rows.Scenes: The beach house, it’s the same scene from the end of last year, with Ross in front of the two doors of Rachel’s and Bonnie’s rooms, trying to decide which door to choose. He finally chooses the one his right and goes in.]
rows.Content: Ross: (surprised) Hi!ScenesRachel and Bonnie: Hi!ScenesBonnie: Rachel was just helping me out. My head got all sunburned.ScenesRoss: Awww.ScenesBonnie: (to Rachel) Thanks a million.ScenesRachel: Oh, you’re welcome a million.ScenesBonnie: (getting up and leaving) (to Ross) Okay, I’ll see you in our room.ScenesRoss: Yeah. (closes the door, and goes over and kisses Rachel.)ScenesRachel: (softly) Oh my God.ScenesRoss: I know.Scenes(They both kiss again and fall onto the bed.)ScenesRoss: (stopping suddenly and getting up) Okay, I gotta go.ScenesRachel: Whoa! What?! Why?!ScenesRoss: Well, I-I gotta go break up with Bonnie.ScenesRachel: Here?! Now?!ScenesRoss: Well, yeah. I can’t-I can’t stay here all night, and if I go in there she’s-she’s gonna wanna... do stuff.ScenesRachel: Well, can’t you tell her that you are not in the mood?ScenesRoss: No, she likes that. Yeah. Faking sleep doesn’t work either, I can’t tell you how many mornings I woke up with her...ScenesRachel: (interrupting) Whoa-ho.ScenesRoss: Whoa-oh, okay! Yeah, why am I telling you that?ScenesRachel: I don’t know.Scenes(they kiss again)ScenesRoss: Yeah, yeah. (opens the door) It wasn’t every morning.ScenesRachel: Oh, making it worse!ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Phoebe Sr.’s house, it’s right after she told Phoebe that she’s her birth mother.]
rows.Content: Phoebe Sr.: So I guess you’d like to know how it all happened.ScenesPhoebe: I-I mean I, well I think I can figure it out. I guess y'know I was born, and everyone started lying their asses off!ScenesPhoebe Sr.: Noo! No! It wasn’t like that I... Remember how I told you how Lily, Frank, and I we were, we were close. Well, we were, we were very close.ScenesPhoebe: How close?ScenesPhoebe Sr.: Well, the-the three of us we were, kind of umm, a couple.ScenesPhoebe: I don’t even know how that would work!ScenesPhoebe Sr.: Well, we were...ScenesPhoebe: (interrupting) I’m not asking!ScenesPhoebe Sr.: Well, any how, some how I got pregnant, and, and I was scared. I was stupid and sellfish, and I was 18 years old. I mean, you remember what it’s like to be eighteen years old?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Let’s see, my had Mom killed herself, and my Dad had run off, and I was living in a Gremlin with a guy named Cindy who talked to his hand.ScenesPhoebe Sr.: Well, I’m so sorry. I thought I was leaving you with the best parents in the world, I didn’t even hear about your Mom and Dad til a couple of years ago, and by then you were already grown up. I don’t know, you’re here, and I would, I would really, I would like to get to know you.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, well, everybody does! I’m a really cool person. And y'know you had 29 years to find that out, but you didn’t even try! Y'know what, you walked out on me, and I’m just, I’m gonna do the same thing to you.ScenesPhoebe Sr.: Wait!ScenesPhoebe: I don’t ever want to see you again!Scenes(She walks out and slams the door.)ScenesPhoebe: (walking back in with her hand over her eyes.) Umm, where’s my purse?

rows.Scenes: The beach house, Joey and Chandler are sitting at the dinner table, Monica is looking in the fridge.]
rows.Content: Monica: (closing the fridge in disgust) Shoot! We’re out of soda.ScenesChandler: (jumping up) Oh, I’ll go out and get you some.ScenesMonica: Really?!ScenesChandler: Nope! Because I’m not your boyfriend. (to Phoebe, who’s entering) Hey Pheebs, how did it go?ScenesPhoebe: Well, umm, my Mom’s friend, Phoebe, is actually my birth Mom.Scenes(The gang is shocked.)ScenesChandler: I found a dried up seashores.ScenesMonica: Sweety, what are you talking about?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, my new Mom, who-who’s a big, fat abandoner! (starts to go upstairs)ScenesJoey: Whoa, wait, Pheebs, wait a second! Don’t you wanna stay here and talk about it?ScenesPhoebe: No. I’m just, I wanna, I need to be alone.Scenes(She starts to go upstairs.)ScenesPhoebe: (turning around, insistently) Monica!ScenesMonica: Oh.

rows.Scenes: The beach house, Rachel’s bedroom. She is finishing up writing something as Ross walks through the door.]
rows.Content: Ross: It’s over.ScenesRachel: Oh, was it awful?ScenesRoss: Well, it was loong. I didn’t even realise how late it was, until I noticed the 5 o’clock shadow on her head. (They both start to laugh, then stop themselves quickly.) Anyway, she didn’t want to stay. I called a cab; she just left.Scenes(They kiss.)ScenesRachel: I wrote you a letter.ScenesRoss: Ohh! Thank you! I like mail. (He goes to kiss her again, but she turns away.)ScenesRachel: (handing him the letter) It’s just some things I’ve been thinking about. Some things about us, and before we can even think about the two of us getting back together, I just need to know how you feel about this stuff.ScenesRoss: Okay. (He leans in to kiss her again, but she leans back preventing him from making contact.) Wow, it’s-it’s 5:30 in the morning. (Rachel laughs) So, I’d better get cracking on this baby.ScenesRachel: Well, I’ll be waiting for you, just come up when you’re done.ScenesRoss: Okay, I’ll be up in, (looks at the letter) 18 pages. Front and back. Very exciting.

rows.Scenes: The beach house, the next morning. Ross is passed out on the kitchen counter. He wakes up with a start and has one of the pages of the letter stuck to his face.]
rows.Content: Ross: Oh. (looks at his watch) Oh-oh. (takes a drink of coffee and resumes reading the letter)ScenesRachel: (coming down the stairs) Hey! (Ross jumps up, and quickly puts the letter back together, pretending like he has just finished it.) What happened to you? Why didn’t you come up?ScenesRoss: Done!ScenesRachel: You just finished?ScenesRoss: Well, I wanted to be thorough. I mean this-this is clearly very, very important to you, to us! And so I wanted to read every word carefully, twice!ScenesRachel: So umm, does it?ScenesRoss: I’m sorry.ScenesRachel: Does it?ScenesRoss: Does it? Does it? Yeah, I wanted to give that whole ‘Does it?’ part just another glance.ScenesRachel: What are you talking about, Ross, you just said that you read it twice! Look, y'know what, either it does or it doesn’t, and if you have to even think about it...ScenesRoss: (interrupting) No, Rach, no. I don’t, I don’t, I don’t have to think about it, in fact, I’ve decided, I’ve decided that, that it.......does.Scenes(Rachel stands there for a moment, starting to cry. Then gasps and runs over and hugs him. While hugging her, Ross tries to find the ‘Does it?’ part in the letter.)ScenesRachel: Are you sure?ScenesRoss: Oh, sure! I’m sure.ScenesRachel: I know. (Hugs him more violently this time and pushes him back away from the letter.)

rows.Scenes: The beach. Chandler and Monica are out getting some sun.]
rows.Content: Chandler: All right, there’s a nuclear holocaust, I’m the last man on Earth. Would you go out with me?ScenesMonica: Ennnh.ScenesChandler: I’ve got canned goods.ScenesJoey: (jumping up in a hole that he is digging, he is shoulder deep) Hey, you guys! Take a look at this! (Chandler and Monica jump up and go over to the hole.) Check this baby out, dug me a hole!ScenesChandler: Excellent hole, Joe.Scenes(A wave crashes on the beach and partially fills up his hole.)ScenesJoey: Oh no! No!! My hole!!ScenesMonica: (screaming in pain) Ow!! Ow!!!ScenesJoey: (climbing out of the hole) What?! What?!! What is it?!ScenesMonica: Jellyfish sting! Oh, it hurts! It hurts!! It hurts!!ScenesChandler: Well, can we help?! You want us to take you back to the house?!ScenesMonica: It’s like two miles!ScenesJoey: Yeah, and I’m a little tired from digging the hole.ScenesMonica: Oh damn the jellyfish. Damn all the jellyfish!ScenesChandler: We’ve got to do something!ScenesJoey: Well, there’s really only one thing you can do.ScenesMonica: What?! What is it?!ScenesJoey: You’re gonna have to pee on it.ScenesMonica: What?!! Gross!!ScenesJoey: Don’t blame me, I saw it on The Discovery Channel.ScenesChandler: Y'know what, he’s right. There’s something like uh, ammonia in that, that like kills the pain.ScenesMonica: Well forget it! It doesn’t hurt that (tries to take a step) baaad!!!!ScenesJoey: If you want some privacy you can use my hole.

rows.Scenes: The beach house, Phoebe is coming down the stairs all packed and ready to go.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Well, I’m ready to get the hell out of here! (Sees Ross and Rachel cuddling on the couch.) Oh. Are you? Are you?!! (they nod ‘Yes.’) Ohh! That’s so great!! Ooh, not for Bonnie. (they nod ‘No.’) But for you, yay! Ohh.Scenes(The rest of the gang arrives with their heads down in shame.)ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesRachel: How was the beach?ScenesMonica: Nothing, I don’t know.ScenesRoss: What happened?ScenesMonica: Nothing. I’m gonna take a shower.ScenesChandler: Me too!!ScenesJoey: Me too.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I’m gonna put this (her suitcase) in the car.ScenesRachel: Ooh, I have to go pack. (Gets up to do so.) It really does?ScenesRoss: It does. It really and truly does.Scenes(Rachel kisses him, and goes upstairs. After she’s gone, Ross frantically tries to find and read the ‘Does it?’ part.)ScenesRoss: (finding the part) (looks up in disgust) It so does not!!!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is telling Joey and Chandler about the letter.]
rows.Content: Ross: She wants me to take responsibility for everything that went wrong in our relationship. I mean she goes on for five pages about, about how I was unfaithful to her! (Both Joey and Chandler shrug their shoulders as to say ”Well...”) (yelling) WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!ScenesChandler: Oh my God! If you say that one more time, I’m gonna break up with you!ScenesRoss: Fine! Fine! But this break-up was not all my fault, and she, she says here, (reading from the letter) “If you accept full responsibility...” (to Chandler and Joey) Full responsibility! “...I can begin to trust you again. Does that seem like something you can do. (yells at Joey) Does it?!!”ScenesJoey: No?ScenesChandler: Look, Ross, you have what you want, you’re back with Rachel. If you bring this up now you’re gonna wreck the best thing that even happened to you.ScenesRoss: (calming down) Yeah, I know. I mean, no, you’re right. Yeah I guess I’ll let it go. But you-you understand how-how hard it is to forget about this.ScenesJoey: Sure, it’s hard to forget! But that doesn’t mean you have to talk about it! A lot of things happened on that trip that we should never, (to Chandler) ever talk about.ScenesRoss: What the hell happened on that beach?!ScenesJoey: It’s between us and the sea, Ross!Scenes(Ross laughs and has a ‘Come on...’ look on his face as he looks and Chandler who nods his head in agreement with Joey. Ross is stunned.)

rows.Scenes: A hallway in an apartment building. Phoebe is knocks on a door and it opens.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (to the person that answered the door) Hi, Ursula.ScenesUrsula: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, well umm, I know that we haven’t talked in a long time, but umm okay, our Mom is not our birth Mom. This-this other lady is our birth Mom.ScenesUrsula: Right, okay, the one that lives in Montuak, umm-hmm.ScenesPhoebe: (shocked) You know her?!ScenesUrsula: No, I umm, I read about her in Mom’s suicide note.ScenesPhoebe: There-there was a suicide note?! (Ursula nods ‘Yes.’) Well, do you still have it?ScenesUrsula: (disgusted) Hang on. (She goes into her apartment and slams the door in Phoebe’s face.)ScenesPhoebe: I can’t believe you didn’t tell me there was a suicide note!ScenesUrsula: Yeah. So how have you been doing?ScenesPhoebe: I, umm, shut up!Scenes(Ursula opens the door and hands her the note.)ScenesPhoebe: (reading from the note) “Good-bye Phoebe and Ursula. I’ll miss you. P.S. Your Mom lives in Montauk.” You just wrote this!ScenesUrsula: Well, it’s pretty much the gist. Well, except for the poem. You read the poem, right?ScenesPhoebe: Noooo!!ScenesUrsula: All right, hang on! (She takes the note, goes back into her apartment and slams the door shut.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Monica, and Joey are sitting at the table eating dinner and not talking. Ross and Rachel are outside cuddling on the balcony.]
rows.Content: Monica: Pass the cheese, please.Scenes(Joey hands her the cheese without looking at her.)ScenesMonica: My God, you can’t even look at me! Can you?ScenesJoey: Nope.Scenes(Phoebe enters.)ScenesChandler: (jumping up) Hey! Phoebe! We can talk to Phoebe!!ScenesPhoebe: No. I’m-I’m to depressed to talk.ScenesChandler: I’ll give you a thousand dollars to talk to us.ScenesRoss: (coming back in with Rachel) Hey, you guys! What do you, what do you think about making that beach trip an annual thing?ScenesChandler, Monica, and Joey: NO!!!ScenesRachel: All right, that’s it, you guys! What happened out there?ScenesMonica: What? We took a walk, nothing happened. I can back with nothing all over me.ScenesRoss and Rachel: Come on!ScenesRoss: What happened? Joey?ScenesJoey: All right. (gets up)ScenesMonica: (stopping him) No! Joey, we swore we’d never tell!ScenesChandler: (running over and joining Monica) They’ll never understand!ScenesJoey: Well, we have to say something! We have to get it out! It’s eating me alive!! Monica got stung by a jellyfish.ScenesMonica: (interrupting) All right!! All right. (walks slowly into the living room) I got stung. Stung bad. I couldn’t stand. I-I couldn’t walk.ScenesChandler: (following Monica) We were two miles from the house. Scared and alone. We didn’t think we could make it. (He goes to put his hands on Monica’s shoulders but for some reason can quite complete the action and pulls back.)ScenesMonica: I was in too much pain.ScenesJoey: And I was tired from digging the huge hole!ScenesChandler: And then Joey remembered something.ScenesJoey: I’d seen this thing on The Discovery Channel...ScenesRoss: Wait a minute! I saw that! On The Discovery Channel, yeah! About jellyfish and how if you... (stops suddenly and turns to look at Monica) Ewwww!! You peed on yourself?!ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: Ewwww!!ScenesMonica: You can’t say that!! You-you don’t know!! I mean I thought I was gonna pass out from the pain! Anyway I-I tried, but I-I couldn’t...bend that way. So... (looks at Joey.)ScenesPhoebe, Ross, and Rachel: (turning to look at Joey) Ewwww!!ScenesJoey: That’s right I stepped up! She’s my friend and she needed help! And if I had too, I’d pee on anyone of you! Only, uhh, I couldn’t. I got the stage fright. I wanted to help, but there was too much pressure. So-so I uh, I turned to Chandler.ScenesChandler: (wails loudly into his hands) Joey kept screaming at me, “Do it now! Do it!! Do it! Do it now!!” Sometimes late at night I can still here the screaming.ScenesJoey: (laughs) That’s ‘cause sometimes I just do it through my wall to freak you out.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is finishing up a song.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) “...fuchsia and mauvvve. Those are the 66 colours of my bedroommmm.” (applause) Thank you, thank you. Ohh, and I invite you to count the colours in your bedroom. (Sees that Phoebe Sr. has entered, and to her) Except for you. You go away.ScenesPhoebe Sr.: I’ll go in a second, I-I just wanted to tell you that there hasn’t been a day where I didn’t regret giving you up.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, bye.ScenesPhoebe Sr.: No, I’m not done. I-I-I just want you to know that I, the reason I didn’t look you up was, well I was afraid that you’d react, just well like, the way, the way you’re reacting right now, and can’t we just, y'know, start from here?ScenesPhoebe: No.ScenesPhoebe Sr.: Sorry. But just one last thing. Y'know you came looking for family. I’m family, I’m it. Now, now I’m done. (starts to leave)ScenesPhoebe: But, it’s not like we’re losing anything. Y'know?ScenesPhoebe Sr.: Yeah, I guess you’re right.ScenesPhoebe: It’s not like we-we know each other or anything. Or that have anything in common.ScenesPhoebe Sr.: Well, I don’t know. I mean it’s not like we don’t have anything in common. I mean I like uh, pizza.ScenesPhoebe: I-I like pizza!ScenesPhoebe Sr.: You do?! Wait, I like umm, the Beetles.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God, so do I!ScenesPhoebe Sr.: I knew it, wow!!ScenesPhoebe: Wait-wait-wait, wait! Puppies. Cute or ugly?ScenesPhoebe Sr.: Ohh, so cute.ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh, well! But umm, still I’m-I’m mad at you.ScenesPhoebe Sr.: I know. I’m mad at me too.ScenesPhoebe: Well umm, do you wanna get something to eat? I’m kinda hungry.ScenesPhoebe Sr.: Hey! Me too!ScenesPhoebe: All right, stop it. Now you’re just doing it to freak me out.

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s bedroom. Ross and Rachel have just finished consummating the new relationship.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh-hooo, I missed you.ScenesRoss: I missed you too.ScenesRachel: Ooh, I was soo nervous about that letter. But the way you owned up to everything, it just showed me how much you’ve grown. Y'know?ScenesRoss: (getting miffed) I suppose.ScenesRachel: You have! Ross, you should give yourself credit. I mean my Mom never thought this would work out. It was all, “Once a cheater, always a cheater.”ScenesRoss: (getting angry) Umm-hmm.ScenesRachel: Ooh, I just wish we hadn’t lost those four months, but if time was what you needed just to gain a little perspective...Scenes[cut to Monica cleaning the floor in the kitchen]ScenesRoss: (yelling from the bedroom) WE WERE ON A BREAK!!!!!!!ScenesChandler: (entering with Joey) (to Monica) Coffee house?ScenesMonica: You bet.Scenes[cut back to Rachel’s bedroom with both of them hurriedly getting dressed]ScenesRoss: And for the record, it took two people to break up this relationship!!ScenesRachel: Yeah! You and that girl from that copy place, which yesterday you took full responsibility for!!ScenesRoss: I didn’t know what I was taking full responsibility for! Okay?! I didn’t finish the whole letter!ScenesRachel: What?!!ScenesRoss: I fell asleep!ScenesRachel: You fell asleep?!ScenesRoss: It was 5:30 in the morning, and you had rambled on for 18 pages. Front and back!! (they go into the living room, trapping Monica, Chandler, and Joey in the kitchen) (to Rachel) Oh-oh-oh, and by the way, Y-O-U-apostrophe-R-E means ‘you are,’ Y-O-U-R means ‘your!’ScenesRachel: Y'know I can’t believe I even thought about getting back together again! We are so over!!ScenesRoss: (starts to cry) FINE BY ME!! (he opens the door and traps Chandler behind it)ScenesRachel: Oh, oh, and hey-hey-hey, those little spelling tips will come in handy when you’re at home on Saturday nights playing Scrabble with Monica!!ScenesMonica: Hey!!ScenesRachel: (to Monica) Sorry!! (to Ross) I just feel bad about all that sleep you’re gonna miss wishing you were with me!ScenesRoss: Oh, no-no-no don’t you worry about me falling asleep. I still have your letter!!!ScenesRachel: And hey! Just so you know, it’s not that common! It doesn’t happen to every guy! And it is a big deal!!ScenesChandler: I KNEW IT!!!!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Monica are playing cards at the dinner table.]
rows.Content: Monica: (sets down some cards) Gin.ScenesChandler: We were playing Gin? Y'know if we were a couple, we could play this game naked.ScenesMonica: Will you stop!ScenesChandler: Okay. All right.ScenesMonica: Okay, all right, I think you’re great, I think you’re sweet, and you’re smart, and I love you. But you will always be the guy who peed on me.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The CatScenesWritten by: Jill Condon & Any ToominScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is eating breakfast as Chandler comes out of his bedroom, ripping his coat in the process.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Wow! That ripped! That ripped real nice!ScenesJoey: How many times do I have to tell you! Ya, turn and sliiiide! Y'know, turn and slide.ScenesChandler: You don’t turn and slide, you throw it out! I’m tired of having to get a tetanus shot every time I get dressed!ScenesJoey: Look, we’re not throwing it out! I built this thing with my own hands!ScenesChandler: All right, how about we, how ‘bout we sell it.ScenesJoey: All right. But, you’re gonna have to tell them. (He opens the cabinet to reveal the chick and the duck living inside with Christmas lights and a disco ball as decorations.)ScenesChandler: (nods his head) Do you mind if we stick you in another cabinet? (to Joey) They seem all right with it!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Ross are there. Monica is checking the messages.]
rows.Content: Chip: (on machine) Hey Monica, it’s Chip.ScenesMonica: Yesss!!ScenesRoss: Who’s Chip?ScenesMonica: Shhh!ScenesChip: (on machine) Good runnin’ into you at the bank today, so ah, here’s my number, 555-9323. Give me a call. Later.ScenesMonica: Chip, is Chip Matthews.ScenesRoss: The guy who took Rachel to the prom? Why is he calling you?ScenesMonica: ‘Cause I ran into him at the bank, he is still soo cute.ScenesRoss: Monica, you’re so lucky! He’s like the most popular guy in school!!ScenesMonica: I know!! (calls him) (on phone) Chip? Hi! It’s Monica. (listens) ‘Kay. (listens) ‘Kay. (listens) Okay. (listens) Okay, good-bye. (hangs up) Oh my God, we just had the best conversation!! (goes into her room as Rachel enters)ScenesRoss: (to Rachel) I was just leaving.ScenesRachel: Good! ‘Cause I’ve got a product report to read, it’s like eight pages, I hope I don’t fall asleep.ScenesRoss: Why? Did you write it?ScenesRachel: (sees Chip’s phone number) Wow! Look at that, Chip Matthews called. I wonder what he wants?ScenesRoss: Well ah, actually...ScenesRachel: (interrupting) I bet he sensed that I was ready to have sex with another guy.ScenesRoss: Well, umm, why don’t you give him a call?ScenesRachel: Okay. (picks up phone) Are you sure you wanna hear this?ScenesRoss: Oh, I’m sure.ScenesRachel: (on phone) Chip! Hi, it’s Rachel. (listens) Rachel Green. Yeah, umm, you left me a message. (listens) Yes you did, my roommate wrote it down. (listens) Monica Geller. (listens) Ohh.ScenesRoss: (whispering in her ear) Oh, that’s right! He called to ask out Monica! That-that’s gotta be embarrassing!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is finishing up a song.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (screaming, angrily) ...DUMB, DRUNKEN, BITCH!!! (applause) (happily) Thank you, thanks.ScenesRoss: (reading the newspaper) Hey, here’s a question; where did you guys get the finest oak East of the Mississippi?ScenesChandler: Uh-huh, first you tell us where you got the prettiest lace in all the land.ScenesRoss: I’m reading your ad.ScenesJoey: Looks good, uh?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesChandler: (reading the ad) Stunning entertainment center. Fine, (pause) fine Italian craftsmanship. (Joey is very proud of himself)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God, you guys are selling the entertainment center?ScenesRachel: Why? I love that thing.ScenesChandler: You want it?ScenesPhoebe and Rachel: Oh no.ScenesChandler: Ahh, Gepeto, $5,000 dollars? Are you insane?ScenesJoey: Hey, the ad alone cost 300 bucks!ScenesChandler: All right look, I’m changing it to 50 bucks, or your best offer.ScenesJoey: What kind of profit is that?! And you call yourself an accountant.ScenesChandler: (looks at him) Nooo.ScenesJoey: Oh. What do you do?ScenesChandler: I can’t believe you don’t know what I do for a living!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I actually don’t know...ScenesRoss: Good, so do IScenesRachel: Something to do with numbers?Scenes[Cut to someone entering Central Perk which lets a cat in. The cat then runs over to Phoebe’s guitar case and starts sniffing around.]ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! No! Shoo! Kitty! No! No-no-no! Shoo! Come on, you! (goes over and picks up the cat) Come on. Crazy. (looks into the cat’s eyes) Oh my God.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesPhoebe: Nothing. Nothing.ScenesJoey: What? What’s wrong?ScenesPhoebe: I just, I just have this really strong feeling that this cat is my Mother.ScenesRachel: You mean the mom you met in Montauk. She was a cat?!ScenesPhoebe: No, no-no, she was a human lady. This is the spirit of my Mom Lily, the one who killed herself.ScenesRoss: Are you sure she’s in the cat, or have you been taking your grandma’s glycoma medicine again?ScenesPhoebe: No Dr. Skeptismo! I’m sure. First of all, okay, there’s the feeling. (Chandler shrugs) Okay, and for another, how about the fact that she went into my guitar case which is lined with orange felt. (Rachel nods her head in unsure agreement) My Mother’s favourite fish is Orange Roughy... (Joey thinks he understands, but then nods that he has no clue.) Cats....like....fish! (Ross and Rachel are totally lost) (to the cat) Hi, Mommy. (Rachel covers her mouth, in an “Oh my God.” gesture) Oh, I haven’t seen this smile in 17 years!ScenesJoey: (to Chandler) Dude, Phoebe’s mom has got a huge peni...ScenesChandler: (interrupting) Let it go!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is working as Monica enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey!ScenesRachel: Umm, when were you gonna tell me that you’re going out with Chip Matthews?ScenesMonica: Now? Is it okay if I go out with Chip Matthews?ScenesRachel: Nooo! It’s not okay! I can’t believe you would want to after what he did to me!ScenesMonica: What, that little thing at the prom?ScenesRachel: Monica! I couldn’t find him for two hours! He was having sex with Amy Welch!ScenesMonica: Come on, that was back in high school! How could that still bother you?ScenesRachel: I mean why, of all people would you want to go out with Chip?!ScenesMonica: Look, you and I went to different high schools...ScenesRachel: Okay, that doesn’t help me, because we went to the same high school.ScenesMonica: You went to one where you were popular, and you got to ride off Chip’s motorcycle, and wear his letterman jacket. I went to one where I wore a band uniform they had to have specially made.ScenesRachel: (shocked) They had to have that specially made?!ScenesMonica: It was a project for one of the Home Ec classes.ScenesRachel: (stunned) Oh my God, they told us that was for the mascot!ScenesMonica: Back then, I thought that I would never, ever get the chance to go out with a Chip Matthews, and now he’s-he’s called me up and asked me out. And the fat girl inside of me really wants to go. I-I owe her this. I never let her eat.ScenesRachel: Oh, you go out with him. (goes over and hugs her)ScenesMonica: Oh, really?!ScenesRachel: Yeah. Just, if it’s possible, could you leave him somewhere and go have sex with another guy?ScenesMonica: I’ll try.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, they are all there eating breakfast.]
rows.Content: Ross: So you guys having any luck getting rid of the entertainment center?ScenesJoey: Well, there were a couple of calls last night, but ah, I don’t think any of them are gonna work out.ScenesChandler: Yes, Joey has a very careful screening process. Apparently, not everyone is qualified to own wood and nails.ScenesPhoebe: (is struggling with the cat) Stop it! Stop it! She keeps squirming, trying to get away! Just like when she was alive.ScenesRoss: So Pheebs, how long is your mom gonna be with us?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I’m not sure. I mean, I guess until she y'know, gets used to the fact that there’s y'know, a new mom. Y'know, I think she’s worried that y'know, she’s gonna, she’s gonna be replaced. (to the cat, in a funny voice) Well, that’s not gonna happen is it? Noo. (gets up) Okay, I have to return a call in the other room.ScenesMonica: Why can’t you use the phone in here?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I’m returning a call from a certain mom at the B-E-A-C-H. I just spelled the wrong word. (goes into Monica’s room)ScenesRoss: So, guys, am I crazy, or does Phoebe’s mom remind anyone of a cat?ScenesMonica: Ross, don’t start.ScenesRoss: Come on, you-you can’t tell me you actually believe that-that there’s a woman inside that cat!ScenesRachel: I believe it.ScenesRoss: No you don’t.ScenesRachel: Yes, I do.ScenesRoss: No you do—y'know what, you’re not gonna suck me into this.ScenesRachel: Oh sure I am, because you always have to be right.ScenesRoss: I do not always have to be—okay, okay. (starts to leave)ScenesRachel: Jurassic Park could happen.Scenes(Ross wants to say something, but just smiles and leaves.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Chandler are showing a couple of guys (Tony and Peter) the entertainment center.]
rows.Content: Tony: Wow! That’s ah, that’s pretty nice!ScenesJoey: Pretty nice?ScenesChandler: You’ll have to pardon my roommate, he wanted to marry this.ScenesTony: We don’t have 50 bucks, but would you be willing to trade for it? We’ve got a canoe.Scenes(Joey jumps up in excitement and without turning around Chandler holds out his hand stopping him, and ushering him back into his seat. Joey sits down, dejected.)ScenesChandler: Y'know, I, I really don’t think we need a canoe.ScenesTony: You gotta take the canoe!ScenesChandler: All right, just, just take the entertainment center, and then when you get home, throw the canoe away!ScenesPeter: We’re not throwing it away! I built that canoe! (starts to leave as Tony chases after him)ScenesJoey: (to Peter) Good for you!!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, Monica, and Ross are there.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (entering) You guys, you’re never gonna believe what I just found tacked up on a telephone pole! (She’s holding a flyer.) Look kinda familiar?ScenesRoss: (taking the flyer) Apparently Phoebe’s mother also goes by the name Julio.ScenesRachel: You guys, there’s a little girl in Soho looking for this cat. I mean, you know what that means?!ScenesJoey: (looking at the flyer) Yeah-eah! 200 dollar reward, split five ways!!ScenesRachel: Do we have to tell her?ScenesRoss: Yes, we have to tell her!ScenesMonica: Oh, but it’s made her so happy.ScenesRoss: (holds up a hand) Little girl misses her cat. (hold up the other hand) Crazy lady thinks her mother is in a cat. (gets up) Okay, y'know what, I have to go have dinner with my son, can I trust that when you see Phoebe, you will tell her.ScenesAll: (disappointed) Yeah.ScenesRoss: Thank you.ScenesRachel: I hate when Ross is right!ScenesMonica: He is right, isn’t he?ScenesChandler: Y'know what, I think this might be one of the times he’s wrong.ScenesAll: You think?ScenesChandler: Oh-no, he’s right.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the same scene is continued from before the break. With Joey, Monica, Rachel, and Chandler sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (entering, with Julio) Hi. (sits down in the chair)ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesJoey: Uh, Pheebs, about your mom...ScenesPhoebe: Yeah?ScenesJoey: (pause) How’s that going?ScenesPhoebe: So great. Oh, we took a nap today and my Mom fell asleep on my tummy and purred.ScenesJoey: That’s so sweet. (pause) I’m gonna get some coffee. (gets up and leaves)ScenesMonica: (sliding into Joey’s place on the couch to try and talk to Phoebe) Huh? What’d ya say Joe? I’ll be right there. (gets up and joins Joey)Scenes(Rachel and Chandler slide into position.)ScenesRachel: Pheebs...ScenesPhoebe: I just feel so, uhh.....ScenesRachel: All right!!ScenesChandler: I’m coming already!!ScenesRachel: Jeez!Scenes(They both get up and leave Phoebe alone.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is reading at the kitchen table as there is a knock on the door.]
rows.Content: Monica: (running from the bathroom to her room, wearing only a towel) Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! (gets to her room and closes the door, as Rachel gets up to answer the door.)ScenesRachel: Hello, Chip.ScenesChip: Hey, Rach! How ya doin’?ScenesRachel: I’m great! I’m great. I’ve got a great job at Bloomingdale’s, have wonderful friends, and eventhough I’m not seeing anyone right now, I’ve never felt better about myself.ScenesChip: So ah, Monica ready yet?ScenesRachel: She’ll be out in a second. So, Chip, how’s umm, Amy Welch?ScenesChip: Amy Welch? Wow! I haven’t seen her since... So, Monica about ready?

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is showing off the entertainment center.]
rows.Content: Joey: This is the unit for you my friend. Sturdy construction, tons of storage compartments, some big enough to fit a grown man.ScenesGuy: What?!ScenesJoey: Oh yeah! I got in there myself once. My roommate bet me five bucks that I couldn’t, and then he stuck a board through the handles that locked me in. Yeah. It was funny ‘til I started feeling like I was in a coffin.ScenesGuy: No, you, you can’t fit in that thing. That’s not deep enough.ScenesJoey: Oh yeah? (opens up the center and takes out the stereo) If I can’t, I’ll knock five bucks off the price off the unit.ScenesGuy: All right, you have yourself a deal. (shakes his hand)ScenesJoey: Okay. (he gets in the unit and closes the door) See?! I told ya!Scenes(The guys takes a hockey stick and slips it through the handles then proceeds to take the stereo and Chandler’s computer and walk out.)ScenesJoey: Sometimes I get in here just to get away from it! Hey, a nickel!!

rows.Scenes: A street, Chip is walking Monica to his motorcycle.]
rows.Content: Chip: Here, we are.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! You still have the Chipper!ScenesChip: The what?ScenesMonica: That’s what we used to call your ah, your motorcycle in high school. Y'know how a motorcycle is a Chopper, and you’re Chip. Nevermind.ScenesChip: No, I think it’s cute. (kisses her)ScenesMonica: Wow! A lipper from Chipper.ScenesChip: So you still in touch with anyone from high school?ScenesMonica: Umm. Well, there’s Rachel, and umm, I think that’s it. How bout you?ScenesChip: Oh yeah, I still hang with Simmons and Zana, y'know. I see Spindler a lot. Devane, Kelly, and I run into Goldie from time to time. Steve Brown, Zuchoff, McGwire, J.T., Breadsly.ScenesMonica: Is that all?ScenesChip: Ehh, y'know after high school, you just kinda lose touch. Oh yeah! I ran into Richard Dorfman.ScenesMonica: Ohh, how is he?ScenesChip: Not so good, Simmons and I gave him a wedgie.ScenesMonica: Isn’t he an architect now?ScenesChip: Yeah, they still wear underwear.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is coming home. As we walks through the door, and without looking up, he goes to throw his keys on the foosball table, only, it’s gone and the keys it the floor. He then looks up at an empty apartment; everything is gone except for the entertainment center and that ceramic dog. Even the food in the fridge!]
rows.Content: Chandler: OH MY GOD!!!ScenesJoey: (still trapped in the entertainment center) WHAT?!!ScenesChandler: Are you all right?!ScenesJoey: Yeah...ScenesChandler: (lets him out) What happened?!!ScenesJoey: (getting out) Awww, man! He promised he wouldn’t take the chairs!!ScenesChandler: What the hell happened?!! How were you locked in?!! And where the hell is all of our stuff?!!ScenesJoey: Well, this guy came by to look at the unit and-and he said he didn’t think big enough to fit a grown man!ScenesChandler: So—You got in voluntarily?!ScenesJoey: I was tryin’ to make a sale!! Oh, man, if I ever run into that guy again, do you know what I’m gonna do?ScenesChandler: BEND OVER?!!!

rows.Scenes: Dot’s Spot, Chip and Monica are on there date, eating dinner. Chip is telling a story.]
rows.Content: Chip: ...and then Zana, just let one rip!! (laughs histerically)ScenesMonica: Look, not that I enjoy talking about people who I went to high school with, ‘cause I do, but umm, maybe we could talk about something else? Like you, I don’t even know where you work?ScenesChip: You know where I work!ScenesMonica: I do?ScenesChip: The movie theatre, you used to come in all the time.ScenesMonica: You still work at the multiplex?ScenesChip: Oh, like I’d give up that job! Free popcorn and candy, anytime I want. I can get you free posters for your room.ScenesMonica: Thanks, I’m set. Do you still live with your parents?ScenesChip: Oh yeah, but I can stay out as late as I want.Scenes(Monica takes a big swig of her martini.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Rachel, Phoebe, and Julio are consoling Joey and Chandler.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Wow! They really got you guys. Your T.V. The chairs.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, your microwave. The stereo.ScenesJoey: (looking through a deck of cards) Aww, man, he took the five of spades!! Oh, no-no-no, here it is!ScenesMonica: (entering) Oh my God! What happened?ScenesChandler: Oh, umm, Joey was born, and then 28 years later, I was robbed!!ScenesRachel: (to Monica) So, how was your date?ScenesMonica: Well, y'know how I always wanted to go out with Chip Matthews in high school?ScenesRachel: Um-hmm.ScenesMonica: Well, tonight, I actually went out with Chip Matthews in high school.ScenesRachel: Oh honey, I’m sorry.ScenesMonica: No, it’s okay, not only did I get to go out with Chip Matthews, I got to dump Chip Matthews.ScenesRachel: Ohh! That’s so great!ScenesMonica: I know!ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey! So ah, what did the insurance company say?ScenesChandler: Oh, they said uh, “You don’t have insurance here, so stop calling us.”ScenesRoss: (seeing Phoebe still with cat) You didn’t tell her?! (They all kinda shy away.) Okay, fine! Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah? (sees Ross) Hi!ScenesRoss: Hi! Listen uhh, this cat belongs to a little girl. There are flyers all over the place.ScenesRachel: I’m sorry, sweetie. (shows her the flyer)ScenesMonica: Hey, we can take her back with you if you want.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh. Um-hmm. But y'know, she choose to find me. I mean, I have to respect her decision. Right?ScenesChandler, Monica, Joey, and Rachel: That’s a good call. Right.ScenesRoss: No! No! Look—Hey, enough is enough! Look, I am sorry that you feel guilty or whatever about spending time with your new mom, but this is not your old mom. This is a cat! Okay, Julio the cat! Not mom! Cat!ScenesPhoebe: (she turns around and puts the cat on the entertainment center) Ross, how many parents have you lost?ScenesRoss: None.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, then you don’t know what it feels like when one of them comes back. Do you? I believe this is my Mother. Even if I’m wrong, who cares? Just be a friend. Okay? Be supportive.ScenesRoss: I’m sorry.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesRoss: I don’t know what to say.ScenesRachel: You could.... say you’re sorry to her mom.ScenesPhoebe: I think she would like that.ScenesRoss: (goes over to Julio) Come here, here, come here, come here, (pause) Mrs. Buffay. Sorry, about what I said, umm, it was, it was insensitive of me to say that you were just a cat. When clearly you are also the reincarnated spirit, of my friend’s mother.ScenesPhoebe: Thank you. We both forgive you.ScenesRachel: So honey, what are you gonna do about the little girl?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, okay, listen, umm, Mom, I hope you know you still mean a lot to me. And you’re welcome to come back anytime.ScenesChandler: Pheebs, if she could come back as a couch, we’d really appreciate it. (Joey nods in agreement)ScenesPhoebe: Come on, Mom, I’ll take you home.ScenesRachel: I’ll go with you.ScenesMonica: Me too. (they all leave)ScenesRoss: Oh! Y'know, I’ve got an extra futon.ScenesJoey: Dude, you don’t have to brag! We got nothing here!!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Chandler have trading the entertainment center for the canoe. Joey is sitting in the bow, staring off into space as to envision his future full of possibilities. Chandler is sitting at the stern, staring into space and is looking at an uncertain future.]
rows.Content: EndScenesThe One With The Ballroom DancingScenesWritten by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is there eating breakfast. Chandler is cleaning out his wallet.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey! New wallet, huh?ScenesChandler: Yeah, it was time. The old condom ring in the leather just doesn’t say ‘cool’ anymore.ScenesMonica: Rachel!ScenesRachel: What?ScenesMonica: You just put an empty carton back in the fridge!ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, I know, but the garbage was full.ScenesMonica: Have you ever taken out the trash? (Hands her the garbage.)ScenesRachel: Well, I thought you liked doing it. (Rachel starts out the door and stops.)ScenesMonica: Third door on the left.ScenesRachel: Right!

rows.Scenes: Garbage room: Mr. Treeger is unclogging the trash chute as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh! Hey, Mr. Treeger.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Hey.Scenes(Rachel opens the trash chute, winces at the smell, and throws the garbage bag in. She then tries to throw the pizza box in, but since it’s so big she jams it into the opening and it prevents the door from closing. She then turns around too see Mr. Treeger watching her.)ScenesMr. Treeger:: What are you doing?ScenesRachel: Ummm. Oh! I’m sorry. (She grabs the box and offers him a piece.) It’s a little old but…ScenesMr. Treeger:: No! You’re clogging up the chute that I spent a half-hour unclogging!ScenesRachel: I’m sorry. I didn’t—I don’t come in here a lot.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Oh yeah, of course you don’t!ScenesRachel: No.ScenesMr. Treeger:: ‘Cause you’re a little princess! "Daddy, buy me a pizza. Daddy, buy me a candy factory. Daddy, make the cast of Cats sing Happy Birthday to me…ScenesRachel: I didn’t… I never said that.ScenesMr. Treeger:: You think you could make a mess and the big man in coveralls will come in here and clean it up, huh? Well, why don’t think of someone else for a change?ScenesRachel: (starting to cry) Okay, I’m sorry. (Runs out still carrying the pizza box.)Scenes[Cut to Monica and Rachel’s apartment as Rachel returns in tears.]ScenesMonica: God! If you’re gonna cry about it! (She grabs the box and goes to through it out.]ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Continued from earlier, Rachel is now telling everyone of her experience in the garbage room.]
rows.Content: Joey: Whoa-whoa, Treeger made you cry?ScenesRachel: Yes! And he said really mean things that were only partly true.ScenesJoey: I’m gonna go down there and teach that guy a lesson.ScenesMonica: Joey, please don’t do that. I think it’s best that we just forget about it.ScenesRachel: That’s easy for you to say, you weren’t almost just killed.ScenesJoey: All right that’s it, school is in session! (Exits and slams the door.)ScenesMonica: (Picking up a card from Chandler’s wallet.) My God! Is this a gym card?ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, gym member. I try to go four times a week, but I’ve missed the last 1200 times.ScenesRoss: So why don’t you quit?ScenesChandler: You don’t think I’ve tried? You think I like having 50 dollars taken out of my bank account every month? No, they make you go all the way down there! Then they use all of these phrases and peppiness to try and confuse you! Then they bring out Maria.ScenesRoss: Who is Maria?ScenesChandler: Oh Maria. You can’t say no to her, she’s like this lycra spandex covered gym…treat.ScenesRoss: You need me to go down there with you and hold your hand?ScenesChandler: No!ScenesRoss: So you’re strong enough to face her on your own?ScenesChandler: Oh no, you’ll have to come.

rows.Scenes: Treeger’s apartment, Joey knocks on the door and Treeger opens it.]
rows.Content: Mr. Treeger:: Tribbiani! Hold on, I’ll get the plunger.ScenesJoey: Hey! You hold on pal! Now you made my friend, Rachel, cry. So now, you’re gonna go up there and apologize to her, unless you want me to call the landlord.ScenesMr. Treeger:: And tell him what?ScenesJoey: Have you heard about a little something called, Not Making Girls Cry.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah. Well maybe you have heard about the Rent Stabilization Act of 1968!ScenesJoey: I have actually not heard of that.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, well your friends are in violation of it. I’ve been a nice guy up until now, but uh, I don’t need this grief. I’m gonna call the landlord and tell him that Monica is illegally subletting here grandmother’s apartment. Your friends are outta here pal.ScenesJoey: Why don’t you tell me something I don’t know! (He storms out, and once Treeger closes the door behind him, Joey makes an ‘Oops!’ have.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier, everyone is still eating breakfast.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh please, somebody tell me I don’t have to go to work today!ScenesMonica: What’s the matter?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, my first massage today is this incredibly gorgeous guy, and every time I see him I just want to do things to him that I’m not allowed to charge for.ScenesMonica: So do them for free.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no, it is forbidden! No-no, Mrs. Potter fires people for fooling around with clients. And it’s against my oath as a masseuse.ScenesRoss: They make you take an oath?ScenesPhoebe: No, I made myself take an oath. Yeah, no fooling around with clients and umm, always be prepared. Yeah, that one’s actually from the Boy Scouts, but it just makes good sense.ScenesChandler: Why don’t you just give him to somebody else?ScenesPhoebe: No, I can handle it. No, I’m a professional. (She starts to leave)ScenesRachel: Oh Pheebs, is that a new ankle bracelet?ScenesMonica: Wow! And you got a petticure. Your feet are all dressed up.ScenesChandler: Because that’s the only part of you he can see when he’s on the table!ScenesMonica: You’re gonna do some feet flirtin’!ScenesPhoebe: I don’t what your talking about. (Laughs nervously and continues to leaqve)ScenesRoss: Then how do you explain the toe ring?!ScenesPhoebe: Because it’s Arabian princess day at work! Okay?! Leave me alone!Scenes[Cut to later, Joey is returning from talking to Mr. Treeger.]ScenesRachel: Oh! My hero! What happened?ScenesJoey: Well uh, I went down there and told him that no one treats my friends like that and that he’d better come up here and apologize. I’ll see you later. (Starts to leave)ScenesMonica: What a minute, what did he say?ScenesJoey: He said that he wasn’t gonna apologize because you guys are living here illegally, so instead what he’s gonna do is have you evicted—I’ll see you later.ScenesRachel: What?! You got us evicted!!ScenesMonica: I told you not to go down there!ScenesJoey: Well he made Rachel cry!ScenesMonica: Rachel always cries!ScenesRachel: That’s not true! (Starts to cry.)ScenesMonica: Now Joey, you go down there and you suck up to him. I mean you suck like you’ve never sucked before!ScenesJoey: All right! I’ll try! But if I can’t, you can stay with Chandler and I until you get settled.ScenesRachel: Go!!ScenesJoey: All right, all right, all right. (Starts to leave, stops, and turns around) I mean I’ll have to check with him first, but I’ll think he’ll be cool with it. (Monica shoos him out.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s gym, He and Ross are there to cancel his membership.]
rows.Content: Ross: Whoa-whoa-whoa, hey! Now remember what we talked about, you gotta be strong.ScenesChandler: Yes. (In a stronger voice) Yes!ScenesRoss: One more time, "Hey, don’t you want a washboard stomach and rock hard pecs?ScenesChandler: No! I want a flabby gut and saggy man breasts!ScenesRoss: Good! That’s good!ScenesChandler: Okay. (They go inside) (To the guy at the desk) I wanna quit the gym.ScenesGym Employee: You wanna quit?ScenesChandler: I wanna quit the gym.ScenesGym Employee: You do realize that you won’t have access to our new full service Swedish spa.ScenesChandler: (He turns to Ross and Ross makes a ‘Be strong’ sound.) I wanna quit the gym.ScenesGym Employee: Okay, Dave in the membership office, handles quitters. (Both Chandler and Ross start to make their way to the membership office.) Uh, excuse me, (to Ross) are you a member?ScenesRoss: Me? No.ScenesGym Employee: Sorry, members only.ScenesChandler: (horrified at the prospect of trying to quit alone and unsure about himself) I wanna quit the gym.ScenesRoss: It’s okay man, be strong. (Chandler goes into the office.)ScenesGym Employee: (to Ross) So, are you a member of any gym.ScenesRoss: No! And I’m not gonna be, so you can save you little speech.ScenesGym Employee: Okay, no problem. (To someone out of the picture) Could you come here for a second?Scenes(This gorgeous woman in spandex walks up)ScenesWoman: Hi, I’m Maria.Scenes(Ross is at a loss for words.)

rows.Scenes: Heeling Hands Inc., Phoebe’s work, she is giving a massage to the guy, Rick, she likes.]
rows.Content: Rick: (looking at her feet) Wow, you have really pretty feet.ScenesPhoebe: These old things.ScenesRick: Would you mind spending some time on my siadic area, it’s been killing me today.ScenesPhoebe: You mean the—Okay by siadic, you mean the towel covered portion.ScenesRick: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Sure, yeah, no I can do that, yeah, because umm, y'know, the muscles in the siadic area can get y’know, real (lifts up the towel) nice and tight. So umm, tell me Rick, how umm, how did you injure the area.ScenesRick: Oh, a 16-hour sit-in for Greenpeace.ScenesPhoebe: Oh. (She goes to work, and her head slowly drops out of view.)ScenesRick: Ow! Did you just bite me?ScenesPhoebe: No!

rows.Scenes: Mr. Treeger’s apartment, Joey is there to suck up.]
rows.Content: Mr. Treeger:: What?ScenesJoey: Please don’t kick Monica and Rachel out, this wasn’t there fault, it was mine.ScenesMr. Treeger:: You want me to kick you guys out instead?ScenesJoey: No you can’t do that, where would the chick and the duck live?ScenesMr. Treeger:: You have pets!ScenesJoey: Noo-no-no, no, those are nicknames. I’m the chick and Chandler is the duck.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Huh, I would’ve thought it was the other way around.ScenesJoey: Come on man, just-just let the girls stay, I’ll do whatever you want.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Really? You’ll do anything?ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah, absolutely.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, I’ve got something you can do.ScenesJoey: What, what is it?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Can you be my dancing partner?ScenesJoey: That’s not, prison lingo, is it?ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is telling Monica and Rachel what he has to do.]
rows.Content: Monica: His dancing partner?!ScenesJoey: Yeah, there’s this superintendent’s dance, the Super Ball. I don’t know, and he wants to impress Marge, this lady super that he’s a crush on.ScenesRachel: Well, why doesn’t he practice with a girl?ScenesJoey: Well, he’s too shy, he doesn’t thing he’s good enough to dance with girls yet.ScenesRachel: Yeah, right, he almost danced me right down that…garbage chute. (Starts to cry)ScenesMonica: Oh, would you let it go already?! You’re fine!Scenes(Chandler and Ross enter)ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hey! So, did you quit?ScenesChandler: No, I almost did, couldn’t leave Ross there without a spotter!ScenesMonica: Wait, now so you joined the gym?Scenes(Rachel starts to laugh.)ScenesRoss: And that’s funny, why?ScenesRachel: Oh, umm, I was just y’know working out and umm… Oh, that’s it.ScenesChandler: We’re doomed. Okay, they’re gonna take 50 bucks out of our accounts for the rest of our lives. What are we gonna do?ScenesMonica: Well, you could actually go to the gym.Scenes(Chandler and Ross both laugh)ScenesRoss: Or! Or, we could go to the bank, close our accounts and cut them off at the source.ScenesChandler: You’re a genius!ScenesJoey: Aww, man, now we won’t be bank buddies!ScenesChandler: Now, there’s two reasons.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey.ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, you guys, remember that cute client I told you about? I bit him.ScenesRachel: Where?!ScenesPhoebe: On the touchy.ScenesRoss: And that’s not against your oath?!ScenesPhoebe: No, I know! I-I’m sorry, but the moment I touch him, I just wanna throw out my old oath and take a new, dirty one.ScenesMonica: Well, next time your massaging him, you should try and distract yourself.ScenesJoey: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! Like-like when I’m doing something exciting and I don’t wanna get too excited, I just ahh, y’know try to thing of other things like ah sandwiches, and ah baseball, and ah Chandler!ScenesChandler: Thank you, Joey.ScenesJoey: No-no, thank you.

rows.Scenes: Treeger’s apartment, Joey knocks and Mr. Treeger opens the door.]
rows.Content: Joey: All right, I’m here, let’s ahh, get this over with.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Okay ahh, well, just ahh, follow my lead. (Turns on some music)ScenesJoey: Whoa-whoa, don’t we need to do some kinda preparation first? Like ahh, get really drunk?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Look come on, eh, just ah, just ah, put your arms around me, eh.Scenes(Joey does so, and they both start dancing. Treeger tries to spin Joey, but ends up throwing him into the door.)ScenesMr. Treeger:: Ahhhh! I’m sorry!ScenesJoey: No, it’s okay, but if I’m Marge, my breasts are coming out my back.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Ahh, forget it! I’ll never be any good at this, my mom was right, I’m just a big potato with arms, and legs, and a head.ScenesJoey: Come on man, you’re not a potato.ScenesMr. Treeger:: I’m sure as hell a dancer, it’s no use Marge will never go for me.ScenesJoey: Come on Treeger, don’t say that. You just ahh, you just need more practice. Here, come on, let’s ahh, let’s try it again. Come on. (they start dancing again) Plus, it was, it was probably mostly my fault, anyway. I mean, y’know, I’m not really that comfortable dancing with a—(Treeger throws him) We-he!! Hey!ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Monica are sitting at the table as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey-hey, how goes the dancing? Gay yet?ScenesJoey: Ah-ha-ha, you guys owe me big time. (He walks into the kitchen and does a little dance step on the way.)ScenesRachel: (laughing) What was that?ScenesJoey: What?ScenesRachel: You just did a little dancy thing.ScenesJoey: No I didn’t.ScenesMonica: Yes you did! You did like a little hop.ScenesRachel: You are soo enjoying this.ScenesJoey: No, I’m not! And it wasn’t a hop it was a pademarie.ScenesMonica: (laughing harder) You know the words! You are so into this!ScenesJoey: All right, well maybe I’m enjoying it a little bit. I mean I’m getting pretty good at it.ScenesRachel: Ooh, this is soo sweet, Joey our little twinkle-toes.ScenesJoey: Hey-hey, hold on, this isn’t some kind of like girly dance. All right, it’s like a sport, it’s manly!ScenesMonica: All right, then show me some manly moves.ScenesJoey: All right.Scenes(They both get up and Monica expects Joey to take the lead, but he doesn’t, and they fumble around for a little bit.)ScenesJoey: I don’t know how to lead.

rows.Scenes: Ross and Chandler’s bank, they are there to close their accounts.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hello.ScenesChandler: Hi.ScenesRoss: We’d like to close our accounts.ScenesBank Officer: Close your accounts? Is there some kind of problem?ScenesRoss: No-no.ScenesChandler: No, we’d just like to close them.ScenesBank Officer: Okay, Ms. Lambert handles all our closures. (to a beautiful woman) Would you come over here please?ScenesMs. Lambert: Hi, I’m Karen.ScenesChandler: I wanna quit the bank!

rows.Scenes: Healing Hands, Inc., Phoebe is giving Rick a massage.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (thinking to herself) Okay, baseball. Rick, playing baseball. Okay, slides into second, maybe even his pants come down a little… Oh no—wait no, no! No! Okay, all right, sandwiches, sandwiches. Umm, okay, on a plate, maybe Rick’s pants come down a little. No! No! Okay, Chandler! Okay Chandler, ooh, that’s working.Scenes(The camera zooms in on the clock on the wall and it reads a quarter after one. Time lapse. The clock now reads 3:30, and Phoebe is still giving Rick his massage.)ScenesPhoebe: (thinking to herself) Chandler’s knees. Chandler’s… ankles. Chandler’s ankle hair. (notices the clock) Oh no. (to Rick) Okay, you’re all set.ScenesRick: Oh wow! That was amazing, was that really just an hour?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! In… really long hour world.ScenesRick: What?ScenesPhoebe: Ugh, okay, I have an enormous crush on you. But because you’re a client, I can’t ask you out, even though you give me y’know, the feeling.ScenesRick: Wow! I had no idea! But you know, I could always find another masseuse.ScenesPhoebe: Really?!ScenesRick: Yeah, really.Scenes(They start to kiss, then Rick stops suddenly.)ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesRick: Suddenly, I very aware that I’m naked.ScenesPhoebe: (laughs) Okay, quit down. (they start to kiss again)Scenes(Suddenly, Phoebe’s boss, Mrs. Potter, and a client, Mr. Simon, enters.)ScenesMrs. Potter: Mr. Simon’s been waiting for—(sees Phoebe and Rick) Oh my God!ScenesMr. Simon: Why wasn’t I offered that? I’d definitely pay more for that.ScenesMrs. Potter: Phoebe, we have rules here, this isn’t that kind of place.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, oh and I know, but this isn’t what it looks like, ‘cause Rick is my ahh, husband.ScenesMrs. Potter: Oh really? Well, then you’d better tell his other wife, ‘cause she called three times asking where he is.ScenesPhoebe: Yes, I will tell her.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Ross are telling Joey, Rachel, and Monica of their bank woes.]
rows.Content: Monica: So you didn’t leave the bank?ScenesRoss: No! And somehow, we ended up with a joint checking account.ScenesRachel: What are you ever gonna use that for?!ScenesChandler: To pay for the gym.Scenes(Phoebe enters)ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Hey! So I had a great day, Rick and I really hit it off, and we started making out, and then my boss walked in and fired me for being a whore.ScenesJoey: What?!ScenesRachel: You got fired?!ScenesMonica: Oh my Gosh!ScenesPhoebe: It’s so weird, I have never been fired from anything before!ScenesRachel: Sweety...ScenesPhoebe: I just-I just started walking around not knowing what to do next, y’know? I-I started asking people on the street if they wanted massages. Then these policemen, thought I was a whore too. It’s been a really bad day, whore wise.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door and Chandler answers it.)ScenesMr. Treeger:: Hey Duck, is Chick here?ScenesChandler: Yeah… Bunny-rabbit.ScenesJoey: (To Mr. Treeger) So you ah, ready for our last practice?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, but y’know, I think the reason we’re not getting that spin right is because my apartment’s too small.ScenesJoey: Look, you wanna use our place?ScenesMr. Treeger:: No, I ahh, had another idea.Scenes[Cut to the roof, where Joey and Mr. Treeger are dancing happily to ^Night and Day^.]ScenesJoey: We did it!!ScenesMr. Treeger:: I know, we did it!! Hey, that was incredible, huh?!ScenesJoey: I know, it was amazing! I mean, we totally nailed it, it was beautiful.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Thank you, listen, thanks a lot Tribbiani, (checks watch). Oh my God, look at the time, I gotta catch the bus to the ball.ScenesJoey: Oh well, okay, good luck.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Unless you wanna practice the Foxtrot again? Or-or the Tango?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Ahh, thanks but no. You see I-I think I’m ready to dance with girls.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Go get ‘em Treeger.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Right. (Starts to leave) Hey, ahh, you wanna come? Marge has a girlfriend.ScenesJoey: (intrigued) Really?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, you could dance real good with her, she’s the same size as me.ScenesJoey: No, I’m good.Scenes(Treeger leaves, and Joey’s dances off.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Lara and Jeni’s Massage, Phoebe is interviewing for a job.]
rows.Content: Interviewer: So it looks like you’ve got some great experience here. Let’s see ahh, reason for leaving last job?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, they thought I was a whore.ScenesInterviewer: Okay, we’ll give a call if anything comes up.ScenesPhoebe: Great! Thank you very much.Scenes(The interviewer watches her leave with an ‘Oh my goodness’ face.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Ballroom DancingScenesWritten by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is there eating breakfast. Chandler is cleaning out his wallet.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey! New wallet, huh?ScenesChandler: Yeah, it was time. The old condom ring in the leather just doesn’t say ‘cool’ anymore.ScenesMonica: Rachel!ScenesRachel: What?ScenesMonica: You just put an empty carton back in the fridge!ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, I know, but the garbage was full.ScenesMonica: Have you ever taken out the trash? (Hands her the garbage.)ScenesRachel: Well, I thought you liked doing it. (Rachel starts out the door and stops.)ScenesMonica: Third door on the left.ScenesRachel: Right!

rows.Scenes: Garbage room: Mr. Treeger is unclogging the trash chute as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh! Hey, Mr. Treeger.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Hey.Scenes(Rachel opens the trash chute, winces at the smell, and throws the garbage bag in. She then tries to throw the pizza box in, but since it’s so big she jams it into the opening and it prevents the door from closing. She then turns around too see Mr. Treeger watching her.)ScenesMr. Treeger:: What are you doing?ScenesRachel: Ummm. Oh! I’m sorry. (She grabs the box and offers him a piece.) It’s a little old but…ScenesMr. Treeger:: No! You’re clogging up the chute that I spent a half-hour unclogging!ScenesRachel: I’m sorry. I didn’t—I don’t come in here a lot.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Oh yeah, of course you don’t!ScenesRachel: No.ScenesMr. Treeger:: ‘Cause you’re a little princess! "Daddy, buy me a pizza. Daddy, buy me a candy factory. Daddy, make the cast of Cats sing Happy Birthday to me…ScenesRachel: I didn’t… I never said that.ScenesMr. Treeger:: You think you could make a mess and the big man in coveralls will come in here and clean it up, huh? Well, why don’t think of someone else for a change?ScenesRachel: (starting to cry) Okay, I’m sorry. (Runs out still carrying the pizza box.)Scenes[Cut to Monica and Rachel’s apartment as Rachel returns in tears.]ScenesMonica: God! If you’re gonna cry about it! (She grabs the box and goes to through it out.]ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Continued from earlier, Rachel is now telling everyone of her experience in the garbage room.]
rows.Content: Joey: Whoa-whoa, Treeger made you cry?ScenesRachel: Yes! And he said really mean things that were only partly true.ScenesJoey: I’m gonna go down there and teach that guy a lesson.ScenesMonica: Joey, please don’t do that. I think it’s best that we just forget about it.ScenesRachel: That’s easy for you to say, you weren’t almost just killed.ScenesJoey: All right that’s it, school is in session! (Exits and slams the door.)ScenesMonica: (Picking up a card from Chandler’s wallet.) My God! Is this a gym card?ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, gym member. I try to go four times a week, but I’ve missed the last 1200 times.ScenesRoss: So why don’t you quit?ScenesChandler: You don’t think I’ve tried? You think I like having 50 dollars taken out of my bank account every month? No, they make you go all the way down there! Then they use all of these phrases and peppiness to try and confuse you! Then they bring out Maria.ScenesRoss: Who is Maria?ScenesChandler: Oh Maria. You can’t say no to her, she’s like this lycra spandex covered gym…treat.ScenesRoss: You need me to go down there with you and hold your hand?ScenesChandler: No!ScenesRoss: So you’re strong enough to face her on your own?ScenesChandler: Oh no, you’ll have to come.

rows.Scenes: Treeger’s apartment, Joey knocks on the door and Treeger opens it.]
rows.Content: Mr. Treeger:: Tribbiani! Hold on, I’ll get the plunger.ScenesJoey: Hey! You hold on pal! Now you made my friend, Rachel, cry. So now, you’re gonna go up there and apologize to her, unless you want me to call the landlord.ScenesMr. Treeger:: And tell him what?ScenesJoey: Have you heard about a little something called, Not Making Girls Cry.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah. Well maybe you have heard about the Rent Stabilization Act of 1968!ScenesJoey: I have actually not heard of that.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, well your friends are in violation of it. I’ve been a nice guy up until now, but uh, I don’t need this grief. I’m gonna call the landlord and tell him that Monica is illegally subletting here grandmother’s apartment. Your friends are outta here pal.ScenesJoey: Why don’t you tell me something I don’t know! (He storms out, and once Treeger closes the door behind him, Joey makes an ‘Oops!’ have.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier, everyone is still eating breakfast.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh please, somebody tell me I don’t have to go to work today!ScenesMonica: What’s the matter?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, my first massage today is this incredibly gorgeous guy, and every time I see him I just want to do things to him that I’m not allowed to charge for.ScenesMonica: So do them for free.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no, it is forbidden! No-no, Mrs. Potter fires people for fooling around with clients. And it’s against my oath as a masseuse.ScenesRoss: They make you take an oath?ScenesPhoebe: No, I made myself take an oath. Yeah, no fooling around with clients and umm, always be prepared. Yeah, that one’s actually from the Boy Scouts, but it just makes good sense.ScenesChandler: Why don’t you just give him to somebody else?ScenesPhoebe: No, I can handle it. No, I’m a professional. (She starts to leave)ScenesRachel: Oh Pheebs, is that a new ankle bracelet?ScenesMonica: Wow! And you got a petticure. Your feet are all dressed up.ScenesChandler: Because that’s the only part of you he can see when he’s on the table!ScenesMonica: You’re gonna do some feet flirtin’!ScenesPhoebe: I don’t what your talking about. (Laughs nervously and continues to leaqve)ScenesRoss: Then how do you explain the toe ring?!ScenesPhoebe: Because it’s Arabian princess day at work! Okay?! Leave me alone!Scenes[Cut to later, Joey is returning from talking to Mr. Treeger.]ScenesRachel: Oh! My hero! What happened?ScenesJoey: Well uh, I went down there and told him that no one treats my friends like that and that he’d better come up here and apologize. I’ll see you later. (Starts to leave)ScenesMonica: What a minute, what did he say?ScenesJoey: He said that he wasn’t gonna apologize because you guys are living here illegally, so instead what he’s gonna do is have you evicted—I’ll see you later.ScenesRachel: What?! You got us evicted!!ScenesMonica: I told you not to go down there!ScenesJoey: Well he made Rachel cry!ScenesMonica: Rachel always cries!ScenesRachel: That’s not true! (Starts to cry.)ScenesMonica: Now Joey, you go down there and you suck up to him. I mean you suck like you’ve never sucked before!ScenesJoey: All right! I’ll try! But if I can’t, you can stay with Chandler and I until you get settled.ScenesRachel: Go!!ScenesJoey: All right, all right, all right. (Starts to leave, stops, and turns around) I mean I’ll have to check with him first, but I’ll think he’ll be cool with it. (Monica shoos him out.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s gym, He and Ross are there to cancel his membership.]
rows.Content: Ross: Whoa-whoa-whoa, hey! Now remember what we talked about, you gotta be strong.ScenesChandler: Yes. (In a stronger voice) Yes!ScenesRoss: One more time, "Hey, don’t you want a washboard stomach and rock hard pecs?ScenesChandler: No! I want a flabby gut and saggy man breasts!ScenesRoss: Good! That’s good!ScenesChandler: Okay. (They go inside) (To the guy at the desk) I wanna quit the gym.ScenesGym Employee: You wanna quit?ScenesChandler: I wanna quit the gym.ScenesGym Employee: You do realize that you won’t have access to our new full service Swedish spa.ScenesChandler: (He turns to Ross and Ross makes a ‘Be strong’ sound.) I wanna quit the gym.ScenesGym Employee: Okay, Dave in the membership office, handles quitters. (Both Chandler and Ross start to make their way to the membership office.) Uh, excuse me, (to Ross) are you a member?ScenesRoss: Me? No.ScenesGym Employee: Sorry, members only.ScenesChandler: (horrified at the prospect of trying to quit alone and unsure about himself) I wanna quit the gym.ScenesRoss: It’s okay man, be strong. (Chandler goes into the office.)ScenesGym Employee: (to Ross) So, are you a member of any gym.ScenesRoss: No! And I’m not gonna be, so you can save you little speech.ScenesGym Employee: Okay, no problem. (To someone out of the picture) Could you come here for a second?Scenes(This gorgeous woman in spandex walks up)ScenesWoman: Hi, I’m Maria.Scenes(Ross is at a loss for words.)

rows.Scenes: Heeling Hands Inc., Phoebe’s work, she is giving a massage to the guy, Rick, she likes.]
rows.Content: Rick: (looking at her feet) Wow, you have really pretty feet.ScenesPhoebe: These old things.ScenesRick: Would you mind spending some time on my siadic area, it’s been killing me today.ScenesPhoebe: You mean the—Okay by siadic, you mean the towel covered portion.ScenesRick: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Sure, yeah, no I can do that, yeah, because umm, y'know, the muscles in the siadic area can get y’know, real (lifts up the towel) nice and tight. So umm, tell me Rick, how umm, how did you injure the area.ScenesRick: Oh, a 16-hour sit-in for Greenpeace.ScenesPhoebe: Oh. (She goes to work, and her head slowly drops out of view.)ScenesRick: Ow! Did you just bite me?ScenesPhoebe: No!

rows.Scenes: Mr. Treeger’s apartment, Joey is there to suck up.]
rows.Content: Mr. Treeger:: What?ScenesJoey: Please don’t kick Monica and Rachel out, this wasn’t there fault, it was mine.ScenesMr. Treeger:: You want me to kick you guys out instead?ScenesJoey: No you can’t do that, where would the chick and the duck live?ScenesMr. Treeger:: You have pets!ScenesJoey: Noo-no-no, no, those are nicknames. I’m the chick and Chandler is the duck.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Huh, I would’ve thought it was the other way around.ScenesJoey: Come on man, just-just let the girls stay, I’ll do whatever you want.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Really? You’ll do anything?ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah, absolutely.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, I’ve got something you can do.ScenesJoey: What, what is it?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Can you be my dancing partner?ScenesJoey: That’s not, prison lingo, is it?ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is telling Monica and Rachel what he has to do.]
rows.Content: Monica: His dancing partner?!ScenesJoey: Yeah, there’s this superintendent’s dance, the Super Ball. I don’t know, and he wants to impress Marge, this lady super that he’s a crush on.ScenesRachel: Well, why doesn’t he practice with a girl?ScenesJoey: Well, he’s too shy, he doesn’t thing he’s good enough to dance with girls yet.ScenesRachel: Yeah, right, he almost danced me right down that…garbage chute. (Starts to cry)ScenesMonica: Oh, would you let it go already?! You’re fine!Scenes(Chandler and Ross enter)ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hey! So, did you quit?ScenesChandler: No, I almost did, couldn’t leave Ross there without a spotter!ScenesMonica: Wait, now so you joined the gym?Scenes(Rachel starts to laugh.)ScenesRoss: And that’s funny, why?ScenesRachel: Oh, umm, I was just y’know working out and umm… Oh, that’s it.ScenesChandler: We’re doomed. Okay, they’re gonna take 50 bucks out of our accounts for the rest of our lives. What are we gonna do?ScenesMonica: Well, you could actually go to the gym.Scenes(Chandler and Ross both laugh)ScenesRoss: Or! Or, we could go to the bank, close our accounts and cut them off at the source.ScenesChandler: You’re a genius!ScenesJoey: Aww, man, now we won’t be bank buddies!ScenesChandler: Now, there’s two reasons.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey.ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, you guys, remember that cute client I told you about? I bit him.ScenesRachel: Where?!ScenesPhoebe: On the touchy.ScenesRoss: And that’s not against your oath?!ScenesPhoebe: No, I know! I-I’m sorry, but the moment I touch him, I just wanna throw out my old oath and take a new, dirty one.ScenesMonica: Well, next time your massaging him, you should try and distract yourself.ScenesJoey: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! Like-like when I’m doing something exciting and I don’t wanna get too excited, I just ahh, y’know try to thing of other things like ah sandwiches, and ah baseball, and ah Chandler!ScenesChandler: Thank you, Joey.ScenesJoey: No-no, thank you.

(Turns on some music)ScenesJoey: Whoa-whoa, don’t we need to do some kinda preparation first? You just ahh, you just need more practice. Here, come on, let’s ahh, let’s try it again. Come on. (they start dancing again) Plus, it was, it was probably mostly my fault, anyway. I mean, y’know, I’m not really that comfortable dancing with a—(Treeger throws him) We-he!! Hey!ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah!

rows.Content: Monica: Hey-hey, how goes the dancing? Gay yet?ScenesJoey: Ah-ha-ha, you guys owe me big time. (He walks into the kitchen and does a little dance step on the way.)ScenesRachel: (laughing) What was that?ScenesJoey: What?ScenesRachel: You just did a little dancy thing.ScenesJoey: No I didn’t.ScenesMonica: Yes you did! So I had a great day, Rick and I really hit it off, and we started making out, and then my boss walked in and fired me for being a whore.ScenesJoey: What?!ScenesRachel: You got fired?!ScenesMonica: Oh my Gosh!ScenesPhoebe: It’s so weird, I have never been fired from anything before!ScenesRachel: Sweety...ScenesPhoebe: I just-I just started walking around not knowing what to do next, y’know? I-I started asking people on the street if they wanted massages. Then these policemen, thought I was a whore too. It’s been a really bad day, whore wise.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door and Chandler answers it.)ScenesMr. Treeger:: Hey Duck, is Chick here?ScenesChandler: Yeah… Bunny-rabbit.ScenesJoey: (To Mr. Treeger) So you ah, ready for our last practice?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, but y’know, I think the reason we’re not getting that spin right is because my apartment’s too small.ScenesJoey: Look, you wanna use our place?ScenesMr. Treeger:: No, I ahh, had another idea.Scenes[Cut to the roof, where Joey and Mr. Treeger are dancing happily to ^Night and Day^.]ScenesJoey: We did it!!ScenesMr. Treeger:: I know, we did it!! Hey, that was incredible, huh?!ScenesJoey: I know, it was amazing! I mean, we totally nailed it, it was beautiful.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Thank you, listen, thanks a lot Tribbiani, (checks watch). Oh my God, look at the time, I gotta catch the bus to the ball.ScenesJoey: Oh well, okay, good luck.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Unless you wanna practice the Foxtrot again? Or-or the Tango?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Ahh, thanks but no. You see I-I think I’m ready to dance with girls.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Go get ‘em Treeger.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Right. (Starts to leave) Hey, ahh, you wanna come? Marge has a girlfriend.ScenesJoey: (intrigued) Really?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, you could dance real good with her, she’s the same size as me.ScenesJoey: No, I’m good.Scenes(Treeger leaves, and Joey’s dances off.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Lara and Jeni’s Massage, Phoebe is interviewing for a job.]
rows.Content: Interviewer: So it looks like you’ve got some great experience here. Let’s see ahh, reason for leaving last job?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, they thought I was a whore.ScenesInterviewer: Okay, we’ll give a call if anything comes up.ScenesPhoebe: Great! Thank you very much.Scenes(The interviewer watches her leave with an ‘Oh my goodness’ face.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With Joey's New GirlfriendScenesWritten by: Michael Curtis & Gregory S. MalinsScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the gang's all there. Ross has a slip of paper that he throws on the ground tying to get Rachel's attention.]
rows.Content: Ross: (picking up the slip of paper) Hello! What's this? Oh right its that girl's phone number. (Rachel ignores him) Yeah-yeah, there it is, just a phone number a really hot girl gave me. (He holds it so that Rachel can see it, she continues to ignore him) It's no big deal, I mean it is her home phone number, but...(Rachel still ignores him) Whoa! (Throws it in her lap) Whoa-whoops, I almost lost this baby! Yeah, the lovely Amanda gives me her number and I-I go and drop it. (He waves it in front of Rachel's face. Then suddenly Phoebe has to sneeze and Rachel quickly grabs the slip of paper and gives it to Phoebe for her to sneeze into.)ScenesPhoebe: Thank you.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the next morning. Chandler, Monica, Ross, and Rachel are there.]
rows.Content: Gunther: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesGunther: When's your birthday?ScenesRachel: May fifth, why?ScenesGunther: Oh, I-I'm just making a list of people's birthdays.ScenesRoss: Oh, mine's December...ScenesGunther: Yeah, whatever. (Walks away)Scenes(Chandler is talking to Monica and notices a beautiful woman.)ScenesChandler: Ohh, she's pretty. Pretty ahh, pretty girl, the pretty--she's pretty.ScenesMonica: Just go up to her and ask her out. (Chandler laughs) Oh, what's the worst thing that could happen?ScenesChandler: I could die.ScenesRoss: Yeah, it's-it's tough being single. That's why I'm so glad I found Amanda.ScenesRachel: Ross, you guys went out once. You took your kids to Chucky Cheese, and you didn't even kiss her.Scenes(Ross glares at Chandler.)ScenesChandler: I tell people secrets. It makes them like me.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Oh.ScenesChandler: Hey! (Phoebe sneezes)ScenesMonica: Phoebe! You're sick, you shouldn't play. You should just go home, get in bed, and stay there.ScenesPhoebe: (in a nasally voice, from her cold) But I'm unemployed, my music is all I really have now. Well music, and making my own shoes. (She puts her shoe on the table, and it's horribly decorated) Pretty, huh? (Sneezes)ScenesChandler: All right, I'm gonna do it! I'm gonna get shot down. Any advice?ScenesMonica: Just be yourself. But, not too much.ScenesChandler: (gets up) (softly) Wish me luck.ScenesRoss: (loudly) Good luck!ScenesChandler: Wish it! (To the woman, Kathy, he likes) Hi. Hi, I-I was just sitting over there, and uhh, Chandler. My name is Chandler. Did I say that?ScenesKathy: No, you didn't. Hi, I'm Kathy.ScenesChandler: Uh Kathy, with K or a C?ScenesKathy: With a K.ScenesChandler: Oh-oh-hey!ScenesKathy: Wow! You are really good at this.ScenesChandler: Hey, come on, give me a break, I'm out on a limb here.ScenesKathy: I'm sorry, you're right, I apologize, but I should tell you that I'm waiting for a date. (Joey enters) Oh, and there he is now.ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey! Hey, hey-hey, hey. (Joey kisses Kathy.)ScenesJoey: Hey, I see you guys already met, huh?ScenesChandler: Yes-yes, I was just trying to figure out a way to uh, demonstrate how I could get my exceptionally large feet into my even bigger mouth.ScenesJoey: Didn't I tell ya? Always showin' off.ScenesPhoebe: Before I start, I just wanna say that umm, I have a cold, so if I sneeze in the middle of song, it's not on purpose. Oh, except the last verse of Pepper People. (Starts to sing) Smelly cat, smelly cat. What are they feeding you? (Stops singing) This chick sounds good. (Singing) Smelly cat, smelly--(stops singing) Hey Gunther, be a good little boy and bring me a whiskey.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is walking into the living room having just gotten up in the middle of the night.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (sees Kathy is up watching TV) Hi!ScenesKathy: Hi.ScenesChandler: Jeez, at 2:30 in the morning, I didn't expect to have to fight over the remote.ScenesKathy: I'm sorry, it's just this Ernie Cofax thing on in a few minutes I wanted to watch.ScenesChandler: Oh my God! That's why I got up too!ScenesKathy: You're kidding! Oh, I love him.ScenesChandler: Hey, listen, I'm sorry about this afternoon, y'know, if I would've known you guys were... I never would've...ScenesKathy: Oh please!ScenesChandler: So ah, Joey tells me you two met in acting class.ScenesKathy: Yeah, they teamed us up as partners. Joey picked three scenes for us to do; all of them had us making out.ScenesChandler: That's a good thing actually, because ah, he used to have me rehearse with him.ScenesKathy: (laughs) Oh-oh-oh-oh!ScenesChandler: Is it on?ScenesKathy: No, but this wonder broom is amazing!ScenesChandler: Hey! (Runs over and gets his wonder broom)ScenesKathy: Oh my God!ScenesChandler: Oh! It's on! It's on!Scenes(Chandler jumps into the canoe and sits down.
