The chick starts chirping and Chandler reaches down to pick him up.)ScenesChandler: There we go little fella.ScenesKathy: (laughs) What about the duck?ScenesChandler: Well the duck can swim.ScenesKathy: Oh, jeez. (Hits him)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the next night, Phoebe is finishing up her set.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing, drunk) My sticky shoes, my sticky-sticky shoes, why do you stick on me, ba-a-by! Thanks for the lights honey.ScenesAll: Way to go, Phoebe!ScenesMonica: That cold makes you sound so great.ScenesPhoebe: It's fun, God I love how sexy I am. (Coughs really loudly.)ScenesJoey: Oh, Kath, we should get going. We're going to by hamsters.ScenesAll: Ooh, that's great, I love those little guys.ScenesKathy: No, no, it's not like that. I, I work for a medical researcher.ScenesRachel: Well, have fun!ScenesKathy: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I think it's great that the medical community is finally trying to help sick hamsters.ScenesMonica: Y'know what, I like Kathy.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, me too, she's so cool and pretty.ScenesRachel: Yeah, she's...ScenesChandler: She's smart and funny, y'know? We were up all last night talking, she said the funniest thing about--what?ScenesRachel: You love her.ScenesChandler: No, I don't.ScenesPhoebe: Yes, you do. Chandler loves Kathy.ScenesRoss: Come on, Pheebs lay off him.ScenesChandler: Thank you, Ross.ScenesRoss: Yeah, he's a little sensitive right now, `cause he's so in love.ScenesChandler: All right.ScenesAll: Ohh!ScenesChandler: All right.ScenesMonica: (turning around and doing that, "I'm making out with someone," thing with her hands) Ooh, umm, oh Kathy! Kathy, I love you! Oh! (She turns around and sees Gunther staring at her and stops suddenly.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe and Monica are there.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: So, I need to write some depressing stuff to go along with my new floozy voice, but nothing that sad has ever really happened to me.ScenesMonica: Oh umm, how about your mom dying, or having to live on the streets when you were 14?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh. Oh, yeah, I could write about the time my hair did that "Woo-hoo" thing.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey.ScenesRoss: (loudly) So I'm going over to Amanda's tonight!ScenesMonica: Rachel's not here.ScenesRoss: Oh.ScenesMonica: How's it going with her?ScenesRoss: Great, actually. I'm thinking tonight, maybe the night. Yeah, I mean ah, the kids are gonna play together and then when they're asleep, I'm thinking Amanda and I break open a bottle of wine, and do a little "playing" ourselves.ScenesRachel: (entering, with a guy) Hi guys! This is Josh. Josh, these are my friends, and that's Ross.ScenesMonica: Hi, Josh.ScenesPhoebe: Hi.ScenesJosh: Dudes.ScenesMonica: So, did you play in college? (She points to his NYU Soccer (football for the rest of the world) sweatshirt he's wearing.)ScenesJosh: Oh, I still do. Next year, I hope to make varsity though.ScenesRachel: Ross, didn't you ah, play soccer in High School? Oh no wait, that's right. You just organized their game schedules on your Commodore 64.ScenesJosh: Well, it's getting late, I've got to get to the game, so I'm gonna... head.ScenesRachel: Okay. (He starts to leave, and Rachel grabs him and gives him a passionate kiss.) I'll miss you.ScenesJosh: Dope! (exits)ScenesPhoebe: Wow, cute one!ScenesMonica: Very!ScenesRachel: I know, isn't he great? It's so nice to finally be in a fun relationship, y'know? There's nothing boring about him, and ah, I bet he's never set foot in a museum.ScenesRoss: Well maybe he'll get to go soon, like on a class trip or something.ScenesRachel: Y'know what else is really great about him, oh, what is the word for the adult that doesn't have dinosaur toys in their bedroom?ScenesRoss: Oh! (He bangs his fists together.)ScenesRachel: What was that?ScenesRoss: Monica knows.ScenesMonica: It's this dumb thing that Ross made up `cause he was trying to fool our parents. It's a way of giving the finger, without actually having to give it. I remember I cried the night you made it up, `cause it was the first time that I realized that I was actually cooler than my older brother.ScenesRoss: Well, I'm gonna go get ready, (Gives Monica the fist thing.) for my date tonight, so ah, I'll just_ head.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I should go to, `cause I'm playing in one hour. Hey, (clears her voice and in her normal voice) you guys should come hear me, ooh hear me. Ooh, (tries to sing) My sticky shoes--eww! Eww! I lost my sexy phlegm!

rows.Scenes: Amanda's apartment, Ross is arriving with Ben.]
rows.Content: Amanda: (opening the door) Hi!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesAmanda: Hi Ben!ScenesRoss: Wow! You-you look great!ScenesAmanda: Thanks!ScenesRoss: (she lets him in) Okay! (to her son) Hey Tommy.ScenesAmanda: I am so glad that you could come over tonight.ScenesRoss: Oh no-no-no, it's my pleasure.ScenesAmanda: Okay, well, my cell phone number is right here on the counter, please help yourself to anything in the fridge.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesAmanda: I appreciate this soo much, I've been trying to go out with this guy for like a month.ScenesRoss: I-I-I...ScenesAmanda: (noticing the bottle of wine he has) Oh, I don't mean to be a square, but I'd really appreciate it if you wait and drink your wine after the kids are asleep? Oh uh, thanks for this, I hope I can do the same for you sometime. (She leaves)ScenesRoss: Who wants to make some long distance calls?

rows.Scenes: A street, Chandler is buying a newspaper and notices Kathy running by.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Kathy! Kathy! Hi!! Kathy! Kathy! (She doesn't hear him and keeps running, Chandler starts chasing her as the theme to The Mod Squad starts to play. First, a car almost hits him and then gets mustard splashed on him as he runs by a hot dog vendor.) Kathy! (He keeps running and gets tangled up in the leashes of five dogs, in desperation he throws his paper.) Fetch! Fetch it! (He frees himself and resumes the chase) Kathy! Kathy! Kathy! (He now trips and falls into a pile of garbage, he tries to get up and scream her name again but he has a piece of spinach in his mouth. He gets out of the garbage and starts crossing the street by running over the hoods of a couple of cabs.) Kathy! (He jumps in front of her and out of breath he says) Kathy.ScenesKathy: Hey, Chandler! What are you doing here?ScenesChandler: Oh, I just wanted to say, "Hey!ScenesKathy: Hey!ScenesChandler: Okay. (He walks away disgusted with himself.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is telling Monica about his new baby sitting job.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh come on! You're making it sound worse than it actually was.ScenesRoss: Her date tipped me ten dollars. (Monica laughs)Scenes(Phoebe runs into the kitchen with wet hair, opens the window, and sticks her head outside.)ScenesRoss: Pheebs, what are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I wanna be sexy again so I'm trying to catch a cold. It should be easy, supposedly they're pretty common.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, you'll catch pneumonia.ScenesChandler: (entering) Okay. You were right. I'm in love with Joey's girlfriend.ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesRoss: Are you serious?ScenesPhoebe: Well, how-how-how is that possible? You barely know her!ScenesChandler: I don't know. I can't--I just, I can't get her out of my head. Y'know? I mean, I'm a very bad person. I'm a very, very bad person. I'm a horrible person. (he waits for a reaction, when he doesn't get one) No you're not Chandler! We still love you Chandler!ScenesMonica: (sneezes) Oh gosh, Phoebe, I think I caught your cold.ScenesPhoebe: You mean you stole it! (Monica sneezes again) Don't cover your mouth when you do that!Scenes(Joey and Kathy enter, laughing)ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesKathy: (to Chandler) We were just talking about you.ScenesChandler: Really?!ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah, I told her about the time you got drunk and fell asleep with your head in the toilet.ScenesChandler: (laughs) Right in there!

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is playing Hide-and-Go-Seek with the chick and the duck.]
rows.Content: Chandler: 99...100! Ready or not, here I come! (He opens his eyes and sees that the chick and the duck are still sitting in front of him) All right, let's go over the concept one more time.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey guys. (to Chandler) Listen uh, you wanna get some dinner with me and Kathy tonight?ScenesChandler: Ohh, umm, y'know what, I already ate.ScenesJoey: It's 4:30.ScenesChandler: Y'know I had a big meal on Monday, y'know. So that's just gonna get me straight through the week.ScenesJoey: Okay, I see what's going on here.ScenesChandler: You-you do?ScenesJoey: Yeah! You don't like Kathy.ScenesChandler: You got me.ScenesJoey: Yeah, you've been avoiding her ever since we started going out. Look, I made an effort to like Janice, now I think it's your turn to make an effort to like Kathy by going out to dinner with us. Right?ScenesChandler: Yeah. Right.ScenesJoey: Good, and hey! My treat. (He turns to go into his bedroom then stops.) But that's only because you're not eating anything, right?ScenesChandler: Okay.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is returning from a date with Josh, and when they get the door open, Rachel turns and passionately kisses Josh.]
rows.Content: Monica: (lying on the couch suffering from her cold) Ross isn't here.ScenesRachel: Oh. (She tries to walk away from Josh, by he keeps holding her) Stop it!ScenesJosh: So I'll see you at the party? Beer's beer man, 24, 7!!ScenesRachel: Yeah! (Monica gives a sarcastic thumbs up) (Josh leaves) I am soo gonna marry that guy. (looking in her wallet) Ohhh!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesRachel: I think he's stealing from me.ScenesMonica: Why?ScenesRachel: Because he's stealing from me!ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hi! It's me. And soup. (to Rachel) Hey, I just saw Josh, he looks so yummy in your leather jacket.ScenesRachel: Ughh! (Storms out after him)ScenesPhoebe: (to Monica) Here, now I don't eat chicken, so it's just noodle soup. And there's no chicken in the broth either, so it's really just... noodle water.ScenesMonica: Thank you so much Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: (picking up Monica's used Kleenex and putting some in her pocket.) Sure.ScenesMonica: What are you doing with those?!ScenesPhoebe: But, I need your germs! I want my cold back! I miss my sexy voice.ScenesMonica: Sorry, Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: It's okay. How's the soup?ScenesMonica: Umm. (nodding her head, "Good.")Scenes(Monica sets the soup down and Phoebe picks it up and licks the rim.)ScenesMonica: Ohhhh!! Gross!!

rows.Scenes: A nightclub, Chandler is having dinner with Kathy and Joey.]
rows.Content: Kathy: Ohh, God, guys, check it out, you can see that girl's underwear!ScenesJoey: Is she great or what?ScenesKathy: (to Chandler) So? Huh? What do you think?ScenesChandler: Ohh, she's-she's not really my type.ScenesKathy: Not your type?! She's gorgeous!ScenesChandler: Y'know what I think it is? It's the fishnet stockings. Y'know? Whenever I see a girl in fishnet stockings it reminds me of my father in fishnet stockings.ScenesKathy: Okay. Understanding a little more why you're single. Ohh! Y'know, I have a friend you would like, she's really pretty. And then we could double date!ScenesChandler: Uhh, no-no thanks.ScenesKathy: Okay, I've got some ugly friends, and they're all available too.ScenesChandler: Listen, I-I'm gonna grab a beer. (Leaves)ScenesJoey: (to Kathy) I'll be right back. (to Chandler) What was that?ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: Kathy was being really nice and you just walked away. I thought we had a deal.ScenesChandler: Hey, look, what do you want from me?ScenesJoey: I want you to like her! But if that's too damned difficult for you, then the least you can do is pretend.ScenesChandler: I am pretending.ScenesJoey: Well then, do it better!ScenesChandler: Okay, what do you saw I go over there and say how much I like her? (Joey gives him a thumbs up) No-no it'll be good, I can tell her much I've been thinking about her. That I haven't stopped thinking about her since the moment I met her. That I'm so fantastically, over-the-top, wanna-slit-my-own-throat in love with her, that for every minute of every hour of every day I can't believe my own damn bad luck that you met her first!!ScenesJoey: Well, that's pretty good. But you might wanna tone it down a little.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are there.]
rows.Content: Ross: (entering) Hey! So, uhh, Amanda just-just dropped me off. Yeah, that's one of the things I love about her, she's...uh, she's old enough to drive. (to Monica) So uhh, I guess you're not going to mom and dad's tonight?ScenesMonica: No, sorry.ScenesRachel: Well where's Amanda?ScenesMonica: Hey Rach, could you get me some cough drops?ScenesRachel: I mean y'know, I'm thinking. You could bring her, and you guys could go up to your old room, and not make out.ScenesMonica: Ross, cough drops, please?ScenesRoss: At least I know she's not going out with me to get into R rated movies.ScenesRachel: Why don't you just marry her? Oh no, wait a minute you can't, I'm sorry I forgot, she's not a lesbian.ScenesRoss: You see Amanda and I have a very special...ScenesMonica: (interrupting) You have nothing! You're not even going out! You're her baby sitter! You have a 12-year-old girl's job!ScenesRachel: (laughing) Ohh, that is soo sad.ScenesMonica: And what are you laughing at, Miss `My-keg-sucking-boyfriend-is-stealing-from-me!'Scenes(Ross starts laughing)ScenesRachel: Hey, so he stole a couple bucks from me! At least he bought me something with it! (Shows her, her ring)ScenesMonica: That's mine!! Now, would you both please start acting like adults? And get me my cough drops!ScenesRoss: Fine.ScenesRachel: Sorry.ScenesRoss: Here. (Hands her, her cough drops) (to Rachel) At least I made ten bucks in my relationship.ScenesRachel: Y'know...Scenes(She does Ross's little gesture. In response Ross puts his hands behind his neck with his arms sticking straight out and starts flapping them together.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is there with her guitar.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) Platting goats are platting. Platting down the street. Platting goats are platting, leaving little treats. (to Gunther) Does it even work without my sexy voice?ScenesGunther: I like it. (sneezes)ScenesPhoebe: Gunther, kiss me.ScenesGunther: What?Scenes(Phoebe grabs Gunther and kisses him. He then falls to the couch in shock.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching TV as Joey and Kathy are laughing in Joey's bedroom. They get to be pretty loud so Chandler turns the TV way up.]
rows.Content: Joey: (opening the door wearing nothing but a sock, and holding a dart board over the `Little General.') Hey! (Chandler turns down the TV) Now, we're not actually gonna be sleeping in her, but do you mind?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, with a blanket draped over her shoulders, opens the door to a similarly clad Chandler.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Can I sleep on your couch?Scenes(Monica nods `Yes.' And they both walk to the couch looking all depressed.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is singing, with everyone else present.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) And I'm still waiting for my paper mache man. Thank you my babies.Scenes(applause)ScenesGunther: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesGunther: I don't know if you heard about what happened between me and Phoebe the other day_ScenesRachel: No!ScenesGunther: Well, we kissed. I-I-I didn't initiate the kiss, but-but I also didn't stop it, and I've been feeling guilty.ScenesRachel: (confused) Okay.ScenesGunther: So umm, are we cool?ScenesRachel: (really confused) Okay.ScenesGunther: I knew you'd understand.Scenes(Gunther walks away, leaving Rachel with a `What just happened?' look on her face.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Dirty GirlScenesWritten by: Scott Silveri & Shana Goldberg-MeehanScenesTranscribed by: Darcy & Julie Partridge

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross and a beautiful blonde (Cheryl) are standing outside. The rest of the gang is watching from inside.]
rows.Content: Cheryl: So, thank you for the delicious dinner.ScenesRoss: You're welcome for a delicious dinner.Scenes[inside]ScenesPhoebe: Hey what are you guys looking at?ScenesChandler: Ross and the most beautiful girl in the world.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, come to papa.Scenes[Cheryl walks away and Ross walks inside. Everyone stares at him in disbelief.]ScenesRoss: I know!ScenesMonica: Probably the only time I'll ever say this, but did you see the ass on her?ScenesChandler: Where did you, when did you, how did you... (Joey hits the back of Chandler's head) How did you get a girl like that?ScenesRachel: Yeah, so what is she, like a... like a spokesmodel, or an aerobics instructor, what?ScenesRoss: Actually she's a paleontology doctoral candidate, specializing in the centazoic era.ScenesChandler: Okay, but that's, like, the easiest era.ScenesRoss: I've seen her at work, but I always figured, ah-huh? But, uh, I made her dinner. We had a great time. And we're going out again tomorrow.ScenesRachel: Well maybe she and her friends are just having a contest to see who can bring home the biggest geek.ScenesRoss: Fine by me; hope she wins.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's. Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are there. Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hi. You guys have any wrapping paper?ScenesPhoebe: Oo! Is it for my birthday present?ScenesChandler: Phebes, it was your birthday, like, months ago.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but remember you said you ordered something special, and it just hasn't come yet?ScenesChandler: Well, I have a call in about that.ScenesPhoebe: 'Kay.ScenesChandler: Actually, this is for Kathy's birthday. It's an early edition of her favorite book.ScenesRachel: Oh, The Velveteen Rabbit! Oh my God, when the boy's love makes the rabbit real!ScenesChandler: Okay, but don't touch it, because you fingers have destructive oils.ScenesRachel: Huh. Well, then you'd better keep it away from Ross's hair. So this is pretty rare. How did you get that?ScenesChandler: Oh, it wasn't a big deal. I just went to a couple of bookstores, talked to a couple of dealers... called a couple of the author's grandchildren.ScenesRachel: Oh, honey, that's so sweet.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, and what a great way to say, "I secretly love you, roommate's girlfriend!ScenesChandler: It doesn't say that. Does it?ScenesRoss: How do you think it's gonna look when you get her something incredibly meaningful and expensive and her boyfriend Joey gives her an orange?ScenesChandler: Okay, all right, I'll just uh, make sure that uh, Joey gets her something really great.ScenesPhoebe: It's gotta be better than that book. Oo! Like a crossbow!ScenesMonica: (Entering from her bedroom, talking on the phone) Yeah, once again, I am sorry. Thank you. Bye. (To the gang) I just had to turn down a job catering a funeral for sixty people.ScenesRachel: Oh my God! What happened?ScenesMonica: Sixty guests.ScenesRoss: So, uh, why did you have to turn it down?ScenesMonica: Because I don't have the money or the equipment to handle something that big on such short notice. I mean there's no way.ScenesPhoebe: Wow, what is with all the negativity? You sound like Monican't , not Monican... (Monica looks almost puzzled) ...Monica. Look, you know, you have been playing around with this catering thing for over three years. Do you want to be a caterer or not?ScenesMonica: I don't know.ScenesPhoebe: There you go, that's the spirit! Okay! Now, if you need money, I will lend you money, but just get moving!ScenesMonica: Really? Cause I'd need like $500 for all the food and the supplies and stuff.ScenesPhoebe: Okay! It's worth it, if it will get you moving. You haven't worked in months.ScenesMonica: Well, you're not working either.ScenesPhoebe: Yes, but I'm doing this.ScenesMonica: Yeah, that'd be great! Thank you!Scenes[Joey enters]ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesEveryone: Hey.ScenesKathy: Can I borrow the keys to your apartment?ScenesJoey: Why?Scenes[Kathy whispers something in Joey's ear]ScenesJoey: You can pee here!ScenesKathy: Ahahaha... haha.. yes I can, of course. Excuse me.ScenesChandler: It's okay, the duck's using our bathroom anyway. (Kathy goes into the bathroom.) Hey Joe! What are you getting Kathy for her birthday?ScenesJoey: We've only been going out for a couple of weeks, do you think I gotta get her something?ScenesEveryone: Yeah!ScenesRachel: Yes, you have to get her something, and it should be something really nice.ScenesJoey: Oh, I know...ScenesRachel: And not one of your coupons for an hour of "Joey Love.Scenes[cut to a new scene, also in Monica and Rachel's apartment. Rachel is sitting, Phoebe is nearby.]ScenesPhoebe: Ooo, a crossword! Can I help?ScenesRachel: No! I'm sorry, honey, it's just that last week I got all but three answers and I really want to finish a whole one without any help.ScenesPhoebe: Fine. But you can't help me develop my new universal language.Scenes[Monica enters]ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey, how'd it go?ScenesMonica: Oh my God, it was the best funeral ever! I mean, everyone loved the food, and guess what? I even got another funeral for tomorrow—the dead-guy-from-today's best friend. I mean, it is like I am the official caterer for that accident!ScenesPhoebe: Mon! I'm so happy for you!ScenesMonica: Thanks. Like, check out my new catering stuff. (Picks up two frying pans) Look at this! I'm an omelet station! Omelet? Made to order!ScenesPhoebe: I'll have one, please. Plus my money.ScenesMonica: Oh. Well, I didn't realize that you needed it back right away. I mean, you told me to go and be a caterer. So I went. I beed. I mean, I... I used it to buy all this stuff. But look—I've got another job tomorrow, so I'll pay you back with the money I make from that.ScenesPhoebe: Oh. Okay. Oo, sorry I acted like a bank.ScenesMonica: Okay.

rows.Scenes: Outside Cheryl's apartment, Ross and Cheryl are kissing]
rows.Content: Ross: (moved by the kiss) Huh...ScenesCheryl: Um, would you like to come in?ScenesRoss: Did homo-erectus hunt with wooden tools?ScenesCheryl: According to recent findings!Scenes[They go into the apartment. Inside the apartment it looks like a sewage dump exploded and landed in her living room. There are clothes and food and junk covering every square inch of space. I mean pigs have nicer pens. Ross is completely shocked.]ScenesCheryl: (throwing food around the room) Here Mitzi! Here Mitzi!ScenesRoss: Mitzi is.....ScenesCheryl: My hamster. I hope she's okay, I haven't seen her in a while. Have a seat.ScenesRoss: (mouths "where?") Uh... Oh hey, do you, uh (steps on some garbage and falters) ...do you have any, um, Cinnamon Fruit Toasties?ScenesCheryl: What?ScenesRoss: Well, I do! Why don't we go back to my place, light a couple of candles, break open a box of Cinnamon Fruit Toasties, uh...ScenesCheryl: I'd rather not.ScenesRoss: Oh, yeah, why not?ScenesCheryl: Okay, um, don't take this the wrong way, but your place kinda has a weird smell.

rows.Scenes: A kitchen where Phoebe and Monica are finishing up a catering job]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh, is everything in the car?ScenesPhoebe: Yes. Did you settle the bill?ScenesMonica: No. I hate this part.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, look what we almost left. (Picks up a coffee maker)ScenesMonica: No, that's not mine.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, all right. Oh! Look what we almost took!Scenes[cut to the living room of the same dwelling, where the funeral guests are mingling. Monica enters.]ScenesMonica: Excuse me, Mrs. Burkart? Well, we're all cleaned up in the kitchen.ScenesMrs. Burkart: Oh, good. Thank you.ScenesMonica: Um, and, well there's the.. the the small matter of...ScenesMrs. Burkart: Dear?ScenesMonica: Just the matter of ...payment?ScenesMrs. Burkart: (in grief) Jack used to handle the finances! (Breaks into tears)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is on the couch still doing the crossword. Chandler is in the kitchen.]
rows.Content: Rachel: You know what we should all do? Go see a musical.ScenesChandler: (confused) Sure...ScenesRachel: And you know which one we should see? The 1996 Tony award winner. Do you happen to know the name of that one?ScenesChandler: I don't know... um, Grease?ScenesRachel: No....ScenesChandler: Rent?ScenesRachel: Yes! Rent!ScenesChandler: Okay, so when do you want to go?ScenesRachel: What? Oh, I'm sorry, I can't, I'm busy.ScenesJoey: (entering the apartment) Hey. Man, it is so hard to shop for girls.ScenesChandler: Yes, it is, at Office Max.ScenesRachel: What did you get her? (Joey opens up a rectangular black box and holds up a pen.)ScenesChandler: A pen.ScenesJoey: It's two gifts in one. It's a pen that's also a clock! Huh?ScenesChandler: Huh-huh! You can't give her that.ScenesJoey: Why not?ScenesChandler: Because she's not eleven! And it's not the seventh night of Hanukkah!ScenesRachel: Okay, honey, what he means by that, is ...while this is a very nice gift, maybe it's just not something a boyfriend gives?ScenesJoey: Sure it is! She needs a pen for work, she's writing, she turns it over.... "Whoa! It's time for my date with Joey!ScenesChandler: All right, look, look. What did... what did you get for Angela Delveccio for her birthday?ScenesJoey: She didn't have a birthday while we were going out.ScenesChandler: For three years?ScenesJoey: (whining and heading toward the door) Look, it's too late, and I got an audition. I can't shop anymore! I...ScenesChandler: All right. I will go out and I will try to find something for her, okay?ScenesJoey: Thanks, man. And oh, while you're at it, could you get her a card?ScenesChandler: Would you like me to write her a little poem as well?ScenesJoey: Or... just get a card that has a poem already in it.

rows.Scenes: Back in the kitchen at the funeral. Phoebe is there, Monica enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: But Mon, you have to get our money!ScenesMonica: Oh, Phoebe, she couldn't stop crying! With those thick glasses, her tears looked giant.ScenesPhoebe: I know, it's tough. You know what the first thing I did after my mother's funeral was?ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: Pay the caterer! Look, I've had a lot of jobs, okay, and there are some people who just always try to get out of paying. It's either, you know, "that massage wasn't long enough, or, "I don't recognize any of those songs," or, you know, "these sombreros aren't big enough. Bad little white girl!ScenesMonica: Okay. So what do you.... you think she's faking?ScenesPhoebe: Well, it seems like there weren't any tears 'til you showed her the bill.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, she sounded pretty upset to me.Scenes[cut to the living room where Mrs. Burkart is now performing.]ScenesMrs. Burkart: (singing) You're a grand ol' flag, you're a high-flying flag, and forever in peace may you wave....ScenesPhoebe: She seems fine now.ScenesMrs. Burkart: (singing) ...emblem of the land I love. The home of....ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Joey are standing and talking, Ross is tying a tie.]
rows.Content: Joey: So, you just left? Her place was really that bad?ScenesRoss: You know how you throw your jacket on a chair at the end of the day?ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Well, like that, only instead of a chair, it's a pile of garbage. And instead of a jacket, it's a pile of garbage. And instead of the end of the day, it's the end of time, and garbage is all that has survived! (Ross takes the loosely tied tie off and hands it to Joey who puts it on.) Here.ScenesJoey: Wow. Thanks. So, uh, what happened?ScenesRoss: What do you mean? Nothing happened! I had to get out of there.ScenesJoey: All right, so... next time, you take her to your place.ScenesRoss: No, I tried that. She says it has a weird smell.ScenesJoey: What kind of smell?ScenesRoss: I don't know. Soap?ScenesJoey: All right, listen, Ross... you like this girl, right?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesJoey: You wanna see her again, right?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesJoey: So you're gonna have to do it in the mess!ScenesRoss: Yeah, okay you're right.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesRoss: I mean, uh, who... who cares about a little sloppiness?ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesRoss: It's, uh... it's endearing, really.ScenesJoey: All right! Now you go get that beautiful pig! (Ross hesitates, looks unsure) Oink!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel, Rachel is there, Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay, all right. I just spent the entire afternoon looking for a present for Kathy that would be better than the rabbit.ScenesRachel: Any luck?ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah. Yeah, I found this great place called "Invisible things for Kathy." (Motions to an imaginary pile of presents next to him.) Can you give me a hand with all this stuff?ScenesRachel: All right, look. Why don't you just return the book, let Joey give her the clock pen, and you give her something worse than that. Like... a regular pen.ScenesChandler: She's really going to love this, you know? The bottom line is I want her to have it, even if I don't get to be the one who gives it to her.ScenesRachel: Aw, honey, that's so sweet.ScenesChandler: Yeah? You don't think it's just pathetic?ScenesRachel: Oh! Pathetic! (Grabs the crossword puzzle and starts writing.)ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey! I'm meeting Kathy in ten minutes! I've been looking all over for you!ScenesChandler: Where?ScenesJoey: Our place, the hall! I...ScenesChandler: I got something for her. (Joey picks up the package, shakes it next to his ear, can't hear anything, switches ears, shakes it again.) It's a book!ScenesJoey: (Unimpressed) A book? (Suddenly interested) Is it like a book that's also a safe?ScenesChandler: No, it's a book that's just a book, okay? It's an early edition of the Velveteen Rabbit. It was her favorite book as a kid. So, uh, just... let me know if she likes it, okay?ScenesJoey: You got it. Thanks man. Thanks for doing this, I owe you one. (Joey leaves, comes back in.) Oh, hey! There wasn't any change from that twenty, was there?ScenesChandler: No, it came out to an even twenty.ScenesJoey: Wow. That's almost as much as a new book.

rows.Scenes: In the living room at the funeral]
rows.Content: Mrs. Burkart: (singing) Jeepers, creepers, where'd you get those peepers? Jeepers, creepers, where'd you get those eyes?Scenes[cut to Monica and Phoebe in the kitchen]ScenesPhoebe: You didn't get the money, did you?ScenesMonica: Maybe I can try at intermission? Phoebe, come on... you know what? Let's just go!ScenesPhoebe: No! Hey, we're not leaving until we get paid! I don't know who she thinks she is! Enough is enough! (Phoebe goes into the living room.) Hey, widow?ScenesMrs. Burkart: (Singing) Come on along and listen to...ScenesPhoebe: Okay, Widow!ScenesMrs. Burkart: (Singing) ...the lullabye of...ScenesPhoebe: Excuse me. Excuse me! (Mrs. Bukart stops singing) Thanks. Um, clearly this is a very, very hard time for you. Um, but, um, we provided a service, and we deserve to be paid because you ate that service, and, um, we are not leaving here until we're paid every penny. 'Cause you know what, lady? We're part time caterers, and we have no place else to go.ScenesMrs. Burkart: All right. I'll get my bag.ScenesPhoebe: Good. (Phoebe and Mrs. Burkart go into the other room, leaving Monica with everyone staring at her.)ScenesMonica: I'm gonna leave some cards here. Please think of us for you next event.

rows.Scenes: Outside Cheryl's apartment.]
rows.Content: Cheryl: So you want to come inside?ScenesRoss: (mustering up courage) Yes. Yes I do. (They go inside.)ScenesCheryl: I'll be right back. Make yourself comfortable. (Ross attempts to clear a place for his coat and fold it small enough to fit. Then hit sits on the couch. Something falls on him from above and he brushes his neck off frantically.)ScenesCheryl: (sneaking up behind Ross) Guess who?ScenesRoss: Department of Sanitation?ScenesCheryl: It's me!ScenesRoss: Oh! (She kisses him) Ah. (They kiss more, and move down onto the couch. Ross's hand moves under some garbage) Aw! (His hand is covered with something brown and gooey.)ScenesCheryl: What?ScenesRoss: (trying to make his disgust into lust) Ah, Cheryl!ScenesCheryl: Oh, Ross!Scenes[They sit up, moaning in excitement, and Cheryl straddles Ross. Ross finds a slice of bologna and moans higher and louder, then a bag of potato chips on the coffee table starts to move. Ross throws Cheryl off his lap, grabs a tennis racket and a toilet brush and starts pounding the bag.]ScenesCheryl: Wait! No! No! It's my hamster! It's Mitzi!ScenesRoss: Oh my god! I'm so sorry, Cheryl. I must have freaked out.ScenesCheryl: (looking in the bag) Oh, thank god, it's not Mitzi. It's just a rat.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Rachel is sitting on the couch alone working on a crossword puzzle. Gunther is there, going into the back room.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I did it! Oh! I finished it! I did it all by myself! And there's nobody to hug!Scenes[From the background we hear a crash and Gunther comes running out of the back room, pushing people aside, reaching for Rachel.]ScenesGunther: Move!Scenes[Gunther slips and falls just before reaching the back of the couch. Monica and Phoebe come into Central Perk.]ScenesRachel: Hey! Hey, you guys, I finished the crossword all by myself! Hug me!Scenes[Gunther gets up slowly from behind the couch and walks away sadly]ScenesPhoebe: Uh... yay!ScenesRachel: Thanks!ScenesMonica: Oh, that's great! Congratulations!ScenesRachel: Thank you! Hey, how'd the catering go?ScenesMonica: Oh, it was great! The widow wouldn't pay, so Phoebe yelled at her 'til she did.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. I'm a hard ass.ScenesMonica: And I'm a wuss. And we should be partners.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Hard Ass and Wuss. We could fight crime!ScenesMonica: Wait a minute, Phoebe! We should be partners. We should be catering partners. I mean, think about it! You're not working right now, and we have such a great time together!ScenesPhoebe: Okay!ScenesMonica: I can cook and you can take care of the money.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Oh! It'll be like I have a wife in the fifties!ScenesBoth: (screaming with excitement) Aah!

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is there, Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey, how'd it go? How'd she like the gift?ScenesJoey: Oh, man, she loved it! She's over there showing Monica and Rachel right now.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah? That's great!ScenesJoey: Hey, listen, I gotta tell ya, I feel kinda bad taking credit for this, because man, am I gonna get a lot of credit for this!ScenesChandler: [nodding, with mixed feelings] Aahhuuhhh....Scenes[Kathy enters]ScenesKathy: Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey! Happy birthday.ScenesKathy: Thank you!ScenesJoey: You know, uh... [Joey moves the pen case out onto the counter.] Chandler got you a gift, too.ScenesChandler: No he didn't. [Moving it back.]ScenesJoey: Yeah, he did, look... look, it's right there on the counter! Ha-ho-ho!ScenesChandler: Happy birthday! I'm sorry.ScenesKathy: You really didn't have to. (Opens the box) Wow.ScenesChandler: See, you think it's just a pen, but then you turn it over and it's also a clock.ScenesKathy: Yeah. No, this is great. Thank you, Chandler. (They hug).ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah... yeah.ScenesJoey: Ah. Hm. (To Kathy) Wanna go to bed?ScenesKathy: I'll be in in a minute.ScenesJoey: Oh, uh... don't forget your coupon. (Tries to strike a sexy pose up against the doorway to his room. Then goes inside).ScenesChandler: [to Kathy] Goodnight.ScenesKathy: Um, thank you for the gift.ScenesChandler: Oh, uh, yeah... I just knew that sometimes when you're writing, you... you don't always know the exact time.ScenesKathy: No, I... I didn't mean the pen. Thank you for the book.ScenesChandler: Uh, the book?ScenesKathy: The Velveteen Rabbit. I kinda have the feeling you had something to do with it.ScenesChandler: What do you mean?ScenesKathy: Well, uh, when Joey gave it to me, he said, "This is 'cause I know ya like Rabbits, and I know ya like cheese." Thanks. I love it. And I know how hard it must have been for you to find.ScenesChandler: (tongue-tied) Uhl..ell. By the way, in case you missed that, that sound was, "Uhl, ell.ScenesKathy: You must really like... Joey... to go to all that trouble for him.ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah, he's my... he's my best friend.ScenesKathy: Well....ScenesChandler: Goodnight. (Goes to his room.)ScenesJoey: (opening bedroom door) Hey, that coupon expires, you know.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Outside Cheryl's apartment, Monica knocks on Cheryl's door]
rows.Content: Monica: Hi. Uh, you... you don't know me, I'm Monica Geller... Ross's sister.ScenesCheryl: Oh, yeah. Oh, you know, that's too bad that didn't work out.ScenesMonica: Yeah. Anyway, he told me about your apartment. And, um, I couldn't sleep, thinking about it. So, uh, would it be okay if I cleaned it?Scenes[Cheryl shrugs, shuts the door, looking puzzled]ScenesMonica: No?Scenes[Monica looks around the hallway, pulls out a sponge and starts scrubbing the door frame.]ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Chandler Crosses a LineScenesWritten by: Adam ChaseScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, everyone except Joey and Chandler are there eating breakfast.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering in a bathrobe) I just walked in the bathroom and saw Kathy naked! It was like torture!ScenesRoss: Y'know if we ever go to war and you’re captured, you’re in for a big surprise.ScenesChandler: It just keeps getting worse and worse! Y'know? I mean it’s bad enough that I’m in love with my roommates girlfriend—which by the way, I think she knows. Because every time we’re in the room together there’s this weird like energy between us. And call me crazy, but I think she likes me too. And now I have seen her naked. I mean at least when I’ve seen her with clothes on, I could imagine her body was like covered in boles or something. But there are no boles, she’s smooth! Smooth! (leaves)Scenes(Pause)ScenesPhoebe: Wow! Could everyone totally see up his robe?ScenesAll: Yeah! Oh my God!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is getting a phone number from a woman (Casey) as Chandler watches from the doorway.]
rows.Content: Casey: Here you go.ScenesJoey: Great! All right, so I’ll call you later.ScenesCasey: Great! (leaves)ScenesChandler: (rushing up) Hey-Hey-Hey! Who was that?ScenesJoey: That would be Casey. We’re going out tonight.ScenesChandler: Goin’ out, huh? Wow! Wow! (Does a little celebration dance) So things didn’t work out with Kathy, huh? Bummer.ScenesJoey: No, things are fine with Kathy. I’m having a late dinner with her tonight, right after my early dinner with Casey.ScenesChandler: (shocked) What?ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah. And the craziest thing is that I just ate a whole pizza by myself! (Laughs)ScenesChandler: Wait! You’re going out with Kathy!ScenesJoey: Yeah. Why are you getting so upset?ScenesChandler: Well, I’m upset—for you. I mean, having sex with an endless line of beautiful women must be very unfulfilling for you. (He can’t believe he just sad that.)ScenesJoey: What is the big deal? It’s not like we’re exclusive.ScenesChandler: Look, Joey, Kathy is clearly not fulfilling your emotional needs. But Casey, I mean granted I only saw the back of her head, but I got this sense that she’s-she’s smart, and funny, and gets you.ScenesJoey: You got all that from the back of her head?ScenesChandler: All right look, I think it’s time for you to settle down. Y'know? Make a choice, pick a lane.ScenesJoey: Who’s Elaine?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Monica are sitting on the couch playing cards, and Phoebe is working on a new song.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) "Little, tiny Tarzan, swinging on a nose hair. Swinging with the greatest of ease…" Darn it! Now, I don’t know who to get to the next verse.ScenesRoss: Oh, you could just go uh, "greatest of ease… (plays air guitar) BAH-bah-bha-bhannn." Then go right into it.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, ooh, I like that! Yeah. Wait! How do you know about ‘bah-bah-bha-bhan?’ScenesRoss: Well umm, y’know, I used to play.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, that’s right, the keyboards, huh?ScenesRoss: Yeah, just a little in high school, but then I really got into it in college. I mean that’s-that’s when I really found my sound.Scenes(Monica is taking a drink as Ross says that, laughs, and snorts her drink.)ScenesMonica: Oh God! Orange juice just came out of my nose, but it was totally worth it. Oh my God, I completely forgot about your sound.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesMonica: He used to lock himself in the basement for hours. No one was every allowed to hear, "The Sound.ScenesPhoebe: I wanna hear "The Sound.ScenesRoss: Really? No. I mean, nah, I haven’t played in so long, and-and, well it’s-it’s really personal stuff, y’know?ScenesPhoebe: Come on, play that funky music white boy.ScenesMonica: Yeah!ScenesRoss: No, you guys, I mean my keyboards are all the way up in—No, yeah, okay. (Runs out.)Scenes[Cut to later that same day, Ross has retrieved his keyboard and is about to debut, "The Sound."]ScenesRoss: Okay, guys.ScenesChandler: All right! Bring it on, you…ScenesRoss: Here we go. (Plays one note) Y’know, I’ve-I’ve never played my stuff for anyone before, so it’s important that-that you understand it’s about communicating very private emotions. (Plays another note) Y’know, umm, you should-you should think of umm, my work as wordless sound poems. That’s what I’m…ScenesChandler: (interrupting) Oh my God! Play!Scenes(Ross starts to play. He plays a key that has a back beat sound attached to it. Over the background music he plays the sound of a barking dog, a mooing cow, a laser beam, someone coughing, a jackhammer, a doorbell, a police siren, a ray gun, breaking dishes, and for a closer he plays the sound of a loud crash. Basically, the music sucks.)ScenesMonica: (At a loss for words) Boy, that was-that was, umm… terrific.ScenesChandler: Really, bitchin’!ScenesPhoebe: Wow, it was so—wow!ScenesRoss: Really?! I mean, really?!!ScenesRachel: Yeah, I mean, you should play in public!ScenesRoss: Wow! Thanks, you guys. That’s uh—ohhh, I wanna, I wanna play you another piece! Umm! Uh-oh! I left my uh, helicopter sounds on another disk. I’ll be right back! Okay? (Runs to fetch them) This is so nice, I’m—I am so… (starts to break up and leaves)ScenesMonica: Oh God bless my dad sound proofing the basement!ScenesRachel: Oh, I can’t believe I ever let him touch me with those fingers.ScenesPhoebe: What are you guys talking about, I loved it! It was soo moving. Oh, plus it’s just, it’s so different from the stuff you usually hear.ScenesChandler: You mean like, music?

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching Yasmein Bleeth running on TV, and the duck starts quacking.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Yeah, I know what you’re thinkin’! Yes, yes, your breasts are just as firm and juicy.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door.)ScenesChandler: Come in!ScenesKathy: (entering) Hey! (sees what’s on TV) Oh God, is that Baywatch?ScenesChandler: Uh yes, but uh, I just watch it for the articles.ScenesKathy: So is Joey around?ScenesChandler: No-no, he’s not back yet, but he’ll be here any minute. So uh, come on in. Have a seat. Bow or stern?ScenesKathy: I uh, don’t really have a preference. You?ScenesChandler: I like it in the stern. (Realizes what he just said.) …of the boat. (The phone rings, and he answers it.) (on phone) Hello.ScenesJoey: (on the other end at a pay phone) Hey, it’s me. Listen Casey and I were on our way back and had a little car trouble.ScenesChandler: What happened?ScenesJoey: We broke down on the Parkway, so I have to walk back and get some transmission fluid. And hey, listen could you please tell Kathy that I’ll be there as soon as I can.ScenesChandler: Why can’t you tell her?ScenesJoey: ‘Cause I only have one quarter, and I think my time is about to—(he stops talking suddenly)ScenesChandler: Joey! Joey!!ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesChandler: I thought your time ran out.ScenesJoey: Me too, but I guess I do have a couple of more—(his time runs out for real)ScenesChandler: (to Kathy) Uhh, that was Joey. He’s running a little late, he says he’s sorry.ScenesKathy: Oh.ScenesChandler: So I guess it’s just uh, you and me then.ScenesKathy: Oh, okay.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I think it is!ScenesKathy: So what did you do today?ScenesChandler: Oh, I had an appointment to get my haircut…ScenesKathy: (interrupting) Oh, it looks great!ScenesChandler: …and then it got canceled.ScenesKathy: Well, I could cut it.ScenesChandler: Really?! You do that?ScenesKathy: Yeah, I do. Of course, I learned at my aunt’s dog grooming shop, but hey, what do you say?ScenesChandler: Dog grooming huh? Okay, just don’t make my tail too poofy.Scenes[Cut to later, Kathy is cutting Chandler’s hair.]ScenesKathy: You have really great hair.ScenesChandler: Well, thanks. I grow it myself. (Kathy is running her fingers through his hair, and Chandler catches himself enjoying it too much.) Y’know who also has great hair is Joey!ScenesKathy: Yes! Yeah! Joey has great hair! Umm, I’m basically done here. Just let me get this off your neck.Scenes(Kathy leans in really close and Chandler mouths "Oh my God." She moves around in front of him and kneels at his feet.)ScenesChandler: What-what ‘cha doin’?ScenesKathy: Checking to see if it’s even.ScenesChandler: ‘Kay.ScenesKathy: Looks good.Scenes(They lean in to kiss and are interrupted by the phone.)ScenesChandler: (jumping up to answer the phone) Oh the phone! The phone’s making sounds! (On phone) Hello!ScenesJoey: (on phone) Hey dude, it’s me.ScenesChandler: Hey it’s Joey!ScenesJoey: Listen uh, I’m really sorry, it looks like I’m gonna be stuck here for a while. I got the transmission fluid, but when I went to put it in the car, the transmission wasn’t there!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: Yeah, it must’ve fallen out a few blocks back. I just figured we hit a dog.ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesJoey: Listen uh, could you put Kathy on, I wanna apologize.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah man. (to Kathy) Joey. (Hands her the phone.)ScenesKathy: (on phone) Hey. (listens) Oh no it’s fine, don’t worry about it. (listens) Yeah-no, stop apologizing, it’s okay. (listens) Yeah! I’ll talk to you tomorrow. (hangs up) (to Chandler) I should uh, probably go.ScenesChandler: Yeah. Yes! Yeah.Scenes(Kathy leaves and Chandler groans in agony. Kathy knocks on the door and Chandler opens it.)ScenesKathy: I forgot my purse.ScenesChandler: Oh.Scenes(They kiss, passionately.)ScenesKathy: No, I really did forget my purse.Scenes(They kiss again.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, continued from earlier. Chandler and Kathy are still kissing, then they stop suddenly.]
rows.Content: Chandler: No-no-no-no, this is bad! It’s bad! This is bad!ScenesKathy: Horrible!ScenesChandler: Wait the uh, the kiss or the situation?ScenesKathy: No-no-no, the kiss was good.ScenesChandler: Okay!ScenesKathy: No, but that’s bad!ScenesChandler: Ooh! Yes! Okay! Here’s what we do, we-we forget it happened.ScenesKathy: What?!ScenesChandler: Okay, we-we swallow our feelings. Even if it means we’re unhappy forever. Sound good?ScenesKathy: Can you really do that?ScenesChandler: I have to; he’s my best friend, and you’re seeing him.ScenesKathy: Chandler, I like Joey a lot, but with you…ScenesChandler: (interrupting) Oh-no-no-no! Don’t! Don’t! See-see, you’re getting me confused, I’m starting to urn.ScenesKathy: I’m sorry. If you wanna pretend that nothing happened, I can try.ScenesChandler: I-I think we have too.ScenesKathy: Okay. Bye.ScenesChandler: Bye. (Kathy leaves and Chandler wonders over to and leans up against the door.) Are you still out there?ScenesKathy: (outside the door) No. (Chandler opens the door and they kiss again.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is performing, his music hasn’t improved.]
rows.Content: Ross: (His voice is altered to sound like a computer.) Electrifying. (He plays the sound of a ticking clock.) Emphatic time-time-time…ScenesMonica: (to Rachel and Phoebe) Y'know, there’s a Starbucks about three blocks down.ScenesPhoebe: (pushing Monica back onto the couch) It’s so inspired! Look at him! Look at him go!Scenes[cut back to Ross who finally finishes his so-called song with the same crash from before. He gets some applause, mainly ‘cause he’s done.]ScenesRoss: (with the altered voice) Thank you guys-guys-guys…ScenesMonica: (to Phoebe) Hey, aren’t you up next?ScenesPhoebe: Oh no, I’m not playing tonight.ScenesRachel: Why not?ScenesPhoebe: I can’t follow Ross! It’d be like those bicycle ridding chimps that followed The Beetles. No.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, Ross sucks!ScenesRachel: Phoebe, the place has emptied because of him.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God, he’s not even appreciated in his own time. I would give anything to not be appreciated in my own time!Scenes(Rachel and Monica look at each other, and agree on something without saying anything.)ScenesMonica: Okay. Umm, Phoebe, you suck too.ScenesRachel: Yeah, Phoebe you’re… awful!ScenesPhoebe: You guys. You suck too. (She hugs them both.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is opening the door, but Chandler has the chain on it.]
rows.Content: Joey: Aww man! I can’t believe I locked myself out again! (He knocks on the door.)ScenesChandler: Hang on buddy! (He goes over and unlocks the door and opens it to reveal a fully furnished apartment.)ScenesJoey: (rushing in) Oh my God! What happened here? Did you do all this?ScenesChandler: I sure did.ScenesJoey: Why?ScenesChandler: Well, I just thought it’d make me feel good to do something nice for my friend.ScenesJoey: Well, you’re amazing.ScenesChandler: Oh no-no-no. This is amazing. (He goes over and presses a button on a remote control that opens the entertainment center doors revealing the TV.)ScenesJoey: (very excited) A TV as if it appears from nowhere! That’s the dream! Man, how did you afford this stuff?ScenesChandler: Well, y’know I’m 29. I mean who needs a savings account.ScenesJoey: Oh, you are the best friends anyone has ever had.ScenesChandler: Oh, I don’t know.ScenesJoey: Oh-no-no-no, you are! You do this, you give me the great advice, and hey listen, I was thinking about what you said yesterday about focusing on one woman, I’m gonna do that.ScenesChandler: You mean with Casey.ScenesJoey: No-no-no, I think I’m gonna see how things go with Kathy. She’s pretty cool.ScenesChandler: Or Casey.ScenesJoey: No-no, Kathy.ScenesChandler: Could be Casey.ScenesJoey: No. No, Kathy.ScenesChandler: Consider Casey.ScenesJoey: Y’know what I think? I think somebody’s got a little crush on Casey. How ‘bout I fix you two up? What do you think?ScenesChandler: That all the pieces of my life are falling right into place!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross has just finished playing.]
rows.Content: Ross: (to Phoebe) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! You were really great! You were really, really great!ScenesRoss: Oh, thanks, thanks. So Monica tells me that uh, you don’t want to play anymore because me and y'know my talent. Is that true?ScenesPhoebe: Well, kinda. Yeah. Yeah.ScenesRoss: Pheebs…ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I-I can’t—I mean y’know I was trying to be really y'know okay and upbeat about it, I just—I feel so dwarfed by your musical gift. I…ScenesRoss: See but, Pheebs that-that is the exact opposite intent of my music. Y’know my music is-is meant to inspire, and if it bothers you this much, then I… I won’t play anymore.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no. No-no-no, don’t do that! How could I live with myself if I knew I was depriving the world of your music.ScenesRoss: Yeah, okay.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel and Monica are sitting on the couch and Phoebe is getting coffee as Chandler enters. Ross is also there.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey Chandler! Saw the new furniture. Very nice.ScenesMonica: Yeah! Joey has the best boyfriend ever!ScenesChandler: I kissed Kathy.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesMonica: Are you serious?ScenesPhoebe: Does Joey know?ScenesChandler: No. Is there anyway, anyway you think he’ll understand this?ScenesMonica: You obviously haven’t screwed over a lot of your friends. (They all look at her) Which we all appreciate.ScenesRoss: No the-the sad thing is, if you had told him how you felt before you kissed her, knowing Joey, he probably just would’ve just stepped aside.ScenesChandler: Oh, don’t say that! Don’t say that. That’s not true. Is it?ScenesPhoebe: I think maybe, yeah.ScenesMonica: He loves you.ScenesChandler: Then why didn’t you tell me to do that?!!ScenesRoss: Well, I said-I said something to Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! No, that’s right. And I thought it was a really good idea.ScenesRachel: I know, I remember that!ScenesMonica: I remember you did.ScenesChandler: God!! (Sits down in disgust.) What am I gonna do?!ScenesRachel: Well, Chandler, you’re gonna have to tell him.ScenesChandler: Why?! Why do I have to tell him?!ScenesRachel: Because you do.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I know.ScenesRoss: Hey, would it be okay if I wrote a song about this.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching TV as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey! Samboucha Margarita?ScenesChandler: Is that a real thing?ScenesJoey: Well, we only had samboucha, so it is now.ScenesChandler: Listen ah, Joe, I-I need to, I need to talk to you about something.ScenesJoey: What’s up?ScenesChandler: It’s-it’s about Kathy. Umm, uh, I like her. I like her a lot actually.ScenesJoey: You do?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Well, you’re timing couldn’t be better. She’s not my girlfriend anymore.ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: Yeah, she broke up with me.ScenesChandler: Oh uh, when?ScenesJoey: Just now, after acting class. At first I thought she was doing some kind of scene, that’s why I let people watch.ScenesChandler: Oh man, I am so sorry. Are, are you okay?ScenesJoey: Well, I’ve been better. But, I’m all right. So you like her huh?ScenesChandler: Yes, but I-I uh, don’t have too.ScenesJoey: No-no-no, no it’s uh, it’s okay.ScenesChandler: Yeah?ScenesJoey: Yeah. You know why? ‘Cause you came to me first.ScenesChandler: Well, I thought that would be the best thing to do.ScenesJoey: But hey, listen just so you know, you might have you’re work cut out for you. ‘Cause when I talked to her, I kinda got the feeling that she’s into some other guy. So…ScenesChandler: See uh, that’s-that’s actually what I wanted to talk to you about. I-I think I know who the other guy is.ScenesJoey: Who?ScenesChandler: It’s me. I’m the other guy.ScenesJoey: What?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I mean when you were late last night, Kathy and I got to talking, and one thing to another and…ScenesJoey: And what?! Did you sleep with her?!ScenesChandler: No! No! No! I just kissed her.ScenesJoey: What?!! That’s even worse!!ScenesChandler: How is that worse?!ScenesJoey: I don’t know! But it’s the same!ScenesChandler: Look, I’m sorry! But there’s nothing I can do, I think I’m in love with her!ScenesJoey: Who cares?! You went behind my back! I would never do that to you!ScenesChandler: You’re right, I have no excuses! I was totally over the line.ScenesJoey: Over the line?! You-you’re-you’re so far past the line, that you-you can’t even see the line! The line is a dot to you!ScenesChandler: Yes. Yes! Right! And I feel horrible. You have to believe me!ScenesJoey: Is that why you bought all this stuff?! (Chandler makes a face like "Well, kinda.") Well, y’know what I will not watch your TV, I will not listen to your stereo, and there’s a cinnamon raisin loaf in the new bread maker that I’m not gonna eat! You know why?!ScenesChandler: Probably because…ScenesJoey: Because it’s all tainted with your betrayal. From now on this apartment is empty for me! And I’m not happy about you either. (The bread maker dings) Oh, and just so you know, I made that bread for you. (Joey walks into his bedroom and slams the door.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is playing his music. Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh my God, he’s lost it. He’s totally lost it.ScenesMonica: (removing ear plugs) What?ScenesRachel: Phoebe, his music could not get any worse. There are rats in the basement that are hanging themselves.Scenes(Ross finally finishes with the same crash, and gets some applause.)ScenesRoss: Thank you, thanks. (Sits down next to the girls) Yeah, I lost it. Y’know, I’m not gonna play anymore, (to Phoebe) would you, can you finish my set?ScenesPhoebe: After that? Yeah! No, I mean if I can help.Scenes(Phoebe gets up and goes to play, Ross goes over and sits down next to Monica and Rachel.)ScenesRoss: Yeah, like I could lose it.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: I played bad on purpose guys.Scenes(Both Monica and Rachel laugh.)ScenesMonica: Okay, so you were trying to play bad this whole time.ScenesRoss: Yeah—no, just that last song.ScenesEndScenesThe One With Chandler in a BoxScenesWritten by: Michael BorkowScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is sitting at the counter reading a magazine as the phone rings.]
rows.Content: Joey: (answering phone) Hello.ScenesChandler: (on phone) Hey, it’s me. I know you can’t stand to be in the same room as me, so I just thought I’d try and apologize over the phone. All I… (Joey hangs up the phone in disgust.)Scenes(Pause)Scenes(The phone rings again.)ScenesJoey: (answering phone) Hello.ScenesChandler: Look I never should have kissed your girlfriend, but I’m… (Joey hangs up the phone again.)Scenes(Pause)Scenes(The phone rings yet again.)ScenesJoey: (answering phone) Stop callin’!!ScenesVoice: (on phone) Hey! Hey! Hey! This is 92.3, WXRK, K-Rock for our $1,000 daily challenge.ScenesJoey: All right!ScenesVoice: What is the name of your roommate who is very, very sorry and would do anything… (Joey realizes it’s Chandler and hangs up the phone in anger.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, everyone but Joey and Chandler are there getting ready for Thanksgiving.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering) Aww, turkey! Aww, giving thanks! Aww!ScenesPhoebe: Look everyone, it’s the spirit of Thanksgiving!ScenesRachel: So are things with you and Joey any better?ScenesChandler: They couldn’t be worse. I spent eight hours calling him last night, just trying to get him to talk to me.ScenesRachel: Oh wow, eight hours? So you could probably really use one of those plug-in telephone headsets huh?ScenesRoss: Should we all expect Christmas gifts that can be stolen from your office?ScenesRachel: You shouldn’t.ScenesPhoebe: Speaking of Christmas, umm since Monica and I are starting a new business and have like no money, umm, this year maybe we could do secret Santa, and then we each only buy one gift. And-and there’s the added mystery of who gets who.ScenesRoss: Who gets whom. (They all look at him.) I don’t know why I do that.Scenes[Cut to later, the gang, minus Joey, is watching the Thanksgiving Day parade.]ScenesRachel: Well, I’m gonna take a nap, turkey makes me sleepy.ScenesMonica: We haven’t eaten yet!ScenesRachel: I know, but all that work you’re doing to get it ready, I just… (goes into her bedroom.)ScenesChandler: Hey, by any chance did either of pick uh Rachel for your secret Santa, ‘cause I wanna trade for her.ScenesPhoebe: I picked her! Oh thank God you want her! Ooh!ScenesChandler: Wow! Why do you want to get rid of her so badly?ScenesPhoebe: Because she exchanges every gift she ever gets, it’s like impossible to get her something she likes. Come on, let’s trade!ScenesChandler: Oh that’s not true! That’s not true! I got her that backpack and she loved it! I remember how much she was crying the day when that big dog ran off with it… (notices the look on Monica and Phoebe’s faces.) Oh, there was no big dog. All right this sucks! I already got her this briefcase, and I had R.G. put on it… (Phoebe looks confused.) Her initials…ScenesPhoebe: Ohh.ScenesMonica: Well, maybe you could give to somebody else. Ooh, like Ross Geller.ScenesChandler: Op, y'know what though, it’s kind’ve a girlie briefcase.ScenesMonica: Who cares? He works in a museum!ScenesChandler: Hey, what time is it? The big game is about to start!ScenesPhoebe: You don’t have to do that, Ross and Joey aren’t here, you can watch the parade if you want.ScenesChandler: Thanks.ScenesMonica: What is wrong with this freezer?! (She jabs her arm into the freezer and a piece of ice flies into her eye.) Ow! Ow!!ScenesPhoebe: God, what happened?!ScenesMonica: Oh my God, ice just got in my eye!ScenesRachel: (standing in her doorway) People are trying to sleep in here!ScenesChandler: Monica got ice in her eye, and it hurts.ScenesPhoebe: Open it up, let me see.ScenesMonica: Oh, y’know what, I can’t, it really kills.ScenesChandler: Well maybe you should put some ice on it.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, God it looks bad.ScenesRachel: Honey, maybe we should take you to a doctor.ScenesMonica: No, my eye doctor is Richard! I can’t go to him when I don’t have a boyfriend!ScenesChandler: He’s really picky about his patients.ScenesPhoebe: Honey, you’ve got to go. What’s his office number?ScenesMonica: Like I remember his office number! (Pause) Speed dial 7.ScenesPhoebe: (on phone) Hi! Yeah, I’m calling on behalf of Monica Geller’s eye, and is um, is Richard Burke in today. (Listens) (to Monica) He’s out of town, but does she want to see the on-call doctor?ScenesMonica: Yes!!ScenesPhoebe: Yes! She’s very excited about that.Scenes[Cut to later, Phoebe is adding butter to something and Ross is watching.]ScenesPhoebe: This is so cool, ‘til Monica gets back, it’s like I’m head chef and I get to make all the decisions. (She looks at the remaining butter, and then decides to add it to the dish.)ScenesRoss: Hey-hey, I thought she told you to follow the recipe exactly!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, get out of my kitchen!ScenesChandler: (entering) All right! Okay! I think I am making some progress with Joey, when I went into the apartment he went straight into his bedroom but he only slammed the door once! (Ross is pleased.) I mean yeah, he gave me the finger while doing it.ScenesPhoebe: All right I… I gotta call my mom and ask her a left handed cooking question.ScenesRoss: So listen ah, I picked Monica for secret Santa, but I’m already getting her something for Chanukah, I was wondering if you wanna switch.ScenesChandler: Oh y’know what, I was already trying to trade for ah, well, you.ScenesRoss: Really?! Wow! That’s-that’s so nice, what are you gonna get me?ScenesChandler: I don’t know R.G., I was thinking something girlie for your office.ScenesRoss: Yeah, well maybe Phoebe will switch with me.ScenesChandler: Oh no-no-no, you don’t want to do that, then you’re gonna get stuck with Rachel and she exchanges every gift she ever gets.ScenesRoss: Oh, that’s not true! I’ve got her lots of stuff she never took back.ScenesChandler: Like?ScenesRoss: Like uh, that gold necklace I got her last year.ScenesChandler: When was the last time you saw her wear it?ScenesRoss: Well, she wore it all Christmas day, and then uh…ScenesChandler: Big dog?

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is repacking the furniture into boxes to return it.]
rows.Content: Ross: (entering) Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesRoss: What are you doing?ScenesJoey: I’m sending back all this stuff that Chandler bought out of guilt.ScenesRoss: Everything? Even the TV?ScenesJoey: No! I’m putting that in my room.ScenesRoss: Listen, Joey, I know what he did was wrong but don’t you think you could at least hear the guy out?ScenesJoey: Back when you and Rachel were together, if Chandler had kissed her, would you hear him out?ScenesRoss: That’s a good point. So uh, how long are you gonna punish him?ScenesJoey: Five years.ScenesRoss: You’ve sentenced him?!ScenesJoey: Hey! Don’t do the crime if you can’t do the time.ScenesRoss: Joey, the guy’s your best friend.ScenesJoey: No, was my best friend. Anyway, I don’t know why you’re pushing for him so hard. With him out of the way as my best friend, there’s a spot open.ScenesRoss: Oh, who? Me?ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesRoss: Wow! I’m honored! And y’know what I’m gonna do as my first act as your best friend?ScenesJoey: What?ScenesRoss: I’m gonna get you to talk to Chandler.ScenesJoey: All right. But if you weren’t my best friend.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Kathy are sitting at a table and talking about Joey.]
rows.Content: Kathy: Oh my God, is it really that bad?ScenesChandler: I walk into a room and he won’t even talk to me, he just mumbles something in Italian. And I know he only knows the bad words.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey Gunther, have you uh, have you seen Chandler?ScenesGunther: I thought you were Chandler. But umm, one of who is over there.Scenes(Joey turns around and sees them kissing.)ScenesKathy: Oh.ScenesChandler: Hey Joe.ScenesJoey: (Something in Italian.) (Storms out.)

rows.Scenes: Dr. Burke’s office, Rachel and Monica are waiting as the doctor arrives.]
rows.Content: Doctor: I’ll be right with you. Okay? (to the nurse) Thanks, Wendy.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! How cute is the on-call doctor?ScenesRachel: Ooh, so cute, that I’m thinking about jamming this pen in my eye.Scenes(The intercom buzzes.)ScenesNurse: Dr. Burke will see you know.ScenesMonica: Oh no-no-no, not Dr. Burke. Dr. Burke is out of town. The-the on-call doctor will see me now.ScenesNurse: Dr. Richard Burke is out of town. Dr. Timothy Burke, his son, will see you now.ScenesDr. Timothy Burke: Ready?Scenes(Monica looks at Rachel, who gives her the thumbs up.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is packing as Chandler rushes in.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey! I’m sorry! That—(sees that Joey is about to leave) where are you going?ScenesJoey: My folks.ScenesChandler: Oh, uh, when-when are you coming back?ScenesJoey: I don’t know. I might stay there for a few days while I look for an apartment.ScenesChandler: What?!ScenesJoey: Yeah, y’know at first I thought we could talk about this y’know, work it out, but uh, seeing you two together I don’t think I…ScenesChandler: Hey, look, what do you want me to say? Do you want me to say that I’ll stop seeing her?ScenesJoey: Look, it’s not about her. Okay? But seeing you two together just reminds me of what you did. And I don’t want to live with some one who doesn’t know what it is to be a friend. So, I’ll see ya. (He starts to leave, but Chandler grabs his bag and stops him.)ScenesChandler: Hey, look, I know what it is to be a friend, I just-I just screwed up!ScenesJoey: Yeah! You did! And that’s why I’m leaving.Scenes(The chick and the duck walk into the living room.)ScenesChandler: All right look, if you’re not gonna stay for me, then at least stay for them! Okay, they have had a very difficult year! What with the robbery and all!ScenesJoey: When that guy was robbing us, and I was locked in the entertainment unit for like six hours, you know what I was doing in there all that time? I was thinking about how I let you down!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: Yeah! But if would’ve know what kind of friend you were gonna turn out to be, I wouldn’t have worried about it so much! See you around!ScenesChandler: All right, wait! Come on! Just wait one second! There has to be something that I can do! Something! If we still had that entertainment unit I would get in it for six hours and think about how I let you down. (Joey looks intrigued) What?ScenesJoey: We’ve got a box. (Motions to a large wooden box next to him.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Dr. Burke’s office, Tim is examining Monica.]
rows.Content: Tim: Last time I saw you, it was the morning I left for college. And you were just standing outside The Dairy Queen.ScenesMonica: I was probably waiting for it to open.ScenesTim: I gotta tell you, you look great now.ScenesMonica: You look great too.ScenesTim: You’re an excellent patient!ScenesMonica: So how does it look?ScenesTim: Well, you’ve got a little scratch on your cornea, your gonna have to wear a patch for a couple of days.ScenesMonica: Like a pirate?!ScenesTim: If that helps you.ScenesMonica: Umm, so how long have you been working with your dad? (He looks at her) Come on, one of us had to mention him.ScenesTim: I moved back here a couple of months ago.ScenesMonica: Oh. Big family dinner tonight?ScenesTim: Uh. (He holds up a brown lunch bag.)ScenesMonica: No way!ScenesTim: I was gonna have Thanksgiving at my girlfriend’s.ScenesMonica: (disappointed) Oh.ScenesTim: But we broke up.ScenesMonica: (happy) Oh.ScenesTim: She-she wasn’t ready for a serious commitment.ScenesMonica: (sympathetic) Oh. (in a pirate’s voice) So you made her walk the plank? Aye, matie?ScenesTim: You’re not wearing the patch yet.ScenesMonica: I know.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, It’s closer to dinner. Monica has just told everyone that Tim is coming to dinner.]
rows.Content: Ross: He’s coming here for Thanksgiving!ScenesRachel: I know, it’s sick.ScenesMonica: Why is it sick?ScenesRachel: Because it’s Richard’s son! It’s like inviting Greek tragedy over for dinner!ScenesMonica: Hey, come on, Phoebe, you understand don’t you?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I can see where I’d be your best shot but, no. I’m sorry, but I think it’s twisted.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesJoey: (coming out of the bathroom) What’s twisted?ScenesMonica: Me going out with Richard’s son.ScenesJoey: Ewwwww!! Ew! Ew! Ew!ScenesChandler: (He is now in the box, in their living room.) Sounds like a really bad idea to me.ScenesRachel: Is he okay in there?ScenesJoey: He’s fine!ScenesRoss: Hey, y'know, Mon, if things wrong out between you and Richard’s son, you’d be able to tell your kids, that you slept with their grandfather.ScenesMonica: Fine! Judge all you want to but, (points to Ross) married a lesbian, (points to Rachel) left a man at the altar, (points to Phoebe) fell in love with a gay ice dancer, (points to Joey) threw a girl’s wooden leg in a fire, (points to Chandler) livin’ in a box!! (goes to her room)ScenesRachel: So now, what exactly is the point of the box?ScenesJoey: Chandler?ScenesChandler: The meaning of the box is three fold. One (holds a finger up through the air hole), it gives me the time to think about what I did. Two (holds up another finger), it proves how much I care about my friendship with Joey. And three (holds up a third finger), it hurts!ScenesRoss: (to Rachel) Oh hey! Hey uh, you remember the necklace I gave you last year? Can I see it?ScenesRachel: (worried) Why?ScenesRoss: I just wanna check something.ScenesRachel: Okay. (She goes into her bedroom)ScenesRoss: (He puts his hand over the hole on the box.) (to Chandler) Now, we’ll see.ScenesChandler: Air hole! Air hole!! (Ross retracts his hand quickly.)ScenesRachel: (coming out of her bedroom with a necklace) Here it is! I love it. I wear it all the time.ScenesRoss: (grabbing the necklace) The necklace I got you was gold, this one is silver.ScenesRachel: Huh, well maybe it uh, it changed.ScenesRoss: Oh my God! You actually exchanged it!ScenesRachel: Well isn’t it better that I exchanged it for something that I enjoy and that I can get a lot of use out of?ScenesRoss: What did you get?ScenesRachel: Credit.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door.)ScenesMonica: (running in from her bedroom) I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! (opens the door) Hi, Tim.ScenesTim: Hi. (gives her a bottle of wine)ScenesMonica: Thank you. Come meet my friends. This is uh, Phoebe.ScenesTim: Hi, nice to meet you.ScenesMonica: And Joey.ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesTim: Hi, Joey.ScenesMonica: My brother, Ross.ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesMonica: And Rachel. (Chandler clears his voice loudly) And that’s Chandler.ScenesChandler: How do ya do.ScenesTim: What’s…ScenesMonica: Umm, well, he’s…ScenesJoey: He’s doin’ some thinkin’!Scenes[cut to later, Joey, Rachel, Ross, and Tim are watching the football game, and they all cheer loudly.]ScenesChandler: What happened? What happened?!ScenesJoey: You kissed my girlfriend!Scenes(A commercial for sunglasses comes on.)ScenesRachel: Ooh, I like those sunglasses.ScenesRoss: Like ‘em, like ‘em? Or, I’d like to get store credit for that amount like ‘em?ScenesRachel: (Swears in Italian, it’s the same term used by Joey earlier and Joey nods his approval.)ScenesMonica: All right everybody, this turkey is ready!ScenesTim: Where can I wash up?ScenesMonica: Here, let me show you. Okay, the towels are hanging next to the sink, and umm, you can use the fancy soap.ScenesTim: Thank you.ScenesRachel: Fancy soap? I thought we were savin’ that for the Pope!ScenesMonica: See he’s nice. Right?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but Monica, do you actually want to be in a relationship where you can actually use the phrase, "That’s not how your dad used to do it.ScenesTim: Wow! Everything looks great! Where should I sit?ScenesMonica: I saved you a seat. (Motions to the one next to her.)ScenesRachel: (pouring the wine) Sick-sick-sick-sick.Scenes(There’s a loud knocking.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I’ll get it. (goes over to the door.)ScenesChandler: Gotcha! (laughs)ScenesJoey: That doesn’t sound like thinking to me!ScenesChandler: Sorry!ScenesJoey: Y’know I don’t think you should be talking at all in there! I think you’ve got to much thinking to do to be talking and making jokes!ScenesChandler: Okay, okay, you got it!ScenesRachel: Ross, can you pass me the yams?ScenesRoss: Sure! Oh, and Joey’s got the mashed potatoes if you want to exchange them.ScenesRachel: Would you stop?! What is the matter with you?!ScenesMonica: Oh-ho-ho, we’ve got company.ScenesRoss: There’s nothing the matter with me. See, I’m not completely devoid of sentiment, see I have feelings.ScenesRachel: Okay, fine. (She gets up and walks into her bedroom)Scenes(an awkward silence follows)ScenesChandler: You can’t tell, but I’m trying to break the tension by mooning you guys!ScenesJoey: All right, look! If this is just a big joke to you, then forget about it, all right?! This means something to me! And if it doesn’t mean anything to you, then you should get out of there, otherwise you’re just an idiot in a box!ScenesChandler: You’re right, and I’m sorry! This means a lot to me! I want you to be my friend again! I swear, I won’t say another word tonight.ScenesJoey: So are you gonna start taking this thing seriously?ScenesChandler: Absolutely!ScenesJoey: That sounds like another word to me! Are you gonna take this seriously? (There’s no response from Chandler.) Okay.Scenes(Rachel comes back carrying a shoe box.)ScenesRachel: Don’t say that I have no sentiment! (Starts to show Ross what’s in the box.) This is a movie stub from our first date! This is an eggshell from the first time you made me breakfast in bed! (Holds up a bone) This is from the museum from the first time we… were together. Okay, maybe I exchange gifts sometimes, but I keep the things that matter!ScenesRoss: I don’t know what to say, I’m sorry. Though, you’re not supposed to take these. (Points to the bone) It’s like a million years old, we, we actually, we had people looking for that.Scenes(Rachel glares at him.)Scenes[Cut to the balcony with Monica and Tim.]ScenesMonica: (putting off her coat) Ooh, this always happens. (Her coat gets stuck.)ScenesTim: Here, let me help. (Does so.)ScenesMonica: Thank you.ScenesTim: You-you have a very beautiful… eye.ScenesMonica: Y’know all my friends think this is weird.ScenesTim: Y’know I-I thought it was gonna be weird, I mean I almost called and canceled, but it really isn’t.ScenesMonica: I know! I mean it’s like me and your dad, that’s a totally separate thing.ScenesTim: Oh, I totally agree.ScenesMonica: We’re just two people who find each other very attractive. Right?Scenes(Tim leans in to kiss her. They stop, and when he tries to kiss her again, Monica pulls away.)ScenesTim: What?ScenesMonica: Nothing. Nothing.ScenesTim: No-no really, was-was that not okay?ScenesMonica: No-no-no that was good, it was, that was uh, that was a goood kiss…ScenesTim: Oh my God! It didn’t remind you of…ScenesMonica: (interrupting) Don’t say it!ScenesTim: No, but it did! Didn’t it?!ScenesMonica: Yeah!ScenesTim: Oh man!!ScenesMonica: I know!Scenes(They both shiver in horror.)Scenes[cut to later, Tim has left. Monica is still shivering. There’s a knock on the door.]ScenesJoey: I’ll get it. (It’s Kathy.)ScenesKathy: (sees it’s Joey) Oh.ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesKathy: Hey. Listen, I want you to know how sorry I am…ScenesJoey: That’s okay. Chandler’s the one I’m mad at.ScenesKathy: Well, I’m still sorry. Is he here?ScenesJoey: In the box.ScenesKathy: (going over to the box) Chandler?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, he-he can’t talk right now.ScenesKathy: Why not? What’s going on?ScenesPhoebe: He’s just trying to show Joey how much he means to him.ScenesKathy: By being in a box?ScenesRachel: Joey, had reasons.ScenesPhoebe: They were threefold.ScenesKathy: Oh. Well uh, (to Chandler) you not being able to talk may make this easier. Listen umm… (She looks at the gang who are watching, they take the hint and leave them alone.) Listen I don’t wanna be someone who comes between two best friends. I just, I can’t stand seeing what this is doing to you guys, and I don’t wanna be the cause of that. So, I don’t think we can see each other anymore. I’m gonna go to my mom’s in Chicago, I’m gonna stay there for awhile. I think this could’ve be something really amazing, but y’know this is probably for the best. Y’know? I’m gonna miss you. Good-bye, Chandler.Scenes(She gets up and leaves, Chandler waves good-bye with one finger extended through the air hole. Ross glares at Joey.)ScenesJoey: (starting to cry) Open the box!! (Runs over to do so.)ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesJoey: He can still catch her! Come on, get out of there! (He opens the box) Get out of there!ScenesChandler: So?ScenesJoey: Yeah, we’re gonna be fine! Get out!ScenesChandler: Yeah?ScenesJoey: Yeah, you did some real good thinkin’ in there.ScenesChandler: Man, this is…Scenes(Joey says something unintelligible and they hug.)ScenesJoey: Now go! ‘Cause you can still catch her! And Merry Christmas from you’re secret Santa! (Chandler runs out and closes the door.)Scenes(After he’s gone.)ScenesJoey: All right, who got Chandler? ‘Cause I uh, need to trade.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's Balcony, the gang is all there watching Chandler.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh, he sees her!ScenesMonica: Oh, he’s catching up to her!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, she sees him! Oh, they’re hugging!ScenesRoss: He’s taking her purse!ScenesJoey: Uhh, that’s not them. I’m gonna go call the police.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, there they are!Scenes(They watch them making up and sigh)ScenesPhoebe: All right, get a room.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Girl From PoughkeepsieScenesWritten by: Scott SilveriScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Chandler, and Phoebe are there as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesChandler, Joey, and Phoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: I’m sorry I’m late, did I miss anything?ScenesPhoebe: Joey stuffing 15 Oreos in his mouth. (Joey, with an obvious mouth full, nods yes.)ScenesRoss: 15? (Joey nods again) Your personal best! (Ross takes an Oreo and Joey mumbles, no!)ScenesPhoebe: Where were you?ScenesRoss: Oh, on a date. Yeah, I met this girl on the train going to a museum upstate.Scenes(simultaneously)ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah! How did you meet her?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, which museum?ScenesPhoebe: (just Phoebe) No, answer his.ScenesRoss: Okay, it was just me and her at the back of the train, and I sat near the door, so she’d have to pass by me if she wanted to switch cars. She was totally at my mercy.ScenesChandler: Were you so late because you were burring this woman?ScenesRoss: No, I’m getting back down ‘cause she lives in Poughkeepsie. She seems really great, but she’s like totally great, but she lives two and a half hours away.ScenesChandler: How can she be great if she’s from Poughkeepsie?
