(laughs, at they all look at him) That joke would’ve killed in Albany.ScenesJoey: Done! I did it! Heh, who’s stupid now? (He smiles and has cookie remains all over his teeth.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe are there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey, look at this! (Holding a newspaper) They’re lighting the big Christmas tree tonight.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, that paper’s two weeks old.ScenesChandler: All right, who keeps leaving old newspapers in the trash?! I really wanted to take Kathy to this, I can’t believe I missed it.ScenesRachel: Hey, y’know, at least you have somebody to miss that stuff with! I hate being alone this time of year! Next thing you know it’ll be Valentine’s Day, then my birthday, then bang!—before you know it, they’re lighting that damn tree again. Ohh, I want somebody! (hearing this, Gunther moves in) Y’know, I want a man!! (Gunther leaves depressed) I mean, it doesn’t even have to be a big relationship, y’know, just like a fling would be great.ScenesChandler: Really?! I didn’t think girls ever just wanted a fling.ScenesRachel: Well, believe me, it’s been a long time since I’ve been flung.ScenesJoey: Well, I know what I’m giving you for Christmas.ScenesChandler: Y’know what? There’s some nice guys at my office, do you want me to set you up?ScenesRachel: Yeah! Wait a minute, it’s been a long time that I’ve been single. How come you never offered this before?ScenesChandler: Well, I have a girlfriend, I’m-I’m happy. So, I no longer feel the need to go out of my way to stop others from being happy.ScenesRachel: Okay! No accountants. Oh, and no one from like legal. I don’t like guys with boring jobs.ScenesChandler: Oh and Ross was like what? A lion tamer?Scenes(Monica enters)ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: What’s wrong Mon?ScenesMonica: Ohh, everybody at the restaurant still hates me.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesMonica: I thought I was making headway, everyone was smiling at me all day, I get off work and I find out that they wrote this (puts on her chef hat) on my chef’s hat. (The hat says ‘Quit, bitch’)ScenesPhoebe: Hey, maybe they meant to write, ‘Quiet, bitch.’ScenesRachel: Hey, honey! What’s the matter? (Monica shows her, her hat.) Fine, I was just trying to be nice! Whoa!ScenesMonica: I mean I have not been picked on this much since kindergarten and they had to bring in someone from junior high to do the see-saw with me. (Joey laughs and Monica glares at him.)ScenesJoey: Ohhh!ScenesMonica: I mean they’re trying to do everything they can to make me quit, and if there were any other job, I would. But this is something I’ve been waiting for my whole life.ScenesRachel: Well, wait a minute, you’re the boss! Why don’t you just yell at them? Or, fire them?ScenesMonica: I would love too, but I can’t! I mean I just can’t, you know that I’m not good at confrontation.ScenesChandler: Hey, you know what you can do? I remember reading about this director, I think it was Orson Wells, who at the beginning of the movie would hire somebody, just so he could fire them in front of everybody. Then they would all know, who’s boss.ScenesJoey: Hey, Mon! I’m not doing anything, why don’t you fire me?ScenesMonica: That’s a good idea! Wait, do you know how to waiter?ScenesJoey: Good enough to get fired.ScenesMonica: All right, you’re hired!ScenesJoey: Hey! That must be why I got fired last week! Does this Orson Wells guy direct Burger King commercials?ScenesChandler: (he glares at him for a while) Yes.

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s office, he is trying to find Rachel a date.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I say, Drew! Are you seeing anybody right now? (Drew looks at him) Og-ee-op, I’m not asking for me, I’m… I mean… No, I’m-I’m not gay, I’m not asking you out. I’m not-I’m not-I’m not gay!ScenesDrew: I didn’t think you were gay. I do now.ScenesChandler: See my friend-my friend, Rachel, she wants to be set up.ScenesDrew: Ahh, I just got out of a big relationship, I’m not looking for any thing serious.ScenesChandler: Oh, y’know what, that might be okay even if it was just kind of a fling, that might be all right with Rachel.ScenesMike: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! Is this, hot Rachel, that you took to the Christmas party, Rachel?ScenesChandler: (to Drew) Oh, by the way, that is her full name.ScenesMike: Oh wow! I’m free for her!ScenesDrew: Oh, wait a second! I didn’t say I wasn’t free!ScenesMike: Hey, Chandler, why don’t we talk this over at the Ranger game tomorrow?ScenesDrew: Hold on, y’know I just got a box of Cubans, maybe I bring them by your office around uh, five?ScenesChandler: Oh well, that’s uh, a little later than I uh, generally care to stay, but sure!ScenesMike: Maybe, before the game we could enjoy some eight year old some small batch Basel Hadens.ScenesChandler: Well, I don’t really know what that is, but let’s!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is working on a new song.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey! You guys, I’m writing a holiday song for everyone. Do you want to hear it?ScenesMonica, Rachel, and Joey: Yes!ScenesPhoebe: (singing) Happy Chanukah, Monica! May your Christmas be snowy, Joey! Happy New Year, Chandler and Ross. Spin the draddle, Rachel!ScenesRachel: Pheebs, that’s great!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yay!ScenesRachel: But y’know umm, Rachel doesn’t rhyme with draddle.ScenesPhoebe: I know but it’s so hard! Nothing rhymes with your stupid name!ScenesJoey: What are you talking about? Lots of things rhyme with Rachel. Bagel. Mail. Jail. Bail. Able. May-pole.ScenesPhoebe: All good, thanks. (to Rachel) Do you maybe have a nickname have like a nickname that’s easier to rhyme?ScenesMonica: Didn’t your dad used to call you Pumpkin?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah!ScenesPhoebe: Pumpkin? Yeah. But did he ever call you like, Budolph?ScenesChandler: (entering) Hello, children!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesChandler: (to Rachel) Have I got the 50 guys for you!ScenesRachel: Really?!ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, I just showed this a picture of you and guys were throwing themselves at me! They’re buying me drinks! They’re giving me stuff! (to Joey) Knicks tonight?ScenesJoey: Sure! Where are the seats?ScenesChandler: Wherever! I’ve got like 20!ScenesRachel: So, will I like any of these guys?ScenesChandler: Y’know what, I’m gonna uh, play the field just a little more.ScenesRachel: Chandler!ScenesChandler: Guys are signing over their 401-K’s to me?ScenesPhoebe: (shocked) You work with robots!!ScenesChandler: (pause) Yes. (to Rachel) Okay, there’s this one guy, Patrick, I think you’re gonna like him, he’s really nice, he’s funny, he’s a swimmer.ScenesRachel: Ohh, I like swimmer’s bodies!ScenesChandler: Yes, and his father invented that magnetic strip on the back of credit cards.ScenesRachel: Op, I like credit cards!ScenesChandler: See, I’m not bad at this fixing up thing, huh?ScenesRachel: Well, so what does he do?ScenesChandler: Oh, he works in the Fine Foods division.ScenesRachel: Your company has a fine foods division?ScenesChandler: It’s a big company, I don’t—if you—I…ScenesJoey: Now, wait a second! You make food and robots?ScenesPhoebe: No! No, the robots just work for them.ScenesMonica: (getting up) All right, I’m gonna go to work. Does anybody have a problem with that?ScenesJoey: Yeah, lady, I do! I got a problem with that!ScenesMonica: You want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!ScenesJoey: Oh, what are you gonna do? You’re gonna fire me?ScenesMonica: You bet your ass, I’m gonna fire you! Thank you.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross, Phoebe, and Chandler are there.]
rows.Content: Ross: Oh, wow! I should get going. I-I got a date tonight.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah! With who?ScenesRoss: You know that girl I told you about who lives up in Poughkeepsie?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Not her. Yeah, this is someone else I meet, and I-I can’t decide between the two of them. Y’know the one from Poughkeepsie, even though she’s a two hour train ride away, is really pretty, really smart, and-and a lot of fun. But this other girl, well, she lives right uptown. Y’know she’s, well she’s-she’s just as pretty, I guess she’s smart, she’s not fun.ScenesPhoebe: If she’s no fun, why do you want to date her at all?ScenesRoss: Well, I-I want to give her another chance, y’know? She lives so close. And, at the end of the date, the other time, she-she said something that was—if she was kidding was very funny. On the other hand, if she wasn’t kidding, she’s not fun, she’s stupid, and kind of a racist.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey, man!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Ooh, how was your first day working at the restaurant?ScenesJoey: (checks his watch) Damn! (runs out to work)

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Monica is cooking.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering from the dining room) Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey, what happened to your fancy chef’s jacket? (sees there’s a burn spot on it)ScenesMonica: They baked it. I can’t take this anymore. I’m gonna call a meeting tonight, I’m gonna fire you tonight.ScenesJoey: You got it! Oh-oh! (He starts patting the burned spot, which just happens to be over her breast.)ScenesMonica: What are you doing?!ScenesJoey: It’s still a tiny bit on fire there.ScenesMonica: Thanks. (Joey’s still patting the burn spot) I think you got it!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is there.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (entering) Chandler!! You have the best taste in men!ScenesChandler: Well, like father, like son.ScenesRachel: Patrick and I had such a great time last night! I mean I think this could maybe turn into something serious.ScenesChandler: Really?! I-I thought you weren’t looking for something serious? I thought you were looking for some kind of a fling.ScenesRachel: Well, y'know, possibly. (pause) You didn’t tell him that, though? Right?ScenesChandler: Ummmmmmmm, no.ScenesRachel: You told this guy that I was looking for a fling?! You don’t tell the guy that!ScenesChandler: Why not?! I’d be thrilled if I heard that some hot girl was just looking to get—oh I see.ScenesRachel: Oh, between you telling him that I wanted to have a fling and me putting out on the first date—oh, he’s so gonna get the wrong idea.

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Joey is eating some cheese.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey, Joey, could you pass the cheese?ScenesJoey: Yeah. Listen uh, I’d prefer it if you didn’t call me Joey. Since I don’t know anyone here, I thought it’d be cool to try out a cool work nickname.ScenesA Waiter: (entering) Hey, dragon! Here’s your tips from Monday and Tuesday. (hands him two envelopes)ScenesJoey: (opening an envelope) There’s like-there’s like 300 bucks in this one!ScenesThe Waiter: Yeah, people get pretty generous around the holidays. And it never hurts to wear tight trousers.ScenesMonica: Okay. Could the waiters gather around to hear tonight’s specials? Okay, first there is a Chilean Sea Bass prepared with a Mango relish on a bag—Why is nobody writing these down?ScenesThe Waiter: Because we can remember them.ScenesMonica: Because your all gonna make up fake specials and make me cook them like you did the other night?ScenesThe Waiter: Well, sure, that too.ScenesMonica: Okay, forget the specials for a minute. Umm, all right here’s the thing, for the last two weeks I have umm, (quietly) tried really hard to create a positive atmosphere…ScenesThe Waiter: Can’t hear you!ScenesMonica: (louder) A positive atmosphere! But I-I-I have had it up to here. (She holds her hand over her head as an afterthought.) From now on, it is gonna be my way, or the highway! All right? Does anybody have a problem with that?!! (Joey looks at the money he’s holding, and doesn’t speak up.) Hey new guy! I said, does anybody have a problem with that?!ScenesJoey: No ma’am.ScenesThe Waiter: Hey! He has a name, it’s Dragon. Do you wanna know your name? Check your hat. (to another waiter) We did the hat right? (The other waiter nods yes.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, continued from earlier. The other waiters are gone and Monica is confronting Joey about his not speaking up.]
rows.Content: Monica: What the hell happened?!ScenesJoey: I am so-so-so sorry. I was gonna do it! Really! But I was standing there with 327 dollars in one hand and 238 dollars in the other hand, and I was thinking, "Wow! It’s been a long time since I had… (tries to do the math in his head, but can’t) 327 + 238 dollars!ScenesMonica: Joey, we had a deal. That-that’s why you’re here! I’ve got to fire you!ScenesJoey: And I gotta pay rent! Look, how-how about this? You don’t fire me, instead I stay here, I gain their trust, and they’ll start listening to all the nice things I’ve been saying about you.ScenesMonica: What kinda things have you been saying?ScenesJoey: Well nothing yet, they really hate you and I want to fit in.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is working on her holiday song, Chandler is sitting on the couch reading a magazine, and Ross is sleeping on the couch.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) Happy, happy Chanukah, Chandler and Monica. Very merry…ScenesChandler: (interrupting) Oh, y’know, y’know what Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesChandler: I’m not Jewish, so…ScenesPhoebe: So! Ross doesn’t really decorate his tree with floss, but you don’t hear him complaining do you? God! (Phoebe hits her guitar which wakes up Ross with a start.)ScenesChandler: Bad dream?ScenesRoss: I wasn’t sleeping.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, then uh, what was Phoebe’s song about?ScenesRoss: The one with the cat. I gotta go, I’ve got another date.ScenesPhoebe: So, did you pick one yet?ScenesRoss: No, it turns out that the one from uptown was making a joke. But it was a different joke than I thought—it wasn’t that funny. So I’m still torn.ScenesPhoebe: Well look, you don’t really like the one from uptown and you’re too exhausted from dating the one up in Poughkeepsie, so I say you just end them both. Okay? You take a train up to Poughkeepsie and break up with her, and on your way back you break up with uptown. And then by the time you get home tonight, you’re done!ScenesRoss: Y’know, you’re right. Thank you.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, well I had a similar problem when I lived in Prague.ScenesChandler: Prague?ScenesPhoebe: There’s sooo much you don’t know.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is playing living room golf as Rachel enters. Rachel sees this and holds the door open until Chandler is ready to start his swing, when he is, she slams the door shut which causes the club to fly from his hands. He turns around, shocked.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Chandler! Patrick just uh, ended things with me. Did you or did you not tell him that I was looking for a serious relationship?ScenesChandler: I did! I absolutely did!ScenesRachel: You idiot!!ScenesChandler: I’m sure you’re right, but why?ScenesRachel: You don’t tell a guy that you’re looking for a serious relationship! You don’t tell the guy that! Now you scared him away!ScenesChandler: Oh, man. I’m sorry, I’m so-so sorry.ScenesRachel: Y’know, you should never be allowed to talk to people!ScenesChandler: I know! I know!ScenesRachel: Oh! See just I’m right back where I started! Aww, this sucks! Being alone, sucks! (She sits down heavily in one of the new chairs)ScenesChandler: Well, y’know, you’re-you’re gonna meet somebody! You’re a great catch! Y’know when I was telling all those guys about you, I didn’t have to lie once. (He sits down on the arm of her chair)ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesChandler: Yeah! You graduated Magma Ku Laude, right?ScenesRachel: No.ScenesChandler: Oh, it doesn’t matter. (Kisses her on the top of her head.) Hey, y’know what, I’ve got two tickets to tonight’s Rangers game, you wanna come with me?ScenesRachel: Cute guys in little shorts? Sure.ScenesChandler: Well, actually it’s a hockey team, so it’s angry Canadians with no teeth.ScenesRachel: Well that sounds fun too. (They hug.)Scenes(pause)ScenesChandler: Have you ever been with a woman?ScenesRachel: What?! Chandler, what is the matter with you?!ScenesChandler: So there is no good time to ask that question.

rows.Scenes: A train to Poughkeepsie, Ross is asleep against the window.]
rows.Content: The Conductor: The next station is Poughkeepsie. Poughkeepsie!ScenesThe Woman From Poughkeepsie: (outside Ross’s window) Ross? Ross! (she knocks on the window) Wake up! Ross! (the train starts moving) Ross! Ross!! Ross!!! Ross!!!!

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Monica is cooking.]
rows.Content: Monica: I need more swordfish. (to one of the assistant chefs) Can you get me some more swordfish?ScenesKitchen Worker: I don’t speak English.ScenesMonica: You did a minute ago!ScenesKitchen Worker: Well, I don’t know what to tell ya!ScenesMonica: Fine!Scenes(She goes into the freezer to get it herself, and leaves the door open. The waiter from earlier comes by and closes the door.)ScenesMonica: Okay! Very funny! Somebody let me out please?! Come on, I’m cold! (She spills something.) And covered in marinara sauce! Come on! Let me out! (the door opens)ScenesThe Waiter: You found that handle, did ya?ScenesMonica: That’s not funny.ScenesThe Waiter: Well that’s not true.ScenesMonica: (starting to cry) I’m a good person. And I’m a good chef, and I don’t deserve to have marinara sauce all over me! Y’know what, if you want me to quit this bad, then all you have to do is…ScenesJoey: (interrupting) Hey! Chef Geller! Y’know that little speech you made the other day? Well I got a problem with it!ScenesMonica: You do?ScenesJoey: You bet I do! I just ah, wasn’t listening then, that’s all.ScenesMonica: Well if you want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!ScenesJoey: What are you gonna do? You’re gonna fire me?ScenesMonica: You bet your ass I’m gonna fire you! Get out of my kitchen! Get out!! (Joey leaves) All right! Anybody else got a problem? How ‘bout you Chuckles? You think this is funny now?ScenesThe Waiter: No.ScenesMonica: How about if I dance around all covered in sauce? Huh? You think it’s funny now?ScenesThe Waiter: No, it’s really good.ScenesMonica: Good! Now, take those salads to table 4, (to the kitchen worker from earlier) And you! Get the swordfish! (to another assistant chef) And you! Get a haircut!

rows.Scenes: The train, it’s pulling into a station.]
rows.Content: The Conductor: Last stop, Montreal. This stop is Montreal.ScenesRoss: (waking up) What? (notices that there is now a beautiful woman sitting next to him)ScenesWoman On Train: I made a bet with myself that you have beautiful eyes. Now that I see them, I win.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesWoman On Train: We’re at my stop. But would you like to have coffee?ScenesRoss: (now fully awake) Are we really in Montreal?!ScenesWoman On Train: Yes we are. So, coffee?ScenesRoss: Coffee sounds great. (They get up) Wait, so, so you live in Montreal?ScenesWoman On Train: Oh, no. But it’s just a two hour ferry ride to Nova Scotia.

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Joey is coming back in with his coat on.]
rows.Content: Joey: Well I guess I should’ve thought about my wife and kids before I talked back to chef Geller!ScenesMonica: Thanks.ScenesJoey: Yep! Looks like it’s gonna be a leeeeean Christmas at the Dragon house this year.ScenesMonica: Enough!ScenesJoey: (leaving) Lean-lean-lean!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is singing her holiday song.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) "Went to the store, sat on Santa's lap.Scenes                                Asked him to bring my friends all kind of crap.Scenes                                Said all you need is to write them a song.Scenes                                They haven't heard it, so don't try and sing along.Scenes                                No, don't sing along.Scenes                                Monica, Moncia, have a happy Chanukah.Scenes                                Saw Santa Clause, he said hello to Ross.Scenes                                And plese tell Joey, Christmas will be snowy!Scenes                                And Rachel and Chandler, have err-umm-glander!!ScenesHappy holidays, everybody!ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Girl From PoughkeepsieScenesWritten by: Scott SilveriScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Chandler, and Phoebe are there as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesChandler, Joey, and Phoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: I’m sorry I’m late, did I miss anything?ScenesPhoebe: Joey stuffing 15 Oreos in his mouth. (Joey, with an obvious mouth full, nods yes.)ScenesRoss: 15? (Joey nods again) Your personal best! (Ross takes an Oreo and Joey mumbles, no!)ScenesPhoebe: Where were you?ScenesRoss: Oh, on a date. Yeah, I met this girl on the train going to a museum upstate.Scenes(simultaneously)ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah! How did you meet her?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, which museum?ScenesPhoebe: (just Phoebe) No, answer his.ScenesRoss: Okay, it was just me and her at the back of the train, and I sat near the door, so she’d have to pass by me if she wanted to switch cars. She was totally at my mercy.ScenesChandler: Were you so late because you were burring this woman?ScenesRoss: No, I’m getting back down ‘cause she lives in Poughkeepsie. She seems really great, but she’s like totally great, but she lives two and a half hours away.ScenesChandler: How can she be great if she’s from Poughkeepsie? (laughs, at they all look at him) That joke would’ve killed in Albany.ScenesJoey: Done! I did it! Heh, who’s stupid now? (He smiles and has cookie remains all over his teeth.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe are there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey, look at this! (Holding a newspaper) They’re lighting the big Christmas tree tonight.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, that paper’s two weeks old.ScenesChandler: All right, who keeps leaving old newspapers in the trash?! I really wanted to take Kathy to this, I can’t believe I missed it.ScenesRachel: Hey, y’know, at least you have somebody to miss that stuff with! I hate being alone this time of year! Next thing you know it’ll be Valentine’s Day, then my birthday, then bang!—before you know it, they’re lighting that damn tree again. Ohh, I want somebody! (hearing this, Gunther moves in) Y’know, I want a man!! (Gunther leaves depressed) I mean, it doesn’t even have to be a big relationship, y’know, just like a fling would be great.ScenesChandler: Really?! I didn’t think girls ever just wanted a fling.ScenesRachel: Well, believe me, it’s been a long time since I’ve been flung.ScenesJoey: Well, I know what I’m giving you for Christmas.ScenesChandler: Y’know what? There’s some nice guys at my office, do you want me to set you up?ScenesRachel: Yeah! Wait a minute, it’s been a long time that I’ve been single. How come you never offered this before?ScenesChandler: Well, I have a girlfriend, I’m-I’m happy. So, I no longer feel the need to go out of my way to stop others from being happy.ScenesRachel: Okay! No accountants. Oh, and no one from like legal. I don’t like guys with boring jobs.ScenesChandler: Oh and Ross was like what? A lion tamer?Scenes(Monica enters)ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: What’s wrong Mon?ScenesMonica: Ohh, everybody at the restaurant still hates me.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesMonica: I thought I was making headway, everyone was smiling at me all day, I get off work and I find out that they wrote this (puts on her chef hat) on my chef’s hat. (The hat says ‘Quit, bitch’)ScenesPhoebe: Hey, maybe they meant to write, ‘Quiet, bitch.’ScenesRachel: Hey, honey! What’s the matter? (Monica shows her, her hat.) Fine, I was just trying to be nice! Whoa!ScenesMonica: I mean I have not been picked on this much since kindergarten and they had to bring in someone from junior high to do the see-saw with me. (Joey laughs and Monica glares at him.)ScenesJoey: Ohhh!ScenesMonica: I mean they’re trying to do everything they can to make me quit, and if there were any other job, I would. But this is something I’ve been waiting for my whole life.ScenesRachel: Well, wait a minute, you’re the boss! Why don’t you just yell at them? Or, fire them?ScenesMonica: I would love too, but I can’t! I mean I just can’t, you know that I’m not good at confrontation.ScenesChandler: Hey, you know what you can do? I remember reading about this director, I think it was Orson Wells, who at the beginning of the movie would hire somebody, just so he could fire them in front of everybody. Then they would all know, who’s boss.ScenesJoey: Hey, Mon! I’m not doing anything, why don’t you fire me?ScenesMonica: That’s a good idea! Wait, do you know how to waiter?ScenesJoey: Good enough to get fired.ScenesMonica: All right, you’re hired!ScenesJoey: Hey! That must be why I got fired last week! Does this Orson Wells guy direct Burger King commercials?ScenesChandler: (he glares at him for a while) Yes.

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s office, he is trying to find Rachel a date.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I say, Drew! Are you seeing anybody right now? (Drew looks at him) Og-ee-op, I’m not asking for me, I’m… I mean… No, I’m-I’m not gay, I’m not asking you out. I’m not-I’m not-I’m not gay!ScenesDrew: I didn’t think you were gay. I do now.ScenesChandler: See my friend-my friend, Rachel, she wants to be set up.ScenesDrew: Ahh, I just got out of a big relationship, I’m not looking for any thing serious.ScenesChandler: Oh, y’know what, that might be okay even if it was just kind of a fling, that might be all right with Rachel.ScenesMike: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! Is this, hot Rachel, that you took to the Christmas party, Rachel?ScenesChandler: (to Drew) Oh, by the way, that is her full name.ScenesMike: Oh wow! I’m free for her!ScenesDrew: Oh, wait a second! I didn’t say I wasn’t free!ScenesMike: Hey, Chandler, why don’t we talk this over at the Ranger game tomorrow?ScenesDrew: Hold on, y’know I just got a box of Cubans, maybe I bring them by your office around uh, five?ScenesChandler: Oh well, that’s uh, a little later than I uh, generally care to stay, but sure!ScenesMike: Maybe, before the game we could enjoy some eight year old some small batch Basel Hadens.ScenesChandler: Well, I don’t really know what that is, but let’s!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is working on a new song.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey! You guys, I’m writing a holiday song for everyone. Do you want to hear it?ScenesMonica, Rachel, and Joey: Yes!ScenesPhoebe: (singing) Happy Chanukah, Monica! May your Christmas be snowy, Joey! Happy New Year, Chandler and Ross. Spin the draddle, Rachel!ScenesRachel: Pheebs, that’s great!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yay!ScenesRachel: But y’know umm, Rachel doesn’t rhyme with draddle.ScenesPhoebe: I know but it’s so hard! Nothing rhymes with your stupid name!ScenesJoey: What are you talking about? Lots of things rhyme with Rachel. Bagel. Mail. Jail. Bail. Able. May-pole.ScenesPhoebe: All good, thanks. (to Rachel) Do you maybe have a nickname have like a nickname that’s easier to rhyme?ScenesMonica: Didn’t your dad used to call you Pumpkin?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah!ScenesPhoebe: Pumpkin? Yeah. But did he ever call you like, Budolph?ScenesChandler: (entering) Hello, children!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesChandler: (to Rachel) Have I got the 50 guys for you!ScenesRachel: Really?!ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, I just showed this a picture of you and guys were throwing themselves at me! They’re buying me drinks! They’re giving me stuff! (to Joey) Knicks tonight?ScenesJoey: Sure! Where are the seats?ScenesChandler: Wherever! I’ve got like 20!ScenesRachel: So, will I like any of these guys?ScenesChandler: Y’know what, I’m gonna uh, play the field just a little more.ScenesRachel: Chandler!ScenesChandler: Guys are signing over their 401-K’s to me?ScenesPhoebe: (shocked) You work with robots!!ScenesChandler: (pause) Yes. (to Rachel) Okay, there’s this one guy, Patrick, I think you’re gonna like him, he’s really nice, he’s funny, he’s a swimmer.ScenesRachel: Ohh, I like swimmer’s bodies!ScenesChandler: Yes, and his father invented that magnetic strip on the back of credit cards.ScenesRachel: Op, I like credit cards!ScenesChandler: See, I’m not bad at this fixing up thing, huh?ScenesRachel: Well, so what does he do?ScenesChandler: Oh, he works in the Fine Foods division.ScenesRachel: Your company has a fine foods division?ScenesChandler: It’s a big company, I don’t—if you—I…ScenesJoey: Now, wait a second! You make food and robots?ScenesPhoebe: No! No, the robots just work for them.ScenesMonica: (getting up) All right, I’m gonna go to work. Does anybody have a problem with that?ScenesJoey: Yeah, lady, I do! I got a problem with that!ScenesMonica: You want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!ScenesJoey: Oh, what are you gonna do? You’re gonna fire me?ScenesMonica: You bet your ass, I’m gonna fire you! Thank you.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross, Phoebe, and Chandler are there.]
rows.Content: Ross: Oh, wow! I should get going. I-I got a date tonight.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah! With who?ScenesRoss: You know that girl I told you about who lives up in Poughkeepsie?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Not her. Yeah, this is someone else I meet, and I-I can’t decide between the two of them. Y’know the one from Poughkeepsie, even though she’s a two hour train ride away, is really pretty, really smart, and-and a lot of fun. But this other girl, well, she lives right uptown. Y’know she’s, well she’s-she’s just as pretty, I guess she’s smart, she’s not fun.ScenesPhoebe: If she’s no fun, why do you want to date her at all?ScenesRoss: Well, I-I want to give her another chance, y’know? She lives so close. And, at the end of the date, the other time, she-she said something that was—if she was kidding was very funny. On the other hand, if she wasn’t kidding, she’s not fun, she’s stupid, and kind of a racist.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey, man!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Ooh, how was your first day working at the restaurant?ScenesJoey: (checks his watch) Damn! (runs out to work)

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Monica is cooking.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering from the dining room) Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey, what happened to your fancy chef’s jacket? (sees there’s a burn spot on it)ScenesMonica: They baked it. I can’t take this anymore. I’m gonna call a meeting tonight, I’m gonna fire you tonight.ScenesJoey: You got it! Oh-oh! (He starts patting the burned spot, which just happens to be over her breast.)ScenesMonica: What are you doing?!ScenesJoey: It’s still a tiny bit on fire there.ScenesMonica: Thanks. (Joey’s still patting the burn spot) I think you got it!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is there.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (entering) Chandler!! You have the best taste in men!ScenesChandler: Well, like father, like son.ScenesRachel: Patrick and I had such a great time last night! I mean I think this could maybe turn into something serious.ScenesChandler: Really?! I-I thought you weren’t looking for something serious? I thought you were looking for some kind of a fling.ScenesRachel: Well, y'know, possibly. (pause) You didn’t tell him that, though? Right?ScenesChandler: Ummmmmmmm, no.ScenesRachel: You told this guy that I was looking for a fling?! You don’t tell the guy that!ScenesChandler: Why not?! I’d be thrilled if I heard that some hot girl was just looking to get—oh I see.ScenesRachel: Oh, between you telling him that I wanted to have a fling and me putting out on the first date—oh, he’s so gonna get the wrong idea.

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Joey is eating some cheese.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey, Joey, could you pass the cheese?ScenesJoey: Yeah. Listen uh, I’d prefer it if you didn’t call me Joey. Since I don’t know anyone here, I thought it’d be cool to try out a cool work nickname.ScenesA Waiter: (entering) Hey, dragon! Here’s your tips from Monday and Tuesday. (hands him two envelopes)ScenesJoey: (opening an envelope) There’s like-there’s like 300 bucks in this one!ScenesThe Waiter: Yeah, people get pretty generous around the holidays. And it never hurts to wear tight trousers.ScenesMonica: Okay. Could the waiters gather around to hear tonight’s specials? Okay, first there is a Chilean Sea Bass prepared with a Mango relish on a bag—Why is nobody writing these down?ScenesThe Waiter: Because we can remember them.ScenesMonica: Because your all gonna make up fake specials and make me cook them like you did the other night?ScenesThe Waiter: Well, sure, that too.ScenesMonica: Okay, forget the specials for a minute. Umm, all right here’s the thing, for the last two weeks I have umm, (quietly) tried really hard to create a positive atmosphere…ScenesThe Waiter: Can’t hear you!ScenesMonica: (louder) A positive atmosphere! But I-I-I have had it up to here. (She holds her hand over her head as an afterthought.) From now on, it is gonna be my way, or the highway! All right? Does anybody have a problem with that?!! (Joey looks at the money he’s holding, and doesn’t speak up.) Hey new guy! I said, does anybody have a problem with that?!ScenesJoey: No ma’am.ScenesThe Waiter: Hey! He has a name, it’s Dragon. Do you wanna know your name? Check your hat. (to another waiter) We did the hat right? (The other waiter nods yes.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, continued from earlier. The other waiters are gone and Monica is confronting Joey about his not speaking up.]
rows.Content: Monica: What the hell happened?!ScenesJoey: I am so-so-so sorry. I was gonna do it! Really! But I was standing there with 327 dollars in one hand and 238 dollars in the other hand, and I was thinking, "Wow! It’s been a long time since I had… (tries to do the math in his head, but can’t) 327 + 238 dollars!ScenesMonica: Joey, we had a deal. That-that’s why you’re here! I’ve got to fire you!ScenesJoey: And I gotta pay rent! Look, how-how about this? You don’t fire me, instead I stay here, I gain their trust, and they’ll start listening to all the nice things I’ve been saying about you.ScenesMonica: What kinda things have you been saying?ScenesJoey: Well nothing yet, they really hate you and I want to fit in.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is working on her holiday song, Chandler is sitting on the couch reading a magazine, and Ross is sleeping on the couch.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) Happy, happy Chanukah, Chandler and Monica. Very merry…ScenesChandler: (interrupting) Oh, y’know, y’know what Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesChandler: I’m not Jewish, so…ScenesPhoebe: So! Ross doesn’t really decorate his tree with floss, but you don’t hear him complaining do you? God! (Phoebe hits her guitar which wakes up Ross with a start.)ScenesChandler: Bad dream?ScenesRoss: I wasn’t sleeping.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, then uh, what was Phoebe’s song about?ScenesRoss: The one with the cat. I gotta go, I’ve got another date.ScenesPhoebe: So, did you pick one yet?ScenesRoss: No, it turns out that the one from uptown was making a joke. But it was a different joke than I thought—it wasn’t that funny. So I’m still torn.ScenesPhoebe: Well look, you don’t really like the one from uptown and you’re too exhausted from dating the one up in Poughkeepsie, so I say you just end them both. Okay? You take a train up to Poughkeepsie and break up with her, and on your way back you break up with uptown. And then by the time you get home tonight, you’re done!ScenesRoss: Y’know, you’re right. Thank you.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, well I had a similar problem when I lived in Prague.ScenesChandler: Prague?ScenesPhoebe: There’s sooo much you don’t know.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is playing living room golf as Rachel enters. Rachel sees this and holds the door open until Chandler is ready to start his swing, when he is, she slams the door shut which causes the club to fly from his hands. He turns around, shocked.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Chandler! Patrick just uh, ended things with me. Did you or did you not tell him that I was looking for a serious relationship?ScenesChandler: I did! I absolutely did!ScenesRachel: You idiot!!ScenesChandler: I’m sure you’re right, but why?ScenesRachel: You don’t tell a guy that you’re looking for a serious relationship! You don’t tell the guy that! Now you scared him away!ScenesChandler: Oh, man. I’m sorry, I’m so-so sorry.ScenesRachel: Y’know, you should never be allowed to talk to people!ScenesChandler: I know! I know!ScenesRachel: Oh! See just I’m right back where I started! Aww, this sucks! Being alone, sucks! (She sits down heavily in one of the new chairs)ScenesChandler: Well, y’know, you’re-you’re gonna meet somebody! You’re a great catch! Y’know when I was telling all those guys about you, I didn’t have to lie once. (He sits down on the arm of her chair)ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesChandler: Yeah! You graduated Magma Ku Laude, right?ScenesRachel: No.ScenesChandler: Oh, it doesn’t matter. (Kisses her on the top of her head.) Hey, y’know what, I’ve got two tickets to tonight’s Rangers game, you wanna come with me?ScenesRachel: Cute guys in little shorts? Sure.ScenesChandler: Well, actually it’s a hockey team, so it’s angry Canadians with no teeth.ScenesRachel: Well that sounds fun too. (They hug.)Scenes(pause)ScenesChandler: Have you ever been with a woman?ScenesRachel: What?! Chandler, what is the matter with you?!ScenesChandler: So there is no good time to ask that question.

rows.Scenes: A train to Poughkeepsie, Ross is asleep against the window.]
rows.Content: The Conductor: The next station is Poughkeepsie. Poughkeepsie!ScenesThe Woman From Poughkeepsie: (outside Ross’s window) Ross? Ross! (she knocks on the window) Wake up! Ross! (the train starts moving) Ross! Ross!! Ross!!! Ross!!!!

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Monica is cooking.]
rows.Content: Monica: I need more swordfish. (to one of the assistant chefs) Can you get me some more swordfish?ScenesKitchen Worker: I don’t speak English.ScenesMonica: You did a minute ago!ScenesKitchen Worker: Well, I don’t know what to tell ya!ScenesMonica: Fine!Scenes(She goes into the freezer to get it herself, and leaves the door open. The waiter from earlier comes by and closes the door.)ScenesMonica: Okay! Very funny! Somebody let me out please?! Come on, I’m cold! (She spills something.) And covered in marinara sauce! Come on! Let me out! (the door opens)ScenesThe Waiter: You found that handle, did ya?ScenesMonica: That’s not funny.ScenesThe Waiter: Well that’s not true.ScenesMonica: (starting to cry) I’m a good person. And I’m a good chef, and I don’t deserve to have marinara sauce all over me! Y’know what, if you want me to quit this bad, then all you have to do is…ScenesJoey: (interrupting) Hey! Chef Geller! Y’know that little speech you made the other day? Well I got a problem with it!ScenesMonica: You do?ScenesJoey: You bet I do! I just ah, wasn’t listening then, that’s all.ScenesMonica: Well if you want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!ScenesJoey: What are you gonna do? You’re gonna fire me?ScenesMonica: You bet your ass I’m gonna fire you! Get out of my kitchen! Get out!! (Joey leaves) All right! Anybody else got a problem? How ‘bout you Chuckles? You think this is funny now?ScenesThe Waiter: No.ScenesMonica: How about if I dance around all covered in sauce? Huh? You think it’s funny now?ScenesThe Waiter: No, it’s really good.ScenesMonica: Good! Now, take those salads to table 4, (to the kitchen worker from earlier) And you! Get the swordfish! (to another assistant chef) And you! Get a haircut!

rows.Scenes: The train, it’s pulling into a station.]
rows.Content: The Conductor: Last stop, Montreal. This stop is Montreal.ScenesRoss: (waking up) What? (notices that there is now a beautiful woman sitting next to him)ScenesWoman On Train: I made a bet with myself that you have beautiful eyes. Now that I see them, I win.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesWoman On Train: We’re at my stop. But would you like to have coffee?ScenesRoss: (now fully awake) Are we really in Montreal?!ScenesWoman On Train: Yes we are. So, coffee?ScenesRoss: Coffee sounds great. (They get up) Wait, so, so you live in Montreal?ScenesWoman On Train: Oh, no. But it’s just a two hour ferry ride to Nova Scotia.

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Joey is coming back in with his coat on.]
rows.Content: Joey: Well I guess I should’ve thought about my wife and kids before I talked back to chef Geller!ScenesMonica: Thanks.ScenesJoey: Yep! Looks like it’s gonna be a leeeeean Christmas at the Dragon house this year.ScenesMonica: Enough!ScenesJoey: (leaving) Lean-lean-lean!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is singing her holiday song.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) "Went to the store, sat on Santa's lap.Scenes                                Asked him to bring my friends all kind of crap.Scenes                                Said all you need is to write them a song.Scenes                                They haven't heard it, so don't try and sing along.Scenes                                No, don't sing along.Scenes                                Monica, Moncia, have a happy Chanukah.Scenes                                Saw Santa Clause, he said hello to Ross.Scenes                                And plese tell Joey, Christmas will be snowy!Scenes                                And Rachel and Chandler, have err-umm-glander!!ScenesHappy holidays, everybody!ScenesEndScenesThe One With Phoebe’s UterusScenesWritten by: Seth KirklandScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Frank and Alice are there talking with Phoebe.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh my God! I can’t believe my little brother is married!ScenesFrank: Oh I know!! (Both he and Alice squeal hysterically)ScenesPhoebe: You guys, why didn’t you tell me you were eloping?ScenesFrank: ‘Cause it just sorta happened, y’know we were at the courthouse, we were having lunch…ScenesPhoebe: Wait, wait, why were you at the courthouse?ScenesFrank: We were having lunch. Yeah and then all of the sudden we were like, "Hey! Y'know, we’re here, having lunch let’s get married!ScenesPhoebe: Wow, a year and a half ago I didn’t even know I had a brother, and now I have a sister too. (They all hug, and Frank and Alice start kissing.) Okay. Okay. Stop it, don’t. So, I gotta get you a gift now. Is there anything you need?ScenesFrank: Uhh, yeah.ScenesAlice: We’ve been trying to get pregnant, uh pretty much ever since we got engaged, we thought we’d get a jump on things, y’know no one’s getting any younger.ScenesFrank: See the thing is umm, we’re not able to y’know, uh, conceive.ScenesAlice: And we’ve tried everything, we’ve seen a bunch of doctors.ScenesFrank: Yeah, and they-and they say that our-that our only chance to have a baby is that if they take my sperm, her egg and put it together in a dish and then put it into another girl. So we were wondering if you could be the girl that we could put it into.ScenesPhoebe: (shocked) That’s a really nice gift. I was thinking of like a gravy boat.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel, and Chandler are trying to throw cards into a vase.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering with Ross) Hey! You guys! Check it out, check it out! (He’s wearing a blue blazer) Guess which job I got.ScenesChandler: I don’t know, but Donald Trump wants his blue blazer black.Scenes(The gang is stunned.)ScenesRoss: What?ScenesChandler: Blue blazer back. He-he wants it back.ScenesRachel: But you-you said black. Why would he want his blue blazer black?ScenesChandler: Well, you-you know what I meant.ScenesMonica: No, you messed it up. You’re stupid.ScenesChandler: So what job did you get Joe?ScenesJoey: Oh, ah, tour guide at the museum. Yeah, Ross got it for me.ScenesRachel: Well, how can you be a tour guide, don’t you have to be a dinosaur expert or something?ScenesJoey: No, not really. They give you all the information, it’s uh, it’s like memorizing a script. (Making like a tour guide) "And on your left, you have Tyrannosaurus Rex, a carnivore from the Jurassic period.ScenesChandler, Monica, and Rachel:  Great!! That’s great!ScenesRoss: Uh actually Joey, it’s the Cretasous period.ScenesJoey: Yeah but, I can pronounce Jurassic.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Guess what. Frank Jr., and Alice got married!ScenesAll: Oh my God!!ScenesPhoebe: And! And, they’re gonna have a baby! (The gang is shocked.) And! And, they want me to grow it for them in my uterus. (The gang is stunned into silence.)ScenesRoss: My God!ScenesMonica: Are you serious?ScenesPhoebe: YeahScenesJoey: You’re really thinking about having sex with your brother?!ScenesPhoebe: Ewww! And "Oh no!" It’s—they just want me to be the surrogate. It’s her-it’s her egg and her sperm, and I’m-I’m just the oven, it’s totally their bun.ScenesJoey: Huh.ScenesMonica: What did you tell them?ScenesPhoebe: Well, they said that I had to think about it first, but what is there to think about? I’m gonna be giving them the greatest gift you can possibly give.ScenesChandler: You’re gonna be carrying their baby and give them a Sony Play Station?ScenesRachel: Honey, this really is an incredible thing to do for them, but there are things to think about.ScenesMonica: Yeah, like you’re gonna be pregnant. I mean pregnant.ScenesPhoebe: I know!ScenesRoss: Pheebs, you’re talking about putting your body through an awful lot, I mean morning sickness, uhh, labour, and it’s all for somebody else!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, what’s your point?ScenesRoss: Well, the stuff I just mentioned.ScenesRachel: Wow! I don’t know if I could ever do that. I always figured the first time I had a baby was with somebody I love and that baby would be a…keeper.ScenesPhoebe: Y'know you guys were a lot more supportive when I wanted to make denim furniture.ScenesJoey: No, Pheebs, listen, if you decide to do this, we’ll be supportive like crazy.ScenesAll: Yeah.ScenesMonica: We just want you to think it through.ScenesRachel: Yeah, honey, maybe you can talk to somebody who’s had a baby. Like your mom?ScenesPhoebe: My mom never gave birth. Oh! But my birth mom did.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Kathy are kissing.]
rows.Content: Kathy: Umm, (moves her hand’s down to his butt) I love this touchy. Can I take it to work with me?ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah, sure, it’s not mine anyway. It can with the pants.ScenesKathy: Oh! (They kiss and she leaves)ScenesMonica: I am so jealous.ScenesRachel: You guys are really right…there aren’t you?ScenesChandler: Yes. Right where?ScenesMonica: In the beginning where y’know it’s all sex and talking and sex and talking and…ScenesChandler: Yeah, you-you gotta love the talking.ScenesMonica: And the sex?ScenesChandler: All right, we haven’t had sex yet. Okay, what’s the big deal? Y’know? This is special, and I want our love to grow until we move on to the next level.ScenesRachel: Oh, Chandler that is so nice.ScenesRoss: That is really nice…lying! No way is that the reason!ScenesRachel: Why? Just because you’re not mature enough to understand something like that?!ScenesChandler: No, he’s right, I’m totally lying.Scenes(Ross makes an "I was right, and you weren’t face." And Rachel does Ross’s little I’m-flicking-you-off-but-I’m-not-giving-you-the-finger banging of the fists.)ScenesMonica: Then what is it?ScenesChandler: Well, Kathy’s last boyfriend was Joey.ScenesRoss: And you’re afraid you won’t be able to…fill his shoes.ScenesChandler: No, I’m afraid I won’t be able to make love as well as him.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I was going for the metaphor.ScenesChandler: Yes, and I was saying the actual words.ScenesMonica: So big deal, so Joey’s had a lot of girlfriends, it doesn’t mean he’s great in bed.ScenesChandler: We share a wall! So either he’s great in bed, or she just likes to agree with him a lot.ScenesMonica: Sweetie, with you it’s gonna be different. The sex is gonna be great, ‘cause you-you guys are in love.ScenesChandler: Yeah?ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesRoss: Just go for it Chandler.ScenesMonica: Yeah, you should.ScenesRachel: Yeah, you should, really.ScenesMonica: Go on.ScenesChandler: All right, all right, I’ll go sleep with my girlfriend. But I’m just doing it for you guys.

rows.Scenes: The museum, Joey is giving a tour to a bunch of school kids.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay, now the Mastodon is from the semi-late Jurassic period.ScenesSmart Kid: Isn’t the Mastodon from the Pliocene Epic?ScenesJoey: Shhh! This is a museum, no talking. Right down here, (Motions to a fossilised dinosaur foot.) we have a large foot. (Sees Ross working in one of the display cases.) Uhh, and over here we have Ross Geller. (Knocks on the glass) Everyone wave ‘Hi’ to Ross. Ross is one of our most important scientists, look at him, hard at work. (Ross does the old "Putting a cigarette in your ear and pulling it out of your mouth trick.") Okay, moving right along. Come on.

rows.Scenes: Phoebe Sr.’s house, there’s a knock on the door.]
rows.Content: Phoebe Sr: It’s open! Come in!ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesPhoebe Sr: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: I’m sorry, I’m late.ScenesPhoebe Sr: Oh, that’s okay, it gave me time to finish glazing my nipples.ScenesPhoebe: Wow! You really go all out when you’re expecting company.ScenesPhoebe Sr: No, I was working on my pottery.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Ooh! Oh, I didn’t know that you did…pot.ScenesPhoebe Sr: Well, yeah, mostly nudes. It combines my two passions, pottery and erotica.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, erotiery!ScenesPhoebe Sr: Hey! Okay! Well thanks for coming out to see me. I just-I just thought it would be a very good idea to talk about this baby stuff in person. Y’know…ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesPhoebe Sr: I really don’t think it’s a very good idea, Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: Why not?ScenesPhoebe Sr: Well, because you’d be giving up a baby, and I-I really don’t—I don’t know if there’s anything I can say that could make you understand the pain of giving up a baby. So, umm, (Picks up a puppy in the box next to the couch.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh no! No-no! I understand the pain! Don’t-don’t hurt the puppy.ScenesPhoebe Sr: No-no-no, the-the puppy’s yours.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I get a puppy!!ScenesPhoebe Sr: Well, yeah! I mean yeah, but only for three days.ScenesPhoebe: Why?ScenesPhoebe Sr: I realise I don’t have any right to start get all parenty on you and everything now, but umm, (Sees that Phoebe isn’t paying attention and is busy mimicking the puppy.) uhh… Phoebe, would you please look at me and not the puppy, it’s very important.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesPhoebe Sr: I mean, I know what I’m talking about. I gave up two babies, and I only wish I had someone there that had given up babies, that could tell me how terrible it is to give up babies. I just think that, it would be something you will regret every single day for the rest of your life. So, how ever hard it is to give up this puppy, it would be like a million times harder to give up a child. (Phoebe is playing with the puppy again, and not listening) I really shouldn’t have given you the puppy first.ScenesPhoebe: All right, I’m sorry.

rows.Scenes: The museum’s worker cafeteria, Joey is eating lunch with the rest of the tour guides. Another tour guide tries to sit down in a seat Joey saved for Ross.]
rows.Content: Joey: Uhh, do you mind sitting there. I’m-I’m saving this for my friend Ross.ScenesTour Guide: You mean Dr. Geller?ScenesJoey: Doctor? Wow! I didn’t know he had a nickname.ScenesTour Guide: Oh, he won’t sit here. Only the people in the white coats sit over there, (Points to there table) and only the people in the blue blazers sit here.ScenesJoey: Well, how-how come?ScenesTour Guide: That’s just the way it is.ScenesJoey: That’s crazy.ScenesTour Guide: Maybe it’s crazy in a perfect world, a world without lab coats and blazers, but you not in a perfect world, you in a museum now. See that scientist in the classes, he and I used to play together all the time in grade school, but now…(Turns around) Peter! Hey, Peter! It’s me Rhonda! From PS-129! I shared my puddin’ which you man! I gave you my Snack Pack! (to Joey) See, he pretend he don’t even here me!ScenesJoey: I-I think everybody’s pretending they don’t hear you. Anyway, look, I don’t know about you and your jackets and your separate tables, but Ross is one of my best friends, and if I save him a seat, I’m telling you, he will sit in it! (Ross enters and goes over to the white table) Ross! Ross! Over here, man! I-I saved you seat.ScenesRoss: That’s okay, I’m cool over here. I’ll catch up with you later, Joey. (Joey is shocked.)Scenes(Another woman enters without a coat or blazer and tries to sit at the ‘blue’ table.)ScenesTour Guide: Op, this is saved. (Joey wonders why) Gift shop.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is eating dinner, Monica and Rachel are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Ross: (entering) Hey, uh, I’m really, really sorry about what happened in the cafeteria today.ScenesJoey: It’s no big deal. Hey, y’know, you do what you gotta do. Right?ScenesRoss: But hey, it’s not just me, I mean the scientists and the tour guides never sit together.ScenesJoey: Whatever.ScenesRoss: It’s like that everywhere, Joey! Okay, Mon, back me up here. Where you work the uh, waiters eat with the waiters, right? And the chefs eat with the other chefs, right?ScenesMonica: I eat by myself in the alley because everybody hates me.ScenesJoey: Look, Ross, really it’s-it’s no big deal. Y’know you wear a white coat, I wear a blue blazer, if that means we can’t be friends at work, then so be it. Y’know, hey I understand. Y’know? Hey, when I’m in a play and you’re in the audience, I don’t talk to you, right? So it’s y’know, it’s uh, it’s cool. I’ll see you tomorrow. (Leaves)ScenesRachel: Yeah, when we’re in the audience he doesn’t talk to us, but he does wave.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, Phoebe is there with her puppy and is trying to sing it to sleep as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hi.ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesChandler: Why is Phoebe singing to Carl Mulden?ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, y’know what, I think it’s time for puppy to go out again. Come on, let’s go to the balcony.ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesPhoebe: Umm, the street. Come on, let’s go to the street. Ooh, listen, don’t go onto the balcony until after I get back. (Leaves)ScenesMonica: (to Chandler) So, did you do it?ScenesChandler: Yes, yes, we had the sex.ScenesMonica: Uh-oh, it was bad?ScenesChandler: It was fine, y’know? But she didn’t agree with me as strongly as she agreed with Joey. She was more like, "I see you point, I’m all right with it.ScenesMonica: Well, it was the first time. Y’know, there’s not always a lot of agreement the first time.ScenesRachel: Yeah, not girls anyway, guys agree (snaps her fingers) like that.ScenesChandler: Look, you have to help me! Okay? I mean, I know what to do with a woman, y’know, I know where everything goes, it’s always nice. But I need to know what makes it go from nice to, "My God! Somebody’s killing her in there!ScenesMonica: All right, I’m gonna show you something a lot of guys don’t know. Rach, give me that pad, please? (She does so and Monica starts drawing on it) All right. Now…ScenesChandler: Look, you don’t have to draw an actual wo—whoa! She’s hot!ScenesMonica: Now everybody knows the basic erogenous zones. (She starts labelling them) You got one, two three, four (Chandler is shocked to find out there’s more than three), five, six, and seven!ScenesChandler: (shocked) There are seven?!ScenesRachel: Let me see that. (Monica shows her) Oh, yeah.ScenesChandler: (Points to one) That’s one?ScenesMonica: It’s kind of an important one!ScenesChandler: Oh, y’know-y’know what, I was looking at it upside down.ScenesRachel: Well, y’know, sometimes that helps. (She realises what that could’ve meant.)ScenesMonica: (continuing) Now, most guys will hit uh, 1-2-3 and then go to 7 and set up camp.ScenesChandler: That-that’s bad?ScenesRachel: Well if you go to Disneyland, you don’t spend the whole day on the Materhorn.ScenesChandler: Well you might if it were anything like 7!ScenesMonica: All right uh, the important thing is to take your time, you want to hit ‘em all, and you mix ‘em up. You gotta keep them on their toes.ScenesRachel: Oo, toes!! Well, for some people. (Chandler eyes her and her toes.)ScenesMonica: All right. Umm, you could uh start out with a little 1, a 2, a 1-2-3, 3, 5, a 4, a 3-2, 2, a 2-4-6, 2-4-6, 4, (Rachel starts getting worked up) 2, 2, 4-7, 5-7, 6-7, 7, …7..…7…7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7…(mouths 7)! (They both lean back on the couch satisfied.)

rows.Scenes: The museum cafeteria, Joey is eating with the tour guides as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Older Scientist: Dr. Geller, there’s a seat over here. (Motions to an empty chair at the ‘white’ table.)ScenesRoss: Thank you, Dr. Phillips, but I’m having my lunch at this table, here in the middle. I’m having lunch right here, with my good friend Joey, if he’ll sit with me.ScenesJoey: (standing up) I will sit with you Dr. Geller. (He goes over to his table and they shake hands.)ScenesRoss: Y'know, we work in a museum of natural history, and yet there is something unnatural about the way we eat lunch. Now, I look around this cafeteria, and y’know what I see, I see-I see division. Division, between people in white coats and people in blue blazers, and I ask myself, "My God why?!" Now, I say we shed these-these coats that separate us, and we get to know the people underneath. (He takes off his coat and throws it down.) I’m Ross! I’m divorced, and I have a kid!ScenesJoey: (stands up, and throws his coat on the floor) I’m Joey! I’m an actor! I don’t know squat about dinosaurs!ScenesAnother Tour Guide: (standing up and removing his coat) I’m Ted, and I just moved here a month ago, and New York really scares me.ScenesRoss: All right, there you go!ScenesJoey: Yeah, you hang in there Teddy!ScenesOlder Scientist: I’m Andrew, and I didn’t pay for this pear.ScenesRoss: Okay, good-good for you.ScenesTour Guide: I’m Rhonda, (motions to her breasts) and these aren’t real! (Joey and Ross look at each other, shocked)ScenesRoss: Wow, Rhonda.ScenesAnother Scientist: I’m Scott.ScenesRoss: Yeah, okay, Scott!ScenesAnother Scientist: And I need to flip the light switch on and off 17 times before I leave a room or my family will die.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe, with the puppy, Monica, and Rachel are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: My mom’s gonna be here any minute. I can’t do this, I can’t give him up. Yes—no, I can. I don’t want to. But I can. No.ScenesRachel: Oo, I can’t watch this, it’s like Sophie’s Choice.ScenesMonica: Y’know, I never saw that.ScenesRachel: Ooh, it was only okay.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, I can’t do this. My mom was right. If I can’t-if I can’t give him up, then there’s no way I can give up a baby. Ohh, God, Frank and Alice are gonna be so crushed. What-what else, what else can I give ‘em—a kidney!ScenesAlice: (entering with Frank) Hi!ScenesFrank: Hi!ScenesAlice: Uhh, we were just in the neighbourhood, so…ScenesFrank: Yeah, so we just thought we’d stop by and let you know there’s still no pressure.ScenesAlice: None. But if there was something you wanted to tell us, we’re just gonna be right over there (points to the counter) having coffee.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesFrank: (noticing the puppy) Oh, who’s this little guy?! (Grabs the puppy)ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Ooh! Umm!ScenesFrank: Oh, he’s so cute, he reminds me of my old dog, Tumour.ScenesAlice: You are so precious, I could just take you home.ScenesPhoebe: Hey, why don’t you?ScenesFrank: Are you serious?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh, yeah!ScenesFrank: Oh, thanks.ScenesMonica: What are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: No, I’m really okay with this. Y’know why? ‘Cause look at them, and I made that, so… I know it’s gonna be like a million times harder to give up a baby but, oh my God, it’s gonna feel like a million times better, right? I wanna do this. (To Frank and Alice) I wanna carry your baby.ScenesAlice: (shocked) Oh! Oh! Oh! Thank you so much! You don’t know what this means to us! Oh!ScenesFrank: Oh my God, I think I’m gonna cry!ScenesMonica: It’s gonna be so great.ScenesPhoebe Sr: (entering) Hi! What’s going on?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I-I gave them the puppy and it made them so happy that I decided I’m gonna carry their baby.ScenesPhoebe Sr: But Phoebe…ScenesPhoebe: No-no-no, I know, but you and I are different people though, and this is a totally different situation, and I know that I am not gonna regret this.ScenesPhoebe Sr: Oh, I-I-I understand all that, but it’s just—that was my puppy.ScenesPhoebe: Oh!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are sitting at the table.]
rows.Content: Monica: Would you ever be a surrogate for anyone?ScenesRachel: It depends on who asked.ScenesMonica: What if I asked?ScenesRachel: Oh, Mon, sure.ScenesMonica: Really?ScenesRachel: Yes. (Pause) You’re not asking are you?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesRachel: Yes! Totally!Scenes(Kathy runs in, hair all out of place, and hugs Monica.)ScenesKathy: Oh! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! Yes! Thank you! (Runs back to Chandler)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The EmbryosScenesWritten by: Jill Condon & Amy ToominScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, it’s 0-Dark:30, in other words it’s really, really early. Everyone’s asleep, and all through the apartments not a creature was stirring, not even a mouse. That is except for the chick, who turns out to be a rooster and is crowing in the sun. Needless to say, this awakens Monica and Rachel who rush into their living room, searching for the cause of the sound.]
rows.Content: Rachel: What the hell is that?!! (to Monica) What the hell is that? Is that you? (Monica nods her head no, and Rachel realizes what is making that sound.) Ohhhhhhh! (storms over to Chandler and Joey’s with Monica in trail.)ScenesMonica: Boy, you are really not a morning person.ScenesRachel: (angrily) BACK OFF!!! (She starts banging on their door.) Get up! Get up! Get up! God damn it! Get up, get up, get up, get up, get up!!Scenes(Chandler opens the door, finally.)ScenesRachel: What is that noise?ScenesChandler: You!ScenesJoey: It’s the chick! She’s…going through some changes.ScenesMonica: What kind of changes?ScenesChandler: Well the vet seems to think that’s she’s becoming a rooster. (The rooster crows.) We’re getting a second opinion.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, it’s later that morning, everybody has gotten up and Ross and Phoebe has joined them for breakfast. Rachel is returning from shopping.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey, what are you doing shopping at eight in the morning?ScenesRachel: Well, I’ve been up since six. Thanks to somebody’s dumb-ass rooster.ScenesPhoebe: You guys you really should get rid of those animals. They shouldn’t be living in an apartment.ScenesRachel: Yeah! Especially not with all of these knives and cookbooks around…ScenesPhoebe: All right. I’m gonna go to the fertility doctor and um, see if I’m ready to have Frank and Alice’s embryo transferred into my uterus.ScenesRoss: Now, how will they know if you’re ready?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, they’re just gonna umm, look to see if my endometria layer is thick.ScenesChandler: Oh, I can uh, check that for ya.ScenesPhoebe: Okay everyone, think thick.ScenesAll: Good-bye! Good luck! (She opens the door to reveal Monica and Joey.)ScenesPhoebe: Hi! Wish me luck!ScenesMonica: Oh, good luck.ScenesJoey: Good luck. (to Monica) And I’m still right!ScenesMonica: That is sooo not true!ScenesRachel: What?ScenesJoey: She’s mad because I know today’s her laundry day and that means she’s wearing her old lady underpants.ScenesChandler: I can check that for ya.ScenesMonica: I just—I can’t believe that you think that you and Chandler know me and Rachel better than we know you.ScenesChandler: Well… we-we do. You can only eat Tic Tacks in even numbers.ScenesJoey: Yeah, what’s that about?ScenesChandler: (to Rachel) And you… Ross, I believe, if you check Rachel’s bag you will find a half-eaten box of cookies in there.ScenesRoss: (He does so, and finds a half-eaten box of cookies.) You’re good. (Tries a cookie.) These are not.ScenesRachel: I’m so not impressed. Everybody snacks when they shop.ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Oh yeah? Ross, how many items left in that bag?ScenesRoss: Five.ScenesChandler: Okay, ten bucks says that we can name every item in that bag.ScenesRachel: How many guesses do you get?ScenesJoey: Six.ScenesRoss: Challenge extended.ScenesMonica: Deal!ScenesRoss: Challenge excepted.ScenesJoey: All right, we’ll start with…apples.ScenesRoss: We’ll be starting with apples.ScenesChandler: (to Ross) Stop that now!Scenes(Ross reveals a bag of apples.)ScenesChandler: Yes!ScenesJoey: Okay. Uhh, tortilla chips, yogurt.ScenesChandler: Diet soda.ScenesRoss: Yes. Yes. Yes. (They’re perfect so far.)ScenesChandler: Orange juice.ScenesRachel: No! There’s no orange juice in there! We win!!ScenesMonica: Ha-ha!ScenesRoss: They have another guess.ScenesRachel: Okay, well, we won that one.ScenesJoey: Okay, the last thing…ScenesChandler: Oh-oh, oh, oh-oh! (Whispers something in Joey’s ear.)ScenesJoey: No-no, not for like another two weeks.ScenesChandler: I got it! Scotch… tape. (They’re right.)ScenesRoss: How did you know she would buy scotch tape?ScenesChandler: Well, we used there’s up last night making scary faces.ScenesMonica: Aww, man!ScenesChandler: All right! Ten buck! Fork it over! Cough it up! Pay the piper! Gimme it.ScenesMonica: That does not mean you know us better, I-I want a rematch.ScenesRachel: Yeah, and none of these stupid grocery questions, real personal questions.ScenesMonica: Yeah! And the winner gets a hundred bucks.ScenesJoey: Serious?ScenesMonica: Are you scared?ScenesJoey: No! All right, who-who makes up the questions?ScenesMonica: Ross will do it.ScenesRoss: Oh sure, "Ross will do it!" It’s not like he has a job, or a child, or a life of his own.ScenesRachel: Fine! We’ll ask Phoebe.ScenesRoss: No-no-no, I-I wanna play.

rows.Scenes: The Doctor’s office, Dr. Zane is examining Phoebe as Frank and Alice watch.]
rows.Content: Dr. Zane: It looks like your uterus is ready for implantation.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! I knew it! I knew it! I felt really thick this morning.ScenesFrank: Well, okay, so what’s now—go get, go get the eggs, put ‘em in there.ScenesDr. Zane: Okay, it’ll take just a little while to prepare the embryos.ScenesPhoebe: Embryossss? As in, "More than one?ScenesDr. Zane: Um-hmm, five actually.ScenesPhoebe: Five? Okay, where am I giving birth, a hospital or a big box under the stairs?ScenesDr. Zane: We do five because that gives you a 25% chance that at least one will attach.ScenesPhoebe: That’s it! 25 percent? That means that’s it’s like 75 percent chance of no baby at all!ScenesFrank: Hey, y’know I was thinking, what are the odds like if-if, if you stuff like 200 of them in there?ScenesAlice: Sweety, now, she’s a woman, not a gumball machine.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, well y’know what, don’t worry you guys, ‘cause I’m-I’m gonna do this as many times as it takes to get it right.ScenesFrank: Well, you see, the-the thing is, we-we only got, we kinda have one shot to make it right.ScenesAlice: Umm, it costs $16,000 each time you do this. So, umm, we’re kinda using all the money we have to do it just this one time.ScenesPhoebe: Whoa!! That—okay, that’s a lot of pressure on me and my uterus. (to Dr. Zane) So, well okay, so is there—is maybe is there something that I can do y’know just to like help make sure I get pregnant?ScenesDr. Zane: No, I’m sorry.ScenesPhoebe: Wow! You guys really don’t know anything!ScenesFrank: I know! Why don’t you get drunk! That worked for a lot of girls in my high school.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the game is about to begin.]
rows.Content: Monica: You guys! Do you realize that any minute now, Phoebe can be pregnant?ScenesJoey: Huh.ScenesRachel: I know! I know, it’s such a huge, life-altering thing.ScenesJoey: I know.Scenes(They all pause and think about it.)ScenesRoss: The test is ready.ScenesAll: Yeah! Yes! (They all right into the living room, all excited.)ScenesRoss: Okay, each team will answer ten questions. The first team that answers the most questions wins. Okay, the categories are, Fears and Pet Peeves, Ancient History, Literature, and It’s All Relative. Now, the coin toss to see who goes first. (He flips the coin and they all watch it hit the table and stop. Then they all look up at him, to see who goes first.) Okay, somebody call it this time.ScenesAll: Oh yeah!Scenes(Ross flips the coin again.)ScenesRachel: Tails!ScenesRoss: It’s heads. (The guys celebrate.) Gentlemen, pick your category.ScenesChandler: Fears and Pet Peeves.ScenesRoss: What is Monica’s biggest pet peeve?ScenesJoey: Animals dressed as humans.ScenesRoss: That’s correct. Ladies?ScenesMonica: Same category?ScenesRoss: According to Chandler, what phenomenon scares the bejeezus out of him?ScenesMonica: Michael Flatley, Lord of the Dance!ScenesRoss: That is correct.ScenesJoey: (to Chandler) The Irish gig guy?!ScenesChandler: His legs flail about as if independent of his body!ScenesRoss: Gentlemen, you’re pick.ScenesJoey: It’s All Relative.ScenesRoss: Monica and I have a grandmother who died, you both went to her funeral, name that grandmother!ScenesJoey: (to Chandler) Nana?ScenesChandler: She has a real name.ScenesJoey: (answering the question) Althea!ScenesChandler: Althea?! What are you doing?!ScenesJoey: I took a shot.ScenesChandler: You're shooting with Althea?!ScenesRoss: Althea is correct.ScenesChandler: Nice shooting!Scenes(Ross motions for the girls to pick.)ScenesRachel: We’ll take Literature!!ScenesRoss: Every week, the TV Guide comes to Chandler and Joey’s apartment. What name appears on the address label?ScenesRachel: Chandler gets it! It’s Chandler Bing!ScenesMonica: No!!ScenesRoss: I’m afraid the TV Guide comes to Chinandolor Bong.ScenesMonica: I knew that! Rachel! Use you’re head!ScenesChandler: Actually, it’s Miss Chinandolor Bong.

rows.Scenes: The Doctor’s office, Phoebe is giving a pep talk to the petrie dish containing the embryos.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hello, tiny embryos. Well, I’m-I’m Phoebe Buffay, hi! I’m-I’m-I’m hoping to be your uterus for the next nine months. You should know, that we’re doing this for Frank and Alice, who you know, you’ve been there! Umm, y’know they want you so much, so when you guys get in there, really grab on. Okay, and-and I promise that I’ll keep you safe and warm until you’re ready to have them take you home, so… Oh! And also, umm next time you see me, I’m screaming, don’t worry, that’s what’s supposed to happen.ScenesDr. Zane: Ready?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh. (To the embryos) Good luck.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the game is coming to a close.]
rows.Content: Ross: All right, the score is nine to eight in favor of the guys. Ladies if you miss this the game is theirs, pick your category.ScenesRachel: (shouting) It’s All Relative!!ScenesRoss: You don’t have to shout everything.ScenesRachel: (shouting) I’m sorry!ScenesRoss: Ooh. What is the name of Chandler’s father’s Las Vegas all-male burlesque?ScenesMonica: Viva Las Gaygas!ScenesChandler: Unfortunately that is correct.ScenesThe Girls: Yes!!ScenesRoss: All right, we have a tie. Luckily, I have prepared for such an event. (He opens up an envelope and holds up some note cards.) The Lightning Round!ScenesAll: Ohhhh.ScenesRoss: Thirty seconds, all the questions you can answer.ScenesMonica: You guys are dead, I am so good at lighting rounds.ScenesChandler: I majored in lightning rounds. All right, we’re gonna destroy you.ScenesMonica: Huh, wanna bet?ScenesChandler: Well, I’m so confused as to what we’ve been doing so far…ScenesMonica: How about we play for more money, say 150?ScenesRoss: 150 dollars.ScenesChandler: Say 200?ScenesRoss: 200 dollars.ScenesMonica: You’re doing it again.ScenesRoss: Excuse me.ScenesRachel: Monica, I don’t want to lose 200 dollars.ScenesMonica: We won’t. (to Chandler) 300?ScenesRachel: Monica?!ScenesMonica: I’m just trying to spice it up!ScenesRachel: Okay, so let’s play for some pepper! Stop spending my money!ScenesMonica: I got it! How about, if we win, they have to get rid of the rooster?ScenesRachel: Oooohh that’s interesting.ScenesJoey: Hey, no way, that rooster’s family!ScenesRachel: Throw in the duck too!ScenesJoey: What do you have against the duck?! He doesn’t make any noise!ScenesRachel: Well, he gets the other one all riled up.ScenesJoey: Look, we are not gonna…ScenesChandler: (interrupting) All right, hold on! If you win, we give up the birds.ScenesJoey: (shocked) Dah!! (Chandler motions for him to calm down.)ScenesChandler: But if we win, we get your apartment.ScenesJoey: Oooooh!ScenesMonica: Deal!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier, only slightly later.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Monica, betting the apartment, I don’t know about this.ScenesMonica: Rachel, I have not missed one question the whole game. I own this game! Look at my hand. (Holds up her hand.)ScenesRachel: Why? Do you have the answers written on there?ScenesMonica: No! Steady as a rock! Now, are you with me.ScenesRachel: All right, let’s do it.ScenesMonica: Come on!ScenesRachel: Okay. (They go into the living room.)ScenesRoss: All right, gentlemen, you’re up first.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesChandler: Okay. (Starts jumping around.)ScenesRoss: You have 30 seconds. And the lightning round begins—stop it (Chandler stops jumping)—now. What was Monica’s nickname when she was a field hockey goalie?ScenesJoey: Big fat goalie.ScenesRoss: Correct. Rachel claims this is her favorite movie…ScenesChandler: Dangerous Liaisons.ScenesRoss: Correct. Her actual favorite movie is...ScenesJoey: Weekend at Bernie’s.ScenesRoss: Correct. In what part of her body did Monica get a pencil stuck at age 14?ScenesChandler: Oh! (Whispers something in Joey’s ear and then in Ross’s ear.)ScenesRoss: Eww! No!! Her ear! All right, Monica categorizes her towels. How many categories are there?Scenes(They both confer.)ScenesJoey: Everyday use.ScenesChandler: Fancy.ScenesJoey: Guest.ScenesChandler: Fancy guest.ScenesRoss: Two seconds…ScenesJoey: Uhh, 11!ScenesRoss: 11, unbelievable 11 is correct. (The guys celebrate.) All right, that’s 4 for the guys. Ladies, you’re up.ScenesRachel: All right!ScenesMonica: Come on!Scenes(As they change places, they give each other the now patented Ross maneuver. If you don’t know what that means, click here to find out The One With Joey's New Girlfriend.)ScenesRoss: 30 seconds on the clock. 5 questions wins the game. The lightning round begins…now! What is Joey’s favorite food?ScenesMonica: Sandwiches!ScenesRoss: Correct. Chandler was how old when he first touched a girl’s breast?ScenesRachel: 14?ScenesRoss: No, 19.ScenesChandler: Thanks man.ScenesRoss: Joey, had an imaginary childhood friend. His name was?ScenesMonica: Maurice.ScenesRoss: Correct, his profession was?ScenesRachel: Space cowboy!ScenesRoss: Correct! What is Chandler Bing’s job?Scenes(The girls are stumped)ScenesRachel: Oh gosh, it has something to do with numbers.ScenesMonica: And processing.ScenesRachel: He carries a briefcase.ScenesRoss: 10 seconds, you need this or you lose the game.ScenesMonica: It’s umm, it has something to do with transponding.ScenesRachel: Oh-oh-oh, he’s a transponce—transpondster!ScenesMonica: That’s not even a word! I can get this! I can get this!Scenes(Ross stops the clock, signifying the end of the lightning round.)ScenesMonica: NOOOOOOOOO!!!!!ScenesRachel: Oh my God.ScenesChandler and Joey: YEAH!!! YES!!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Joey are carrying in the foosball table.]
rows.Content: Joey: I call Monica’s room!ScenesChandler: You can’t just call Monica’s room.ScenesJoey: Sure I can, standard shotgun rules, I’m sight of the room and I called it.Scenes(Chandler grunts and turns around, sees that he’s in sight of the room, and mouths damn!)ScenesMonica: Man, I feel like I’m coming down with something.ScenesJoey: What?ScenesMonica: Yeah. (to Chandler) I bet you can’t guess what color my tonsils are? I’ll bet the apartment!ScenesChandler: Oh, I would never bet this apartment. It’s too nice.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey—ooh Pheebs, are they in there?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, yeah, uh-huh, they’re implanted.ScenesMonica: How do you feel?ScenesPhoebe: Well, freaked. ‘Cause it turns out that the odds are really sucky. And! This is Frank and Alice’s like only shot. Like, they are literally putting all of their eggs in my basket.ScenesChandler: Yeah, but I bet it works.ScenesMonica: Really?! How much?!ScenesPhoebe: All right, I’m gonna go take a pregnancy test, right now.ScenesJoey: Oh wow! You can tell this soon.ScenesPhoebe: Well the doctor says it takes a couple days, but my body’s always been a little faster than Western medicine.ScenesRachel: (entering from Chandler’s bedroom, I guess, and sees the foosball table.) Oh my God! I can’t believe you guys are actually think you’re moving in here!ScenesChandler: Well believe it baby!ScenesRachel: Well I-I-I’m not moving.ScenesJoey: What?!ScenesRachel: No, it was a stupid bet! We were just playing a game!ScenesJoey: You can’t just ignore the bet! It’s a bet! You bet and you bet and if you lose, you lose the bet!ScenesMonica: Look Rach, we have to move. I mean if they had lost, we would’ve made them get rid of the birds. Right?ScenesRachel: Noooo.ScenesMonica: All right, look, I hate this as much as you, but if it makes you feel better, it’s all your fault.ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesMonica: Chinadolor Bong, come on, we steal that TV Guide every week!ScenesChandler: I knew it!ScenesRachel: I don’t care, I’m not going anywhere.ScenesChandler: Cool, girl roommate.Scenes(Phoebe comes in from the bathroom as Rachel sits down in disgust.)ScenesMonica: Well?ScenesPhoebe: Nope, not knocked up yet.ScenesMonica: It’s only been a couple of hours, so just give it some time.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, all right. Meanwhile, I’m gonna do whatever I can to help this so, I’m just gonna y’know, lie it your chair, (She climbs into the chair and drapes her feet over the back of the chair.) Y'know? Yeah, good, I’m let gravity y’know, do its jobs.Scenes[Cut too later, the moving process is progressing steadily. Monica is trying to lift a heavy box, as Rachel comes in from Chandler’s bedroom.]ScenesMonica: Hey, Rach, can you give me a hand with this box?ScenesRachel: No! Put that box down! We are not going anywhere! This is my apartment and I like it! This is a girl’s apartment! That is a boy’s apartment, it’s dirty and it smells. This is pretty. It’s-it’s so pretty! And look, and it’s-it’s purple! And I’m telling you, you with the steady hand, I am not moving, and now I have got the steady hand. (She holds out her hand, which is shaking uncontrollably.)ScenesMonica: I’ll take care of it.ScenesRachel: That’s right! You do what the hand says!Scenes[Cut to later, Phoebe is still in the chair and Rachel is laying down as Monica enters.]ScenesRachel: How did it go?ScenesMonica: I lost our mattresses.Scenes[Cut to still later, Rachel has now resigned herself to move and is now helping Monica. Phoebe is still on the chair.]ScenesPhoebe: (singing) "Are you in there little fetus? Scenes                             In nine will you come great us? Scenes                             I will buy you some Adidas.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door and Monica answers it.)ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesFrank and Alice: (entering) Hi!ScenesAlice: Hi, Phoebe! We were just at the drugstore and we got you a little present.ScenesPhoebe: Oh. Oh.ScenesFrank: Umm, it’s a lollipop and a uh, a home pregnancy test.ScenesMonica: Hey, don’t mix those up, you could really ruin that lollipop.ScenesAlice: So umm, you feel like taking a test? There’s only one question.ScenesPhoebe: All right, I will. No, I will. But umm, y’know just remember that it’s still really early, okay so, if it says that I’m not pregnant, that doesn’t mean that I’m not gonna get pregnant, okay and, and just please, just so I don’t go completely nuts, just try not put all your hopes on this.ScenesAlice: Okay.ScenesFrank: Okay.
