(Rachel walks away, coughing.)ScenesRoss: (interrupting Monica and Emily) So we should probably get going soon.ScenesEmily: Oh, but the party’s only just getting started!ScenesRoss: Yeah, but we-we have to be at the Four Seasons for drinks in 15 minutes and then y’know, then The Plaza for dinner.ScenesEmily: So why did you plan a party at the same time?ScenesRoss: No-no-no, no, umm, actually American surprise parties are-are-are very short. It’s usually, "Surprise!" And then, "Oh my God, I’m so surprised—good-bye!ScenesEmily: But Ross, I’m such having a great time! Your sister has just been telling me that you used to dress up like little, old ladies and hold make-believe tea parties.ScenesRoss: Monica said that did she? (He squeezes Monica’s knee really hardly and Monica winces in pain.)Scenes[Cut to Joey and Phoebe in the kitchen. Phoebe is watching Joey make a sandwich.]ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, yeah. Then what are you going to put on top of that?ScenesJoey: A little salami.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh yeah! Then umm, what goes on top of the salami?ScenesJoey: Pastrami.ScenesPhoebe: Oooh, yeah. You’re a genius.Scenes(Rachel enters, she has changed clothes.)ScenesRachel: Oh, could somebody give me a hand with this zipper?ScenesJoey: Yeah. (He goes over to her.)ScenesRachel: Up!ScenesMonica: You changed?ScenesRachel: Yeah, I did. I needed my lucky dress.ScenesMonica: And lucky means, more cleavage?ScenesChandler: Does for me.Scenes(Joey starts wiping lint off of her back, but goes at little too far and Rachel just glares at him. He stops, gives her the ‘okay’ symbol and walks away.)ScenesRachel: Ohh, God! Look at him, he’s so cute. I wanna go over there, grab him, and kiss him! How can I kiss him and not letting him know that I like him?ScenesJoey: Oh! I know how you can get him, take off your bra.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesJoey: There was a seen in Footloose...ScenesChandler: Flashdance.ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah, yeah, with that-that uh, plumber girl…ScenesChandler: She was a welder.ScenesJoey: What? Were you like in the movie, or… Anyway, she takes off her bra under her shirt and pulls it out the sleeve. Very sexy, and classy.ScenesMonica: Or if you want to kiss him, umm, you could use mistletoe.ScenesRachel: It’s not Christmas!ScenesMonica: Or Spin the Bottle?ScenesRachel: He’s not 11!ScenesEmily: (with her coat on, she’s leaving with Ross) Thank you so much for this. It was really so thoughtful of you.ScenesRachel: What? You’re leaving?!ScenesRoss: Yes, we have something we have to get to.ScenesJoshua: Uhh, yeah, I think I’m going to take-off too.ScenesRachel: No! You guys can’t leave yet! You have to stay, we-we got the whole big thing planned!ScenesRoss: What big thing?Scenes[Cut to later, the whole group is seated on the floor and Rachel is explaining the rules of Spin the Bottle.]ScenesRachel: (spinning the bottle) So, Spin the Bottle works like this: I spin the bottle, it lands on Gunther, so I would have to kiss Gunther. (She crawls over to where Gunther is sitting and sees the look of anticipation on Gunther’s face and decides not to kiss him.) All right. Who wants to go first?ScenesEmily: I’ll go.ScenesAll: Yay!Scenes(Emily spins the bottle and it lands on Joey.)ScenesJoey: Welcome to America. (They both kiss.)Scenes(Joey spins the bottle and it lands on Emily.)ScenesMonica: Two in a row! You’ve got to use your tongues now! (They kiss again.)ScenesRachel: Yay! Emily!Scenes(Emily spins the bottle and once again, it lands on Joey.)ScenesChandler: What are the odds? What are the odds?Scenes(They both move to kiss again.)ScenesRoss: (stopping them) Okay, that-that’s enough! Y’know, let’s, let’s let someone else play.ScenesJoey: If you didn’t want to play, why did you come to the party?ScenesRachel: Okay, my turn!!Scenes(Rachel spins the bottle and it lands on….wait for it….Joshua. (You thought I was going to say Ross, didn’t you?) Rachel squeals in delight and starts a slow sexy crawl over to Joshua, making sure he and everyone else watching gets a good look at her cleavage.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!! The baby just kicked!ScenesAll: Ohh!ScenesRachel: It’s okay! It’s okay! It kicked once, it’ll kick again!ScenesAll: Oh my God!Scenes(They all stand up and go over to Phoebe to feel the baby, preventing Rachel from kissing Joshua.)ScenesRachel: All right, well, everybody just remember where they were sitting.Scenes(She crawls over to Joshua and kisses the back of his knee. He feels it and looks down, Rachel pretends she’s knocking a bug off his leg.)ScenesRachel: Just a bug.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, it is later in the party. The Spin the Bottle game is over and Chandler is making a sandwich as Phoebe watches.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Y’know it doesn’t matter how much I’m craving it. Y’know why I’m never gonna eat meat? Because it’s murder, cold blooded murder.ScenesChandler: Okay.Scenes(He takes a bite out of the sandwich and as he does so, Phoebe attacks the other end and starts devouring the sandwich.)ScenesChandler: There’s a Phoebe on my sandwich! (He walks away, giving the sandwich to Phoebe.)ScenesJoey: Phoebe, what-what are you doing?!ScenesPhoebe: I can’t help it. I need the meat. The baby needs the meat.ScenesJoey: All right look, y’know how-y’know how when you’re dating someone and you don’t want to cheat on them, unless it’s with someone really hot?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, totally!ScenesJoey: All right. Okay. Well this is the same kind of deal. If you’re going to do something wrong, (He grabs two steaks from the freezer) do it right!Scenes[Cut to later, Phoebe is finishing off her steak.]ScenesJoey: Feel better now?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but at what cost? Six more months, three meals a day, I’m gonna eat like, y’know millions of cows.ScenesJoey: Hey, what if I said, I could even things out for ya, meatwise.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesJoey: Well, I eat a lot of meat right?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Well, suppose until the baby’s born I laid off it. No extra animals would die, you-you’d just be eating my animals.ScenesPhoebe: Joey, I can’t believe you would do that for me.ScenesJoey: Absolutely! I could be a vegetarian. There’s no meat in beer, right?Scenes[Cut to Ross and Emily standing by the foosball table.]ScenesRoss: Okay, we could still make dinner if we skipped the appetisers and asked for our check right away.Scenes(Rachel enters, she has changed once again. This time into her high school cheerleading uniform.)ScenesEmily: But, we can’t go now. It looks like Rachel’s gonna put on a skit.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! Have you lost your mind?ScenesRachel: No-n-n-n-no! I am finally thinking clearly. My lucky dress wasn’t working out to well for me, but for four years, this baby never missed.ScenesMonica: Rachel-Rachel-Rachel I-I cannot, I can’t let—(pause), actually I kinda want to see what happens.ScenesJoshua: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesJoshua: Nice uh, costume.ScenesRachel: Ohh, yeah, well I wanted to give Emily a big American good-bye cheer. So okay! (Runs into the living room) Ready! Okay! Gimme an ‘E!’ScenesAll: E!ScenesRachel: Gimme an ‘M!’ScenesAll: M!ScenesRachel: Gimme an ‘I!’ScenesAll: I!ScenesRachel: Gimme an ‘L!’ScenesAll: L!ScenesRachel: Gimme a ‘Y!’ScenesAll: Y!ScenesRachel: What do you get? (She throws her pom-poms to Joey and Phoebe and performs a cartwheel.) Emily!! (Tries to do another one.) Emil—Whoa!! (She falls in Chandler’s room.) Okay! So that’s me as a cheerleader! Ta-dum! (Gunther’s the only one that claps.)Scenes(Joey and Monica rush over to her.)ScenesJoey and Monica: Are you all right?ScenesRachel: I’m fine! I’m fine! I’m just losing a tooth, it’s no big deal. I have a dentist! Y’know. I’m gonna go put some ice on it. Excuse me. (She goes over to the ice and Joey and Monica follow her.) What do I do now? What do I do now?ScenesMonica: I think you’re done.ScenesJoey: Okay, time to take off the bra. (She glares at him.)ScenesJoshua: Umm, that was really great, but I-I gotta take-off actually.ScenesJoey: (trying not to be obvious) Take the bra off.ScenesRachel: All right, come on, let’s go get your coat.ScenesJoshua: Okay.Scenes(They both go to Chandler’s bedroom to get his coat.)Scenes[Cut to Gunther and Emily.]ScenesGunther: Rachel is my girlfriend.Scenes[Cut to Chandler’s bedroom.]ScenesJoshua: So, this was uh, really fun.ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah! Real fun. (She makes a decision.) Y’know, this bra… Really, bothers me. (She starts taking off her bra.) Y’know, this used to be my bedroom. Yeah. A lot of memories in here, a lot of memories. If these walls could talk, y’know what they’d say? Wanna hear some memories? (She is now violently pulling on her bra in order to remove it, but it isn’t co-operating.)ScenesJoshua: Need uh, need a little hand there.ScenesRachel: Oh no-no-no! No, I got this all under control.ScenesJoshua: You really don’t seem like you do. That’s…Scenes(She is still yanking on the bra, but it is stuck in her sleeve. Finally, she gives up.)ScenesRachel: Ughhhh!! Forget it! (Sits down heavily on the bed.) This is, this is not how this is supposed to happen.ScenesJoshua: Well, what was supposed to happen?ScenesRachel: Can you not look at me when I say this? (He turns around) I thought that if I could get you here, I could seduce you.ScenesJoshua: Huh. Oh, boy! (Sits down next to her.) Uhh, I-I don’t wear suits to work, and I bought six of them from you.ScenesRachel: Well, I’m sorry, I thought you needed them!ScenesJoshua: No, no-no, no-no, my point is that I kept coming back because, I wanted to see you.ScenesRachel: Why?!ScenesJoshua: Because I-I like you.ScenesRachel: You like me?ScenesJoshua: Yeah! I mean you’re-you’re beautiful and smart and sophisticated—a lot of this isn’t based on tonight.ScenesRachel: Yeah but-but-but you liked me! Oh my God, I can’t believe this, all this time, I liked you and you liked me!ScenesJoshua: But…ScenesRachel: Oh no-no-no don’t say but! No-no, but’s never good! Let’s just leave it at, you like me and I like you.ScenesJoshua: Okay uh, however…ScenesRachel: Oh, now see that’s a fancy but.ScenesJoshua: My marriage like just ended, and I’m really not ready to get into anything yet.ScenesRachel: But….ScenesJoshua: I’m sorry, I, I just need a little time.ScenesRachel: Okay.

rows.Scenes: The hallway, Ross is sitting on the step drinking a beer as Rachel comes out of the guys apartment.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ohh, here you are. I was looking for you before. Joshua’s gone so you and Emily are free to go.ScenesRoss: That’s okay. She’s still in there enjoying her fake party and uh, it’s too late to do any of the things I had planned, so…ScenesRachel: Oh, Ross, I’m sorry. I completely ruined your evening.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Well, if it makes you feel any better, I made a fool out of myself.ScenesRoss: Helps a little.ScenesRachel: Is there room on that step for a pathetic loser?ScenesRoss: Yeah, have a seat.ScenesRachel: I’m so sorry.ScenesRoss: That’s okay, I mean it was just two-week thing anyway, I just didn’t want it to end this way, y’know?ScenesRachel: Well, maybe you didn’t want it to end?ScenesRoss: What do you mean?ScenesRachel: You seem to really like her.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I really do. Yeah, but what am I gonna do, I mean we-we both agreed that it was gonna be a two-week thing, y’know no commitment.ScenesRachel: Ross, that girl just spent the entire evening talking to your friends, asking to hear stories about you, looking through Monica’s photo albums, I mean you don’t do that if you’re just in it for two weeks.ScenesRoss: You think?ScenesRachel: Yeah, you got like 14 hours until she has to be at the airport, and you’re sitting here in the hallway with a 28-year-old cheerleader with a fat lip.ScenesRoss: Hey, you’re right.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Thanks. (He starts to go inside and stops.) What photo album was it?ScenesRachel: I don’t know, it was you and a bunch of albino kids.ScenesRoss: Oh my God! Those weren’t albino kids, that was computer camp! Rach! (He hurries inside and Chandler is taking out the garbage.)ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesRachel: You’re a pathetic loser, right?ScenesChandler: Oh-ho, yeah!ScenesRachel: Sit!Scenes(He does so, and immediately starts looking pathetic.)ScenesJoshua: Hi. (He has just returned.)ScenesRachel: Oh my gosh, Joshua!ScenesJoshua: All those things I said about not being ready…ScenesRachel: They’re not true?ScenesJoshua: No, they’re-they’re all true.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesJoshua: But…ScenesRachel: Oh! Oh, I love that but.Scenes(They move to kiss, but realise that Chandler is staring at them. Chandler urges them on.)ScenesRachel: You wanna go inside and have some coffee?ScenesJoshua: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Okay. (Joshua goes inside and to Chandler.) Every time.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, the next day. Phoebe is busy making a sandwich.]
rows.Content: Joey: Oooh, what you got there?ScenesPhoebe: Pastrami.ScenesJoey: Oh-ho-ho, yeah! Hey! Y’know what goes good with that?ScenesPhoebe: Hm-mm, corn beef.ScenesJoey: Ooh, I was gonna say bologna, but that’s much better. How about a little of that smoked turkey?ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesJoey: (He starts looking longingly at the sandwich.) Oh mama! Uh when-when is the baby due?ScenesPhoebe: Six months.ScenesJoey: Ugh. Now if a cow should die of natural causes, I can have one of those right?ScenesPhoebe: Not if I get there first.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Free PornScenesStory by Mark J. Kunerth ScenesTeleplay by Richard Goodman ScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching TV, and we hear Mr. Treeger in the bathroom.]
rows.Content: Mr. Treeger: Ohhh, man!!ScenesJoey: (coming in from his bedroom) What is that?ScenesChandler: Treeger’s snaking the shower drain.ScenesMr. Treeger: What in the name of hell?ScenesJoey: Maybe he found you flip-flop.Scenes(Joey sits down and changes the channel, and we see two people making out.)ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Whoa! Is this porn? What did I do? I must’ve hit something on the remote.ScenesChandler: Do we pay for this?ScenesJoey: No, we didn’t even pay our cable bill—maybe this is how they punish us.ScenesChandler: Maybe we shouldn’t pay our phone bill—free phone sex.ScenesJoey: Maybe we shouldn’t pay our gas bill? (Stops and thinks about what he just said.)ScenesMr. Treeger: (coming in from the bathroom) Whoa, hey, that lady’s all kinds of naked.ScenesChandler: Yeah, Joey just pressed something on the remote and it just, came on!ScenesMr. Treeger: Yeah, it happened to me once. I was just flipping through the channels and bam! It was like finding money.ScenesChandler: Like finding money with naked people on it!ScenesMr. Treeger: Then I made the mistake of turning off the TV, I never got it back again. And I’m sad. (Exits.)ScenesJoey: (to Chandler) Why would he turn off the TV? (Chandler shrugs.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, later that morning. The porn is still on, there are three women getting ready to shave the chest of some guy. Joey and Chandler are wondering why that guy is letting them shave his chest, and Monica and Rachel are eating breakfast at the foosball table.]
rows.Content: Rachel: All right, y’know what, come on, do we really have to watch this while we eat? (She makes a move for the remote.)ScenesJoey and Chandler: (stopping her) Oh no-no-no-no!ScenesChandler: We don’t know what could make this go away.ScenesJoey: Yeah, so no one touches the remote. And no one touches the TV!ScenesChandler: And no one touches the air around the TV!ScenesJoey: Imagine a protective porn bubble if you will, okay?ScenesMonica: Well at least, I’m going to mute it.ScenesJoey and Chandler: Oh no-no-no! (Monica mutes the TV and they tentatively look behind them)ScenesChandler: We still have porn.ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: (entering, carrying her massage table) Hi!ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesRachel: Honey, what are you doing? That’s too heavy.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Give it here. (She takes the table.) Oh, God. (And gives it to Monica right away.)ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, I’m getting too pregnant for this, lugging around a stupid massage table. Y’know, I have to find a job where I carrying a smaller table. (She goes over and stands in front of the TV.)ScenesChandler: Or a job where you don’t have to carry a table.ScenesPhoebe: You mean like a doctor?ScenesJoey: Pheebs! You’re blocking the porn! Look out!ScenesPhoebe: Ohh! (She moves.) Oh my. Oh, that reminds me, I have to see my OB-GYN today.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Ross is entering.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hi.ScenesMonica: Hi.ScenesRoss: So uh, Emily just went to the airport.ScenesMonica: Oh. Why didn’t you take her?ScenesRoss: Eh, her-her uncle already had planned on doing it. And y’know, we-we said our good-byes this morning, so…ScenesMonica: You must feel horrible. Hey! The guys have free porn!ScenesRoss: (Thinks about it.) Nah.ScenesMonica: Hey, cheer up! You’re gonna see her again, right?ScenesRoss: Well I, that’s the thing, I don’t know! I mean, whenever I brought it up with her she said, (In a British accent.) "This is so fantastic! Why do we have to talk about the future? Let’s just enjoy…ScenesMonica: (interrupting him) No-no-no, don’t-don’t do the accent. You’ve got to see her again.ScenesRoss: And why do you care so much?ScenesMonica: Because! You could get to live out my fantasy!ScenesRoss: You had fantasies about Emily?ScenesMonica: No! Y’know, the fantasy! Meet someone from a strange land, fall in madly love, and spend the rest of your lives together.ScenesRoss: Is that why in junior high you were the only one that hung out with that Ukrainian kid?ScenesMonica: Yeah that, plus his mom used to put sour cream on everything!ScenesRoss: Ahh.ScenesMonica: Do you love her?ScenesRoss: We said it was only going to be two weeks, y’know?ScenesMonica: You love her!ScenesRoss: What-what is love really?ScenesMonica: Ohhh, I knew you loved her! Then you need to go to the airport and tell her. You’re probably just gonna catch her just as she’s about to go to the gate. You’re gonna call out her name and say, "I love you!" And she’s gonna say, "I love you, too!" And you guys are going to have the most amazing kiss, everyone at the gate will applaud.ScenesRoss: I am a good kisser.ScenesMonica: Then you two can, can sneak into the cockpit, and things will start to heat up, and then a stewardess comes in… (Ross looks at her.) I’ve been watching too much porn.

rows.Scenes: Beth Israel Medical Center, Phoebe is at her OB-GYN doing an ultrasound, Rachel is with her. We here the baby’s heartbeat.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Is that the heartbeat?ScenesThe Doctor: That’s it.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!ScenesRachel: Oh wow! This is so cool.Scenes(The heartbeat changes, and we hear a different one.)ScenesThe Doctor: Have we talked about the possibility of multiple births?ScenesPhoebe: Why don’t take care of this one, and should I get pregnant again, I’ll hold onto your card, okay?ScenesThe Doctor: No, I’m getting three separate heartbeats.ScenesPhoebe: Three? You guys were worried I wouldn’t even have one!ScenesThe Doctor: Doctors are wrong all the time.ScenesPhoebe: Well, yeah.ScenesRachel: Well, so, are-are you sure that there are three?!ScenesThe Doctor: Definitely. (Points out each head on the ultrasound.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! Oh my God! Oh my God!! So I-I mean so in a few months I’m going to have three full grown babies just walkin’ around inside me?! Oh! Oh! And it’s gonna be one of those log rides where they just come shooting out!ScenesThe Doctor: Actually, giving birth to three babies isn’t that different from giving birth to one.ScenesPhoebe: What do you know?!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is there, waiting to tell Frank and Alice the news.]
rows.Content: Alice: (entering) Oh-oh, Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Ooh! Hi!ScenesAlice: Hi! (She runs over and hugs Phoebe’s stomach.) So, how did it go at the doctors?ScenesPhoebe: Oh well, okay, hey, y’know how when you’re umm, you’re walking down the street and you see three people in a row, and you say, "Oh, that’s nice?ScenesFrank: Yes.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, yeah well, good news, you’re going to have three babies.ScenesAlice: Three babies?ScenesFrank: I finally got my band!ScenesAlice: We’re gonna have a big family, I’ve always wanted a big family!ScenesPhoebe: Oh God, I’m so glad you guys are happy, I was so afraid you were going to be all freaked.ScenesFrank: Why would we be freaked?ScenesPhoebe: No, no maybe ‘cause it’s harder to raise them, and the added expense, and…ScenesFrank: (They’re less than happy now) Oh.ScenesAlice: Right.ScenesPhoebe: No, back to happy. Back to happy!ScenesAlice: No-no-no, no, it’s going to be fine. Because umm, because I teach Home Ec, and uh, I can have 30 kids making baby clothes all year long. Y’know it’ll-it’ll be like my very own little sweatshop.ScenesFrank: Yeah, I’ve been thinking ever since you said we were having triplets, the best thing for me to do is to drop out of college and get a job.ScenesAlice: No, Frank.ScenesPhoebe: No you can’t quit college! No! You’re in college? Really?ScenesFrank: Yeah, refrigerator college.ScenesAlice: Yeah.ScenesFrank: Yeah, y’know when we found out we were going to have a baby, y’know I figured y’know like I should y’know have like a career—and I love refrigerators!ScenesPhoebe: You can’t give up on your dream.ScenesFrank: No, it’s okay. We’re-we’re gonna have three kids! And that’s-that’s a different kind of dream. Three kids and no money.

rows.Scenes: The airport, Emily is getting ready to board her flight to London.]
rows.Content: Ticket Agent: (On the P.A.) This is the boarding call for Flight 009.ScenesRoss: Emily! (Runs up.)ScenesEmily: Oh my God! What are you doing here? (They hug)ScenesRoss: I just, I had to see you one more time before you took-off.ScenesEmily: You are so sweet. (They kiss.)ScenesRoss: That’s, that’s, that’s a big candy bar. (She’s holding one of those huge Toblerone bars.) I had the most amazing time with you.ScenesEmily: Me too.ScenesTicket Agent: This is the final boarding call for Flight 009.ScenesEmily: Well, that’ me. (They kiss again.) Here, have this. (She gives him the candy bar.) I’m only allowed one piece of carryon anyway. (She starts towards the jetway.)ScenesRoss: (stops her) Wait uh, listen. I-I, I have to tell you something. Umm, I’ve been thinking, I’m just gonna come out and say it. Okay? I-I-I ah, I-I think I love you.ScenesEmily: Oh. (She’s shocked and hugs him.) Thank you. (She boards the plane.)ScenesRoss: That’s no problem.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Rachel is singing some kind of song.]
rows.Content: Rachel: What’s that song? It has been in my head all day long.ScenesChandler: It’s the theme from Good Will Humping.ScenesRachel: Y’know who doesn’t even like dirty movies? My new boyfriend Joshua.ScenesJoey: Yeah right.ScenesRachel: No, he told me. He prefers to leave certain things to the imagination.ScenesChandler: Oh-oh, yeah, and did he also say that ah, some of the dialogue was corny and that he actually found it was funny and not sexy?ScenesRachel: Yes!ScenesJoey: Yeah, he likes porn.Scenes(Rachel starts to leave.)ScenesMonica: Where ya going?ScenesRachel: I’m going to find out if he really thinks supermodels are too skinny. (As she exits, Phoebe enters.) Hey, Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesMonica: How did it go with Frank and Alice?ScenesPhoebe: Well, Frank has to quit college because his super fertile sister is having three babies! I need to make a lot of money really fast, and I had an idea that I want to talk to you (Points to Chandler) about, ‘cause you work for a big company. Okay, insider trading, what information is there that you can give me.ScenesChandler: They don’t really talk to us about that kind of stuff. I can get you some free white out though.Scenes(Ross enters.)ScenesMonica: Ohh! Did you do what I said? Did-did-did you tell her?ScenesRoss: I did.ScenesMonica: And well, what did she say?ScenesRoss: Thank you.ScenesMonica: Oh, you’re totally welcome! What’d she say?ScenesRoss: She said, "Thank you." I said, "I love you." And she said, "Thank you.ScenesChandler: Whoa-whoa, wait a minute, did you say, you love her?ScenesJoey: Yeah, what were you trying to get her to do?!ScenesRoss: What do I do now?ScenesJoey: You play hard to get.ScenesRoss: She already lives in London.ScenesJoey: Then you go to Tokyo.ScenesChandler: All right look, forget it, forget it. You told her you love her, it’s over.ScenesMonica: It is not over! You’re over!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: You know!ScenesChandler: Okay. (Pause) Good one.ScenesMonica: It is not over because she is going to call you and tell you she loves you. And the reason why she couldn’t, is because her feelings were so strong, it scared her. Now you go home and wait for her call, she could be calling you from the plane! Come on now go! Go! (Tries to push Ross out the door.)ScenesRoss: Okay! Okay! But if she doesn’t call, it is definitely over! No, wait. Wait. Unless, eventually, I call her, y’know just to she what’s going on, and, and she says she’ll call me back, but then she doesn’t. Then it’s over.Scenes(Joey holds his fist up, and Chandler gives him two thumbs up.)ScenesJoey: Way to be strong, man!Scenes(Ross leaves, and after the door closes, Joey gives him the loser sign.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Joey enter having just woken up.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hi! Listen, can we watch cartoons on your television? We need a porn break. We spent the last two hours watching In & Out & In, Again.ScenesRachel: Well, so, why don’t you just turn it off?ScenesChandler: Because then we would be the guys who turned off free porn.ScenesPhoebe: (entering carrying a case) Ooh, good, you’re hear! Okay.ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesRachel: Well, what-what ‘cha got there?ScenesPhoebe: Oh this, well I’m glad you asked. (She opens the case and removes a knife and an soda can.) Now, don’t you hate it when you have to cut a tin can with an ordinary steak knife? (She efficiently cuts it in half.) Ahh! Now, I know what you’re thinking…ScenesChandler: Pregnant Woman Slays Four?ScenesMonica: Phoebe, they didn’t make you pay for those knives, did they?ScenesPhoebe: No!ScenesMonica: Are you sure?ScenesPhoebe: No!ScenesRachel: Honey, you’re not gonna make enough money to help Frank and Alice just by selling knives.ScenesPhoebe: No-no, I know that, but I just have to make enough money for the second part of my plan.ScenesChandler: What’s the second part of your plan?ScenesPhoebe: My Saturn dealership.

rows.Scenes: Ross’s bedroom, he has fallen asleep waiting for Emily to call. He is awaken by the phone.]
rows.Content: Ross: (Answers the phone.) Hello?ScenesEmily: Ross.ScenesRoss: Emily, hi! Uh, how-how was you flight?ScenesEmily: It was dreadful. I felt terrible about how I acted when you said those wonderful things.ScenesRoss: No, no, that-that, that’s all right. Umm, I’m just glad you called.ScenesEmily: Ross umm, there’s something that I’ve got to tell you, there’s-there’s someone else.ScenesRoss: Does that mean the same thing in England as it does in America?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Ross is relating his recent conversation with Emily to the gang.]
rows.Content: Ross: She doesn’t know which one of us she wants, me or this Colin guy.ScenesMonica: This isn’t how it’s supposed to go, there can’t be another guy.ScenesRoss: Well…ScenesMonica: Of course there’s another guy!! This is even more perfect! Now you have to prove your love!ScenesRoss: I’m not proving anything. Okay, I’m done listening to you. If I hadn’t let you talk me into going to the airport in the first place, I never would’ve put my fist through the wall!ScenesChandler: You put your fist through the wall?ScenesRoss: No, I missed and hit the door. But, it opened really hard!ScenesMonica: You have to go to London!ScenesRoss: What?ScenesMonica: Yeah, you have to go fight for her!ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, sure, that makes sense. Yeah. ‘Cause you already told her you love her and she didn’t say it back, then she called you and told you that there’s another guy, so yeah, go to London that’ll scare her!ScenesMonica: When Rachel was with Paulo, what did you do?ScenesRoss: I made fun of his accent.ScenesMonica: You sat back and let him have her, you didn’t fight at all. Am I right? Do you want the same thing to happen with Emily?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesMonica: All right then, go fight for her! Go to London! I mean, that could be you and Emily! (Points to the TV.) That, but-but nicer. Just, go to London!ScenesRoss: Really?ScenesMonica: Come on! Surprise her! Show up at her doorstep! Don’t let her go without a fight!ScenesRoss: All right. All right, I’m gonna do it!ScenesMonica: All right.ScenesRoss: I’m gonna, I’m gonna go to London and I’m going to fight for her.ScenesMonica: Okay, good luck!Scenes(Ross starts to leave.)ScenesJoey: Ross! Ross! If you’re going to the airport, could you pick me up another one of those Toblerone bars? (Chandler nods his head no.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Joey, and Chandler are sitting and talking as Phoebe and Rachel enter.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Ooh-Ooh! I did it! I did it! I figured out a way to make money! I’m gonna open up my own massage place and Frank’s gonna help me! And! We can work it around his schedule so he doesn’t have to quit school!ScenesMonica: That’s sounds great, but how are you going to afford it?ScenesRachel: Well, we were walking down the street and we saw that van that you guys used for catering and we realised…ScenesPhoebe: I’m telling it! I’m telling it!ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. You know how people need transportation, but they also need massages to help them relax so I just figured we could combine the two, okay, I give the massages and Frank drives! I can fix up the van, bolt the table in the back, and you know what I’ve got?ScenesChandler: A place where no one will ever get out alive?ScenesPhoebe: No! Think about it, it’s a taxi that people take when they need to relax, it’s…ScenesRachel: (interrupting) Relaxi-Taxi!ScenesPhoebe: The name was my favourite part!ScenesRachel: Well, well I can up with it!ScenesPhoebe: YOU DID NOT!!!! Oh! No! You came up with Relaxi Cab! That’s not good.ScenesRachel: Well, I…Scenes(The phone rings and Monica answers it.)ScenesMonica: Hello.ScenesRoss: (on phone) Hey.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! Ross, are you in England? Was Emily surprised?Scenes[Cut to Ross in one of those British phone booths.]ScenesRoss: No, because she hasn’t come home yet. And she hasn’t been home all night! She’s obviously staying with that other guy, and I’m the stupid moron who spent the whole night outside her apartment!ScenesMonica: All right. When is, when is the next flight out?ScenesRoss: About four hours.ScenesMonica: Okay, just stay there a couple more hours and if she doesn’t show up by then, then just come on home.ScenesPhoebe: Hey, tell him about Relaxi-Taxi, and-and ask him if he thinks that’s better than Relaxi Cab.ScenesRachel: Okay, it’s not Relaxi Cab. It’s Relaxicab, like taxicab.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, that is better.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, later that same night. There is a knock on the door and Chandler answers it to reveal Emily standing behind it.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Are we in London?ScenesMonica: What are you doing here? You can’t be here!ScenesEmily: I’ve uh, I’ve come to talk to Ross.Scenes(She sets her bag down on the foosball table and Joey sees the Toblerone bar sticking out of it and gazes longingly at it.)ScenesEmily: What?ScenesJoey: (pause) Nothing. No, nothing.ScenesEmily: I was going to call him, but…ScenesMonica: Oh, you came to tell him you love him! I knew it! (Points at Chandler) I was right! (Points to Emily) I’m right, right?ScenesEmily: I’d really rather talk to him.ScenesMonica: Oh.ScenesEmily: I uh, I’ve been to his apartment and he wasn’t there, and uh. I need to talk to him, so do you have any idea where he is?Scenes[Cut to London, we sit Ross sitting outside Emily’s apartment. We hear Emily’s phone ring with amazing clarity. Apparently, sound travels quite easily through the walls of British buildings. Anyhoo, Ross looks around for the ringing phone and in the meantime Emily’s answering machine picks up and once again with amazing clarity we hear Emily say…]ScenesEmily: Ross, are you there? Ross, I don’t know if you can hear this but… (Ross has moved to the window, apparently so that he can hear better.) I’m gonna talk anyway, uh, I’m in the States with you sister and your friends and it’s all over with Colin. I came here to tell you that, and to tell you—Yes, Joey you can have all the chocolate you want, just take it! Uh, I came here to tell you that I love you.ScenesRoss: (yelling, thinking Emily can hear him through the answering machine all the way to New York.) I love you too! I’m, I’m gonna call you right now from the phone booth! (Realises) You can’t hear me. (Goes to make his call.)ScenesEmily: I wish I could know if you’d heard any of that. I suppose I’ve either just told you I love you or given my neighbours a good laugh. Mrs. Newman if you’re listening, bugger off this in none of your business. I suppose there’s not much chance you did heard that, and there’s the call waiting so, I should go. Oh well. (Answers the call waiting.) Hello.ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesEmily: Ross, I love you!ScenesRoss: Ohh! Thank you.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey is still watching the porn as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesChandler: I was just at the bank, and there was this really hot teller, and she didn’t ask me to go do it with her in the vault.ScenesJoey: Same kind of thing happened to me! Woman pizza delivery guy come over, gives me the pizza, takes the money, and leaves!ScenesChandler: What, no, "Nice apartment, I bet the bedrooms are huge?ScenesJoey: Noo! Nothing!ScenesChandler: Y’know what, we have to turn off the porn.ScenesJoey: I think you’re right.Scenes(Goes over and picks up the remote.)ScenesChandler: All right, ready?ScenesJoey: One.ScenesChandler: Two.ScenesBoth: Three.Scenes(Chandler turns off the porn and sets the remote down.)ScenesJoey: That’s kinda nice.ScenesChandler: Yeah, that’s kinda a relief.ScenesJoey: Yeah.Scenes(Pause.)ScenesChandler: You wanna see if we still have it?ScenesJoey: Yeah.Scenes(Chandler turns on the TV and…)ScenesChandler: FREE PORN!!!ScenesJoey: Yeah!!ScenesChandler: We have free porn here!!!ScenesEndScenesThe One With Rachel’s New DressScenesTeleplay by: Jill Condon & Amy ToominScenesStory by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey and Chandler are there as Phoebe enters carrying a drum.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey! Wow, it is true what they say, pregnant bellies look like a drum.ScenesPhoebe: (not amused) Ha-ha. (She sits down on the couch.) No, it’s just I’m so pregnant that I—my guitar doesn’t fit anymore. So I thought ‘til I’m not, I’m just gonna play all my songs on this drum. It sounds really cool!ScenesChandler: All right.ScenesPhoebe: Listen. Listen. (She starts to play and sing.) Smelly cat, smelly cat, what are they feeding you?ScenesJoey: Wow, Pheebs! That sounds great!ScenesPhoebe: I know! I know, and I’ve only been playing for like an hour!ScenesAlice: (entering) Phoebe! Phoebe! Hi! Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! What are you doing here?ScenesAlice: Umm, actually, I came down to ask you a big favour.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, well, don’t tell me you want to keep more of your stuff in my uterus.ScenesAlice: (laughs) No. No. No. (Sits down.) Okay, now, see, I wanna name the girl baby Leslie, and Frank wants to name one of the boy babies Frank JR. JR.ScenesChandler: Wouldn’t that be Frank the III?ScenesAlice: Don’t get me started. (To Phoebe) Anyway, umm, since there are three babies and umm, we both got to put our names in, we would be truly honoured if you named the other boy baby.ScenesPhoebe: Wow! That’s so great! Oh! Oh! Cougar.ScenesAlice: You think about it. (Leaves)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Ross’s apartment, he and Emily are getting ready to go to the airport.]
rows.Content: Emily: I left a bra drying on the shower rod, you don’t think your son will think it’s yours and be horribly traumatised?ScenesRoss: Hey, if mommy can have a wife, daddy can have a bra.ScenesEmily: (checks the clock) Ohh, it’s time to go.ScenesRoss: Oh, no-no-no, see, that-that clock’s a little fast, uh, we have 17 minutes. Huh, what can we do in 17 minutes? Twice?ScenesEmily: Well that’s ambitious.Scenes(They kiss but are interrupted by a knock on the door.)ScenesRoss: Hey, uh, you can ignore that.ScenesEmily: That’s Carol with your son!ScenesRoss: Uhh, believe me when he’s older, he’ll understand.ScenesCarol: (knocking on the door) Ross!ScenesRoss: I’ll be right there. (He goes over and opens the door to Carol, Susan, and Ben.) (To Ben.) Hello! (To Carol.) Hello! (To Susan.) Hey. Uhh, Emily, this is Carol and Susan.ScenesSusan: Hey, it’s so nice to finally meet you!ScenesEmily: Me too!ScenesCarol: Ohh, y’know, Susan’s gonna be shooting a commercial in London next week.ScenesSusan: Oh yeah, I’m so excited, I’ve never been there.ScenesEmily: Oh, well, I’ll show you around.ScenesSusan: That would be great! Also, uh, I was hoping to catch a show so if you can make any suggestions…ScenesEmily: Oh, there’s tonnes of terrific stuff—I’ll go with you!ScenesSusan: Ahh!Scenes(Ross accidentally, on purpose, bumps into Susan.)ScenesRoss: Look at you two, bonding, making us late for the airport so…ScenesEmily: Are you all right?ScenesSusan: Oh, he’s fine. He’s fine. It’s just that us getting along is difficult for him, because he doesn’t like me.ScenesRoss: Oh come on! That’s-that’s… true.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Chandler are playing foosball as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hi!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey! Do we have a baby name yet?ScenesPhoebe: Ugh! No! This is so hard! I went through this whole book (Holds up a book) and found nothing! I want a name that’s really like, y’know strong and confident, y’know? Like-like Exxon.ScenesChandler: Well, it certainly worked for that Valdez kid.ScenesJoey: Ooh-ooh, Pheebs, you want a strong name? How about, The Hulk?ScenesPhoebe: No, I’m-I’m not sure about Hulk, but I like the idea of a name starting with "The.ScenesJoey: Oh, want a good name, go with Joey. Joey’s your pal. Joey’s your buddy. "Where is everybody?" "Well, they’re hanging out with Joey.ScenesChandler: Hey, y’know what, if you’re gonna do that, if you’re gonna name him Joey, you should name him Chandler. (Phoebe doesn’t think so.) Oh, come on! Chandler’s funny, sophisticated, and he’s very loveable, once you get to know him.ScenesJoey: Oh well, hey, Joey’s loveable too! But the thing about Joey is, if you need him, he’ll be there.ScenesChandler: Well, Chandler will be there for you too. I mean, well, he might be a little late, but-but, he’ll be there. And he’ll bring you some cold soda, if want you need him for is that you’re really hot.ScenesJoey: What do ya say? What do ya say?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I, I like the idea of naming him after someone I love, and Joey and Chandler are great names. (They both stare at her.) But, all right, I don’t—maybe I’ll just name him The Hulk.ScenesJoey: I knew I shouldn’t have mentioned it! That’s what I wanted to name my kid!

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Monica is cooking and Rachel is getting ready for a date with Joshua.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey, Mon, if you were hoping to sleep with Joshua the first time tonight, which one of these would you want to be wearing. (She’s holding two frilly, lace nighties.)ScenesMonica: Y’know what? It really creeps me out choosing other people’s sex clothes.ScenesRachel: Sorry. I’m so exited! I’ve been waiting for this for months! I got my hair coloured! I got new sheets! I’m making him a very fancy meal.ScenesMonica: Um-hmm.ScenesRachel: What am I making him by the way?ScenesMonica: Well, you’re making him a frieze salad with goat cheese and pine nuts, wild nuts, wild rice, roast asparagus, and salmon au croup.ScenesRachel: I thought I was making him filet mignon?ScenesMonica: Yeah, you were, but you decided to make salmon because you had some left over at the restaurant. And then you realised if you (Points at Rachel) bitched about it, then you (Points to herself) would stop cooking, and you (Points at Rachel) would have to make your famous baked potato and Diet Coke.ScenesRachel: Wow, I really get crabby when I cook.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Chandler, and Phoebe are there as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRoss: So uh, Emily called last night…ScenesChandler: And now you’re giving me the message!ScenesRoss: Turns out them Emily is just crazy about Susan. Yeah, they’re going to the theatre together! They’re going to dinner! They’re going horseback riding!ScenesPhoebe: God, Susan is so fun!ScenesRoss: Look, this is just a little too familiar, okay? For like, for like six months before Carol and I spilt up, all I heard was: "My friend Susan is so smart. My friend Susan is so funny. My friend Susan is so great.ScenesChandler: You actually think that something can happen between Emily and Susan?ScenesRoss: Hey, they’re going to the gym together! Two women! Stretching! Y’know they-they take a steam together! Things get a little playful—didn’t you see Personal Best?ScenesJoey: No, but I’m gonna!ScenesChandler: Hi! Hi! You’re crazy! Okay? This is Emily. Emily is straight.ScenesRoss: How do you know? I mean we thought Carol was straight before I married her!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I definitely. I don’t like the name Ross.ScenesRoss: What a weird way to kick me when I’m down.ScenesPhoebe: No! No! I-I meant for the baby!ScenesRoss: Oh. What’s wrong with Ross?ScenesPhoebe: Well, it’s just y’know that something like this would never to like The Hulk, y’know…ScenesRoss: Actually that-that’s not true, in The Incredible Hulk uh, No. 72, Dr. Bruce Banner found… (Sees everyone staring at him and stops.) Y’know, ugh, nevermind, my girlfriend’s a lesbian. (Leaves.)ScenesPhoebe: So, I decided I’m definitely going to go with either Joey or Chandler.ScenesJoey: Oh! Oh-oh, you gotta pick Joey! I mean, name one famous person named Chandler.ScenesChandler: Raymond Chandler.ScenesJoey: Someone you didn’t make up!ScenesChandler: Okay, there are no famous Joey’s. Except for, huh, Joey Buttafucco.ScenesJoey: Yeah, that guy really hurt us.ScenesPhoebe: Well, how about a compromise then, okay? What if it’s like y’know, Chanoey?ScenesChandler: Okay, look, Joey! Come on, think about it, first of all, he’ll never be President. There’s never gonna be a President Joey.ScenesJoey: All right look man, I didn’t want to bring this up, but Chandler, is the stupidest name I ever heard in my life! It’s not even a name; it’s barely even a word. Okay? It’s kinda like chandelier, but it’s not! All right? It’s a stupid, stupid non-name!ScenesChandler: Wow, you’re, you’re right. I have a horrible, horrible name.ScenesJoey: I’m sorry man, I didn’t—I’m-I’m sorry. I’m sorry. (Goes over and comforts him.)ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesJoey: So I guess it’s Joey then!

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is on her dinner date with Joshua.]
rows.Content: Joshua: This is so nice. Thank you for doing this.ScenesRachel: Ohh, please! Cooking soothes me. (They kiss.) Ahh. So, dig in!ScenesJoshua: Great! Oh, it all looks sooo good!ScenesRachel: (taking a bite) Hmmm!ScenesJoshua: Oh my God!ScenesRachel: Oh I know, my God, this is so—this rice is so—I am so good.ScenesJoshua: Behind you?ScenesRachel: (sees the chick and the duck) Oh, yeah, I’m sorry. They used to live here; sometimes they migrate back over.ScenesJoshua: (getting up and backing away from they.) Is there ah, is there some way they can not be here. It’s just ah, farm birds really kinda freak me out!ScenesRachel: Yeah, sure, okay. Okay.Scenes(Rachel gets up and ushers them into the hall, as they pass Joshua, he leaps onto the counter to avoid them. Rachel drops them off in the hall, and knocks on Joey’s door.)ScenesJoey: (answering the door.) Hey, how did you do that?! Come on in. (He brings them inside.)Scenes[Cut back to Rachel’s date.]ScenesRachel: All gone! So, farm birds, huh?ScenesJoshua: Yeah, it’s-it’s my only weird thing, I swear. And I-I-I would’ve told you about it, but I didn’t know they would be here.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesJoshua: So, all right.Scenes(They both sit back down.)ScenesRachel: Okay. So, can I serve you a little of—What? What? What? (She sees that Joshua isn’t relaxed.)ScenesJoshua: Nothing I uh, it’s just that I know that they’re still out there.ScenesRachel: But, they’re across the hall! I mean that’s two doors away, it would take them a long time to peck their way back over here.ScenesJoshua: Okay, that’s-that’s not funny. Uhh.ScenesRachel: Okay, y’know, would you feel better if we went someplace else? I mean we could pack all this stuff up and y’know go to your apartment.ScenesJoshua: Oh, they’re working on this week, it’s a total mess. But uh, I’m staying at my parents’ house, we could go there.ScenesRachel: Your parents’?ScenesJoshua: Yeah, they’re out of town.ScenesRachel: Ohh.ScenesJoshua: Yeah-yeah, it’s this huge place, and-and it’s got this gorgeous view of the park, and very, very romantic. What do you say?ScenesRachel: Yeah that works.Scenes(He moves to kiss her, but stops when he hears the duck.)ScenesJoshua: They-they-they can smell fear.

rows.Scenes: Ross’s apartment, Carol has come to pick up Ben.]
rows.Content: Ross: (opening the door.) Hey!ScenesCarol: Hey! How’s Ben?ScenesRoss: Well, I asked him if he wanted to eat, he said, "No." I asked him if he wanted to sleep, he said, "No." I asked him what he wanted to do, he said, "No." So, he’s sweeping. (We see Ben playing with a broom and a dustpan.)ScenesCarol: Hey, Ben! Hey!ScenesRoss: So umm, any word from Susan?ScenesCarol: Ooh, yeah! She said she’s having sooo much fun with Emily.ScenesRoss: Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Uh, by the by, did it uh, did it ever occur to you that, I don’t know, maybe they might be having a little too much fun?ScenesCarol: What’s too much fun?ScenesRoss: Y’know, the kind of fun, you and Susan had when we were married.ScenesCarol: Oh my God, you are so paranoid!ScenesRoss: Am I?!ScenesCarol: Yes!ScenesRoss: Am I?!ScenesCarol: I can’t speak for Emily, but Susan is in a loving, committed relationship.ScenesRoss: Uh-huh, Carol, so were we. All right, just-just imagine for a moment, Susan meets someone and-and they really hit it off. Y’know? Say-say they’re coming back from the theatre, and they-they stop at a pub for a couple of drinks, they’re laughing, y’know, someone innocently touches someone else… There’s electricity, it’s new. It’s exciting. Are you telling me there isn’t even the slightest possibility of something happening?ScenesCarol: Maybe.ScenesRoss: OH MY GOD!! I didn’t really believe it until you just said it!!

rows.Scenes: Joshua’s parents’ apartment, Rachel and Joshua are entering.]
rows.Content: Joshua: …and even though none of the other kids believed me, I swear to God, that duck pushed me!ScenesRachel: Wow! This place is fabulous!ScenesJoshua: Yeah, yeah, let me show you around. This is the uh, downstairs living room.ScenesRachel: Whoa-whoa, there’s two living rooms? God, growing up here, this place must’ve been a real babe magnet.ScenesJoshua: Yeah, well, it would’ve been, but uh, my parents just moved here.ScenesRachel: Ohh, you should know, this place is a real babe magnet. Wanna make out?Scenes(They kiss.)ScenesJoshua: Hey, here’s an idea. Why don’t uh, I put the food in the fridge and we can eat it later?ScenesRachel: That sounds like a plan. Umm, is there a place I can go freshen up?ScenesJoshua: Oh yeah, yeah uh, it’s down the hall and uh, second door to your left.ScenesRachel: Ah.Scenes(She goes down the hall. Joshua goes to put the food away when his parents walk in.)ScenesMrs. Burgin: Oh, hi, darling!ScenesJoshua: Mom, Dad, what are you guys doing here?ScenesMrs. Burgin: Oh, well we cut the trip short.ScenesMr. Burgin: France sucks!ScenesJoshua: Umm, this may be a little weird, but I-I-I got a date here.ScenesMrs. Burgin: Oh, say no more!ScenesMr. Burgin: We’ll just grab some food and take it with us right upstairs, and we’ll be right out of you hair.ScenesJoshua: Oh, that-that would be great. So you didn’t even get to Italy?ScenesMr. Burgin: Yep, sucks!Scenes(They all go into the kitchen. Just then, Rachel comes back from the bathroom; she had removed her dress and is wearing nothing but a lace nightie. She tries to find someplace seductive to wait for Joshua. She tries to sit on the piano, but it makes too much noise. So she goes over to the couch and kinda half lays down to wait for Joshua. Joshua comes in from the kitchen, sees Rachel, and freezes.)ScenesRachel: Hi you!ScenesJoshua: Oh my God!ScenesRachel: I know, I can do more than cook.Scenes(Just then, his parents enter. Rachel gasps.)ScenesMr. Burgin: I like her. She sees smart.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Joshua’s parents’ apartment, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Joshua: Uhh, Rachel, my parents…ScenesRachel: Ohh! It’s so nice to meet you. (She goes over and shakes their hands.) Hello.ScenesMr. Burgin: Hi.ScenesRachel: Hello.ScenesMrs. Burgin: Hello. Well, Joshua, that $500 was for groceries.ScenesRachel: What? This-this, no, oh no, no-no-no, this is not—that’s-that’s not what it is. See, see, okay, I work in fashion, see and-and, this is a real dress actually. It’s-it’s, they’re-they’re wearing it in Milan, so part of my job is too wear the clothes, and then I see how people respond, and then I report back to my superiors at Bloomingdale’s, so… And obviously in uh, in-in this case, (She grabs a pen and paper) I am going to report back, "USA not ready.ScenesMrs. Burgin: Maybe in L.A?ScenesRachel: Yes!ScenesJoshua: There you go.ScenesMr. Burgin: So, have you kids eaten yet?ScenesRachel: Well, we were going to do that after—I mean umm, next.ScenesMr. Burgin: Well, we’re starving, why don’t we all go get something to eat?ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah, well… Yeah, no use wasting this baby, just lyin’ around the house.ScenesMr. Burgin: So… We go eat.ScenesRachel: Yes.ScenesMr. Burgin: You’ll wear that. We’ll be eating, and of course, you’ll be wearing that.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is looking for a new name in Phoebe’s book of names.]
rows.Content: Joey: Dude, I am sorry about what I said!ScenesChandler: No, no, you’re right, it is a ridiculous name!ScenesJoey: It’s not that bad.ScenesChandler: Yes it is! From now on, I have no first name.ScenesJoey: So, you’re just Bing?ScenesChandler: I have no name.ScenesPhoebe: All right, so, what are we supposed to call you?ScenesChandler: Okay uh, for now, temporarily, you can call me, Clint.ScenesJoey: No way are you cool enough to pull of Clint.ScenesChandler: Okay, so what name am I cool enough to pull off?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, Gene.ScenesChandler: It’s Clint. It’s Clint! (He heads for his bedroom.)ScenesJoey: See you later, Gene.ScenesPhoebe: Bye, Gene.ScenesChandler: It’s Clint! Clint!ScenesJoey: What’s up with Gene?

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is telling Phoebe and Monica of her date.]
rows.Content: Monica: So, you wore your nightie to dinner?ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah. And uh, the best part though, when the uh, waiter spilled water down my back, I jumped up, and my boob popped out.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!ScenesMonica: Oh, no!ScenesRachel: No, it’s all right. I got nice boobs. (Phoebe and Monica nod there heads in agreement.)ScenesRoss: (returning from the phone.) So, I just picked up a message from Emily, she and Susan are going to a poetry reading together!ScenesRachel: So?ScenesRoss: So! Poetry? Susan’s gay! They’re being gay together!ScenesMonica: Emily’s straight.ScenesRoss: Oh, wake up!ScenesPhoebe: Wow, Carol really messed you up!ScenesRoss: Excuse me?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, she turned you into this-this-this untrusting, crazy, jealous, sycophant. (They all look at her.) All right, so I don’t know what sycophant means, but the rest is right.ScenesRoss: Look, I don’t know what you’re talking about, I am not a crazy, jealous person.ScenesRachel: Huh.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: She’s totally right! When we were together, you got all freaked out about Mark and there was nothing going on.ScenesMonica: This totally makes sense!ScenesRoss: It does not!ScenesMonica: Oh, sure it does! In high school, you weren’t jealous at all even though all your girlfriends were cheating on you!ScenesPhoebe: All right, all right, so up until ‘92-93 he was very trusting, then ’94 hit, Carol left him and bamn! Paranoid city!ScenesRachel: Absolutely! Absolutely!ScenesMonica: This is so much fun!ScenesRoss: This is not fun!ScenesMonica: Look, all we’re trying to say is, don’t let what happened with Carol ruin what you got with Emily.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. The ’92 Ross wouldn’t.ScenesRoss: Well, I still think I was right about that whole Mark thing.ScenesRachel: What—yeah—what, y’know what? I hope Emily is a lesbian.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Phoebe is showing off more of her drum skills to Joey by rubbing one of the sticks back and forth across the drum.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Drum roll.ScenesChandler: (entering) Okay. Okay. All right. Help! Am I a Mark, or a John?ScenesJoey: Nah, you’re not tall enough to be a Mark, but you might make a good Barney.ScenesChandler: All right look, am I serious, okay? Tomorrow at 3:30 I am going down to the courthouse.ScenesPhoebe: You’re actually going through with this?ScenesChandler: Hey, look, this name has been holding me back my entire life. Okay, it’s probably why kids picked on me in school, and why I never do well with women… So, as of 4 o’clock tomorrow, I’m either gonna be Mark Johnson or John Markson.ScenesPhoebe: You got problems because of you! Not your name! All right, this has got to stop! Chandler is a great name! In fact—yes, (To Joey) I’m, I’m sorry. I know you really wanted me to name the baby Joey, but eh, so, I’m-I’m, I’m gonna, I’m gonna name the baby Chandler.ScenesChandler: (pleased) Really?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but you have to keep the name too!ScenesChandler: Okay. Thanks.ScenesPhoebe: Okay!ScenesChandler: You wanna hug it out?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah!Scenes(They both hug.)ScenesPhoebe: Yay!ScenesChandler: Yay!ScenesPhoebe: Yay—oh—yay! Okay, I gotta go tell Frank and Alice! Right now!ScenesChandler: Okay!ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, uh… (She grabs her coat and runs out.)ScenesChandler: Bye, Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, bye!Scenes(She exits, and after the door is closed, Chandler turns to Joey and…)ScenesChandler: Ha! Ha! Ha!ScenesJoey: Ohh! (Realises it was all a trick to get Phoebe to name the baby Chandler.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: The Airport, Carol and Ross are waiting for Emily and Susan to deplane. A gorgeous woman walks by and they both turn to watch her go.]
rows.Content: Ross: Nice luggage.ScenesCarol: I was gonna say…Scenes(Susan and Emily get off.)ScenesSusan: Hey!Scenes(They both run and hug they’re respective partners.)ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesEmily: Hey! I missed you.ScenesRoss: Oh, I missed you too.ScenesSusan: (To Emily) Thanks for everything, I had such a great time.ScenesEmily: Oh, so did I.Scenes(They hug and give each other a little peck on the cheek.)ScenesRoss: (To Carol) No tongue. (And gives her the thumbs up.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With All The HasteScenesWritten by: Wil Calhoun & Scott SilveriScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s bedroom; Rachel is awoken by a man singing in the next apartment.]
rows.Content: The Singing Man: (singing, duh) Morning’s here! Sunshine is here! The sky is clear, the morning’s here! The morning’s here!ScenesRachel: HEY!! Do you have to do that? It’s Saturday!ScenesThe Singing Man: Oh come on! Morning’s here! (Starts singing) Morning’s here! The morning is here! Sunshine is here!Scenes(Rachel slams shut her window and storms into the living room, where Joey and Monica are eating breakfast.)ScenesRachel: I hate this apartment! I hate the color of these walls! I hate the fact that this place still smells like bird! I hate that singing guy!ScenesJoey: Are you kidding? I love that guy! (Starts singing) Morning’s here! Morning is here—ScenesRachel: Stop it! I will kill you. I hate the fact that my room is so small.ScenesMonica: Hey, I have all the space I need. Just do what I did.ScenesRachel: Monica, you don’t even have a bed, you sleep in a ball on the floor!ScenesMonica: Y’know what? I am really tired of your bellyaching! Okay, I-I worked really hard at making this a nice place for us to live!ScenesRachel: I’m sorry. I’m so sorry.ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesJoey: See, this is a great apartment.ScenesMonica: Shut up! This place is a hole!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Ross’s bedroom; Ross and Emily are making out. Ross as a new feature.]
rows.Content: Emily: Oh, blimey, I still can’t believe you’ve got an earring!Scenes(Yep, it’s a little gold loop.)ScenesRoss: Huh? I know, I know. Who am I? David Bowe? (Shakes his head around, pretending like he’s jamming.)ScenesEmily: He does that?!ScenesRoss: Uh, I don’t know, whatever.ScenesEmily: I think it makes you look really dangerous.ScenesRoss: Oh, I know. Y’know what, I never would’ve gotten this if it weren’t for you. No really, when I’m with you I’m-I’m like this whole other guy, I love that guy! I mean, I love you too, a lot, but that guy! I-I love that guy!ScenesEmily: I love both of you!ScenesRoss: Yeah?Scenes(They kiss.)ScenesEmily: I wish I didn’t have to go.ScenesRoss: Then don’t. Stay here. Just don’t go so soon to London, just one more day.ScenesEmily: Ohh, Ross, please!ScenesRoss: One more day, seriously/ScenesEmily: Don’t do this to me, again. You’d know I’d stay here in a minute, but I’d really miss so much work, they’ll fire me.ScenesRoss: So, then you can stay as long as you want.ScenesEmily: I wish I could.ScenesRoss: Oh no. Don’t, don’t, don’t start packing. Come on! (She puts some clothes into her bag, and Ross throws them out.)ScenesEmily: I don’t think you understand packing. Look, I just don’t want to leave it to the last minute. Last time I left in such a rush, I left my knickers here.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I know, I uh, I tried them on.ScenesEmily: You didn’t!ScenesRoss: No. No, I didn’t. I didn’t want to be that guy.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Chandler are watching one of those Kung Fu movies and imitating the moves.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (entering, wearing Santa pants) Hello!ScenesChandler: Ho! Ho! Ho!ScenesPhoebe: Excuse me.ScenesChandler: Your pants!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yeah! You like ‘em? I just, I went to a used clothes store and got a bunch of maternity stuff. These are sooo comfortable!ScenesJoey: Uhh, Pheebs, those are uh, those are Santa pants.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesChandler: Santa pants. (Phoebe still doesn’t get it.) Santa Claus’s pants.ScenesPhoebe: Nuh-uh! They’re maternity pants. They even came with a list of baby names. (Pulls out a sheet of paper which lists who’s been naughty and who’s been nice.) See, these names are good, and these names are bad. (Finally, she figures it out.) Ohh.ScenesRachel: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey!ScenesRachel: So—Hey, Pheebs! So, how are the elves?ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know! How are the-the-the-the, y’know—You’re clothes aren’t funny.ScenesMonica: Hey, guys, what-what should I wear to a Knicks game?ScenesChandler: Uhh, a T-shirt that says, "I don’t belong here.ScenesJoey: You have Knicks tickets?ScenesRachel: Yeah, my mom got my dad’s season tickets in the divorce, so she just gave them to me.ScenesMonica: Yeah, apparently, they’re pretty good seats.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesJoey: (examining the tickets) Oh my God! Those are almost right on the floor!ScenesRachel: Do you guys want these?ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesChandler: Yeah we do!ScenesRachel: Ohh, well you got ‘em.ScenesBoth: All right!ScenesRachel: Just give us our apartment back!ScenesPhoebe: Boy! I didn’t see that coming!ScenesChandler: Are you serious?ScenesRachel: Oh, come on! We know what these are worth.ScenesMonica: Yeah, what, do you think we’re stupid?ScenesJoey: You’re not stupid. You’re meaner than I thought.ScenesMonica: What do you say?ScenesChandler: Forget it! Okay, I’m not giving up my bachelor pad for some basketball seats!ScenesRachel: You’re bachelor pad?!ScenesMonica: Have you even had a girl up here?ScenesChandler: No. But uh, Joey has, and I usually talk to them in the morning time.ScenesJoey: Yeah, you do!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is whining to Chandler about the tickets.]
rows.Content: Joey: Come on!ScenesChandler: (ignoring him) Yes, Gunther, can I get two cups of chino, please?ScenesGunther: Good one.ScenesJoey: Come on, season tickets! Season tickets, do you know what that means?ScenesChandler: Forget it! Okay, I’m not giving up the apartment.ScenesJoey: Oh come—look, when I was a kid my dad’s company gave season tickets to the number one salesman every year, all right? My dad never won! Of course, he wasn’t in the sales division, but still, I never ever, ever forgot that!ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey, guys! (They both notice his new little friend)ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Oh my God!ScenesJoey: We don’t make enough fun of you already?ScenesRoss: Oh yeah, Emily convinced me to do it.ScenesChandler: You do know that Wham broke up?ScenesRoss: I like it, and Emily likes it, and that’s what counts. So uh, how are you guys doing?ScenesJoey: Oh-no, don’t try and talk all normal with that thing in your ear.ScenesChandler: Where is Emily?ScenesRoss: Ugh, she’s saying good-bye to her uncle.ScenesChandler: Man, didn’t she like just get here?ScenesRoss: Yeah!! Yeah!ScenesChandler: Easy tiger.ScenesRoss: I just, I hate this so much! I mean, every time I go pick her up at the airport, it’s-it’s so great. But at the same time I’m thinking, "Well, I’m gonna be right back there in a couple of days, dropping her off.ScenesChandler: So what are you going to do?ScenesRoss: Nothing! There’s nothing to do! I mean, she lives there, I live here. I mean, she-she’d have to uh, move here. She should move here!ScenesJoey: What?ScenesRoss: I could ask her to live with me!ScenesChandler: Are you serious?ScenesRoss: I mean, why not! I mean, I mean why not?!ScenesChandler: Because you’ve only known her for six weeks! Okay, I’ve got a carton of milk in my fridge I’ve had a longer relationship with!ScenesRoss: Look guys, when I’m with her it’s-it’s-it’s like she brings this-this-this great side out of me. I mean I-I-I love her, y’know?ScenesChandler: And I love the milk! But, I’m not gonna some British girl to move in with me! (Realizes that made no sense.) Joey, you say things now.ScenesJoey: All right look, Ross, he’s right. Emily’s great, she’s great! But this way too soon, you’re only gonna scare her!ScenesRoss: I don’t want to do that.ScenesJoey: No! You don’t want to wreck it, you don’t want to go to fast!ScenesRoss: Yeah, no, you’re right, I know, you’re right, I’m not, I’m not gonna do it. All right, thanks guys. (Gets up to leave.)ScenesChandler: Okay, no problem, just remember to wake us up before you go-go.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, later that same day. Joey and Chandler are eating pizza, and Phoebe is trying to knit something.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: That’s too hard. Too hard!ScenesMonica: (entering with Rachel) All right boys, last chance for the tickets!ScenesRachel: Or I’ll give them to my new boyfriend, Joshua.ScenesChandler: No thank you.ScenesJoey: Wait-wait-wait-wait! (To Chandler) Come on! Come on, let’s trade! The timing’s perfect, I just clogged the toilet!ScenesChandler: Look, I want those basketball seats as much as you do! Okay, but we can’t leave in the small apartment after we’ve lived here! Didn’t you ever read Flowers for Algernon?ScenesJoey: Yes! Didn’t you ever read Sports Illustrated?! No! I didn’t read yours! But come on, we can go to the game tonight!ScenesChandler: Look, the only way I will even consider this is if they offer a lot more than just season seats.ScenesJoey: It’s the Knicks!ScenesChandler: Screw the Knicks!ScenesJoey: Whoa!ScenesChandler: I didn’t mean that. I just meant that the apartment is worth so much more.ScenesJoey: Huh.ScenesChandler: And the Knicks rule all.ScenesJoey: Yeah, the Knicks rule all!ScenesPhoebe: Hey, so? Are you gonna do it?ScenesChandler: No. No. We’re not gonna do that, y’know why? Because its not an even trade.ScenesRachel: All right, okay, look, what if you could keep the apartment and get the tickets?ScenesJoey: Done!ScenesRachel: Let me finish.ScenesJoey: Oh.ScenesRachel: I’m talking about a bet, winner takes all.ScenesJoey: Ooh, we could end up with nothing.ScenesPhoebe: Or you could end up with everything.ScenesJoey: Ooh, I like that.ScenesMonica: All right, so what do you say?ScenesChandler: No!ScenesMonica: Oh, just do it!!ScenesChandler: Op, op, I’m convinced!ScenesJoey: Come on man, you know I’d do it for you! Because, you’re my best friend.ScenesChandler: All right, but you can’t use that again for a whole year. I’m in.ScenesJoey: All right!ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, this is so exciting! Ooh, God, what are you going to bet?ScenesRachel: Oh, okay, well, I think we should let Phoebe decide, because she’s the only who’s impartial, and she’s so pretty.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Umm, ooh, ooh—oh, I have a game!ScenesJoey: Okay!ScenesChandler: Okay!ScenesPhoebe: This is great!ScenesJoey: What’s the game?! What’s the game?!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, well, it doesn’t have a name—oh, okay, Phoebeball! No, it doesn’t have a name. Umm, okay, Monica, what is your favourite thing about trees?ScenesMonica: They’re green?ScenesPhoebe: Good! Good! Five points!Scenes(They both rejoice; Chandler is totally confused.)ScenesPhoebe: All right, Joey, same question.Scenes(He looks to Chandler, who doesn’t have a clue.)ScenesJoey: Uhh, they’re tall.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, three points. Both fine answers, but we were looking for leafy, leafy.Scenes(Joey turns and is angry that Chandler didn’t come up with the answer.)ScenesMonica: That’s not even a game!ScenesRachel: What? Shut up! We’re winning!ScenesMonica: You wanna finish this right now? All right, we get a deck of cards, high card wins. What do you say?ScenesChandler: Fine, let’s do it.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I have cards!ScenesJoey: Oh.ScenesMonica: Oh, good.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! Here! (She grabs a deck out of her purse) Oh no, these are the trick deck. Okay. Here yes. Okay.ScenesChandler: Okay, you guys uh, you guys pick firstScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesMonica: Okay. (She picks a card.) Four.ScenesChandler: That’s a low one!ScenesJoey: Yeah! Okay. (Joey picks a card.) Phoebe, you look, I can’t.ScenesPhoebe: What make you think I can?! (Shields her eyes from it.)ScenesJoey: Okay. Okay. (He looks at the card.) Ace!Scenes(Both Joey and Chandler and Monica and Rachel jump up and down for joy.)ScenesChandler: Why are you screaming and hugging?ScenesMonica: Because we won our apartment back!ScenesJoey: What? Ace is high! Jack, queen, king, ace!ScenesMonica: No! Ace is low! Ace, two, three, four!Scenes(They all look to Phoebe to settle this.)ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know. Ooh! Ooh! Look it! (She fans out the trick deck.) Ah-ha!ScenesRachel: All right, cut, let’s pick again, pick again.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesRachel: Come on apartment! Come on apartment! (Picks a card.) Oh! I know queen is high!ScenesJoey: Uh-huh, not as high as…(picks a card) It worked! King!ScenesChandler: Yeah baby!ScenesMonica: But, we pick again! We pick again!ScenesJoey: Why?!ScenesMonica: I don’t know!ScenesChandler: Tickets please! (Rachel hands over the tickets) That’s courtside baby!ScenesJoey: Seriously, good game though. Good game. (He tries to congratulate them, but they pull away.) (To Chandler) What are they so mad about? They get the apartment back!ScenesChandler: No they didn’t!

rows.Scenes: Ross’s apartment, Emily has packed as Ross returns.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesEmily: I packed while you were gone. I left some knickers under your pillow.ScenesRoss: (laughs) Move in with me.ScenesEmily: What?!ScenesRoss: Don’t be scared, I-I know it sounds crazy and-and people will say it’s too soon, but just-just think, think how great it will be.ScenesEmily: Ohh, no. Ugh. Oh, leaving London, my whole family lives there.ScenesRoss: I know.ScenesEmily: My job!ScenesRoss: Well, so, you-you’ll get a job here! I mean, I’m always hearing about uh, them foreigners coming in here and stealing American jobs; that could be you!ScenesEmily: Yeah, but it-it-it’s my whole life—you come to England.ScenesRoss: No, I can’t. I would, I really would, but my son is here; I can’t leave him. Isn’t—you don’t think there’s any way?ScenesEmily: Ohh, I don’t think so. I mean it would be different if it was way into the future –and-and-and we were getting married or something.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesEmily: Oh no, no, right I shouldn’t have said married. Uh, please don’t go freaky on me. I didn’t mean it. Well, I didn’t say it; I take it back!ScenesRoss: No, no, don’t. Why don’t we?ScenesEmily: Why don’t we what?ScenesRoss: Get married.ScenesEmily: You are mad!ScenesRoss: No! No! I’m not! It’s-it’s-it’s perfect! I mean it’s better than you just-just moving here, ‘cause it’s us together forever, and that’s-that’s what I want.ScenesEmily: We’ve only known each other for six weeks!ScenesRoss: Yeah, I know, so what? I mean, who’s-who’s to say? Does that me we-we can’t do it? Look, huh, I was with Carol for four years before we got married and I wound up divorced from a pregnant lesbian. I mean, this, this makes sense for us. Come on! I mean, on our first date we ended up spending the whole weekend in Vermont! I mean, last night I got my ear pierced! Me! This feels right. Doesn’t it?ScenesEmily: My parents are going to be really mad.ScenesRoss: Is that—are you saying yes? Is that yes?ScenesEmily: Yes.Scenes(They kiss and hug.)ScenesEmily: Yes!ScenesRoss: Yes! We’re getting married?!ScenesEmily: Oh my God!ScenesRoss: Yes!ScenesEmily: We’re getting married!ScenesRoss: Come here, come here. Uh, (He takes the earring out.) ow! Emily, will you marry me?ScenesEmily: Yes.Scenes(He tries to put it on her finger.)ScenesEmily: Ohh, it’s a bit small.ScenesRoss: Damn! I thought that was going to be romantic as hell!ScenesEmily: It was.Scenes(They kiss.)ScenesCommerical Break

rows.Scenes: The hallway, Joey and Chandler are coming back from the game.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Those were like the best seats ever.ScenesJoey: Oh yeah. Hey! Should we give these shirts to the girls? Y’know, kinda like a peace offering.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, that’s very nice. Plus, y’know they were free and they’re too small.Scenes(He knocks on the girls’ door and walks in. Surprise! The girls, obviously using Star Trek technology, have completely moved everything in both apartments back to their original positions, all in the time it took for the guys to go to a basketball game. Wow! Anyhoo, Chandler is stunned, and Joey doesn’t even realise it.)ScenesChandler: Oh. Oh, God! (He starts running around like a chicken with his head cut off.)ScenesJoey: Hey, want a beer? (Hands him a beer and sits down in one of the chairs.) (Jumping up.) WHOA!!!!ScenesChandler: I KNOW!!!Scenes(They both sprint to what used to be their apartment.)ScenesChandler: Open up! Open up! Open up!Scenes(A very angry Monica opens the door with the security chain still on.)ScenesMonica: We’ll discuss it, in the morning! (Slams the door shut.)ScenesChandler: What the hell is going on?!Scenes(It’s Rachel’s turn to open the door.)ScenesRachel: We took our apartment back!! (Slams the door shut.)ScenesPhoebe: (opening the door) I had nothing to do with it. (Closes the door.) (Opens the door.) Okay, it was my idea, but I don’t feel good about it.Scenes(She goes to close the door, but Chandler puts his foot it in.)ScenesChandler: We are switching back, right now!ScenesMonica: No, we’re not! We’re not leaving!ScenesChandler: Well, you’re gonna have to leave sometime, because you both have jobs, and as soon as you do, we’re switching it back! There’s nothing you can do to stop us! Right, Joe?ScenesJoey: I don’t know.ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: I don’t want to move again!ScenesChandler: I don’t care, this is our apartment! And they stole—you stole it—our apartment, and we won that apartment fair and square, twice! And I am getting it back right now. I’m getting back right now!Scenes(They open the door.)ScenesRachel: All right. We figured you might respond this way, so we have a backup offer.ScenesChandler: Oh no-no-no, no more offers. You can’t offer anything to us!ScenesRachel: Let us keep the apartment and…ScenesMonica: As a thank you, Rachel and I will kiss for one minute.Scenes[Time lapse. The guys are entering their apartment.]ScenesChandler: Totally worth it!ScenesJoey: That was one good minute!ScenesChandler: Good night.ScenesJoey: Good night.Scenes(They both go back into their old rooms and shut the doors. Of course, Chandler has to close both sections of his door.)Scenes[Cut to the girls apartment.]ScenesMonica: Men are such idiots.ScenesRachel: Yeah! Can you believe that something that stupid actually got us our apartment back?ScenesPhoebe: That’s so funny to think if you’d just done that right after the last contest, no one would have had to move at all.ScenesMonica: Yeah, let-let-let’s pretend that’s not true.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, scarf’s done. (It’s not really a scarf, it’s just a bunch of yarn that Phoebe has tied together. Just then, Ross and Emily enter dragging with them Joey and Chandler.)ScenesRoss: Come on! Come on. Come on.ScenesChandler: Okay!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesMonica: What-what’s going on?ScenesJoey: Ross has some big thing to tell everyone.ScenesRoss: Uhh, okay, it’s uh, Emily and I, we decided to uh, to get married.Scenes(The gang is stunned.)ScenesPhoebe: What? Oh, are you pregnant too?!ScenesEmily: Umm, no.ScenesMonica: When, when did—how, how did you…ScenesRoss: We, we just decided to uh, to go for it.ScenesEmily: I mean, we know it’s a bit hasty but, uh, it just feels so right, so…Scenes(Rachel slowly walks in from her bedroom. She is stunned speechless.)ScenesRoss: (turning around.) Umm, uh, I was just telling the guys…ScenesRachel: Yeah, I-I heard. (Pause, everyone looks at each other, waiting for Rachel’s reaction.) I think it’s great! (Hugs Ross.) Ohh, I’m so happy for you!Scenes(Seeing Rachel’s apparently okay with this, the rest of the gang jumps up to congratulate Ross and Emily on their pending nuptials.)ScenesChandler: Oh, well, that’s great!ScenesJoey: Yeah! Yeah!ScenesMonica: (to Ross) I can’t believe you’re getting married!ScenesRoss: Yeah. (They hug again.)ScenesJoey: Monica and Rachel made out. (Giggles like a schoolboy and Monica glares at him.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Joey’s bedroom, he is awoken by the singing guy.]
rows.Content: The Singing Man: (singing) Morning’s here! The morning’s here!Scenes(Joey joins him.)ScenesBoth: Sunshine is here! The sky is clear, the morning’s here!ScenesThe Singing Man: Hey! You’re back!ScenesJoey: Hey! (Singing) Get into gear!ScenesThe Singing Man: (singing) Breakfast is near!ScenesBoth: The dark of night has disappeared!!ScenesThe Singing Man: I’ll see you tomorrow morning!ScenesJoey: (happily) Okay!ScenesEndScenesThe One With All the Wedding DressesScenesStory by: Adam ChaseScenesTeleplay by: Michael Curtis & Gregory S. MalinsScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Joey’s bedroom, he is asleep and snoring loudly. Chandler enters wondering who left their engine running.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Are you kidding me?! Joey. Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey! Joey!!ScenesJoey: (joining in, in his sleep) Joey. Joey. Joey. Joey! Joey!!Scenes(Chandler acts disgusted, but is happy that Joey has stopped snoring. However, just as he is about to leave, Joey starts snoring again. So to get him to stop, he slams the door shut, waking Joey.)ScenesChandler: Oh. Oh, did-did-did I wake you?ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is getting another cup of coffee.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Gunther, can I get another cup of coffee, please? (Gunther starts to pour him another cup.) So uh, what do you do when you’re not working here?ScenesGunther: You don’t need to fill these silences.ScenesChandler: Oh, okay, thanks. (He goes back to the couch and rejoins Monica, Joey, and Phoebe.)ScenesMonica: Chandler, that’s like your fourth cup of coffee!ScenesChandler: Well, I am drinking lots of cups of coffee because I’m exhausted! Because Joey started snoring!ScenesMonica: He’s in a different room! He’s really that loud?ScenesJoey: (proudly) Oh, you should here me.ScenesChandler: It’s not something to be proud of, okay? You have to go to a sleep clinic!ScenesJoey: Look, I told ya, I’m not going to any clinic! I don’t have a problem, you’re the one with the problem! You should go to a "Quit being a baby and leave me alone" clinic!ScenesChandler: They don’t have those.ScenesJoey: Yeah, they do! Quit being a baby and leave me alone! There, you’ve just had your first class!ScenesMonica: Y’know I used to go out with this guy that was a really light sleeper, and whenever I started to snore, he would just roll me over…ScenesJoey: Ohhh, yeah!ScenesMonica: He would just roll me over and I would stop snoring.ScenesChandler: Next time you snore, I’m rolling ya over!ScenesJoey: I gotta do what I gotta do, you gotta do what you gotta do, you just do it.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey guys!ScenesChandler: Hey, all right!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!Scenes(Joey starts humming Here Come the Bride.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, the Olympics.ScenesMonica: Have you guys picked a date yet?ScenesRoss: Oh no, not yet.ScenesPhoebe: I still cannot believe you’re engaged! (Ross looks at her) Just ‘cause its happening so fast; not ‘cause you’re such a loser.ScenesRoss: Oh. Thanks. Uh, has anyone seen Rach?ScenesMonica: Ugh, she’s upstairs not doing the dishes! And I tell ya something! I’m not doing them this time! I don’t care if those dishes sit in the sink until they’re all covered with—I’ll do them when I get home!ScenesRoss: Yeah—oh! Hey listen umm, Emily found this wedding dress in London…ScenesPhoebe: Already?!ScenesRoss: Yeah, but it didn’t fit. Well, luckily there’s a store here that has one left in her size, but I’m the groom, I’m not supposed to see the dress…ScenesMonica: I’ll pick it up for you!ScenesRoss: Thank you.ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesChandler: Oh, she’s got you running errands, y’know, picking up wedding dresses… (Laughs and makes like Indiana Jones and his whip) Wah-pah!ScenesRoss: What’s wah-pah?ScenesChandler: Y’know, whipped! Wah-pah!ScenesJoey: That’s not whipped! Whipped is wh-tcssh!ScenesChandler: That’s what I did. Wah-pah!ScenesJoey: You can’t do anything!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is not doing the dishes. She hears someone coming up the stairs and quickly puts down her magazine and pretends like she’s actually doing the dishes.]
