(They go inside) (To the guy at the desk) I wanna quit the gym.ScenesGym Employee: You wanna quit?ScenesChandler: I wanna quit the gym.ScenesGym Employee: You do realize that you won’t have access to our new full service Swedish spa.ScenesChandler: (He turns to Ross and Ross makes a ‘Be strong’ sound.) I wanna quit the gym.ScenesGym Employee: Okay, Dave in the membership office, handles quitters. (Both Chandler and Ross start to make their way to the membership office.) Uh, excuse me, (to Ross) are you a member?ScenesRoss: Me? No.ScenesGym Employee: Sorry, members only.ScenesChandler: (horrified at the prospect of trying to quit alone and unsure about himself) I wanna quit the gym.ScenesRoss: It’s okay man, be strong. (Chandler goes into the office.)ScenesGym Employee: (to Ross) So, are you a member of any gym.ScenesRoss: No! And I’m not gonna be, so you can save you little speech.ScenesGym Employee: Okay, no problem. (To someone out of the picture) Could you come here for a second?Scenes(This gorgeous woman in spandex walks up)ScenesWoman: Hi, I’m Maria.Scenes(Ross is at a loss for words.)

rows.Scenes: Heeling Hands Inc., Phoebe’s work, she is giving a massage to the guy, Rick, she likes.]
rows.Content: Rick: (looking at her feet) Wow, you have really pretty feet.ScenesPhoebe: These old things.ScenesRick: Would you mind spending some time on my siadic area, it’s been killing me today.ScenesPhoebe: You mean the—Okay by siadic, you mean the towel covered portion.ScenesRick: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Sure, yeah, no I can do that, yeah, because umm, y'know, the muscles in the siadic area can get y’know, real (lifts up the towel) nice and tight. So umm, tell me Rick, how umm, how did you injure the area.ScenesRick: Oh, a 16-hour sit-in for Greenpeace.ScenesPhoebe: Oh. (She goes to work, and her head slowly drops out of view.)ScenesRick: Ow! Did you just bite me?ScenesPhoebe: No!

rows.Scenes: Mr. Treeger’s apartment, Joey is there to suck up.]
rows.Content: Mr. Treeger:: What?ScenesJoey: Please don’t kick Monica and Rachel out, this wasn’t there fault, it was mine.ScenesMr. Treeger:: You want me to kick you guys out instead?ScenesJoey: No you can’t do that, where would the chick and the duck live?ScenesMr. Treeger:: You have pets!ScenesJoey: Noo-no-no, no, those are nicknames. I’m the chick and Chandler is the duck.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Huh, I would’ve thought it was the other way around.ScenesJoey: Come on man, just-just let the girls stay, I’ll do whatever you want.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Really? You’ll do anything?ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah, absolutely.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, I’ve got something you can do.ScenesJoey: What, what is it?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Can you be my dancing partner?ScenesJoey: That’s not, prison lingo, is it?ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is telling Monica and Rachel what he has to do.]
rows.Content: Monica: His dancing partner?!ScenesJoey: Yeah, there’s this superintendent’s dance, the Super Ball. I don’t know, and he wants to impress Marge, this lady super that he’s a crush on.ScenesRachel: Well, why doesn’t he practice with a girl?ScenesJoey: Well, he’s too shy, he doesn’t thing he’s good enough to dance with girls yet.ScenesRachel: Yeah, right, he almost danced me right down that…garbage chute. (Starts to cry)ScenesMonica: Oh, would you let it go already?! You’re fine!Scenes(Chandler and Ross enter)ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hey! So, did you quit?ScenesChandler: No, I almost did, couldn’t leave Ross there without a spotter!ScenesMonica: Wait, now so you joined the gym?Scenes(Rachel starts to laugh.)ScenesRoss: And that’s funny, why?ScenesRachel: Oh, umm, I was just y’know working out and umm… Oh, that’s it.ScenesChandler: We’re doomed. Okay, they’re gonna take 50 bucks out of our accounts for the rest of our lives. What are we gonna do?ScenesMonica: Well, you could actually go to the gym.Scenes(Chandler and Ross both laugh)ScenesRoss: Or! Or, we could go to the bank, close our accounts and cut them off at the source.ScenesChandler: You’re a genius!ScenesJoey: Aww, man, now we won’t be bank buddies!ScenesChandler: Now, there’s two reasons.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey.ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, you guys, remember that cute client I told you about? I bit him.ScenesRachel: Where?!ScenesPhoebe: On the touchy.ScenesRoss: And that’s not against your oath?!ScenesPhoebe: No, I know! I-I’m sorry, but the moment I touch him, I just wanna throw out my old oath and take a new, dirty one.ScenesMonica: Well, next time your massaging him, you should try and distract yourself.ScenesJoey: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! Like-like when I’m doing something exciting and I don’t wanna get too excited, I just ahh, y’know try to thing of other things like ah sandwiches, and ah baseball, and ah Chandler!ScenesChandler: Thank you, Joey.ScenesJoey: No-no, thank you.

rows.Scenes: Treeger’s apartment, Joey knocks and Mr. Treeger opens the door.]
rows.Content: Joey: All right, I’m here, let’s ahh, get this over with.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Okay ahh, well, just ahh, follow my lead. (Turns on some music)ScenesJoey: Whoa-whoa, don’t we need to do some kinda preparation first? Like ahh, get really drunk?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Look come on, eh, just ah, just ah, put your arms around me, eh.Scenes(Joey does so, and they both start dancing. Treeger tries to spin Joey, but ends up throwing him into the door.)ScenesMr. Treeger:: Ahhhh! I’m sorry!ScenesJoey: No, it’s okay, but if I’m Marge, my breasts are coming out my back.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Ahh, forget it! I’ll never be any good at this, my mom was right, I’m just a big potato with arms, and legs, and a head.ScenesJoey: Come on man, you’re not a potato.ScenesMr. Treeger:: I’m sure as hell a dancer, it’s no use Marge will never go for me.ScenesJoey: Come on Treeger, don’t say that. You just ahh, you just need more practice. Here, come on, let’s ahh, let’s try it again. Come on. (they start dancing again) Plus, it was, it was probably mostly my fault, anyway. I mean, y’know, I’m not really that comfortable dancing with a—(Treeger throws him) We-he!! Hey!ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Monica are sitting at the table as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey-hey, how goes the dancing? Gay yet?ScenesJoey: Ah-ha-ha, you guys owe me big time. (He walks into the kitchen and does a little dance step on the way.)ScenesRachel: (laughing) What was that?ScenesJoey: What?ScenesRachel: You just did a little dancy thing.ScenesJoey: No I didn’t.ScenesMonica: Yes you did! You did like a little hop.ScenesRachel: You are soo enjoying this.ScenesJoey: No, I’m not! And it wasn’t a hop it was a pademarie.ScenesMonica: (laughing harder) You know the words! You are so into this!ScenesJoey: All right, well maybe I’m enjoying it a little bit. I mean I’m getting pretty good at it.ScenesRachel: Ooh, this is soo sweet, Joey our little twinkle-toes.ScenesJoey: Hey-hey, hold on, this isn’t some kind of like girly dance. All right, it’s like a sport, it’s manly!ScenesMonica: All right, then show me some manly moves.ScenesJoey: All right.Scenes(They both get up and Monica expects Joey to take the lead, but he doesn’t, and they fumble around for a little bit.)ScenesJoey: I don’t know how to lead.

rows.Scenes: Ross and Chandler’s bank, they are there to close their accounts.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hello.ScenesChandler: Hi.ScenesRoss: We’d like to close our accounts.ScenesBank Officer: Close your accounts? Is there some kind of problem?ScenesRoss: No-no.ScenesChandler: No, we’d just like to close them.ScenesBank Officer: Okay, Ms. Lambert handles all our closures. (to a beautiful woman) Would you come over here please?ScenesMs. Lambert: Hi, I’m Karen.ScenesChandler: I wanna quit the bank!

rows.Scenes: Healing Hands, Inc., Phoebe is giving Rick a massage.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (thinking to herself) Okay, baseball. Rick, playing baseball. Okay, slides into second, maybe even his pants come down a little… Oh no—wait no, no! No! Okay, all right, sandwiches, sandwiches. Umm, okay, on a plate, maybe Rick’s pants come down a little. No! No! Okay, Chandler! Okay Chandler, ooh, that’s working.Scenes(The camera zooms in on the clock on the wall and it reads a quarter after one. Time lapse. The clock now reads 3:30, and Phoebe is still giving Rick his massage.)ScenesPhoebe: (thinking to herself) Chandler’s knees. Chandler’s… ankles. Chandler’s ankle hair. (notices the clock) Oh no. (to Rick) Okay, you’re all set.ScenesRick: Oh wow! That was amazing, was that really just an hour?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! In… really long hour world.ScenesRick: What?ScenesPhoebe: Ugh, okay, I have an enormous crush on you. But because you’re a client, I can’t ask you out, even though you give me y’know, the feeling.ScenesRick: Wow! I had no idea! But you know, I could always find another masseuse.ScenesPhoebe: Really?!ScenesRick: Yeah, really.Scenes(They start to kiss, then Rick stops suddenly.)ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesRick: Suddenly, I very aware that I’m naked.ScenesPhoebe: (laughs) Okay, quit down. (they start to kiss again)Scenes(Suddenly, Phoebe’s boss, Mrs. Potter, and a client, Mr. Simon, enters.)ScenesMrs. Potter: Mr. Simon’s been waiting for—(sees Phoebe and Rick) Oh my God!ScenesMr. Simon: Why wasn’t I offered that? I’d definitely pay more for that.ScenesMrs. Potter: Phoebe, we have rules here, this isn’t that kind of place.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, oh and I know, but this isn’t what it looks like, ‘cause Rick is my ahh, husband.ScenesMrs. Potter: Oh really? Well, then you’d better tell his other wife, ‘cause she called three times asking where he is.ScenesPhoebe: Yes, I will tell her.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Ross are telling Joey, Rachel, and Monica of their bank woes.]
rows.Content: Monica: So you didn’t leave the bank?ScenesRoss: No! And somehow, we ended up with a joint checking account.ScenesRachel: What are you ever gonna use that for?!ScenesChandler: To pay for the gym.Scenes(Phoebe enters)ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Hey! So I had a great day, Rick and I really hit it off, and we started making out, and then my boss walked in and fired me for being a whore.ScenesJoey: What?!ScenesRachel: You got fired?!ScenesMonica: Oh my Gosh!ScenesPhoebe: It’s so weird, I have never been fired from anything before!ScenesRachel: Sweety...ScenesPhoebe: I just-I just started walking around not knowing what to do next, y’know? I-I started asking people on the street if they wanted massages. Then these policemen, thought I was a whore too. It’s been a really bad day, whore wise.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door and Chandler answers it.)ScenesMr. Treeger:: Hey Duck, is Chick here?ScenesChandler: Yeah… Bunny-rabbit.ScenesJoey: (To Mr. Treeger) So you ah, ready for our last practice?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, but y’know, I think the reason we’re not getting that spin right is because my apartment’s too small.ScenesJoey: Look, you wanna use our place?ScenesMr. Treeger:: No, I ahh, had another idea.Scenes[Cut to the roof, where Joey and Mr. Treeger are dancing happily to ^Night and Day^.]ScenesJoey: We did it!!ScenesMr. Treeger:: I know, we did it!! Hey, that was incredible, huh?!ScenesJoey: I know, it was amazing! I mean, we totally nailed it, it was beautiful.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Thank you, listen, thanks a lot Tribbiani, (checks watch). Oh my God, look at the time, I gotta catch the bus to the ball.ScenesJoey: Oh well, okay, good luck.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Unless you wanna practice the Foxtrot again? Or-or the Tango?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Ahh, thanks but no. You see I-I think I’m ready to dance with girls.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Go get ‘em Treeger.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Right. (Starts to leave) Hey, ahh, you wanna come? Marge has a girlfriend.ScenesJoey: (intrigued) Really?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, you could dance real good with her, she’s the same size as me.ScenesJoey: No, I’m good.Scenes(Treeger leaves, and Joey’s dances off.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Lara and Jeni’s Massage, Phoebe is interviewing for a job.]
rows.Content: Interviewer: So it looks like you’ve got some great experience here. Let’s see ahh, reason for leaving last job?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, they thought I was a whore.ScenesInterviewer: Okay, we’ll give a call if anything comes up.ScenesPhoebe: Great! Thank you very much.Scenes(The interviewer watches her leave with an ‘Oh my goodness’ face.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Ballroom DancingScenesWritten by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is there eating breakfast. Chandler is cleaning out his wallet.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey! New wallet, huh?ScenesChandler: Yeah, it was time. The old condom ring in the leather just doesn’t say ‘cool’ anymore.ScenesMonica: Rachel!ScenesRachel: What?ScenesMonica: You just put an empty carton back in the fridge!ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, I know, but the garbage was full.ScenesMonica: Have you ever taken out the trash? (Hands her the garbage.)ScenesRachel: Well, I thought you liked doing it. (Rachel starts out the door and stops.)ScenesMonica: Third door on the left.ScenesRachel: Right!

rows.Scenes: Garbage room: Mr. Treeger is unclogging the trash chute as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh! Hey, Mr. Treeger.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Hey.Scenes(Rachel opens the trash chute, winces at the smell, and throws the garbage bag in. She then tries to throw the pizza box in, but since it’s so big she jams it into the opening and it prevents the door from closing. She then turns around too see Mr. Treeger watching her.)ScenesMr. Treeger:: What are you doing?ScenesRachel: Ummm. Oh! I’m sorry. (She grabs the box and offers him a piece.) It’s a little old but…ScenesMr. Treeger:: No! You’re clogging up the chute that I spent a half-hour unclogging!ScenesRachel: I’m sorry. I didn’t—I don’t come in here a lot.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Oh yeah, of course you don’t!ScenesRachel: No.ScenesMr. Treeger:: ‘Cause you’re a little princess! "Daddy, buy me a pizza. Daddy, buy me a candy factory. Daddy, make the cast of Cats sing Happy Birthday to me…ScenesRachel: I didn’t… I never said that.ScenesMr. Treeger:: You think you could make a mess and the big man in coveralls will come in here and clean it up, huh? Well, why don’t think of someone else for a change?ScenesRachel: (starting to cry) Okay, I’m sorry. (Runs out still carrying the pizza box.)Scenes[Cut to Monica and Rachel’s apartment as Rachel returns in tears.]ScenesMonica: God! If you’re gonna cry about it! (She grabs the box and goes to through it out.]ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Continued from earlier, Rachel is now telling everyone of her experience in the garbage room.]
rows.Content: Joey: Whoa-whoa, Treeger made you cry?ScenesRachel: Yes! And he said really mean things that were only partly true.ScenesJoey: I’m gonna go down there and teach that guy a lesson.ScenesMonica: Joey, please don’t do that. I think it’s best that we just forget about it.ScenesRachel: That’s easy for you to say, you weren’t almost just killed.ScenesJoey: All right that’s it, school is in session! (Exits and slams the door.)ScenesMonica: (Picking up a card from Chandler’s wallet.) My God! Is this a gym card?ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, gym member. I try to go four times a week, but I’ve missed the last 1200 times.ScenesRoss: So why don’t you quit?ScenesChandler: You don’t think I’ve tried? You think I like having 50 dollars taken out of my bank account every month? No, they make you go all the way down there! Then they use all of these phrases and peppiness to try and confuse you! Then they bring out Maria.ScenesRoss: Who is Maria?ScenesChandler: Oh Maria. You can’t say no to her, she’s like this lycra spandex covered gym…treat.ScenesRoss: You need me to go down there with you and hold your hand?ScenesChandler: No!ScenesRoss: So you’re strong enough to face her on your own?ScenesChandler: Oh no, you’ll have to come.

rows.Scenes: Treeger’s apartment, Joey knocks on the door and Treeger opens it.]
rows.Content: Mr. Treeger:: Tribbiani! Hold on, I’ll get the plunger.ScenesJoey: Hey! You hold on pal! Now you made my friend, Rachel, cry. So now, you’re gonna go up there and apologize to her, unless you want me to call the landlord.ScenesMr. Treeger:: And tell him what?ScenesJoey: Have you heard about a little something called, Not Making Girls Cry.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah. Well maybe you have heard about the Rent Stabilization Act of 1968!ScenesJoey: I have actually not heard of that.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, well your friends are in violation of it. I’ve been a nice guy up until now, but uh, I don’t need this grief. I’m gonna call the landlord and tell him that Monica is illegally subletting here grandmother’s apartment. Your friends are outta here pal.ScenesJoey: Why don’t you tell me something I don’t know! (He storms out, and once Treeger closes the door behind him, Joey makes an ‘Oops!’ have.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier, everyone is still eating breakfast.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh please, somebody tell me I don’t have to go to work today!ScenesMonica: What’s the matter?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, my first massage today is this incredibly gorgeous guy, and every time I see him I just want to do things to him that I’m not allowed to charge for.ScenesMonica: So do them for free.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no, it is forbidden! No-no, Mrs. Potter fires people for fooling around with clients. And it’s against my oath as a masseuse.ScenesRoss: They make you take an oath?ScenesPhoebe: No, I made myself take an oath. Yeah, no fooling around with clients and umm, always be prepared. Yeah, that one’s actually from the Boy Scouts, but it just makes good sense.ScenesChandler: Why don’t you just give him to somebody else?ScenesPhoebe: No, I can handle it. No, I’m a professional. (She starts to leave)ScenesRachel: Oh Pheebs, is that a new ankle bracelet?ScenesMonica: Wow! And you got a petticure. Your feet are all dressed up.ScenesChandler: Because that’s the only part of you he can see when he’s on the table!ScenesMonica: You’re gonna do some feet flirtin’!ScenesPhoebe: I don’t what your talking about. (Laughs nervously and continues to leaqve)ScenesRoss: Then how do you explain the toe ring?!ScenesPhoebe: Because it’s Arabian princess day at work! Okay?! Leave me alone!Scenes[Cut to later, Joey is returning from talking to Mr. Treeger.]ScenesRachel: Oh! My hero! What happened?ScenesJoey: Well uh, I went down there and told him that no one treats my friends like that and that he’d better come up here and apologize. I’ll see you later. (Starts to leave)ScenesMonica: What a minute, what did he say?ScenesJoey: He said that he wasn’t gonna apologize because you guys are living here illegally, so instead what he’s gonna do is have you evicted—I’ll see you later.ScenesRachel: What?! You got us evicted!!ScenesMonica: I told you not to go down there!ScenesJoey: Well he made Rachel cry!ScenesMonica: Rachel always cries!ScenesRachel: That’s not true! (Starts to cry.)ScenesMonica: Now Joey, you go down there and you suck up to him. I mean you suck like you’ve never sucked before!ScenesJoey: All right! I’ll try! But if I can’t, you can stay with Chandler and I until you get settled.ScenesRachel: Go!!ScenesJoey: All right, all right, all right. (Starts to leave, stops, and turns around) I mean I’ll have to check with him first, but I’ll think he’ll be cool with it. (Monica shoos him out.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s gym, He and Ross are there to cancel his membership.]
rows.Content: Ross: Whoa-whoa-whoa, hey! Now remember what we talked about, you gotta be strong.ScenesChandler: Yes. (In a stronger voice) Yes!ScenesRoss: One more time, "Hey, don’t you want a washboard stomach and rock hard pecs?ScenesChandler: No! I want a flabby gut and saggy man breasts!ScenesRoss: Good! That’s good!ScenesChandler: Okay. (They go inside) (To the guy at the desk) I wanna quit the gym.ScenesGym Employee: You wanna quit?ScenesChandler: I wanna quit the gym.ScenesGym Employee: You do realize that you won’t have access to our new full service Swedish spa.ScenesChandler: (He turns to Ross and Ross makes a ‘Be strong’ sound.) I wanna quit the gym.ScenesGym Employee: Okay, Dave in the membership office, handles quitters. (Both Chandler and Ross start to make their way to the membership office.) Uh, excuse me, (to Ross) are you a member?ScenesRoss: Me? No.ScenesGym Employee: Sorry, members only.ScenesChandler: (horrified at the prospect of trying to quit alone and unsure about himself) I wanna quit the gym.ScenesRoss: It’s okay man, be strong. (Chandler goes into the office.)ScenesGym Employee: (to Ross) So, are you a member of any gym.ScenesRoss: No! And I’m not gonna be, so you can save you little speech.ScenesGym Employee: Okay, no problem. (To someone out of the picture) Could you come here for a second?Scenes(This gorgeous woman in spandex walks up)ScenesWoman: Hi, I’m Maria.Scenes(Ross is at a loss for words.)

rows.Scenes: Heeling Hands Inc., Phoebe’s work, she is giving a massage to the guy, Rick, she likes.]
rows.Content: Rick: (looking at her feet) Wow, you have really pretty feet.ScenesPhoebe: These old things.ScenesRick: Would you mind spending some time on my siadic area, it’s been killing me today.ScenesPhoebe: You mean the—Okay by siadic, you mean the towel covered portion.ScenesRick: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Sure, yeah, no I can do that, yeah, because umm, y'know, the muscles in the siadic area can get y’know, real (lifts up the towel) nice and tight. So umm, tell me Rick, how umm, how did you injure the area.ScenesRick: Oh, a 16-hour sit-in for Greenpeace.ScenesPhoebe: Oh. (She goes to work, and her head slowly drops out of view.)ScenesRick: Ow! Did you just bite me?ScenesPhoebe: No!

rows.Scenes: Mr. Treeger’s apartment, Joey is there to suck up.]
rows.Content: Mr. Treeger:: What?ScenesJoey: Please don’t kick Monica and Rachel out, this wasn’t there fault, it was mine.ScenesMr. Treeger:: You want me to kick you guys out instead?ScenesJoey: No you can’t do that, where would the chick and the duck live?ScenesMr. Treeger:: You have pets!ScenesJoey: Noo-no-no, no, those are nicknames. I’m the chick and Chandler is the duck.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Huh, I would’ve thought it was the other way around.ScenesJoey: Come on man, just-just let the girls stay, I’ll do whatever you want.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Really? You’ll do anything?ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah, absolutely.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, I’ve got something you can do.ScenesJoey: What, what is it?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Can you be my dancing partner?ScenesJoey: That’s not, prison lingo, is it?ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is telling Monica and Rachel what he has to do.]
rows.Content: Monica: His dancing partner?!ScenesJoey: Yeah, there’s this superintendent’s dance, the Super Ball. I don’t know, and he wants to impress Marge, this lady super that he’s a crush on.ScenesRachel: Well, why doesn’t he practice with a girl?ScenesJoey: Well, he’s too shy, he doesn’t thing he’s good enough to dance with girls yet.ScenesRachel: Yeah, right, he almost danced me right down that…garbage chute. (Starts to cry)ScenesMonica: Oh, would you let it go already?! You’re fine!Scenes(Chandler and Ross enter)ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hey! So, did you quit?ScenesChandler: No, I almost did, couldn’t leave Ross there without a spotter!ScenesMonica: Wait, now so you joined the gym?Scenes(Rachel starts to laugh.)ScenesRoss: And that’s funny, why?ScenesRachel: Oh, umm, I was just y’know working out and umm… Oh, that’s it.ScenesChandler: We’re doomed. Okay, they’re gonna take 50 bucks out of our accounts for the rest of our lives. What are we gonna do?ScenesMonica: Well, you could actually go to the gym.Scenes(Chandler and Ross both laugh)ScenesRoss: Or! Or, we could go to the bank, close our accounts and cut them off at the source.ScenesChandler: You’re a genius!ScenesJoey: Aww, man, now we won’t be bank buddies!ScenesChandler: Now, there’s two reasons.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey.ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, you guys, remember that cute client I told you about? I bit him.ScenesRachel: Where?!ScenesPhoebe: On the touchy.ScenesRoss: And that’s not against your oath?!ScenesPhoebe: No, I know! I-I’m sorry, but the moment I touch him, I just wanna throw out my old oath and take a new, dirty one.ScenesMonica: Well, next time your massaging him, you should try and distract yourself.ScenesJoey: Yeah! Yeah! Yeah! Like-like when I’m doing something exciting and I don’t wanna get too excited, I just ahh, y’know try to thing of other things like ah sandwiches, and ah baseball, and ah Chandler!ScenesChandler: Thank you, Joey.ScenesJoey: No-no, thank you.

rows.Scenes: Treeger’s apartment, Joey knocks and Mr. Treeger opens the door.]
rows.Content: Joey: All right, I’m here, let’s ahh, get this over with.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Okay ahh, well, just ahh, follow my lead. (Turns on some music)ScenesJoey: Whoa-whoa, don’t we need to do some kinda preparation first? Like ahh, get really drunk?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Look come on, eh, just ah, just ah, put your arms around me, eh.Scenes(Joey does so, and they both start dancing. Treeger tries to spin Joey, but ends up throwing him into the door.)ScenesMr. Treeger:: Ahhhh! I’m sorry!ScenesJoey: No, it’s okay, but if I’m Marge, my breasts are coming out my back.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Ahh, forget it! I’ll never be any good at this, my mom was right, I’m just a big potato with arms, and legs, and a head.ScenesJoey: Come on man, you’re not a potato.ScenesMr. Treeger:: I’m sure as hell a dancer, it’s no use Marge will never go for me.ScenesJoey: Come on Treeger, don’t say that. You just ahh, you just need more practice. Here, come on, let’s ahh, let’s try it again. Come on. (they start dancing again) Plus, it was, it was probably mostly my fault, anyway. I mean, y’know, I’m not really that comfortable dancing with a—(Treeger throws him) We-he!! Hey!ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Monica are sitting at the table as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey-hey, how goes the dancing? Gay yet?ScenesJoey: Ah-ha-ha, you guys owe me big time. (He walks into the kitchen and does a little dance step on the way.)ScenesRachel: (laughing) What was that?ScenesJoey: What?ScenesRachel: You just did a little dancy thing.ScenesJoey: No I didn’t.ScenesMonica: Yes you did! You did like a little hop.ScenesRachel: You are soo enjoying this.ScenesJoey: No, I’m not! And it wasn’t a hop it was a pademarie.ScenesMonica: (laughing harder) You know the words! You are so into this!ScenesJoey: All right, well maybe I’m enjoying it a little bit. I mean I’m getting pretty good at it.ScenesRachel: Ooh, this is soo sweet, Joey our little twinkle-toes.ScenesJoey: Hey-hey, hold on, this isn’t some kind of like girly dance. All right, it’s like a sport, it’s manly!ScenesMonica: All right, then show me some manly moves.ScenesJoey: All right.Scenes(They both get up and Monica expects Joey to take the lead, but he doesn’t, and they fumble around for a little bit.)ScenesJoey: I don’t know how to lead.

rows.Scenes: Ross and Chandler’s bank, they are there to close their accounts.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hello.ScenesChandler: Hi.ScenesRoss: We’d like to close our accounts.ScenesBank Officer: Close your accounts? Is there some kind of problem?ScenesRoss: No-no.ScenesChandler: No, we’d just like to close them.ScenesBank Officer: Okay, Ms. Lambert handles all our closures. (to a beautiful woman) Would you come over here please?ScenesMs. Lambert: Hi, I’m Karen.ScenesChandler: I wanna quit the bank!

rows.Scenes: Healing Hands, Inc., Phoebe is giving Rick a massage.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (thinking to herself) Okay, baseball. Rick, playing baseball. Okay, slides into second, maybe even his pants come down a little… Oh no—wait no, no! No! Okay, all right, sandwiches, sandwiches. Umm, okay, on a plate, maybe Rick’s pants come down a little. No! No! Okay, Chandler! Okay Chandler, ooh, that’s working.Scenes(The camera zooms in on the clock on the wall and it reads a quarter after one. Time lapse. The clock now reads 3:30, and Phoebe is still giving Rick his massage.)ScenesPhoebe: (thinking to herself) Chandler’s knees. Chandler’s… ankles. Chandler’s ankle hair. (notices the clock) Oh no. (to Rick) Okay, you’re all set.ScenesRick: Oh wow! That was amazing, was that really just an hour?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! In… really long hour world.ScenesRick: What?ScenesPhoebe: Ugh, okay, I have an enormous crush on you. But because you’re a client, I can’t ask you out, even though you give me y’know, the feeling.ScenesRick: Wow! I had no idea! But you know, I could always find another masseuse.ScenesPhoebe: Really?!ScenesRick: Yeah, really.Scenes(They start to kiss, then Rick stops suddenly.)ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesRick: Suddenly, I very aware that I’m naked.ScenesPhoebe: (laughs) Okay, quit down. (they start to kiss again)Scenes(Suddenly, Phoebe’s boss, Mrs. Potter, and a client, Mr. Simon, enters.)ScenesMrs. Potter: Mr. Simon’s been waiting for—(sees Phoebe and Rick) Oh my God!ScenesMr. Simon: Why wasn’t I offered that? I’d definitely pay more for that.ScenesMrs. Potter: Phoebe, we have rules here, this isn’t that kind of place.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, oh and I know, but this isn’t what it looks like, ‘cause Rick is my ahh, husband.ScenesMrs. Potter: Oh really? Well, then you’d better tell his other wife, ‘cause she called three times asking where he is.ScenesPhoebe: Yes, I will tell her.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Ross are telling Joey, Rachel, and Monica of their bank woes.]
rows.Content: Monica: So you didn’t leave the bank?ScenesRoss: No! And somehow, we ended up with a joint checking account.ScenesRachel: What are you ever gonna use that for?!ScenesChandler: To pay for the gym.Scenes(Phoebe enters)ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Hey! So I had a great day, Rick and I really hit it off, and we started making out, and then my boss walked in and fired me for being a whore.ScenesJoey: What?!ScenesRachel: You got fired?!ScenesMonica: Oh my Gosh!ScenesPhoebe: It’s so weird, I have never been fired from anything before!ScenesRachel: Sweety...ScenesPhoebe: I just-I just started walking around not knowing what to do next, y’know? I-I started asking people on the street if they wanted massages. Then these policemen, thought I was a whore too. It’s been a really bad day, whore wise.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door and Chandler answers it.)ScenesMr. Treeger:: Hey Duck, is Chick here?ScenesChandler: Yeah… Bunny-rabbit.ScenesJoey: (To Mr. Treeger) So you ah, ready for our last practice?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, but y’know, I think the reason we’re not getting that spin right is because my apartment’s too small.ScenesJoey: Look, you wanna use our place?ScenesMr. Treeger:: No, I ahh, had another idea.Scenes[Cut to the roof, where Joey and Mr. Treeger are dancing happily to ^Night and Day^.]ScenesJoey: We did it!!ScenesMr. Treeger:: I know, we did it!! Hey, that was incredible, huh?!ScenesJoey: I know, it was amazing! I mean, we totally nailed it, it was beautiful.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Thank you, listen, thanks a lot Tribbiani, (checks watch). Oh my God, look at the time, I gotta catch the bus to the ball.ScenesJoey: Oh well, okay, good luck.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Unless you wanna practice the Foxtrot again? Or-or the Tango?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Ahh, thanks but no. You see I-I think I’m ready to dance with girls.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Go get ‘em Treeger.ScenesMr. Treeger:: Right. (Starts to leave) Hey, ahh, you wanna come? Marge has a girlfriend.ScenesJoey: (intrigued) Really?ScenesMr. Treeger:: Yeah, you could dance real good with her, she’s the same size as me.ScenesJoey: No, I’m good.Scenes(Treeger leaves, and Joey’s dances off.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Lara and Jeni’s Massage, Phoebe is interviewing for a job.]
rows.Content: Interviewer: So it looks like you’ve got some great experience here. Let’s see ahh, reason for leaving last job?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, they thought I was a whore.ScenesInterviewer: Okay, we’ll give a call if anything comes up.ScenesPhoebe: Great! Thank you very much.Scenes(The interviewer watches her leave with an ‘Oh my goodness’ face.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With Joey's New GirlfriendScenesWritten by: Michael Curtis & Gregory S. MalinsScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the gang's all there. Ross has a slip of paper that he throws on the ground tying to get Rachel's attention.]
rows.Content: Ross: (picking up the slip of paper) Hello! What's this? Oh right its that girl's phone number. (Rachel ignores him) Yeah-yeah, there it is, just a phone number a really hot girl gave me. (He holds it so that Rachel can see it, she continues to ignore him) It's no big deal, I mean it is her home phone number, but...(Rachel still ignores him) Whoa! (Throws it in her lap) Whoa-whoops, I almost lost this baby! Yeah, the lovely Amanda gives me her number and I-I go and drop it. (He waves it in front of Rachel's face. Then suddenly Phoebe has to sneeze and Rachel quickly grabs the slip of paper and gives it to Phoebe for her to sneeze into.)ScenesPhoebe: Thank you.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the next morning. Chandler, Monica, Ross, and Rachel are there.]
rows.Content: Gunther: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesGunther: When's your birthday?ScenesRachel: May fifth, why?ScenesGunther: Oh, I-I'm just making a list of people's birthdays.ScenesRoss: Oh, mine's December...ScenesGunther: Yeah, whatever. (Walks away)Scenes(Chandler is talking to Monica and notices a beautiful woman.)ScenesChandler: Ohh, she's pretty. Pretty ahh, pretty girl, the pretty--she's pretty.ScenesMonica: Just go up to her and ask her out. (Chandler laughs) Oh, what's the worst thing that could happen?ScenesChandler: I could die.ScenesRoss: Yeah, it's-it's tough being single. That's why I'm so glad I found Amanda.ScenesRachel: Ross, you guys went out once. You took your kids to Chucky Cheese, and you didn't even kiss her.Scenes(Ross glares at Chandler.)ScenesChandler: I tell people secrets. It makes them like me.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Oh.ScenesChandler: Hey! (Phoebe sneezes)ScenesMonica: Phoebe! You're sick, you shouldn't play. You should just go home, get in bed, and stay there.ScenesPhoebe: (in a nasally voice, from her cold) But I'm unemployed, my music is all I really have now. Well music, and making my own shoes. (She puts her shoe on the table, and it's horribly decorated) Pretty, huh? (Sneezes)ScenesChandler: All right, I'm gonna do it! I'm gonna get shot down. Any advice?ScenesMonica: Just be yourself. But, not too much.ScenesChandler: (gets up) (softly) Wish me luck.ScenesRoss: (loudly) Good luck!ScenesChandler: Wish it! (To the woman, Kathy, he likes) Hi. Hi, I-I was just sitting over there, and uhh, Chandler. My name is Chandler. Did I say that?ScenesKathy: No, you didn't. Hi, I'm Kathy.ScenesChandler: Uh Kathy, with K or a C?ScenesKathy: With a K.ScenesChandler: Oh-oh-hey!ScenesKathy: Wow! You are really good at this.ScenesChandler: Hey, come on, give me a break, I'm out on a limb here.ScenesKathy: I'm sorry, you're right, I apologize, but I should tell you that I'm waiting for a date. (Joey enters) Oh, and there he is now.ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey! Hey, hey-hey, hey. (Joey kisses Kathy.)ScenesJoey: Hey, I see you guys already met, huh?ScenesChandler: Yes-yes, I was just trying to figure out a way to uh, demonstrate how I could get my exceptionally large feet into my even bigger mouth.ScenesJoey: Didn't I tell ya? Always showin' off.ScenesPhoebe: Before I start, I just wanna say that umm, I have a cold, so if I sneeze in the middle of song, it's not on purpose. Oh, except the last verse of Pepper People. (Starts to sing) Smelly cat, smelly cat. What are they feeding you? (Stops singing) This chick sounds good. (Singing) Smelly cat, smelly--(stops singing) Hey Gunther, be a good little boy and bring me a whiskey.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is walking into the living room having just gotten up in the middle of the night.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (sees Kathy is up watching TV) Hi!ScenesKathy: Hi.ScenesChandler: Jeez, at 2:30 in the morning, I didn't expect to have to fight over the remote.ScenesKathy: I'm sorry, it's just this Ernie Cofax thing on in a few minutes I wanted to watch.ScenesChandler: Oh my God! That's why I got up too!ScenesKathy: You're kidding! Oh, I love him.ScenesChandler: Hey, listen, I'm sorry about this afternoon, y'know, if I would've known you guys were... I never would've...ScenesKathy: Oh please!ScenesChandler: So ah, Joey tells me you two met in acting class.ScenesKathy: Yeah, they teamed us up as partners. Joey picked three scenes for us to do; all of them had us making out.ScenesChandler: That's a good thing actually, because ah, he used to have me rehearse with him.ScenesKathy: (laughs) Oh-oh-oh-oh!ScenesChandler: Is it on?ScenesKathy: No, but this wonder broom is amazing!ScenesChandler: Hey! (Runs over and gets his wonder broom)ScenesKathy: Oh my God!ScenesChandler: Oh! It's on! It's on!Scenes(Chandler jumps into the canoe and sits down. The chick starts chirping and Chandler reaches down to pick him up.)ScenesChandler: There we go little fella.ScenesKathy: (laughs) What about the duck?ScenesChandler: Well the duck can swim.ScenesKathy: Oh, jeez. (Hits him)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the next night, Phoebe is finishing up her set.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing, drunk) My sticky shoes, my sticky-sticky shoes, why do you stick on me, ba-a-by! Thanks for the lights honey.ScenesAll: Way to go, Phoebe!ScenesMonica: That cold makes you sound so great.ScenesPhoebe: It's fun, God I love how sexy I am. (Coughs really loudly.)ScenesJoey: Oh, Kath, we should get going. We're going to by hamsters.ScenesAll: Ooh, that's great, I love those little guys.ScenesKathy: No, no, it's not like that. I, I work for a medical researcher.ScenesRachel: Well, have fun!ScenesKathy: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I think it's great that the medical community is finally trying to help sick hamsters.ScenesMonica: Y'know what, I like Kathy.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, me too, she's so cool and pretty.ScenesRachel: Yeah, she's...ScenesChandler: She's smart and funny, y'know? We were up all last night talking, she said the funniest thing about--what?ScenesRachel: You love her.ScenesChandler: No, I don't.ScenesPhoebe: Yes, you do. Chandler loves Kathy.ScenesRoss: Come on, Pheebs lay off him.ScenesChandler: Thank you, Ross.ScenesRoss: Yeah, he's a little sensitive right now, `cause he's so in love.ScenesChandler: All right.ScenesAll: Ohh!ScenesChandler: All right.ScenesMonica: (turning around and doing that, "I'm making out with someone," thing with her hands) Ooh, umm, oh Kathy! Kathy, I love you! Oh! (She turns around and sees Gunther staring at her and stops suddenly.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe and Monica are there.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: So, I need to write some depressing stuff to go along with my new floozy voice, but nothing that sad has ever really happened to me.ScenesMonica: Oh umm, how about your mom dying, or having to live on the streets when you were 14?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh. Oh, yeah, I could write about the time my hair did that "Woo-hoo" thing.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey.ScenesRoss: (loudly) So I'm going over to Amanda's tonight!ScenesMonica: Rachel's not here.ScenesRoss: Oh.ScenesMonica: How's it going with her?ScenesRoss: Great, actually. I'm thinking tonight, maybe the night. Yeah, I mean ah, the kids are gonna play together and then when they're asleep, I'm thinking Amanda and I break open a bottle of wine, and do a little "playing" ourselves.ScenesRachel: (entering, with a guy) Hi guys! This is Josh. Josh, these are my friends, and that's Ross.ScenesMonica: Hi, Josh.ScenesPhoebe: Hi.ScenesJosh: Dudes.ScenesMonica: So, did you play in college? (She points to his NYU Soccer (football for the rest of the world) sweatshirt he's wearing.)ScenesJosh: Oh, I still do. Next year, I hope to make varsity though.ScenesRachel: Ross, didn't you ah, play soccer in High School? Oh no wait, that's right. You just organized their game schedules on your Commodore 64.ScenesJosh: Well, it's getting late, I've got to get to the game, so I'm gonna... head.ScenesRachel: Okay. (He starts to leave, and Rachel grabs him and gives him a passionate kiss.) I'll miss you.ScenesJosh: Dope! (exits)ScenesPhoebe: Wow, cute one!ScenesMonica: Very!ScenesRachel: I know, isn't he great? It's so nice to finally be in a fun relationship, y'know? There's nothing boring about him, and ah, I bet he's never set foot in a museum.ScenesRoss: Well maybe he'll get to go soon, like on a class trip or something.ScenesRachel: Y'know what else is really great about him, oh, what is the word for the adult that doesn't have dinosaur toys in their bedroom?ScenesRoss: Oh! (He bangs his fists together.)ScenesRachel: What was that?ScenesRoss: Monica knows.ScenesMonica: It's this dumb thing that Ross made up `cause he was trying to fool our parents. It's a way of giving the finger, without actually having to give it. I remember I cried the night you made it up, `cause it was the first time that I realized that I was actually cooler than my older brother.ScenesRoss: Well, I'm gonna go get ready, (Gives Monica the fist thing.) for my date tonight, so ah, I'll just_ head.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I should go to, `cause I'm playing in one hour. Hey, (clears her voice and in her normal voice) you guys should come hear me, ooh hear me. Ooh, (tries to sing) My sticky shoes--eww! Eww! I lost my sexy phlegm!

rows.Scenes: Amanda's apartment, Ross is arriving with Ben.]
rows.Content: Amanda: (opening the door) Hi!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesAmanda: Hi Ben!ScenesRoss: Wow! You-you look great!ScenesAmanda: Thanks!ScenesRoss: (she lets him in) Okay! (to her son) Hey Tommy.ScenesAmanda: I am so glad that you could come over tonight.ScenesRoss: Oh no-no-no, it's my pleasure.ScenesAmanda: Okay, well, my cell phone number is right here on the counter, please help yourself to anything in the fridge.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesAmanda: I appreciate this soo much, I've been trying to go out with this guy for like a month.ScenesRoss: I-I-I...ScenesAmanda: (noticing the bottle of wine he has) Oh, I don't mean to be a square, but I'd really appreciate it if you wait and drink your wine after the kids are asleep? Oh uh, thanks for this, I hope I can do the same for you sometime. (She leaves)ScenesRoss: Who wants to make some long distance calls?

rows.Scenes: A street, Chandler is buying a newspaper and notices Kathy running by.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Kathy! Kathy! Hi!! Kathy! Kathy! (She doesn't hear him and keeps running, Chandler starts chasing her as the theme to The Mod Squad starts to play. First, a car almost hits him and then gets mustard splashed on him as he runs by a hot dog vendor.) Kathy! (He keeps running and gets tangled up in the leashes of five dogs, in desperation he throws his paper.) Fetch! Fetch it! (He frees himself and resumes the chase) Kathy! Kathy! Kathy! (He now trips and falls into a pile of garbage, he tries to get up and scream her name again but he has a piece of spinach in his mouth. He gets out of the garbage and starts crossing the street by running over the hoods of a couple of cabs.) Kathy! (He jumps in front of her and out of breath he says) Kathy.ScenesKathy: Hey, Chandler! What are you doing here?ScenesChandler: Oh, I just wanted to say, "Hey!ScenesKathy: Hey!ScenesChandler: Okay. (He walks away disgusted with himself.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is telling Monica about his new baby sitting job.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh come on! You're making it sound worse than it actually was.ScenesRoss: Her date tipped me ten dollars. (Monica laughs)Scenes(Phoebe runs into the kitchen with wet hair, opens the window, and sticks her head outside.)ScenesRoss: Pheebs, what are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I wanna be sexy again so I'm trying to catch a cold. It should be easy, supposedly they're pretty common.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, you'll catch pneumonia.ScenesChandler: (entering) Okay. You were right. I'm in love with Joey's girlfriend.ScenesPhoebe: What?!ScenesRoss: Are you serious?ScenesPhoebe: Well, how-how-how is that possible? You barely know her!ScenesChandler: I don't know. I can't--I just, I can't get her out of my head. Y'know? I mean, I'm a very bad person. I'm a very, very bad person. I'm a horrible person. (he waits for a reaction, when he doesn't get one) No you're not Chandler! We still love you Chandler!ScenesMonica: (sneezes) Oh gosh, Phoebe, I think I caught your cold.ScenesPhoebe: You mean you stole it! (Monica sneezes again) Don't cover your mouth when you do that!Scenes(Joey and Kathy enter, laughing)ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesKathy: (to Chandler) We were just talking about you.ScenesChandler: Really?!ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah, I told her about the time you got drunk and fell asleep with your head in the toilet.ScenesChandler: (laughs) Right in there!

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is playing Hide-and-Go-Seek with the chick and the duck.]
rows.Content: Chandler: 99...100! Ready or not, here I come! (He opens his eyes and sees that the chick and the duck are still sitting in front of him) All right, let's go over the concept one more time.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey guys. (to Chandler) Listen uh, you wanna get some dinner with me and Kathy tonight?ScenesChandler: Ohh, umm, y'know what, I already ate.ScenesJoey: It's 4:30.ScenesChandler: Y'know I had a big meal on Monday, y'know. So that's just gonna get me straight through the week.ScenesJoey: Okay, I see what's going on here.ScenesChandler: You-you do?ScenesJoey: Yeah! You don't like Kathy.ScenesChandler: You got me.ScenesJoey: Yeah, you've been avoiding her ever since we started going out. Look, I made an effort to like Janice, now I think it's your turn to make an effort to like Kathy by going out to dinner with us. Right?ScenesChandler: Yeah. Right.ScenesJoey: Good, and hey! My treat. (He turns to go into his bedroom then stops.) But that's only because you're not eating anything, right?ScenesChandler: Okay.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is returning from a date with Josh, and when they get the door open, Rachel turns and passionately kisses Josh.]
rows.Content: Monica: (lying on the couch suffering from her cold) Ross isn't here.ScenesRachel: Oh. (She tries to walk away from Josh, by he keeps holding her) Stop it!ScenesJosh: So I'll see you at the party? Beer's beer man, 24, 7!!ScenesRachel: Yeah! (Monica gives a sarcastic thumbs up) (Josh leaves) I am soo gonna marry that guy. (looking in her wallet) Ohhh!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesRachel: I think he's stealing from me.ScenesMonica: Why?ScenesRachel: Because he's stealing from me!ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hi! It's me. And soup. (to Rachel) Hey, I just saw Josh, he looks so yummy in your leather jacket.ScenesRachel: Ughh! (Storms out after him)ScenesPhoebe: (to Monica) Here, now I don't eat chicken, so it's just noodle soup. And there's no chicken in the broth either, so it's really just... noodle water.ScenesMonica: Thank you so much Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: (picking up Monica's used Kleenex and putting some in her pocket.) Sure.ScenesMonica: What are you doing with those?!ScenesPhoebe: But, I need your germs! I want my cold back! I miss my sexy voice.ScenesMonica: Sorry, Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: It's okay. How's the soup?ScenesMonica: Umm. (nodding her head, "Good.")Scenes(Monica sets the soup down and Phoebe picks it up and licks the rim.)ScenesMonica: Ohhhh!! Gross!!

rows.Scenes: A nightclub, Chandler is having dinner with Kathy and Joey.]
rows.Content: Kathy: Ohh, God, guys, check it out, you can see that girl's underwear!ScenesJoey: Is she great or what?ScenesKathy: (to Chandler) So? Huh? What do you think?ScenesChandler: Ohh, she's-she's not really my type.ScenesKathy: Not your type?! She's gorgeous!ScenesChandler: Y'know what I think it is? It's the fishnet stockings. Y'know? Whenever I see a girl in fishnet stockings it reminds me of my father in fishnet stockings.ScenesKathy: Okay. Understanding a little more why you're single. Ohh! Y'know, I have a friend you would like, she's really pretty. And then we could double date!ScenesChandler: Uhh, no-no thanks.ScenesKathy: Okay, I've got some ugly friends, and they're all available too.ScenesChandler: Listen, I-I'm gonna grab a beer. (Leaves)ScenesJoey: (to Kathy) I'll be right back. (to Chandler) What was that?ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: Kathy was being really nice and you just walked away. I thought we had a deal.ScenesChandler: Hey, look, what do you want from me?ScenesJoey: I want you to like her! But if that's too damned difficult for you, then the least you can do is pretend.ScenesChandler: I am pretending.ScenesJoey: Well then, do it better!ScenesChandler: Okay, what do you saw I go over there and say how much I like her? (Joey gives him a thumbs up) No-no it'll be good, I can tell her much I've been thinking about her. That I haven't stopped thinking about her since the moment I met her. That I'm so fantastically, over-the-top, wanna-slit-my-own-throat in love with her, that for every minute of every hour of every day I can't believe my own damn bad luck that you met her first!!ScenesJoey: Well, that's pretty good. But you might wanna tone it down a little.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are there.]
rows.Content: Ross: (entering) Hey! So, uhh, Amanda just-just dropped me off. Yeah, that's one of the things I love about her, she's...uh, she's old enough to drive. (to Monica) So uhh, I guess you're not going to mom and dad's tonight?ScenesMonica: No, sorry.ScenesRachel: Well where's Amanda?ScenesMonica: Hey Rach, could you get me some cough drops?ScenesRachel: I mean y'know, I'm thinking. You could bring her, and you guys could go up to your old room, and not make out.ScenesMonica: Ross, cough drops, please?ScenesRoss: At least I know she's not going out with me to get into R rated movies.ScenesRachel: Why don't you just marry her? Oh no, wait a minute you can't, I'm sorry I forgot, she's not a lesbian.ScenesRoss: You see Amanda and I have a very special...ScenesMonica: (interrupting) You have nothing! You're not even going out! You're her baby sitter! You have a 12-year-old girl's job!ScenesRachel: (laughing) Ohh, that is soo sad.ScenesMonica: And what are you laughing at, Miss `My-keg-sucking-boyfriend-is-stealing-from-me!'Scenes(Ross starts laughing)ScenesRachel: Hey, so he stole a couple bucks from me! At least he bought me something with it! (Shows her, her ring)ScenesMonica: That's mine!! Now, would you both please start acting like adults? And get me my cough drops!ScenesRoss: Fine.ScenesRachel: Sorry.ScenesRoss: Here. (Hands her, her cough drops) (to Rachel) At least I made ten bucks in my relationship.ScenesRachel: Y'know...Scenes(She does Ross's little gesture. In response Ross puts his hands behind his neck with his arms sticking straight out and starts flapping them together.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is there with her guitar.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) Platting goats are platting. Platting down the street. Platting goats are platting, leaving little treats. (to Gunther) Does it even work without my sexy voice?ScenesGunther: I like it. (sneezes)ScenesPhoebe: Gunther, kiss me.ScenesGunther: What?Scenes(Phoebe grabs Gunther and kisses him. He then falls to the couch in shock.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching TV as Joey and Kathy are laughing in Joey's bedroom. They get to be pretty loud so Chandler turns the TV way up.]
rows.Content: Joey: (opening the door wearing nothing but a sock, and holding a dart board over the `Little General.') Hey! (Chandler turns down the TV) Now, we're not actually gonna be sleeping in her, but do you mind?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, with a blanket draped over her shoulders, opens the door to a similarly clad Chandler.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Can I sleep on your couch?Scenes(Monica nods `Yes.' And they both walk to the couch looking all depressed.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is singing, with everyone else present.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) And I'm still waiting for my paper mache man. Thank you my babies.Scenes(applause)ScenesGunther: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesGunther: I don't know if you heard about what happened between me and Phoebe the other day_ScenesRachel: No!ScenesGunther: Well, we kissed. I-I-I didn't initiate the kiss, but-but I also didn't stop it, and I've been feeling guilty.ScenesRachel: (confused) Okay.ScenesGunther: So umm, are we cool?ScenesRachel: (really confused) Okay.ScenesGunther: I knew you'd understand.Scenes(Gunther walks away, leaving Rachel with a `What just happened?' look on her face.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Dirty GirlScenesWritten by: Scott Silveri & Shana Goldberg-MeehanScenesTranscribed by: Darcy & Julie Partridge

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross and a beautiful blonde (Cheryl) are standing outside. The rest of the gang is watching from inside.]
rows.Content: Cheryl: So, thank you for the delicious dinner.ScenesRoss: You're welcome for a delicious dinner.Scenes[inside]ScenesPhoebe: Hey what are you guys looking at?ScenesChandler: Ross and the most beautiful girl in the world.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, come to papa.Scenes[Cheryl walks away and Ross walks inside. Everyone stares at him in disbelief.]ScenesRoss: I know!ScenesMonica: Probably the only time I'll ever say this, but did you see the ass on her?ScenesChandler: Where did you, when did you, how did you... (Joey hits the back of Chandler's head) How did you get a girl like that?ScenesRachel: Yeah, so what is she, like a... like a spokesmodel, or an aerobics instructor, what?ScenesRoss: Actually she's a paleontology doctoral candidate, specializing in the centazoic era.ScenesChandler: Okay, but that's, like, the easiest era.ScenesRoss: I've seen her at work, but I always figured, ah-huh? But, uh, I made her dinner. We had a great time. And we're going out again tomorrow.ScenesRachel: Well maybe she and her friends are just having a contest to see who can bring home the biggest geek.ScenesRoss: Fine by me; hope she wins.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's. Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are there. Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hi. You guys have any wrapping paper?ScenesPhoebe: Oo! Is it for my birthday present?ScenesChandler: Phebes, it was your birthday, like, months ago.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but remember you said you ordered something special, and it just hasn't come yet?ScenesChandler: Well, I have a call in about that.ScenesPhoebe: 'Kay.ScenesChandler: Actually, this is for Kathy's birthday. It's an early edition of her favorite book.ScenesRachel: Oh, The Velveteen Rabbit! Oh my God, when the boy's love makes the rabbit real!ScenesChandler: Okay, but don't touch it, because you fingers have destructive oils.ScenesRachel: Huh. Well, then you'd better keep it away from Ross's hair. So this is pretty rare. How did you get that?ScenesChandler: Oh, it wasn't a big deal. I just went to a couple of bookstores, talked to a couple of dealers... called a couple of the author's grandchildren.ScenesRachel: Oh, honey, that's so sweet.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, and what a great way to say, "I secretly love you, roommate's girlfriend!ScenesChandler: It doesn't say that. Does it?ScenesRoss: How do you think it's gonna look when you get her something incredibly meaningful and expensive and her boyfriend Joey gives her an orange?ScenesChandler: Okay, all right, I'll just uh, make sure that uh, Joey gets her something really great.ScenesPhoebe: It's gotta be better than that book. Oo! Like a crossbow!ScenesMonica: (Entering from her bedroom, talking on the phone) Yeah, once again, I am sorry. Thank you. Bye. (To the gang) I just had to turn down a job catering a funeral for sixty people.ScenesRachel: Oh my God! What happened?ScenesMonica: Sixty guests.ScenesRoss: So, uh, why did you have to turn it down?ScenesMonica: Because I don't have the money or the equipment to handle something that big on such short notice. I mean there's no way.ScenesPhoebe: Wow, what is with all the negativity? You sound like Monican't , not Monican... (Monica looks almost puzzled) ...Monica. Look, you know, you have been playing around with this catering thing for over three years. Do you want to be a caterer or not?ScenesMonica: I don't know.ScenesPhoebe: There you go, that's the spirit! Okay! Now, if you need money, I will lend you money, but just get moving!ScenesMonica: Really? Cause I'd need like $500 for all the food and the supplies and stuff.ScenesPhoebe: Okay! It's worth it, if it will get you moving. You haven't worked in months.ScenesMonica: Well, you're not working either.ScenesPhoebe: Yes, but I'm doing this.ScenesMonica: Yeah, that'd be great! Thank you!Scenes[Joey enters]ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesEveryone: Hey.ScenesKathy: Can I borrow the keys to your apartment?ScenesJoey: Why?Scenes[Kathy whispers something in Joey's ear]ScenesJoey: You can pee here!ScenesKathy: Ahahaha... haha.. yes I can, of course. Excuse me.ScenesChandler: It's okay, the duck's using our bathroom anyway. (Kathy goes into the bathroom.) Hey Joe! What are you getting Kathy for her birthday?ScenesJoey: We've only been going out for a couple of weeks, do you think I gotta get her something?ScenesEveryone: Yeah!ScenesRachel: Yes, you have to get her something, and it should be something really nice.ScenesJoey: Oh, I know...ScenesRachel: And not one of your coupons for an hour of "Joey Love.Scenes[cut to a new scene, also in Monica and Rachel's apartment. Rachel is sitting, Phoebe is nearby.]ScenesPhoebe: Ooo, a crossword! Can I help?ScenesRachel: No! I'm sorry, honey, it's just that last week I got all but three answers and I really want to finish a whole one without any help.ScenesPhoebe: Fine. But you can't help me develop my new universal language.Scenes[Monica enters]ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey, how'd it go?ScenesMonica: Oh my God, it was the best funeral ever! I mean, everyone loved the food, and guess what? I even got another funeral for tomorrow—the dead-guy-from-today's best friend. I mean, it is like I am the official caterer for that accident!ScenesPhoebe: Mon! I'm so happy for you!ScenesMonica: Thanks. Like, check out my new catering stuff. (Picks up two frying pans) Look at this! I'm an omelet station! Omelet? Made to order!ScenesPhoebe: I'll have one, please. Plus my money.ScenesMonica: Oh. Well, I didn't realize that you needed it back right away. I mean, you told me to go and be a caterer. So I went. I beed. I mean, I... I used it to buy all this stuff. But look—I've got another job tomorrow, so I'll pay you back with the money I make from that.ScenesPhoebe: Oh. Okay. Oo, sorry I acted like a bank.ScenesMonica: Okay.

rows.Scenes: Outside Cheryl's apartment, Ross and Cheryl are kissing]
rows.Content: Ross: (moved by the kiss) Huh...ScenesCheryl: Um, would you like to come in?ScenesRoss: Did homo-erectus hunt with wooden tools?ScenesCheryl: According to recent findings!Scenes[They go into the apartment. Inside the apartment it looks like a sewage dump exploded and landed in her living room. There are clothes and food and junk covering every square inch of space. I mean pigs have nicer pens. Ross is completely shocked.]ScenesCheryl: (throwing food around the room) Here Mitzi! Here Mitzi!ScenesRoss: Mitzi is.....ScenesCheryl: My hamster. I hope she's okay, I haven't seen her in a while. Have a seat.ScenesRoss: (mouths "where?") Uh... Oh hey, do you, uh (steps on some garbage and falters) ...do you have any, um, Cinnamon Fruit Toasties?ScenesCheryl: What?ScenesRoss: Well, I do! Why don't we go back to my place, light a couple of candles, break open a box of Cinnamon Fruit Toasties, uh...ScenesCheryl: I'd rather not.ScenesRoss: Oh, yeah, why not?ScenesCheryl: Okay, um, don't take this the wrong way, but your place kinda has a weird smell.

rows.Scenes: A kitchen where Phoebe and Monica are finishing up a catering job]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh, is everything in the car?ScenesPhoebe: Yes. Did you settle the bill?ScenesMonica: No. I hate this part.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, look what we almost left. (Picks up a coffee maker)ScenesMonica: No, that's not mine.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, all right. Oh! Look what we almost took!Scenes[cut to the living room of the same dwelling, where the funeral guests are mingling. Monica enters.]ScenesMonica: Excuse me, Mrs. Burkart? Well, we're all cleaned up in the kitchen.ScenesMrs. Burkart: Oh, good. Thank you.ScenesMonica: Um, and, well there's the.. the the small matter of...ScenesMrs. Burkart: Dear?ScenesMonica: Just the matter of ...payment?ScenesMrs. Burkart: (in grief) Jack used to handle the finances! (Breaks into tears)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is on the couch still doing the crossword. Chandler is in the kitchen.]
rows.Content: Rachel: You know what we should all do? Go see a musical.ScenesChandler: (confused) Sure...ScenesRachel: And you know which one we should see? The 1996 Tony award winner. Do you happen to know the name of that one?ScenesChandler: I don't know... um, Grease?ScenesRachel: No....ScenesChandler: Rent?ScenesRachel: Yes! Rent!ScenesChandler: Okay, so when do you want to go?ScenesRachel: What? Oh, I'm sorry, I can't, I'm busy.ScenesJoey: (entering the apartment) Hey. Man, it is so hard to shop for girls.ScenesChandler: Yes, it is, at Office Max.ScenesRachel: What did you get her? (Joey opens up a rectangular black box and holds up a pen.)ScenesChandler: A pen.ScenesJoey: It's two gifts in one. It's a pen that's also a clock! Huh?ScenesChandler: Huh-huh! You can't give her that.ScenesJoey: Why not?ScenesChandler: Because she's not eleven! And it's not the seventh night of Hanukkah!ScenesRachel: Okay, honey, what he means by that, is ...while this is a very nice gift, maybe it's just not something a boyfriend gives?ScenesJoey: Sure it is! She needs a pen for work, she's writing, she turns it over.... "Whoa! It's time for my date with Joey!ScenesChandler: All right, look, look. What did... what did you get for Angela Delveccio for her birthday?ScenesJoey: She didn't have a birthday while we were going out.ScenesChandler: For three years?ScenesJoey: (whining and heading toward the door) Look, it's too late, and I got an audition. I can't shop anymore! I...ScenesChandler: All right. I will go out and I will try to find something for her, okay?ScenesJoey: Thanks, man. And oh, while you're at it, could you get her a card?ScenesChandler: Would you like me to write her a little poem as well?ScenesJoey: Or... just get a card that has a poem already in it.

rows.Scenes: Back in the kitchen at the funeral. Phoebe is there, Monica enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: But Mon, you have to get our money!ScenesMonica: Oh, Phoebe, she couldn't stop crying! With those thick glasses, her tears looked giant.ScenesPhoebe: I know, it's tough. You know what the first thing I did after my mother's funeral was?ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: Pay the caterer! Look, I've had a lot of jobs, okay, and there are some people who just always try to get out of paying. It's either, you know, "that massage wasn't long enough, or, "I don't recognize any of those songs," or, you know, "these sombreros aren't big enough. Bad little white girl!ScenesMonica: Okay. So what do you.... you think she's faking?ScenesPhoebe: Well, it seems like there weren't any tears 'til you showed her the bill.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, she sounded pretty upset to me.Scenes[cut to the living room where Mrs. Burkart is now performing.]ScenesMrs. Burkart: (singing) You're a grand ol' flag, you're a high-flying flag, and forever in peace may you wave....ScenesPhoebe: She seems fine now.ScenesMrs. Burkart: (singing) ...emblem of the land I love. The home of....ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Joey are standing and talking, Ross is tying a tie.]
rows.Content: Joey: So, you just left? Her place was really that bad?ScenesRoss: You know how you throw your jacket on a chair at the end of the day?ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Well, like that, only instead of a chair, it's a pile of garbage. And instead of a jacket, it's a pile of garbage. And instead of the end of the day, it's the end of time, and garbage is all that has survived! (Ross takes the loosely tied tie off and hands it to Joey who puts it on.) Here.ScenesJoey: Wow. Thanks. So, uh, what happened?ScenesRoss: What do you mean? Nothing happened! I had to get out of there.ScenesJoey: All right, so... next time, you take her to your place.ScenesRoss: No, I tried that. She says it has a weird smell.ScenesJoey: What kind of smell?ScenesRoss: I don't know. Soap?ScenesJoey: All right, listen, Ross... you like this girl, right?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesJoey: You wanna see her again, right?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesJoey: So you're gonna have to do it in the mess!ScenesRoss: Yeah, okay you're right.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesRoss: I mean, uh, who... who cares about a little sloppiness?ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesRoss: It's, uh... it's endearing, really.ScenesJoey: All right! Now you go get that beautiful pig! (Ross hesitates, looks unsure) Oink!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel, Rachel is there, Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay, all right. I just spent the entire afternoon looking for a present for Kathy that would be better than the rabbit.ScenesRachel: Any luck?ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah. Yeah, I found this great place called "Invisible things for Kathy." (Motions to an imaginary pile of presents next to him.) Can you give me a hand with all this stuff?ScenesRachel: All right, look. Why don't you just return the book, let Joey give her the clock pen, and you give her something worse than that. Like... a regular pen.ScenesChandler: She's really going to love this, you know? The bottom line is I want her to have it, even if I don't get to be the one who gives it to her.ScenesRachel: Aw, honey, that's so sweet.ScenesChandler: Yeah? You don't think it's just pathetic?ScenesRachel: Oh! Pathetic! (Grabs the crossword puzzle and starts writing.)ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey! I'm meeting Kathy in ten minutes! I've been looking all over for you!ScenesChandler: Where?ScenesJoey: Our place, the hall! I...ScenesChandler: I got something for her. (Joey picks up the package, shakes it next to his ear, can't hear anything, switches ears, shakes it again.) It's a book!ScenesJoey: (Unimpressed) A book? (Suddenly interested) Is it like a book that's also a safe?ScenesChandler: No, it's a book that's just a book, okay? It's an early edition of the Velveteen Rabbit. It was her favorite book as a kid. So, uh, just... let me know if she likes it, okay?ScenesJoey: You got it. Thanks man. Thanks for doing this, I owe you one. (Joey leaves, comes back in.) Oh, hey! There wasn't any change from that twenty, was there?ScenesChandler: No, it came out to an even twenty.ScenesJoey: Wow. That's almost as much as a new book.

rows.Scenes: In the living room at the funeral]
rows.Content: Mrs. Burkart: (singing) Jeepers, creepers, where'd you get those peepers? Jeepers, creepers, where'd you get those eyes?Scenes[cut to Monica and Phoebe in the kitchen]ScenesPhoebe: You didn't get the money, did you?ScenesMonica: Maybe I can try at intermission? Phoebe, come on... you know what? Let's just go!ScenesPhoebe: No! Hey, we're not leaving until we get paid! I don't know who she thinks she is! Enough is enough! (Phoebe goes into the living room.) Hey, widow?ScenesMrs. Burkart: (Singing) Come on along and listen to...ScenesPhoebe: Okay, Widow!ScenesMrs. Burkart: (Singing) ...the lullabye of...ScenesPhoebe: Excuse me. Excuse me! (Mrs. Bukart stops singing) Thanks. Um, clearly this is a very, very hard time for you. Um, but, um, we provided a service, and we deserve to be paid because you ate that service, and, um, we are not leaving here until we're paid every penny. 'Cause you know what, lady? We're part time caterers, and we have no place else to go.ScenesMrs. Burkart: All right. I'll get my bag.ScenesPhoebe: Good. (Phoebe and Mrs. Burkart go into the other room, leaving Monica with everyone staring at her.)ScenesMonica: I'm gonna leave some cards here. Please think of us for you next event.

rows.Scenes: Outside Cheryl's apartment.]
rows.Content: Cheryl: So you want to come inside?ScenesRoss: (mustering up courage) Yes. Yes I do. (They go inside.)ScenesCheryl: I'll be right back. Make yourself comfortable. (Ross attempts to clear a place for his coat and fold it small enough to fit. Then hit sits on the couch. Something falls on him from above and he brushes his neck off frantically.)ScenesCheryl: (sneaking up behind Ross) Guess who?ScenesRoss: Department of Sanitation?ScenesCheryl: It's me!ScenesRoss: Oh! (She kisses him) Ah. (They kiss more, and move down onto the couch. Ross's hand moves under some garbage) Aw! (His hand is covered with something brown and gooey.)ScenesCheryl: What?ScenesRoss: (trying to make his disgust into lust) Ah, Cheryl!ScenesCheryl: Oh, Ross!Scenes[They sit up, moaning in excitement, and Cheryl straddles Ross. Ross finds a slice of bologna and moans higher and louder, then a bag of potato chips on the coffee table starts to move. Ross throws Cheryl off his lap, grabs a tennis racket and a toilet brush and starts pounding the bag.]ScenesCheryl: Wait! No! No! It's my hamster! It's Mitzi!ScenesRoss: Oh my god! I'm so sorry, Cheryl. I must have freaked out.ScenesCheryl: (looking in the bag) Oh, thank god, it's not Mitzi. It's just a rat.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk. Rachel is sitting on the couch alone working on a crossword puzzle. Gunther is there, going into the back room.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I did it! Oh! I finished it! I did it all by myself! And there's nobody to hug!Scenes[From the background we hear a crash and Gunther comes running out of the back room, pushing people aside, reaching for Rachel.]ScenesGunther: Move!Scenes[Gunther slips and falls just before reaching the back of the couch. Monica and Phoebe come into Central Perk.]ScenesRachel: Hey! Hey, you guys, I finished the crossword all by myself! Hug me!Scenes[Gunther gets up slowly from behind the couch and walks away sadly]ScenesPhoebe: Uh... yay!ScenesRachel: Thanks!ScenesMonica: Oh, that's great! Congratulations!ScenesRachel: Thank you! Hey, how'd the catering go?ScenesMonica: Oh, it was great! The widow wouldn't pay, so Phoebe yelled at her 'til she did.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. I'm a hard ass.ScenesMonica: And I'm a wuss. And we should be partners.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Hard Ass and Wuss. We could fight crime!ScenesMonica: Wait a minute, Phoebe! We should be partners. We should be catering partners. I mean, think about it! You're not working right now, and we have such a great time together!ScenesPhoebe: Okay!ScenesMonica: I can cook and you can take care of the money.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. Oh! It'll be like I have a wife in the fifties!ScenesBoth: (screaming with excitement) Aah!

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is there, Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey, how'd it go? How'd she like the gift?ScenesJoey: Oh, man, she loved it! She's over there showing Monica and Rachel right now.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah? That's great!ScenesJoey: Hey, listen, I gotta tell ya, I feel kinda bad taking credit for this, because man, am I gonna get a lot of credit for this!ScenesChandler: [nodding, with mixed feelings] Aahhuuhhh....Scenes[Kathy enters]ScenesKathy: Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey! Happy birthday.ScenesKathy: Thank you!ScenesJoey: You know, uh... [Joey moves the pen case out onto the counter.] Chandler got you a gift, too.ScenesChandler: No he didn't. [Moving it back.]ScenesJoey: Yeah, he did, look... look, it's right there on the counter! Ha-ho-ho!ScenesChandler: Happy birthday! I'm sorry.ScenesKathy: You really didn't have to. (Opens the box) Wow.ScenesChandler: See, you think it's just a pen, but then you turn it over and it's also a clock.ScenesKathy: Yeah. No, this is great. Thank you, Chandler. (They hug).ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah... yeah.ScenesJoey: Ah. Hm. (To Kathy) Wanna go to bed?ScenesKathy: I'll be in in a minute.ScenesJoey: Oh, uh... don't forget your coupon. (Tries to strike a sexy pose up against the doorway to his room. Then goes inside).ScenesChandler: [to Kathy] Goodnight.ScenesKathy: Um, thank you for the gift.ScenesChandler: Oh, uh, yeah... I just knew that sometimes when you're writing, you... you don't always know the exact time.ScenesKathy: No, I... I didn't mean the pen. Thank you for the book.ScenesChandler: Uh, the book?ScenesKathy: The Velveteen Rabbit. I kinda have the feeling you had something to do with it.ScenesChandler: What do you mean?ScenesKathy: Well, uh, when Joey gave it to me, he said, "This is 'cause I know ya like Rabbits, and I know ya like cheese." Thanks. I love it. And I know how hard it must have been for you to find.ScenesChandler: (tongue-tied) Uhl..ell. By the way, in case you missed that, that sound was, "Uhl, ell.ScenesKathy: You must really like... Joey... to go to all that trouble for him.ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah, he's my... he's my best friend.ScenesKathy: Well....ScenesChandler: Goodnight. (Goes to his room.)ScenesJoey: (opening bedroom door) Hey, that coupon expires, you know.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Outside Cheryl's apartment, Monica knocks on Cheryl's door]
rows.Content: Monica: Hi. Uh, you... you don't know me, I'm Monica Geller... Ross's sister.ScenesCheryl: Oh, yeah. Oh, you know, that's too bad that didn't work out.ScenesMonica: Yeah. Anyway, he told me about your apartment. And, um, I couldn't sleep, thinking about it. So, uh, would it be okay if I cleaned it?Scenes[Cheryl shrugs, shuts the door, looking puzzled]ScenesMonica: No?Scenes[Monica looks around the hallway, pulls out a sponge and starts scrubbing the door frame.]ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Chandler Crosses a LineScenesWritten by: Adam ChaseScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, everyone except Joey and Chandler are there eating breakfast.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering in a bathrobe) I just walked in the bathroom and saw Kathy naked! It was like torture!ScenesRoss: Y'know if we ever go to war and you’re captured, you’re in for a big surprise.ScenesChandler: It just keeps getting worse and worse! Y'know? I mean it’s bad enough that I’m in love with my roommates girlfriend—which by the way, I think she knows. Because every time we’re in the room together there’s this weird like energy between us. And call me crazy, but I think she likes me too. And now I have seen her naked. I mean at least when I’ve seen her with clothes on, I could imagine her body was like covered in boles or something. But there are no boles, she’s smooth! Smooth! (leaves)Scenes(Pause)ScenesPhoebe: Wow! Could everyone totally see up his robe?ScenesAll: Yeah! Oh my God!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey is getting a phone number from a woman (Casey) as Chandler watches from the doorway.]
rows.Content: Casey: Here you go.ScenesJoey: Great! All right, so I’ll call you later.ScenesCasey: Great! (leaves)ScenesChandler: (rushing up) Hey-Hey-Hey! Who was that?ScenesJoey: That would be Casey. We’re going out tonight.ScenesChandler: Goin’ out, huh? Wow! Wow! (Does a little celebration dance) So things didn’t work out with Kathy, huh? Bummer.ScenesJoey: No, things are fine with Kathy. I’m having a late dinner with her tonight, right after my early dinner with Casey.ScenesChandler: (shocked) What?ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah. And the craziest thing is that I just ate a whole pizza by myself! (Laughs)ScenesChandler: Wait! You’re going out with Kathy!ScenesJoey: Yeah. Why are you getting so upset?ScenesChandler: Well, I’m upset—for you. I mean, having sex with an endless line of beautiful women must be very unfulfilling for you. (He can’t believe he just sad that.)ScenesJoey: What is the big deal? It’s not like we’re exclusive.ScenesChandler: Look, Joey, Kathy is clearly not fulfilling your emotional needs. But Casey, I mean granted I only saw the back of her head, but I got this sense that she’s-she’s smart, and funny, and gets you.ScenesJoey: You got all that from the back of her head?ScenesChandler: All right look, I think it’s time for you to settle down. Y'know? Make a choice, pick a lane.ScenesJoey: Who’s Elaine?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Monica are sitting on the couch playing cards, and Phoebe is working on a new song.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) "Little, tiny Tarzan, swinging on a nose hair. Swinging with the greatest of ease…" Darn it! Now, I don’t know who to get to the next verse.ScenesRoss: Oh, you could just go uh, "greatest of ease… (plays air guitar) BAH-bah-bha-bhannn." Then go right into it.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, ooh, I like that! Yeah. Wait! How do you know about ‘bah-bah-bha-bhan?’ScenesRoss: Well umm, y’know, I used to play.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, that’s right, the keyboards, huh?ScenesRoss: Yeah, just a little in high school, but then I really got into it in college. I mean that’s-that’s when I really found my sound.Scenes(Monica is taking a drink as Ross says that, laughs, and snorts her drink.)ScenesMonica: Oh God! Orange juice just came out of my nose, but it was totally worth it. Oh my God, I completely forgot about your sound.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesMonica: He used to lock himself in the basement for hours. No one was every allowed to hear, "The Sound.ScenesPhoebe: I wanna hear "The Sound.ScenesRoss: Really? No. I mean, nah, I haven’t played in so long, and-and, well it’s-it’s really personal stuff, y’know?ScenesPhoebe: Come on, play that funky music white boy.ScenesMonica: Yeah!ScenesRoss: No, you guys, I mean my keyboards are all the way up in—No, yeah, okay. (Runs out.)Scenes[Cut to later that same day, Ross has retrieved his keyboard and is about to debut, "The Sound."]ScenesRoss: Okay, guys.ScenesChandler: All right! Bring it on, you…ScenesRoss: Here we go. (Plays one note) Y’know, I’ve-I’ve never played my stuff for anyone before, so it’s important that-that you understand it’s about communicating very private emotions. (Plays another note) Y’know, umm, you should-you should think of umm, my work as wordless sound poems. That’s what I’m…ScenesChandler: (interrupting) Oh my God! Play!Scenes(Ross starts to play. He plays a key that has a back beat sound attached to it. Over the background music he plays the sound of a barking dog, a mooing cow, a laser beam, someone coughing, a jackhammer, a doorbell, a police siren, a ray gun, breaking dishes, and for a closer he plays the sound of a loud crash. Basically, the music sucks.)ScenesMonica: (At a loss for words) Boy, that was-that was, umm… terrific.ScenesChandler: Really, bitchin’!ScenesPhoebe: Wow, it was so—wow!ScenesRoss: Really?! I mean, really?!!ScenesRachel: Yeah, I mean, you should play in public!ScenesRoss: Wow! Thanks, you guys. That’s uh—ohhh, I wanna, I wanna play you another piece! Umm! Uh-oh! I left my uh, helicopter sounds on another disk. I’ll be right back! Okay? (Runs to fetch them) This is so nice, I’m—I am so… (starts to break up and leaves)ScenesMonica: Oh God bless my dad sound proofing the basement!ScenesRachel: Oh, I can’t believe I ever let him touch me with those fingers.ScenesPhoebe: What are you guys talking about, I loved it!
