It was soo moving. Oh, plus it’s just, it’s so different from the stuff you usually hear.ScenesChandler: You mean like, music?

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching Yasmein Bleeth running on TV, and the duck starts quacking.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Yeah, I know what you’re thinkin’! Yes, yes, your breasts are just as firm and juicy.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door.)ScenesChandler: Come in!ScenesKathy: (entering) Hey! (sees what’s on TV) Oh God, is that Baywatch?ScenesChandler: Uh yes, but uh, I just watch it for the articles.ScenesKathy: So is Joey around?ScenesChandler: No-no, he’s not back yet, but he’ll be here any minute. So uh, come on in. Have a seat. Bow or stern?ScenesKathy: I uh, don’t really have a preference. You?ScenesChandler: I like it in the stern. (Realizes what he just said.) …of the boat. (The phone rings, and he answers it.) (on phone) Hello.ScenesJoey: (on the other end at a pay phone) Hey, it’s me. Listen Casey and I were on our way back and had a little car trouble.ScenesChandler: What happened?ScenesJoey: We broke down on the Parkway, so I have to walk back and get some transmission fluid. And hey, listen could you please tell Kathy that I’ll be there as soon as I can.ScenesChandler: Why can’t you tell her?ScenesJoey: ‘Cause I only have one quarter, and I think my time is about to—(he stops talking suddenly)ScenesChandler: Joey! Joey!!ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesChandler: I thought your time ran out.ScenesJoey: Me too, but I guess I do have a couple of more—(his time runs out for real)ScenesChandler: (to Kathy) Uhh, that was Joey. He’s running a little late, he says he’s sorry.ScenesKathy: Oh.ScenesChandler: So I guess it’s just uh, you and me then.ScenesKathy: Oh, okay.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I think it is!ScenesKathy: So what did you do today?ScenesChandler: Oh, I had an appointment to get my haircut…ScenesKathy: (interrupting) Oh, it looks great!ScenesChandler: …and then it got canceled.ScenesKathy: Well, I could cut it.ScenesChandler: Really?! You do that?ScenesKathy: Yeah, I do. Of course, I learned at my aunt’s dog grooming shop, but hey, what do you say?ScenesChandler: Dog grooming huh? Okay, just don’t make my tail too poofy.Scenes[Cut to later, Kathy is cutting Chandler’s hair.]ScenesKathy: You have really great hair.ScenesChandler: Well, thanks. I grow it myself. (Kathy is running her fingers through his hair, and Chandler catches himself enjoying it too much.) Y’know who also has great hair is Joey!ScenesKathy: Yes! Yeah! Joey has great hair! Umm, I’m basically done here. Just let me get this off your neck.Scenes(Kathy leans in really close and Chandler mouths "Oh my God." She moves around in front of him and kneels at his feet.)ScenesChandler: What-what ‘cha doin’?ScenesKathy: Checking to see if it’s even.ScenesChandler: ‘Kay.ScenesKathy: Looks good.Scenes(They lean in to kiss and are interrupted by the phone.)ScenesChandler: (jumping up to answer the phone) Oh the phone! The phone’s making sounds! (On phone) Hello!ScenesJoey: (on phone) Hey dude, it’s me.ScenesChandler: Hey it’s Joey!ScenesJoey: Listen uh, I’m really sorry, it looks like I’m gonna be stuck here for a while. I got the transmission fluid, but when I went to put it in the car, the transmission wasn’t there!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: Yeah, it must’ve fallen out a few blocks back. I just figured we hit a dog.ScenesChandler: Okay.ScenesJoey: Listen uh, could you put Kathy on, I wanna apologize.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah man. (to Kathy) Joey. (Hands her the phone.)ScenesKathy: (on phone) Hey. (listens) Oh no it’s fine, don’t worry about it. (listens) Yeah-no, stop apologizing, it’s okay. (listens) Yeah! I’ll talk to you tomorrow. (hangs up) (to Chandler) I should uh, probably go.ScenesChandler: Yeah. Yes! Yeah.Scenes(Kathy leaves and Chandler groans in agony. Kathy knocks on the door and Chandler opens it.)ScenesKathy: I forgot my purse.ScenesChandler: Oh.Scenes(They kiss, passionately.)ScenesKathy: No, I really did forget my purse.Scenes(They kiss again.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, continued from earlier. Chandler and Kathy are still kissing, then they stop suddenly.]
rows.Content: Chandler: No-no-no-no, this is bad! It’s bad! This is bad!ScenesKathy: Horrible!ScenesChandler: Wait the uh, the kiss or the situation?ScenesKathy: No-no-no, the kiss was good.ScenesChandler: Okay!ScenesKathy: No, but that’s bad!ScenesChandler: Ooh! Yes! Okay! Here’s what we do, we-we forget it happened.ScenesKathy: What?!ScenesChandler: Okay, we-we swallow our feelings. Even if it means we’re unhappy forever. Sound good?ScenesKathy: Can you really do that?ScenesChandler: I have to; he’s my best friend, and you’re seeing him.ScenesKathy: Chandler, I like Joey a lot, but with you…ScenesChandler: (interrupting) Oh-no-no-no! Don’t! Don’t! See-see, you’re getting me confused, I’m starting to urn.ScenesKathy: I’m sorry. If you wanna pretend that nothing happened, I can try.ScenesChandler: I-I think we have too.ScenesKathy: Okay. Bye.ScenesChandler: Bye. (Kathy leaves and Chandler wonders over to and leans up against the door.) Are you still out there?ScenesKathy: (outside the door) No. (Chandler opens the door and they kiss again.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is performing, his music hasn’t improved.]
rows.Content: Ross: (His voice is altered to sound like a computer.) Electrifying. (He plays the sound of a ticking clock.) Emphatic time-time-time…ScenesMonica: (to Rachel and Phoebe) Y'know, there’s a Starbucks about three blocks down.ScenesPhoebe: (pushing Monica back onto the couch) It’s so inspired! Look at him! Look at him go!Scenes[cut back to Ross who finally finishes his so-called song with the same crash from before. He gets some applause, mainly ‘cause he’s done.]ScenesRoss: (with the altered voice) Thank you guys-guys-guys…ScenesMonica: (to Phoebe) Hey, aren’t you up next?ScenesPhoebe: Oh no, I’m not playing tonight.ScenesRachel: Why not?ScenesPhoebe: I can’t follow Ross! It’d be like those bicycle ridding chimps that followed The Beetles. No.ScenesMonica: Phoebe, Ross sucks!ScenesRachel: Phoebe, the place has emptied because of him.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God, he’s not even appreciated in his own time. I would give anything to not be appreciated in my own time!Scenes(Rachel and Monica look at each other, and agree on something without saying anything.)ScenesMonica: Okay. Umm, Phoebe, you suck too.ScenesRachel: Yeah, Phoebe you’re… awful!ScenesPhoebe: You guys. You suck too. (She hugs them both.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is opening the door, but Chandler has the chain on it.]
rows.Content: Joey: Aww man! I can’t believe I locked myself out again! (He knocks on the door.)ScenesChandler: Hang on buddy! (He goes over and unlocks the door and opens it to reveal a fully furnished apartment.)ScenesJoey: (rushing in) Oh my God! What happened here? Did you do all this?ScenesChandler: I sure did.ScenesJoey: Why?ScenesChandler: Well, I just thought it’d make me feel good to do something nice for my friend.ScenesJoey: Well, you’re amazing.ScenesChandler: Oh no-no-no. This is amazing. (He goes over and presses a button on a remote control that opens the entertainment center doors revealing the TV.)ScenesJoey: (very excited) A TV as if it appears from nowhere! That’s the dream! Man, how did you afford this stuff?ScenesChandler: Well, y’know I’m 29. I mean who needs a savings account.ScenesJoey: Oh, you are the best friends anyone has ever had.ScenesChandler: Oh, I don’t know.ScenesJoey: Oh-no-no-no, you are! You do this, you give me the great advice, and hey listen, I was thinking about what you said yesterday about focusing on one woman, I’m gonna do that.ScenesChandler: You mean with Casey.ScenesJoey: No-no-no, I think I’m gonna see how things go with Kathy. She’s pretty cool.ScenesChandler: Or Casey.ScenesJoey: No-no, Kathy.ScenesChandler: Could be Casey.ScenesJoey: No. No, Kathy.ScenesChandler: Consider Casey.ScenesJoey: Y’know what I think? I think somebody’s got a little crush on Casey. How ‘bout I fix you two up? What do you think?ScenesChandler: That all the pieces of my life are falling right into place!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross has just finished playing.]
rows.Content: Ross: (to Phoebe) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! You were really great! You were really, really great!ScenesRoss: Oh, thanks, thanks. So Monica tells me that uh, you don’t want to play anymore because me and y'know my talent. Is that true?ScenesPhoebe: Well, kinda. Yeah. Yeah.ScenesRoss: Pheebs…ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I-I can’t—I mean y’know I was trying to be really y'know okay and upbeat about it, I just—I feel so dwarfed by your musical gift. I…ScenesRoss: See but, Pheebs that-that is the exact opposite intent of my music. Y’know my music is-is meant to inspire, and if it bothers you this much, then I… I won’t play anymore.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no. No-no-no, don’t do that! How could I live with myself if I knew I was depriving the world of your music.ScenesRoss: Yeah, okay.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel and Monica are sitting on the couch and Phoebe is getting coffee as Chandler enters. Ross is also there.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey Chandler! Saw the new furniture. Very nice.ScenesMonica: Yeah! Joey has the best boyfriend ever!ScenesChandler: I kissed Kathy.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesMonica: Are you serious?ScenesPhoebe: Does Joey know?ScenesChandler: No. Is there anyway, anyway you think he’ll understand this?ScenesMonica: You obviously haven’t screwed over a lot of your friends. (They all look at her) Which we all appreciate.ScenesRoss: No the-the sad thing is, if you had told him how you felt before you kissed her, knowing Joey, he probably just would’ve just stepped aside.ScenesChandler: Oh, don’t say that! Don’t say that. That’s not true. Is it?ScenesPhoebe: I think maybe, yeah.ScenesMonica: He loves you.ScenesChandler: Then why didn’t you tell me to do that?!!ScenesRoss: Well, I said-I said something to Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! No, that’s right. And I thought it was a really good idea.ScenesRachel: I know, I remember that!ScenesMonica: I remember you did.ScenesChandler: God!! (Sits down in disgust.) What am I gonna do?!ScenesRachel: Well, Chandler, you’re gonna have to tell him.ScenesChandler: Why?! Why do I have to tell him?!ScenesRachel: Because you do.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I know.ScenesRoss: Hey, would it be okay if I wrote a song about this.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching TV as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey! Samboucha Margarita?ScenesChandler: Is that a real thing?ScenesJoey: Well, we only had samboucha, so it is now.ScenesChandler: Listen ah, Joe, I-I need to, I need to talk to you about something.ScenesJoey: What’s up?ScenesChandler: It’s-it’s about Kathy. Umm, uh, I like her. I like her a lot actually.ScenesJoey: You do?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Well, you’re timing couldn’t be better. She’s not my girlfriend anymore.ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: Yeah, she broke up with me.ScenesChandler: Oh uh, when?ScenesJoey: Just now, after acting class. At first I thought she was doing some kind of scene, that’s why I let people watch.ScenesChandler: Oh man, I am so sorry. Are, are you okay?ScenesJoey: Well, I’ve been better. But, I’m all right. So you like her huh?ScenesChandler: Yes, but I-I uh, don’t have too.ScenesJoey: No-no-no, no it’s uh, it’s okay.ScenesChandler: Yeah?ScenesJoey: Yeah. You know why? ‘Cause you came to me first.ScenesChandler: Well, I thought that would be the best thing to do.ScenesJoey: But hey, listen just so you know, you might have you’re work cut out for you. ‘Cause when I talked to her, I kinda got the feeling that she’s into some other guy. So…ScenesChandler: See uh, that’s-that’s actually what I wanted to talk to you about. I-I think I know who the other guy is.ScenesJoey: Who?ScenesChandler: It’s me. I’m the other guy.ScenesJoey: What?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I mean when you were late last night, Kathy and I got to talking, and one thing to another and…ScenesJoey: And what?! Did you sleep with her?!ScenesChandler: No! No! No! I just kissed her.ScenesJoey: What?!! That’s even worse!!ScenesChandler: How is that worse?!ScenesJoey: I don’t know! But it’s the same!ScenesChandler: Look, I’m sorry! But there’s nothing I can do, I think I’m in love with her!ScenesJoey: Who cares?! You went behind my back! I would never do that to you!ScenesChandler: You’re right, I have no excuses! I was totally over the line.ScenesJoey: Over the line?! You-you’re-you’re so far past the line, that you-you can’t even see the line! The line is a dot to you!ScenesChandler: Yes. Yes! Right! And I feel horrible. You have to believe me!ScenesJoey: Is that why you bought all this stuff?! (Chandler makes a face like "Well, kinda.") Well, y’know what I will not watch your TV, I will not listen to your stereo, and there’s a cinnamon raisin loaf in the new bread maker that I’m not gonna eat! You know why?!ScenesChandler: Probably because…ScenesJoey: Because it’s all tainted with your betrayal. From now on this apartment is empty for me! And I’m not happy about you either. (The bread maker dings) Oh, and just so you know, I made that bread for you. (Joey walks into his bedroom and slams the door.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross is playing his music. Monica, Phoebe, and Rachel are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh my God, he’s lost it. He’s totally lost it.ScenesMonica: (removing ear plugs) What?ScenesRachel: Phoebe, his music could not get any worse. There are rats in the basement that are hanging themselves.Scenes(Ross finally finishes with the same crash, and gets some applause.)ScenesRoss: Thank you, thanks. (Sits down next to the girls) Yeah, I lost it. Y’know, I’m not gonna play anymore, (to Phoebe) would you, can you finish my set?ScenesPhoebe: After that? Yeah! No, I mean if I can help.Scenes(Phoebe gets up and goes to play, Ross goes over and sits down next to Monica and Rachel.)ScenesRoss: Yeah, like I could lose it.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: I played bad on purpose guys.Scenes(Both Monica and Rachel laugh.)ScenesMonica: Okay, so you were trying to play bad this whole time.ScenesRoss: Yeah—no, just that last song.ScenesEndScenesThe One With Chandler in a BoxScenesWritten by: Michael BorkowScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is sitting at the counter reading a magazine as the phone rings.]
rows.Content: Joey: (answering phone) Hello.ScenesChandler: (on phone) Hey, it’s me. I know you can’t stand to be in the same room as me, so I just thought I’d try and apologize over the phone. All I… (Joey hangs up the phone in disgust.)Scenes(Pause)Scenes(The phone rings again.)ScenesJoey: (answering phone) Hello.ScenesChandler: Look I never should have kissed your girlfriend, but I’m… (Joey hangs up the phone again.)Scenes(Pause)Scenes(The phone rings yet again.)ScenesJoey: (answering phone) Stop callin’!!ScenesVoice: (on phone) Hey! Hey! Hey! This is 92.3, WXRK, K-Rock for our $1,000 daily challenge.ScenesJoey: All right!ScenesVoice: What is the name of your roommate who is very, very sorry and would do anything… (Joey realizes it’s Chandler and hangs up the phone in anger.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, everyone but Joey and Chandler are there getting ready for Thanksgiving.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering) Aww, turkey! Aww, giving thanks! Aww!ScenesPhoebe: Look everyone, it’s the spirit of Thanksgiving!ScenesRachel: So are things with you and Joey any better?ScenesChandler: They couldn’t be worse. I spent eight hours calling him last night, just trying to get him to talk to me.ScenesRachel: Oh wow, eight hours? So you could probably really use one of those plug-in telephone headsets huh?ScenesRoss: Should we all expect Christmas gifts that can be stolen from your office?ScenesRachel: You shouldn’t.ScenesPhoebe: Speaking of Christmas, umm since Monica and I are starting a new business and have like no money, umm, this year maybe we could do secret Santa, and then we each only buy one gift. And-and there’s the added mystery of who gets who.ScenesRoss: Who gets whom. (They all look at him.) I don’t know why I do that.Scenes[Cut to later, the gang, minus Joey, is watching the Thanksgiving Day parade.]ScenesRachel: Well, I’m gonna take a nap, turkey makes me sleepy.ScenesMonica: We haven’t eaten yet!ScenesRachel: I know, but all that work you’re doing to get it ready, I just… (goes into her bedroom.)ScenesChandler: Hey, by any chance did either of pick uh Rachel for your secret Santa, ‘cause I wanna trade for her.ScenesPhoebe: I picked her! Oh thank God you want her! Ooh!ScenesChandler: Wow! Why do you want to get rid of her so badly?ScenesPhoebe: Because she exchanges every gift she ever gets, it’s like impossible to get her something she likes. Come on, let’s trade!ScenesChandler: Oh that’s not true! That’s not true! I got her that backpack and she loved it! I remember how much she was crying the day when that big dog ran off with it… (notices the look on Monica and Phoebe’s faces.) Oh, there was no big dog. All right this sucks! I already got her this briefcase, and I had R.G. put on it… (Phoebe looks confused.) Her initials…ScenesPhoebe: Ohh.ScenesMonica: Well, maybe you could give to somebody else. Ooh, like Ross Geller.ScenesChandler: Op, y'know what though, it’s kind’ve a girlie briefcase.ScenesMonica: Who cares? He works in a museum!ScenesChandler: Hey, what time is it? The big game is about to start!ScenesPhoebe: You don’t have to do that, Ross and Joey aren’t here, you can watch the parade if you want.ScenesChandler: Thanks.ScenesMonica: What is wrong with this freezer?! (She jabs her arm into the freezer and a piece of ice flies into her eye.) Ow! Ow!!ScenesPhoebe: God, what happened?!ScenesMonica: Oh my God, ice just got in my eye!ScenesRachel: (standing in her doorway) People are trying to sleep in here!ScenesChandler: Monica got ice in her eye, and it hurts.ScenesPhoebe: Open it up, let me see.ScenesMonica: Oh, y’know what, I can’t, it really kills.ScenesChandler: Well maybe you should put some ice on it.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, God it looks bad.ScenesRachel: Honey, maybe we should take you to a doctor.ScenesMonica: No, my eye doctor is Richard! I can’t go to him when I don’t have a boyfriend!ScenesChandler: He’s really picky about his patients.ScenesPhoebe: Honey, you’ve got to go. What’s his office number?ScenesMonica: Like I remember his office number! (Pause) Speed dial 7.ScenesPhoebe: (on phone) Hi! Yeah, I’m calling on behalf of Monica Geller’s eye, and is um, is Richard Burke in today. (Listens) (to Monica) He’s out of town, but does she want to see the on-call doctor?ScenesMonica: Yes!!ScenesPhoebe: Yes! She’s very excited about that.Scenes[Cut to later, Phoebe is adding butter to something and Ross is watching.]ScenesPhoebe: This is so cool, ‘til Monica gets back, it’s like I’m head chef and I get to make all the decisions. (She looks at the remaining butter, and then decides to add it to the dish.)ScenesRoss: Hey-hey, I thought she told you to follow the recipe exactly!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, get out of my kitchen!ScenesChandler: (entering) All right! Okay! I think I am making some progress with Joey, when I went into the apartment he went straight into his bedroom but he only slammed the door once! (Ross is pleased.) I mean yeah, he gave me the finger while doing it.ScenesPhoebe: All right I… I gotta call my mom and ask her a left handed cooking question.ScenesRoss: So listen ah, I picked Monica for secret Santa, but I’m already getting her something for Chanukah, I was wondering if you wanna switch.ScenesChandler: Oh y’know what, I was already trying to trade for ah, well, you.ScenesRoss: Really?! Wow! That’s-that’s so nice, what are you gonna get me?ScenesChandler: I don’t know R.G., I was thinking something girlie for your office.ScenesRoss: Yeah, well maybe Phoebe will switch with me.ScenesChandler: Oh no-no-no, you don’t want to do that, then you’re gonna get stuck with Rachel and she exchanges every gift she ever gets.ScenesRoss: Oh, that’s not true! I’ve got her lots of stuff she never took back.ScenesChandler: Like?ScenesRoss: Like uh, that gold necklace I got her last year.ScenesChandler: When was the last time you saw her wear it?ScenesRoss: Well, she wore it all Christmas day, and then uh…ScenesChandler: Big dog?

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is repacking the furniture into boxes to return it.]
rows.Content: Ross: (entering) Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesRoss: What are you doing?ScenesJoey: I’m sending back all this stuff that Chandler bought out of guilt.ScenesRoss: Everything? Even the TV?ScenesJoey: No! I’m putting that in my room.ScenesRoss: Listen, Joey, I know what he did was wrong but don’t you think you could at least hear the guy out?ScenesJoey: Back when you and Rachel were together, if Chandler had kissed her, would you hear him out?ScenesRoss: That’s a good point. So uh, how long are you gonna punish him?ScenesJoey: Five years.ScenesRoss: You’ve sentenced him?!ScenesJoey: Hey! Don’t do the crime if you can’t do the time.ScenesRoss: Joey, the guy’s your best friend.ScenesJoey: No, was my best friend. Anyway, I don’t know why you’re pushing for him so hard. With him out of the way as my best friend, there’s a spot open.ScenesRoss: Oh, who? Me?ScenesJoey: Yeah!ScenesRoss: Wow! I’m honored! And y’know what I’m gonna do as my first act as your best friend?ScenesJoey: What?ScenesRoss: I’m gonna get you to talk to Chandler.ScenesJoey: All right. But if you weren’t my best friend.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Kathy are sitting at a table and talking about Joey.]
rows.Content: Kathy: Oh my God, is it really that bad?ScenesChandler: I walk into a room and he won’t even talk to me, he just mumbles something in Italian. And I know he only knows the bad words.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey Gunther, have you uh, have you seen Chandler?ScenesGunther: I thought you were Chandler. But umm, one of who is over there.Scenes(Joey turns around and sees them kissing.)ScenesKathy: Oh.ScenesChandler: Hey Joe.ScenesJoey: (Something in Italian.) (Storms out.)

rows.Scenes: Dr. Burke’s office, Rachel and Monica are waiting as the doctor arrives.]
rows.Content: Doctor: I’ll be right with you. Okay? (to the nurse) Thanks, Wendy.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! How cute is the on-call doctor?ScenesRachel: Ooh, so cute, that I’m thinking about jamming this pen in my eye.Scenes(The intercom buzzes.)ScenesNurse: Dr. Burke will see you know.ScenesMonica: Oh no-no-no, not Dr. Burke. Dr. Burke is out of town. The-the on-call doctor will see me now.ScenesNurse: Dr. Richard Burke is out of town. Dr. Timothy Burke, his son, will see you now.ScenesDr. Timothy Burke: Ready?Scenes(Monica looks at Rachel, who gives her the thumbs up.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is packing as Chandler rushes in.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey! I’m sorry! That—(sees that Joey is about to leave) where are you going?ScenesJoey: My folks.ScenesChandler: Oh, uh, when-when are you coming back?ScenesJoey: I don’t know. I might stay there for a few days while I look for an apartment.ScenesChandler: What?!ScenesJoey: Yeah, y’know at first I thought we could talk about this y’know, work it out, but uh, seeing you two together I don’t think I…ScenesChandler: Hey, look, what do you want me to say? Do you want me to say that I’ll stop seeing her?ScenesJoey: Look, it’s not about her. Okay? But seeing you two together just reminds me of what you did. And I don’t want to live with some one who doesn’t know what it is to be a friend. So, I’ll see ya. (He starts to leave, but Chandler grabs his bag and stops him.)ScenesChandler: Hey, look, I know what it is to be a friend, I just-I just screwed up!ScenesJoey: Yeah! You did! And that’s why I’m leaving.Scenes(The chick and the duck walk into the living room.)ScenesChandler: All right look, if you’re not gonna stay for me, then at least stay for them! Okay, they have had a very difficult year! What with the robbery and all!ScenesJoey: When that guy was robbing us, and I was locked in the entertainment unit for like six hours, you know what I was doing in there all that time? I was thinking about how I let you down!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: Yeah! But if would’ve know what kind of friend you were gonna turn out to be, I wouldn’t have worried about it so much! See you around!ScenesChandler: All right, wait! Come on! Just wait one second! There has to be something that I can do! Something! If we still had that entertainment unit I would get in it for six hours and think about how I let you down. (Joey looks intrigued) What?ScenesJoey: We’ve got a box. (Motions to a large wooden box next to him.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Dr. Burke’s office, Tim is examining Monica.]
rows.Content: Tim: Last time I saw you, it was the morning I left for college. And you were just standing outside The Dairy Queen.ScenesMonica: I was probably waiting for it to open.ScenesTim: I gotta tell you, you look great now.ScenesMonica: You look great too.ScenesTim: You’re an excellent patient!ScenesMonica: So how does it look?ScenesTim: Well, you’ve got a little scratch on your cornea, your gonna have to wear a patch for a couple of days.ScenesMonica: Like a pirate?!ScenesTim: If that helps you.ScenesMonica: Umm, so how long have you been working with your dad? (He looks at her) Come on, one of us had to mention him.ScenesTim: I moved back here a couple of months ago.ScenesMonica: Oh. Big family dinner tonight?ScenesTim: Uh. (He holds up a brown lunch bag.)ScenesMonica: No way!ScenesTim: I was gonna have Thanksgiving at my girlfriend’s.ScenesMonica: (disappointed) Oh.ScenesTim: But we broke up.ScenesMonica: (happy) Oh.ScenesTim: She-she wasn’t ready for a serious commitment.ScenesMonica: (sympathetic) Oh. (in a pirate’s voice) So you made her walk the plank? Aye, matie?ScenesTim: You’re not wearing the patch yet.ScenesMonica: I know.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, It’s closer to dinner. Monica has just told everyone that Tim is coming to dinner.]
rows.Content: Ross: He’s coming here for Thanksgiving!ScenesRachel: I know, it’s sick.ScenesMonica: Why is it sick?ScenesRachel: Because it’s Richard’s son! It’s like inviting Greek tragedy over for dinner!ScenesMonica: Hey, come on, Phoebe, you understand don’t you?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I can see where I’d be your best shot but, no. I’m sorry, but I think it’s twisted.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesJoey: (coming out of the bathroom) What’s twisted?ScenesMonica: Me going out with Richard’s son.ScenesJoey: Ewwwww!! Ew! Ew! Ew!ScenesChandler: (He is now in the box, in their living room.) Sounds like a really bad idea to me.ScenesRachel: Is he okay in there?ScenesJoey: He’s fine!ScenesRoss: Hey, y'know, Mon, if things wrong out between you and Richard’s son, you’d be able to tell your kids, that you slept with their grandfather.ScenesMonica: Fine! Judge all you want to but, (points to Ross) married a lesbian, (points to Rachel) left a man at the altar, (points to Phoebe) fell in love with a gay ice dancer, (points to Joey) threw a girl’s wooden leg in a fire, (points to Chandler) livin’ in a box!! (goes to her room)ScenesRachel: So now, what exactly is the point of the box?ScenesJoey: Chandler?ScenesChandler: The meaning of the box is three fold. One (holds a finger up through the air hole), it gives me the time to think about what I did. Two (holds up another finger), it proves how much I care about my friendship with Joey. And three (holds up a third finger), it hurts!ScenesRoss: (to Rachel) Oh hey! Hey uh, you remember the necklace I gave you last year? Can I see it?ScenesRachel: (worried) Why?ScenesRoss: I just wanna check something.ScenesRachel: Okay. (She goes into her bedroom)ScenesRoss: (He puts his hand over the hole on the box.) (to Chandler) Now, we’ll see.ScenesChandler: Air hole! Air hole!! (Ross retracts his hand quickly.)ScenesRachel: (coming out of her bedroom with a necklace) Here it is! I love it. I wear it all the time.ScenesRoss: (grabbing the necklace) The necklace I got you was gold, this one is silver.ScenesRachel: Huh, well maybe it uh, it changed.ScenesRoss: Oh my God! You actually exchanged it!ScenesRachel: Well isn’t it better that I exchanged it for something that I enjoy and that I can get a lot of use out of?ScenesRoss: What did you get?ScenesRachel: Credit.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door.)ScenesMonica: (running in from her bedroom) I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! I’ll get it! (opens the door) Hi, Tim.ScenesTim: Hi. (gives her a bottle of wine)ScenesMonica: Thank you. Come meet my friends. This is uh, Phoebe.ScenesTim: Hi, nice to meet you.ScenesMonica: And Joey.ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesTim: Hi, Joey.ScenesMonica: My brother, Ross.ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesMonica: And Rachel. (Chandler clears his voice loudly) And that’s Chandler.ScenesChandler: How do ya do.ScenesTim: What’s…ScenesMonica: Umm, well, he’s…ScenesJoey: He’s doin’ some thinkin’!Scenes[cut to later, Joey, Rachel, Ross, and Tim are watching the football game, and they all cheer loudly.]ScenesChandler: What happened? What happened?!ScenesJoey: You kissed my girlfriend!Scenes(A commercial for sunglasses comes on.)ScenesRachel: Ooh, I like those sunglasses.ScenesRoss: Like ‘em, like ‘em? Or, I’d like to get store credit for that amount like ‘em?ScenesRachel: (Swears in Italian, it’s the same term used by Joey earlier and Joey nods his approval.)ScenesMonica: All right everybody, this turkey is ready!ScenesTim: Where can I wash up?ScenesMonica: Here, let me show you. Okay, the towels are hanging next to the sink, and umm, you can use the fancy soap.ScenesTim: Thank you.ScenesRachel: Fancy soap? I thought we were savin’ that for the Pope!ScenesMonica: See he’s nice. Right?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but Monica, do you actually want to be in a relationship where you can actually use the phrase, "That’s not how your dad used to do it.ScenesTim: Wow! Everything looks great! Where should I sit?ScenesMonica: I saved you a seat. (Motions to the one next to her.)ScenesRachel: (pouring the wine) Sick-sick-sick-sick.Scenes(There’s a loud knocking.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I’ll get it. (goes over to the door.)ScenesChandler: Gotcha! (laughs)ScenesJoey: That doesn’t sound like thinking to me!ScenesChandler: Sorry!ScenesJoey: Y’know I don’t think you should be talking at all in there! I think you’ve got to much thinking to do to be talking and making jokes!ScenesChandler: Okay, okay, you got it!ScenesRachel: Ross, can you pass me the yams?ScenesRoss: Sure! Oh, and Joey’s got the mashed potatoes if you want to exchange them.ScenesRachel: Would you stop?! What is the matter with you?!ScenesMonica: Oh-ho-ho, we’ve got company.ScenesRoss: There’s nothing the matter with me. See, I’m not completely devoid of sentiment, see I have feelings.ScenesRachel: Okay, fine. (She gets up and walks into her bedroom)Scenes(an awkward silence follows)ScenesChandler: You can’t tell, but I’m trying to break the tension by mooning you guys!ScenesJoey: All right, look! If this is just a big joke to you, then forget about it, all right?! This means something to me! And if it doesn’t mean anything to you, then you should get out of there, otherwise you’re just an idiot in a box!ScenesChandler: You’re right, and I’m sorry! This means a lot to me! I want you to be my friend again! I swear, I won’t say another word tonight.ScenesJoey: So are you gonna start taking this thing seriously?ScenesChandler: Absolutely!ScenesJoey: That sounds like another word to me! Are you gonna take this seriously? (There’s no response from Chandler.) Okay.Scenes(Rachel comes back carrying a shoe box.)ScenesRachel: Don’t say that I have no sentiment! (Starts to show Ross what’s in the box.) This is a movie stub from our first date! This is an eggshell from the first time you made me breakfast in bed! (Holds up a bone) This is from the museum from the first time we… were together. Okay, maybe I exchange gifts sometimes, but I keep the things that matter!ScenesRoss: I don’t know what to say, I’m sorry. Though, you’re not supposed to take these. (Points to the bone) It’s like a million years old, we, we actually, we had people looking for that.Scenes(Rachel glares at him.)Scenes[Cut to the balcony with Monica and Tim.]ScenesMonica: (putting off her coat) Ooh, this always happens. (Her coat gets stuck.)ScenesTim: Here, let me help. (Does so.)ScenesMonica: Thank you.ScenesTim: You-you have a very beautiful… eye.ScenesMonica: Y’know all my friends think this is weird.ScenesTim: Y’know I-I thought it was gonna be weird, I mean I almost called and canceled, but it really isn’t.ScenesMonica: I know! I mean it’s like me and your dad, that’s a totally separate thing.ScenesTim: Oh, I totally agree.ScenesMonica: We’re just two people who find each other very attractive. Right?Scenes(Tim leans in to kiss her. They stop, and when he tries to kiss her again, Monica pulls away.)ScenesTim: What?ScenesMonica: Nothing. Nothing.ScenesTim: No-no really, was-was that not okay?ScenesMonica: No-no-no that was good, it was, that was uh, that was a goood kiss…ScenesTim: Oh my God! It didn’t remind you of…ScenesMonica: (interrupting) Don’t say it!ScenesTim: No, but it did! Didn’t it?!ScenesMonica: Yeah!ScenesTim: Oh man!!ScenesMonica: I know!Scenes(They both shiver in horror.)Scenes[cut to later, Tim has left. Monica is still shivering. There’s a knock on the door.]ScenesJoey: I’ll get it. (It’s Kathy.)ScenesKathy: (sees it’s Joey) Oh.ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesKathy: Hey. Listen, I want you to know how sorry I am…ScenesJoey: That’s okay. Chandler’s the one I’m mad at.ScenesKathy: Well, I’m still sorry. Is he here?ScenesJoey: In the box.ScenesKathy: (going over to the box) Chandler?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, he-he can’t talk right now.ScenesKathy: Why not? What’s going on?ScenesPhoebe: He’s just trying to show Joey how much he means to him.ScenesKathy: By being in a box?ScenesRachel: Joey, had reasons.ScenesPhoebe: They were threefold.ScenesKathy: Oh. Well uh, (to Chandler) you not being able to talk may make this easier. Listen umm… (She looks at the gang who are watching, they take the hint and leave them alone.) Listen I don’t wanna be someone who comes between two best friends. I just, I can’t stand seeing what this is doing to you guys, and I don’t wanna be the cause of that. So, I don’t think we can see each other anymore. I’m gonna go to my mom’s in Chicago, I’m gonna stay there for awhile. I think this could’ve be something really amazing, but y’know this is probably for the best. Y’know? I’m gonna miss you. Good-bye, Chandler.Scenes(She gets up and leaves, Chandler waves good-bye with one finger extended through the air hole. Ross glares at Joey.)ScenesJoey: (starting to cry) Open the box!! (Runs over to do so.)ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesJoey: He can still catch her! Come on, get out of there! (He opens the box) Get out of there!ScenesChandler: So?ScenesJoey: Yeah, we’re gonna be fine! Get out!ScenesChandler: Yeah?ScenesJoey: Yeah, you did some real good thinkin’ in there.ScenesChandler: Man, this is…Scenes(Joey says something unintelligible and they hug.)ScenesJoey: Now go! ‘Cause you can still catch her! And Merry Christmas from you’re secret Santa! (Chandler runs out and closes the door.)Scenes(After he’s gone.)ScenesJoey: All right, who got Chandler? ‘Cause I uh, need to trade.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's Balcony, the gang is all there watching Chandler.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh, he sees her!ScenesMonica: Oh, he’s catching up to her!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, she sees him! Oh, they’re hugging!ScenesRoss: He’s taking her purse!ScenesJoey: Uhh, that’s not them. I’m gonna go call the police.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, there they are!Scenes(They watch them making up and sigh)ScenesPhoebe: All right, get a room.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Girl From PoughkeepsieScenesWritten by: Scott SilveriScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Chandler, and Phoebe are there as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesChandler, Joey, and Phoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: I’m sorry I’m late, did I miss anything?ScenesPhoebe: Joey stuffing 15 Oreos in his mouth. (Joey, with an obvious mouth full, nods yes.)ScenesRoss: 15? (Joey nods again) Your personal best! (Ross takes an Oreo and Joey mumbles, no!)ScenesPhoebe: Where were you?ScenesRoss: Oh, on a date. Yeah, I met this girl on the train going to a museum upstate.Scenes(simultaneously)ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah! How did you meet her?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, which museum?ScenesPhoebe: (just Phoebe) No, answer his.ScenesRoss: Okay, it was just me and her at the back of the train, and I sat near the door, so she’d have to pass by me if she wanted to switch cars. She was totally at my mercy.ScenesChandler: Were you so late because you were burring this woman?ScenesRoss: No, I’m getting back down ‘cause she lives in Poughkeepsie. She seems really great, but she’s like totally great, but she lives two and a half hours away.ScenesChandler: How can she be great if she’s from Poughkeepsie? (laughs, at they all look at him) That joke would’ve killed in Albany.ScenesJoey: Done! I did it! Heh, who’s stupid now? (He smiles and has cookie remains all over his teeth.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe are there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey, look at this! (Holding a newspaper) They’re lighting the big Christmas tree tonight.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, that paper’s two weeks old.ScenesChandler: All right, who keeps leaving old newspapers in the trash?! I really wanted to take Kathy to this, I can’t believe I missed it.ScenesRachel: Hey, y’know, at least you have somebody to miss that stuff with! I hate being alone this time of year! Next thing you know it’ll be Valentine’s Day, then my birthday, then bang!—before you know it, they’re lighting that damn tree again. Ohh, I want somebody! (hearing this, Gunther moves in) Y’know, I want a man!! (Gunther leaves depressed) I mean, it doesn’t even have to be a big relationship, y’know, just like a fling would be great.ScenesChandler: Really?! I didn’t think girls ever just wanted a fling.ScenesRachel: Well, believe me, it’s been a long time since I’ve been flung.ScenesJoey: Well, I know what I’m giving you for Christmas.ScenesChandler: Y’know what? There’s some nice guys at my office, do you want me to set you up?ScenesRachel: Yeah! Wait a minute, it’s been a long time that I’ve been single. How come you never offered this before?ScenesChandler: Well, I have a girlfriend, I’m-I’m happy. So, I no longer feel the need to go out of my way to stop others from being happy.ScenesRachel: Okay! No accountants. Oh, and no one from like legal. I don’t like guys with boring jobs.ScenesChandler: Oh and Ross was like what? A lion tamer?Scenes(Monica enters)ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: What’s wrong Mon?ScenesMonica: Ohh, everybody at the restaurant still hates me.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesMonica: I thought I was making headway, everyone was smiling at me all day, I get off work and I find out that they wrote this (puts on her chef hat) on my chef’s hat. (The hat says ‘Quit, bitch’)ScenesPhoebe: Hey, maybe they meant to write, ‘Quiet, bitch.’ScenesRachel: Hey, honey! What’s the matter? (Monica shows her, her hat.) Fine, I was just trying to be nice! Whoa!ScenesMonica: I mean I have not been picked on this much since kindergarten and they had to bring in someone from junior high to do the see-saw with me. (Joey laughs and Monica glares at him.)ScenesJoey: Ohhh!ScenesMonica: I mean they’re trying to do everything they can to make me quit, and if there were any other job, I would. But this is something I’ve been waiting for my whole life.ScenesRachel: Well, wait a minute, you’re the boss! Why don’t you just yell at them? Or, fire them?ScenesMonica: I would love too, but I can’t! I mean I just can’t, you know that I’m not good at confrontation.ScenesChandler: Hey, you know what you can do? I remember reading about this director, I think it was Orson Wells, who at the beginning of the movie would hire somebody, just so he could fire them in front of everybody. Then they would all know, who’s boss.ScenesJoey: Hey, Mon! I’m not doing anything, why don’t you fire me?ScenesMonica: That’s a good idea! Wait, do you know how to waiter?ScenesJoey: Good enough to get fired.ScenesMonica: All right, you’re hired!ScenesJoey: Hey! That must be why I got fired last week! Does this Orson Wells guy direct Burger King commercials?ScenesChandler: (he glares at him for a while) Yes.

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s office, he is trying to find Rachel a date.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I say, Drew! Are you seeing anybody right now? (Drew looks at him) Og-ee-op, I’m not asking for me, I’m… I mean… No, I’m-I’m not gay, I’m not asking you out. I’m not-I’m not-I’m not gay!ScenesDrew: I didn’t think you were gay. I do now.ScenesChandler: See my friend-my friend, Rachel, she wants to be set up.ScenesDrew: Ahh, I just got out of a big relationship, I’m not looking for any thing serious.ScenesChandler: Oh, y’know what, that might be okay even if it was just kind of a fling, that might be all right with Rachel.ScenesMike: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! Is this, hot Rachel, that you took to the Christmas party, Rachel?ScenesChandler: (to Drew) Oh, by the way, that is her full name.ScenesMike: Oh wow! I’m free for her!ScenesDrew: Oh, wait a second! I didn’t say I wasn’t free!ScenesMike: Hey, Chandler, why don’t we talk this over at the Ranger game tomorrow?ScenesDrew: Hold on, y’know I just got a box of Cubans, maybe I bring them by your office around uh, five?ScenesChandler: Oh well, that’s uh, a little later than I uh, generally care to stay, but sure!ScenesMike: Maybe, before the game we could enjoy some eight year old some small batch Basel Hadens.ScenesChandler: Well, I don’t really know what that is, but let’s!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is working on a new song.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey! You guys, I’m writing a holiday song for everyone. Do you want to hear it?ScenesMonica, Rachel, and Joey: Yes!ScenesPhoebe: (singing) Happy Chanukah, Monica! May your Christmas be snowy, Joey! Happy New Year, Chandler and Ross. Spin the draddle, Rachel!ScenesRachel: Pheebs, that’s great!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yay!ScenesRachel: But y’know umm, Rachel doesn’t rhyme with draddle.ScenesPhoebe: I know but it’s so hard! Nothing rhymes with your stupid name!ScenesJoey: What are you talking about? Lots of things rhyme with Rachel. Bagel. Mail. Jail. Bail. Able. May-pole.ScenesPhoebe: All good, thanks. (to Rachel) Do you maybe have a nickname have like a nickname that’s easier to rhyme?ScenesMonica: Didn’t your dad used to call you Pumpkin?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah!ScenesPhoebe: Pumpkin? Yeah. But did he ever call you like, Budolph?ScenesChandler: (entering) Hello, children!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesChandler: (to Rachel) Have I got the 50 guys for you!ScenesRachel: Really?!ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, I just showed this a picture of you and guys were throwing themselves at me! They’re buying me drinks! They’re giving me stuff! (to Joey) Knicks tonight?ScenesJoey: Sure! Where are the seats?ScenesChandler: Wherever! I’ve got like 20!ScenesRachel: So, will I like any of these guys?ScenesChandler: Y’know what, I’m gonna uh, play the field just a little more.ScenesRachel: Chandler!ScenesChandler: Guys are signing over their 401-K’s to me?ScenesPhoebe: (shocked) You work with robots!!ScenesChandler: (pause) Yes. (to Rachel) Okay, there’s this one guy, Patrick, I think you’re gonna like him, he’s really nice, he’s funny, he’s a swimmer.ScenesRachel: Ohh, I like swimmer’s bodies!ScenesChandler: Yes, and his father invented that magnetic strip on the back of credit cards.ScenesRachel: Op, I like credit cards!ScenesChandler: See, I’m not bad at this fixing up thing, huh?ScenesRachel: Well, so what does he do?ScenesChandler: Oh, he works in the Fine Foods division.ScenesRachel: Your company has a fine foods division?ScenesChandler: It’s a big company, I don’t—if you—I…ScenesJoey: Now, wait a second! You make food and robots?ScenesPhoebe: No! No, the robots just work for them.ScenesMonica: (getting up) All right, I’m gonna go to work. Does anybody have a problem with that?ScenesJoey: Yeah, lady, I do! I got a problem with that!ScenesMonica: You want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!ScenesJoey: Oh, what are you gonna do? You’re gonna fire me?ScenesMonica: You bet your ass, I’m gonna fire you! Thank you.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross, Phoebe, and Chandler are there.]
rows.Content: Ross: Oh, wow! I should get going. I-I got a date tonight.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah! With who?ScenesRoss: You know that girl I told you about who lives up in Poughkeepsie?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Not her. Yeah, this is someone else I meet, and I-I can’t decide between the two of them. Y’know the one from Poughkeepsie, even though she’s a two hour train ride away, is really pretty, really smart, and-and a lot of fun. But this other girl, well, she lives right uptown. Y’know she’s, well she’s-she’s just as pretty, I guess she’s smart, she’s not fun.ScenesPhoebe: If she’s no fun, why do you want to date her at all?ScenesRoss: Well, I-I want to give her another chance, y’know? She lives so close. And, at the end of the date, the other time, she-she said something that was—if she was kidding was very funny. On the other hand, if she wasn’t kidding, she’s not fun, she’s stupid, and kind of a racist.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey, man!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Ooh, how was your first day working at the restaurant?ScenesJoey: (checks his watch) Damn! (runs out to work)

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Monica is cooking.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering from the dining room) Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey, what happened to your fancy chef’s jacket? (sees there’s a burn spot on it)ScenesMonica: They baked it. I can’t take this anymore. I’m gonna call a meeting tonight, I’m gonna fire you tonight.ScenesJoey: You got it! Oh-oh! (He starts patting the burned spot, which just happens to be over her breast.)ScenesMonica: What are you doing?!ScenesJoey: It’s still a tiny bit on fire there.ScenesMonica: Thanks. (Joey’s still patting the burn spot) I think you got it!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is there.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (entering) Chandler!! You have the best taste in men!ScenesChandler: Well, like father, like son.ScenesRachel: Patrick and I had such a great time last night! I mean I think this could maybe turn into something serious.ScenesChandler: Really?! I-I thought you weren’t looking for something serious? I thought you were looking for some kind of a fling.ScenesRachel: Well, y'know, possibly. (pause) You didn’t tell him that, though? Right?ScenesChandler: Ummmmmmmm, no.ScenesRachel: You told this guy that I was looking for a fling?! You don’t tell the guy that!ScenesChandler: Why not?! I’d be thrilled if I heard that some hot girl was just looking to get—oh I see.ScenesRachel: Oh, between you telling him that I wanted to have a fling and me putting out on the first date—oh, he’s so gonna get the wrong idea.

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Joey is eating some cheese.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey, Joey, could you pass the cheese?ScenesJoey: Yeah. Listen uh, I’d prefer it if you didn’t call me Joey. Since I don’t know anyone here, I thought it’d be cool to try out a cool work nickname.ScenesA Waiter: (entering) Hey, dragon! Here’s your tips from Monday and Tuesday. (hands him two envelopes)ScenesJoey: (opening an envelope) There’s like-there’s like 300 bucks in this one!ScenesThe Waiter: Yeah, people get pretty generous around the holidays. And it never hurts to wear tight trousers.ScenesMonica: Okay. Could the waiters gather around to hear tonight’s specials? Okay, first there is a Chilean Sea Bass prepared with a Mango relish on a bag—Why is nobody writing these down?ScenesThe Waiter: Because we can remember them.ScenesMonica: Because your all gonna make up fake specials and make me cook them like you did the other night?ScenesThe Waiter: Well, sure, that too.ScenesMonica: Okay, forget the specials for a minute. Umm, all right here’s the thing, for the last two weeks I have umm, (quietly) tried really hard to create a positive atmosphere…ScenesThe Waiter: Can’t hear you!ScenesMonica: (louder) A positive atmosphere! But I-I-I have had it up to here. (She holds her hand over her head as an afterthought.) From now on, it is gonna be my way, or the highway! All right? Does anybody have a problem with that?!! (Joey looks at the money he’s holding, and doesn’t speak up.) Hey new guy! I said, does anybody have a problem with that?!ScenesJoey: No ma’am.ScenesThe Waiter: Hey! He has a name, it’s Dragon. Do you wanna know your name? Check your hat. (to another waiter) We did the hat right? (The other waiter nods yes.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, continued from earlier. The other waiters are gone and Monica is confronting Joey about his not speaking up.]
rows.Content: Monica: What the hell happened?!ScenesJoey: I am so-so-so sorry. I was gonna do it! Really! But I was standing there with 327 dollars in one hand and 238 dollars in the other hand, and I was thinking, "Wow! It’s been a long time since I had… (tries to do the math in his head, but can’t) 327 + 238 dollars!ScenesMonica: Joey, we had a deal. That-that’s why you’re here! I’ve got to fire you!ScenesJoey: And I gotta pay rent! Look, how-how about this? You don’t fire me, instead I stay here, I gain their trust, and they’ll start listening to all the nice things I’ve been saying about you.ScenesMonica: What kinda things have you been saying?ScenesJoey: Well nothing yet, they really hate you and I want to fit in.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is working on her holiday song, Chandler is sitting on the couch reading a magazine, and Ross is sleeping on the couch.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) Happy, happy Chanukah, Chandler and Monica. Very merry…ScenesChandler: (interrupting) Oh, y’know, y’know what Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesChandler: I’m not Jewish, so…ScenesPhoebe: So! Ross doesn’t really decorate his tree with floss, but you don’t hear him complaining do you? God! (Phoebe hits her guitar which wakes up Ross with a start.)ScenesChandler: Bad dream?ScenesRoss: I wasn’t sleeping.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, then uh, what was Phoebe’s song about?ScenesRoss: The one with the cat. I gotta go, I’ve got another date.ScenesPhoebe: So, did you pick one yet?ScenesRoss: No, it turns out that the one from uptown was making a joke. But it was a different joke than I thought—it wasn’t that funny. So I’m still torn.ScenesPhoebe: Well look, you don’t really like the one from uptown and you’re too exhausted from dating the one up in Poughkeepsie, so I say you just end them both. Okay? You take a train up to Poughkeepsie and break up with her, and on your way back you break up with uptown. And then by the time you get home tonight, you’re done!ScenesRoss: Y’know, you’re right. Thank you.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, well I had a similar problem when I lived in Prague.ScenesChandler: Prague?ScenesPhoebe: There’s sooo much you don’t know.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is playing living room golf as Rachel enters. Rachel sees this and holds the door open until Chandler is ready to start his swing, when he is, she slams the door shut which causes the club to fly from his hands. He turns around, shocked.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Chandler! Patrick just uh, ended things with me. Did you or did you not tell him that I was looking for a serious relationship?ScenesChandler: I did! I absolutely did!ScenesRachel: You idiot!!ScenesChandler: I’m sure you’re right, but why?ScenesRachel: You don’t tell a guy that you’re looking for a serious relationship! You don’t tell the guy that! Now you scared him away!ScenesChandler: Oh, man. I’m sorry, I’m so-so sorry.ScenesRachel: Y’know, you should never be allowed to talk to people!ScenesChandler: I know! I know!ScenesRachel: Oh! See just I’m right back where I started! Aww, this sucks! Being alone, sucks! (She sits down heavily in one of the new chairs)ScenesChandler: Well, y’know, you’re-you’re gonna meet somebody! You’re a great catch! Y’know when I was telling all those guys about you, I didn’t have to lie once. (He sits down on the arm of her chair)ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesChandler: Yeah! You graduated Magma Ku Laude, right?ScenesRachel: No.ScenesChandler: Oh, it doesn’t matter. (Kisses her on the top of her head.) Hey, y’know what, I’ve got two tickets to tonight’s Rangers game, you wanna come with me?ScenesRachel: Cute guys in little shorts? Sure.ScenesChandler: Well, actually it’s a hockey team, so it’s angry Canadians with no teeth.ScenesRachel: Well that sounds fun too. (They hug.)Scenes(pause)ScenesChandler: Have you ever been with a woman?ScenesRachel: What?! Chandler, what is the matter with you?!ScenesChandler: So there is no good time to ask that question.

rows.Scenes: A train to Poughkeepsie, Ross is asleep against the window.]
rows.Content: The Conductor: The next station is Poughkeepsie. Poughkeepsie!ScenesThe Woman From Poughkeepsie: (outside Ross’s window) Ross? Ross! (she knocks on the window) Wake up! Ross! (the train starts moving) Ross! Ross!! Ross!!! Ross!!!!

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Monica is cooking.]
rows.Content: Monica: I need more swordfish. (to one of the assistant chefs) Can you get me some more swordfish?ScenesKitchen Worker: I don’t speak English.ScenesMonica: You did a minute ago!ScenesKitchen Worker: Well, I don’t know what to tell ya!ScenesMonica: Fine!Scenes(She goes into the freezer to get it herself, and leaves the door open. The waiter from earlier comes by and closes the door.)ScenesMonica: Okay! Very funny! Somebody let me out please?! Come on, I’m cold! (She spills something.) And covered in marinara sauce! Come on! Let me out! (the door opens)ScenesThe Waiter: You found that handle, did ya?ScenesMonica: That’s not funny.ScenesThe Waiter: Well that’s not true.ScenesMonica: (starting to cry) I’m a good person. And I’m a good chef, and I don’t deserve to have marinara sauce all over me! Y’know what, if you want me to quit this bad, then all you have to do is…ScenesJoey: (interrupting) Hey! Chef Geller! Y’know that little speech you made the other day? Well I got a problem with it!ScenesMonica: You do?ScenesJoey: You bet I do! I just ah, wasn’t listening then, that’s all.ScenesMonica: Well if you want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!ScenesJoey: What are you gonna do? You’re gonna fire me?ScenesMonica: You bet your ass I’m gonna fire you! Get out of my kitchen! Get out!! (Joey leaves) All right! Anybody else got a problem? How ‘bout you Chuckles? You think this is funny now?ScenesThe Waiter: No.ScenesMonica: How about if I dance around all covered in sauce? Huh? You think it’s funny now?ScenesThe Waiter: No, it’s really good.ScenesMonica: Good! Now, take those salads to table 4, (to the kitchen worker from earlier) And you! Get the swordfish! (to another assistant chef) And you! Get a haircut!

rows.Scenes: The train, it’s pulling into a station.]
rows.Content: The Conductor: Last stop, Montreal. This stop is Montreal.ScenesRoss: (waking up) What? (notices that there is now a beautiful woman sitting next to him)ScenesWoman On Train: I made a bet with myself that you have beautiful eyes. Now that I see them, I win.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesWoman On Train: We’re at my stop. But would you like to have coffee?ScenesRoss: (now fully awake) Are we really in Montreal?!ScenesWoman On Train: Yes we are. So, coffee?ScenesRoss: Coffee sounds great. (They get up) Wait, so, so you live in Montreal?ScenesWoman On Train: Oh, no. But it’s just a two hour ferry ride to Nova Scotia.

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Joey is coming back in with his coat on.]
rows.Content: Joey: Well I guess I should’ve thought about my wife and kids before I talked back to chef Geller!ScenesMonica: Thanks.ScenesJoey: Yep! Looks like it’s gonna be a leeeeean Christmas at the Dragon house this year.ScenesMonica: Enough!ScenesJoey: (leaving) Lean-lean-lean!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is singing her holiday song.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) "Went to the store, sat on Santa's lap.Scenes                                Asked him to bring my friends all kind of crap.Scenes                                Said all you need is to write them a song.Scenes                                They haven't heard it, so don't try and sing along.Scenes                                No, don't sing along.Scenes                                Monica, Moncia, have a happy Chanukah.Scenes                                Saw Santa Clause, he said hello to Ross.Scenes                                And plese tell Joey, Christmas will be snowy!Scenes                                And Rachel and Chandler, have err-umm-glander!!ScenesHappy holidays, everybody!ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Girl From PoughkeepsieScenesWritten by: Scott SilveriScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Chandler, and Phoebe are there as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesChandler, Joey, and Phoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: I’m sorry I’m late, did I miss anything?ScenesPhoebe: Joey stuffing 15 Oreos in his mouth. (Joey, with an obvious mouth full, nods yes.)ScenesRoss: 15? (Joey nods again) Your personal best! (Ross takes an Oreo and Joey mumbles, no!)ScenesPhoebe: Where were you?ScenesRoss: Oh, on a date. Yeah, I met this girl on the train going to a museum upstate.Scenes(simultaneously)ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah! How did you meet her?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, which museum?ScenesPhoebe: (just Phoebe) No, answer his.ScenesRoss: Okay, it was just me and her at the back of the train, and I sat near the door, so she’d have to pass by me if she wanted to switch cars. She was totally at my mercy.ScenesChandler: Were you so late because you were burring this woman?ScenesRoss: No, I’m getting back down ‘cause she lives in Poughkeepsie. She seems really great, but she’s like totally great, but she lives two and a half hours away.ScenesChandler: How can she be great if she’s from Poughkeepsie? (laughs, at they all look at him) That joke would’ve killed in Albany.ScenesJoey: Done! I did it! Heh, who’s stupid now? (He smiles and has cookie remains all over his teeth.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, Rachel, and Phoebe are there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey, look at this! (Holding a newspaper) They’re lighting the big Christmas tree tonight.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, that paper’s two weeks old.ScenesChandler: All right, who keeps leaving old newspapers in the trash?! I really wanted to take Kathy to this, I can’t believe I missed it.ScenesRachel: Hey, y’know, at least you have somebody to miss that stuff with! I hate being alone this time of year! Next thing you know it’ll be Valentine’s Day, then my birthday, then bang!—before you know it, they’re lighting that damn tree again. Ohh, I want somebody! (hearing this, Gunther moves in) Y’know, I want a man!! (Gunther leaves depressed) I mean, it doesn’t even have to be a big relationship, y’know, just like a fling would be great.ScenesChandler: Really?! I didn’t think girls ever just wanted a fling.ScenesRachel: Well, believe me, it’s been a long time since I’ve been flung.ScenesJoey: Well, I know what I’m giving you for Christmas.ScenesChandler: Y’know what? There’s some nice guys at my office, do you want me to set you up?ScenesRachel: Yeah! Wait a minute, it’s been a long time that I’ve been single. How come you never offered this before?ScenesChandler: Well, I have a girlfriend, I’m-I’m happy. So, I no longer feel the need to go out of my way to stop others from being happy.ScenesRachel: Okay! No accountants. Oh, and no one from like legal. I don’t like guys with boring jobs.ScenesChandler: Oh and Ross was like what? A lion tamer?Scenes(Monica enters)ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: What’s wrong Mon?ScenesMonica: Ohh, everybody at the restaurant still hates me.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesMonica: I thought I was making headway, everyone was smiling at me all day, I get off work and I find out that they wrote this (puts on her chef hat) on my chef’s hat. (The hat says ‘Quit, bitch’)ScenesPhoebe: Hey, maybe they meant to write, ‘Quiet, bitch.’ScenesRachel: Hey, honey! What’s the matter? (Monica shows her, her hat.) Fine, I was just trying to be nice! Whoa!ScenesMonica: I mean I have not been picked on this much since kindergarten and they had to bring in someone from junior high to do the see-saw with me. (Joey laughs and Monica glares at him.)ScenesJoey: Ohhh!ScenesMonica: I mean they’re trying to do everything they can to make me quit, and if there were any other job, I would. But this is something I’ve been waiting for my whole life.ScenesRachel: Well, wait a minute, you’re the boss! Why don’t you just yell at them? Or, fire them?ScenesMonica: I would love too, but I can’t! I mean I just can’t, you know that I’m not good at confrontation.ScenesChandler: Hey, you know what you can do? I remember reading about this director, I think it was Orson Wells, who at the beginning of the movie would hire somebody, just so he could fire them in front of everybody. Then they would all know, who’s boss.ScenesJoey: Hey, Mon! I’m not doing anything, why don’t you fire me?ScenesMonica: That’s a good idea! Wait, do you know how to waiter?ScenesJoey: Good enough to get fired.ScenesMonica: All right, you’re hired!ScenesJoey: Hey! That must be why I got fired last week! Does this Orson Wells guy direct Burger King commercials?ScenesChandler: (he glares at him for a while) Yes.

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s office, he is trying to find Rachel a date.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I say, Drew! Are you seeing anybody right now? (Drew looks at him) Og-ee-op, I’m not asking for me, I’m… I mean… No, I’m-I’m not gay, I’m not asking you out. I’m not-I’m not-I’m not gay!ScenesDrew: I didn’t think you were gay. I do now.ScenesChandler: See my friend-my friend, Rachel, she wants to be set up.ScenesDrew: Ahh, I just got out of a big relationship, I’m not looking for any thing serious.ScenesChandler: Oh, y’know what, that might be okay even if it was just kind of a fling, that might be all right with Rachel.ScenesMike: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! Is this, hot Rachel, that you took to the Christmas party, Rachel?ScenesChandler: (to Drew) Oh, by the way, that is her full name.ScenesMike: Oh wow! I’m free for her!ScenesDrew: Oh, wait a second! I didn’t say I wasn’t free!ScenesMike: Hey, Chandler, why don’t we talk this over at the Ranger game tomorrow?ScenesDrew: Hold on, y’know I just got a box of Cubans, maybe I bring them by your office around uh, five?ScenesChandler: Oh well, that’s uh, a little later than I uh, generally care to stay, but sure!ScenesMike: Maybe, before the game we could enjoy some eight year old some small batch Basel Hadens.ScenesChandler: Well, I don’t really know what that is, but let’s!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is working on a new song.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey! You guys, I’m writing a holiday song for everyone. Do you want to hear it?ScenesMonica, Rachel, and Joey: Yes!ScenesPhoebe: (singing) Happy Chanukah, Monica! May your Christmas be snowy, Joey! Happy New Year, Chandler and Ross. Spin the draddle, Rachel!ScenesRachel: Pheebs, that’s great!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yay!ScenesRachel: But y’know umm, Rachel doesn’t rhyme with draddle.ScenesPhoebe: I know but it’s so hard! Nothing rhymes with your stupid name!ScenesJoey: What are you talking about? Lots of things rhyme with Rachel. Bagel. Mail. Jail. Bail. Able. May-pole.ScenesPhoebe: All good, thanks. (to Rachel) Do you maybe have a nickname have like a nickname that’s easier to rhyme?ScenesMonica: Didn’t your dad used to call you Pumpkin?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah!ScenesPhoebe: Pumpkin? Yeah. But did he ever call you like, Budolph?ScenesChandler: (entering) Hello, children!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesChandler: (to Rachel) Have I got the 50 guys for you!ScenesRachel: Really?!ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, I just showed this a picture of you and guys were throwing themselves at me! They’re buying me drinks! They’re giving me stuff! (to Joey) Knicks tonight?ScenesJoey: Sure! Where are the seats?ScenesChandler: Wherever! I’ve got like 20!ScenesRachel: So, will I like any of these guys?ScenesChandler: Y’know what, I’m gonna uh, play the field just a little more.ScenesRachel: Chandler!ScenesChandler: Guys are signing over their 401-K’s to me?ScenesPhoebe: (shocked) You work with robots!!ScenesChandler: (pause) Yes. (to Rachel) Okay, there’s this one guy, Patrick, I think you’re gonna like him, he’s really nice, he’s funny, he’s a swimmer.ScenesRachel: Ohh, I like swimmer’s bodies!ScenesChandler: Yes, and his father invented that magnetic strip on the back of credit cards.ScenesRachel: Op, I like credit cards!ScenesChandler: See, I’m not bad at this fixing up thing, huh?ScenesRachel: Well, so what does he do?ScenesChandler: Oh, he works in the Fine Foods division.ScenesRachel: Your company has a fine foods division?ScenesChandler: It’s a big company, I don’t—if you—I…ScenesJoey: Now, wait a second! You make food and robots?ScenesPhoebe: No! No, the robots just work for them.ScenesMonica: (getting up) All right, I’m gonna go to work. Does anybody have a problem with that?ScenesJoey: Yeah, lady, I do! I got a problem with that!ScenesMonica: You want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!ScenesJoey: Oh, what are you gonna do? You’re gonna fire me?ScenesMonica: You bet your ass, I’m gonna fire you! Thank you.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross, Phoebe, and Chandler are there.]
rows.Content: Ross: Oh, wow! I should get going. I-I got a date tonight.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah! With who?ScenesRoss: You know that girl I told you about who lives up in Poughkeepsie?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Not her. Yeah, this is someone else I meet, and I-I can’t decide between the two of them. Y’know the one from Poughkeepsie, even though she’s a two hour train ride away, is really pretty, really smart, and-and a lot of fun. But this other girl, well, she lives right uptown. Y’know she’s, well she’s-she’s just as pretty, I guess she’s smart, she’s not fun.ScenesPhoebe: If she’s no fun, why do you want to date her at all?ScenesRoss: Well, I-I want to give her another chance, y’know? She lives so close. And, at the end of the date, the other time, she-she said something that was—if she was kidding was very funny. On the other hand, if she wasn’t kidding, she’s not fun, she’s stupid, and kind of a racist.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey, man!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Ooh, how was your first day working at the restaurant?ScenesJoey: (checks his watch) Damn! (runs out to work)

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Monica is cooking.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering from the dining room) Hey.ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey, what happened to your fancy chef’s jacket? (sees there’s a burn spot on it)ScenesMonica: They baked it. I can’t take this anymore. I’m gonna call a meeting tonight, I’m gonna fire you tonight.ScenesJoey: You got it! Oh-oh! (He starts patting the burned spot, which just happens to be over her breast.)ScenesMonica: What are you doing?!ScenesJoey: It’s still a tiny bit on fire there.ScenesMonica: Thanks. (Joey’s still patting the burn spot) I think you got it!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is there.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (entering) Chandler!! You have the best taste in men!ScenesChandler: Well, like father, like son.ScenesRachel: Patrick and I had such a great time last night! I mean I think this could maybe turn into something serious.ScenesChandler: Really?! I-I thought you weren’t looking for something serious? I thought you were looking for some kind of a fling.ScenesRachel: Well, y'know, possibly. (pause) You didn’t tell him that, though? Right?ScenesChandler: Ummmmmmmm, no.ScenesRachel: You told this guy that I was looking for a fling?! You don’t tell the guy that!ScenesChandler: Why not?! I’d be thrilled if I heard that some hot girl was just looking to get—oh I see.ScenesRachel: Oh, between you telling him that I wanted to have a fling and me putting out on the first date—oh, he’s so gonna get the wrong idea.

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Joey is eating some cheese.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey, Joey, could you pass the cheese?ScenesJoey: Yeah. Listen uh, I’d prefer it if you didn’t call me Joey. Since I don’t know anyone here, I thought it’d be cool to try out a cool work nickname.ScenesA Waiter: (entering) Hey, dragon! Here’s your tips from Monday and Tuesday. (hands him two envelopes)ScenesJoey: (opening an envelope) There’s like-there’s like 300 bucks in this one!ScenesThe Waiter: Yeah, people get pretty generous around the holidays. And it never hurts to wear tight trousers.ScenesMonica: Okay. Could the waiters gather around to hear tonight’s specials? Okay, first there is a Chilean Sea Bass prepared with a Mango relish on a bag—Why is nobody writing these down?ScenesThe Waiter: Because we can remember them.ScenesMonica: Because your all gonna make up fake specials and make me cook them like you did the other night?ScenesThe Waiter: Well, sure, that too.ScenesMonica: Okay, forget the specials for a minute. Umm, all right here’s the thing, for the last two weeks I have umm, (quietly) tried really hard to create a positive atmosphere…ScenesThe Waiter: Can’t hear you!ScenesMonica: (louder) A positive atmosphere! But I-I-I have had it up to here. (She holds her hand over her head as an afterthought.) From now on, it is gonna be my way, or the highway! All right? Does anybody have a problem with that?!! (Joey looks at the money he’s holding, and doesn’t speak up.) Hey new guy! I said, does anybody have a problem with that?!ScenesJoey: No ma’am.ScenesThe Waiter: Hey! He has a name, it’s Dragon. Do you wanna know your name? Check your hat. (to another waiter) We did the hat right? (The other waiter nods yes.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, continued from earlier. The other waiters are gone and Monica is confronting Joey about his not speaking up.]
rows.Content: Monica: What the hell happened?!ScenesJoey: I am so-so-so sorry. I was gonna do it! Really! But I was standing there with 327 dollars in one hand and 238 dollars in the other hand, and I was thinking, "Wow! It’s been a long time since I had… (tries to do the math in his head, but can’t) 327 + 238 dollars!ScenesMonica: Joey, we had a deal. That-that’s why you’re here! I’ve got to fire you!ScenesJoey: And I gotta pay rent! Look, how-how about this? You don’t fire me, instead I stay here, I gain their trust, and they’ll start listening to all the nice things I’ve been saying about you.ScenesMonica: What kinda things have you been saying?ScenesJoey: Well nothing yet, they really hate you and I want to fit in.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is working on her holiday song, Chandler is sitting on the couch reading a magazine, and Ross is sleeping on the couch.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) Happy, happy Chanukah, Chandler and Monica. Very merry…ScenesChandler: (interrupting) Oh, y’know, y’know what Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesChandler: I’m not Jewish, so…ScenesPhoebe: So! Ross doesn’t really decorate his tree with floss, but you don’t hear him complaining do you? God! (Phoebe hits her guitar which wakes up Ross with a start.)ScenesChandler: Bad dream?ScenesRoss: I wasn’t sleeping.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, then uh, what was Phoebe’s song about?ScenesRoss: The one with the cat. I gotta go, I’ve got another date.ScenesPhoebe: So, did you pick one yet?ScenesRoss: No, it turns out that the one from uptown was making a joke. But it was a different joke than I thought—it wasn’t that funny. So I’m still torn.ScenesPhoebe: Well look, you don’t really like the one from uptown and you’re too exhausted from dating the one up in Poughkeepsie, so I say you just end them both. Okay? You take a train up to Poughkeepsie and break up with her, and on your way back you break up with uptown. And then by the time you get home tonight, you’re done!ScenesRoss: Y’know, you’re right. Thank you.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, well I had a similar problem when I lived in Prague.ScenesChandler: Prague?ScenesPhoebe: There’s sooo much you don’t know.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is playing living room golf as Rachel enters. Rachel sees this and holds the door open until Chandler is ready to start his swing, when he is, she slams the door shut which causes the club to fly from his hands. He turns around, shocked.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Chandler! Patrick just uh, ended things with me. Did you or did you not tell him that I was looking for a serious relationship?ScenesChandler: I did! I absolutely did!ScenesRachel: You idiot!!ScenesChandler: I’m sure you’re right, but why?ScenesRachel: You don’t tell a guy that you’re looking for a serious relationship! You don’t tell the guy that! Now you scared him away!ScenesChandler: Oh, man. I’m sorry, I’m so-so sorry.ScenesRachel: Y’know, you should never be allowed to talk to people!ScenesChandler: I know! I know!ScenesRachel: Oh! See just I’m right back where I started! Aww, this sucks! Being alone, sucks! (She sits down heavily in one of the new chairs)ScenesChandler: Well, y’know, you’re-you’re gonna meet somebody! You’re a great catch! Y’know when I was telling all those guys about you, I didn’t have to lie once. (He sits down on the arm of her chair)ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesChandler: Yeah! You graduated Magma Ku Laude, right?ScenesRachel: No.ScenesChandler: Oh, it doesn’t matter. (Kisses her on the top of her head.) Hey, y’know what, I’ve got two tickets to tonight’s Rangers game, you wanna come with me?ScenesRachel: Cute guys in little shorts? Sure.ScenesChandler: Well, actually it’s a hockey team, so it’s angry Canadians with no teeth.ScenesRachel: Well that sounds fun too. (They hug.)Scenes(pause)ScenesChandler: Have you ever been with a woman?ScenesRachel: What?! Chandler, what is the matter with you?!ScenesChandler: So there is no good time to ask that question.

rows.Scenes: A train to Poughkeepsie, Ross is asleep against the window.]
rows.Content: The Conductor: The next station is Poughkeepsie. Poughkeepsie!ScenesThe Woman From Poughkeepsie: (outside Ross’s window) Ross? Ross! (she knocks on the window) Wake up! Ross! (the train starts moving) Ross! Ross!! Ross!!! Ross!!!!

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Monica is cooking.]
rows.Content: Monica: I need more swordfish. (to one of the assistant chefs) Can you get me some more swordfish?ScenesKitchen Worker: I don’t speak English.ScenesMonica: You did a minute ago!ScenesKitchen Worker: Well, I don’t know what to tell ya!ScenesMonica: Fine!Scenes(She goes into the freezer to get it herself, and leaves the door open. The waiter from earlier comes by and closes the door.)ScenesMonica: Okay! Very funny! Somebody let me out please?! Come on, I’m cold! (She spills something.) And covered in marinara sauce! Come on! Let me out! (the door opens)ScenesThe Waiter: You found that handle, did ya?ScenesMonica: That’s not funny.ScenesThe Waiter: Well that’s not true.ScenesMonica: (starting to cry) I’m a good person. And I’m a good chef, and I don’t deserve to have marinara sauce all over me! Y’know what, if you want me to quit this bad, then all you have to do is…ScenesJoey: (interrupting) Hey! Chef Geller! Y’know that little speech you made the other day? Well I got a problem with it!ScenesMonica: You do?ScenesJoey: You bet I do! I just ah, wasn’t listening then, that’s all.ScenesMonica: Well if you want a problem? I’ll give you a problem!ScenesJoey: What are you gonna do? You’re gonna fire me?ScenesMonica: You bet your ass I’m gonna fire you! Get out of my kitchen! Get out!! (Joey leaves) All right! Anybody else got a problem? How ‘bout you Chuckles? You think this is funny now?ScenesThe Waiter: No.ScenesMonica: How about if I dance around all covered in sauce? Huh? You think it’s funny now?ScenesThe Waiter: No, it’s really good.ScenesMonica: Good! Now, take those salads to table 4, (to the kitchen worker from earlier) And you! Get the swordfish! (to another assistant chef) And you! Get a haircut!

rows.Scenes: The train, it’s pulling into a station.]
rows.Content: The Conductor: Last stop, Montreal. This stop is Montreal.ScenesRoss: (waking up) What? (notices that there is now a beautiful woman sitting next to him)ScenesWoman On Train: I made a bet with myself that you have beautiful eyes. Now that I see them, I win.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesWoman On Train: We’re at my stop. But would you like to have coffee?ScenesRoss: (now fully awake) Are we really in Montreal?!ScenesWoman On Train: Yes we are. So, coffee?ScenesRoss: Coffee sounds great. (They get up) Wait, so, so you live in Montreal?ScenesWoman On Train: Oh, no. But it’s just a two hour ferry ride to Nova Scotia.

rows.Scenes: Allesandro’s, Joey is coming back in with his coat on.]
rows.Content: Joey: Well I guess I should’ve thought about my wife and kids before I talked back to chef Geller!ScenesMonica: Thanks.ScenesJoey: Yep! Looks like it’s gonna be a leeeeean Christmas at the Dragon house this year.ScenesMonica: Enough!ScenesJoey: (leaving) Lean-lean-lean!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is singing her holiday song.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (singing) "Went to the store, sat on Santa's lap.Scenes                                Asked him to bring my friends all kind of crap.Scenes                                Said all you need is to write them a song.Scenes                                They haven't heard it, so don't try and sing along.Scenes                                No, don't sing along.Scenes                                Monica, Moncia, have a happy Chanukah.Scenes                                Saw Santa Clause, he said hello to Ross.Scenes                                And plese tell Joey, Christmas will be snowy!Scenes                                And Rachel and Chandler, have err-umm-glander!!ScenesHappy holidays, everybody!ScenesEndScenesThe One With Phoebe’s UterusScenesWritten by: Seth KirklandScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Frank and Alice are there talking with Phoebe.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh my God! I can’t believe my little brother is married!ScenesFrank: Oh I know!! (Both he and Alice squeal hysterically)ScenesPhoebe: You guys, why didn’t you tell me you were eloping?ScenesFrank: ‘Cause it just sorta happened, y’know we were at the courthouse, we were having lunch…ScenesPhoebe: Wait, wait, why were you at the courthouse?ScenesFrank: We were having lunch. Yeah and then all of the sudden we were like, "Hey! Y'know, we’re here, having lunch let’s get married!ScenesPhoebe: Wow, a year and a half ago I didn’t even know I had a brother, and now I have a sister too. (They all hug, and Frank and Alice start kissing.) Okay. Okay. Stop it, don’t. So, I gotta get you a gift now. Is there anything you need?ScenesFrank: Uhh, yeah.ScenesAlice: We’ve been trying to get pregnant, uh pretty much ever since we got engaged, we thought we’d get a jump on things, y’know no one’s getting any younger.ScenesFrank: See the thing is umm, we’re not able to y’know, uh, conceive.ScenesAlice: And we’ve tried everything, we’ve seen a bunch of doctors.ScenesFrank: Yeah, and they-and they say that our-that our only chance to have a baby is that if they take my sperm, her egg and put it together in a dish and then put it into another girl.
