So we were wondering if you could be the girl that we could put it into.ScenesPhoebe: (shocked) That’s a really nice gift. I was thinking of like a gravy boat.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel, and Chandler are trying to throw cards into a vase.]
rows.Content: Joey: (entering with Ross) Hey! You guys! Check it out, check it out! (He’s wearing a blue blazer) Guess which job I got.ScenesChandler: I don’t know, but Donald Trump wants his blue blazer black.Scenes(The gang is stunned.)ScenesRoss: What?ScenesChandler: Blue blazer back. He-he wants it back.ScenesRachel: But you-you said black. Why would he want his blue blazer black?ScenesChandler: Well, you-you know what I meant.ScenesMonica: No, you messed it up. You’re stupid.ScenesChandler: So what job did you get Joe?ScenesJoey: Oh, ah, tour guide at the museum. Yeah, Ross got it for me.ScenesRachel: Well, how can you be a tour guide, don’t you have to be a dinosaur expert or something?ScenesJoey: No, not really. They give you all the information, it’s uh, it’s like memorizing a script. (Making like a tour guide) "And on your left, you have Tyrannosaurus Rex, a carnivore from the Jurassic period.ScenesChandler, Monica, and Rachel:  Great!! That’s great!ScenesRoss: Uh actually Joey, it’s the Cretasous period.ScenesJoey: Yeah but, I can pronounce Jurassic.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Guess what. Frank Jr., and Alice got married!ScenesAll: Oh my God!!ScenesPhoebe: And! And, they’re gonna have a baby! (The gang is shocked.) And! And, they want me to grow it for them in my uterus. (The gang is stunned into silence.)ScenesRoss: My God!ScenesMonica: Are you serious?ScenesPhoebe: YeahScenesJoey: You’re really thinking about having sex with your brother?!ScenesPhoebe: Ewww! And "Oh no!" It’s—they just want me to be the surrogate. It’s her-it’s her egg and her sperm, and I’m-I’m just the oven, it’s totally their bun.ScenesJoey: Huh.ScenesMonica: What did you tell them?ScenesPhoebe: Well, they said that I had to think about it first, but what is there to think about? I’m gonna be giving them the greatest gift you can possibly give.ScenesChandler: You’re gonna be carrying their baby and give them a Sony Play Station?ScenesRachel: Honey, this really is an incredible thing to do for them, but there are things to think about.ScenesMonica: Yeah, like you’re gonna be pregnant. I mean pregnant.ScenesPhoebe: I know!ScenesRoss: Pheebs, you’re talking about putting your body through an awful lot, I mean morning sickness, uhh, labour, and it’s all for somebody else!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, what’s your point?ScenesRoss: Well, the stuff I just mentioned.ScenesRachel: Wow! I don’t know if I could ever do that. I always figured the first time I had a baby was with somebody I love and that baby would be a…keeper.ScenesPhoebe: Y'know you guys were a lot more supportive when I wanted to make denim furniture.ScenesJoey: No, Pheebs, listen, if you decide to do this, we’ll be supportive like crazy.ScenesAll: Yeah.ScenesMonica: We just want you to think it through.ScenesRachel: Yeah, honey, maybe you can talk to somebody who’s had a baby. Like your mom?ScenesPhoebe: My mom never gave birth. Oh! But my birth mom did.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Kathy are kissing.]
rows.Content: Kathy: Umm, (moves her hand’s down to his butt) I love this touchy. Can I take it to work with me?ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah, sure, it’s not mine anyway. It can with the pants.ScenesKathy: Oh! (They kiss and she leaves)ScenesMonica: I am so jealous.ScenesRachel: You guys are really right…there aren’t you?ScenesChandler: Yes. Right where?ScenesMonica: In the beginning where y’know it’s all sex and talking and sex and talking and…ScenesChandler: Yeah, you-you gotta love the talking.ScenesMonica: And the sex?ScenesChandler: All right, we haven’t had sex yet. Okay, what’s the big deal? Y’know? This is special, and I want our love to grow until we move on to the next level.ScenesRachel: Oh, Chandler that is so nice.ScenesRoss: That is really nice…lying! No way is that the reason!ScenesRachel: Why? Just because you’re not mature enough to understand something like that?!ScenesChandler: No, he’s right, I’m totally lying.Scenes(Ross makes an "I was right, and you weren’t face." And Rachel does Ross’s little I’m-flicking-you-off-but-I’m-not-giving-you-the-finger banging of the fists.)ScenesMonica: Then what is it?ScenesChandler: Well, Kathy’s last boyfriend was Joey.ScenesRoss: And you’re afraid you won’t be able to…fill his shoes.ScenesChandler: No, I’m afraid I won’t be able to make love as well as him.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I was going for the metaphor.ScenesChandler: Yes, and I was saying the actual words.ScenesMonica: So big deal, so Joey’s had a lot of girlfriends, it doesn’t mean he’s great in bed.ScenesChandler: We share a wall! So either he’s great in bed, or she just likes to agree with him a lot.ScenesMonica: Sweetie, with you it’s gonna be different. The sex is gonna be great, ‘cause you-you guys are in love.ScenesChandler: Yeah?ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesRoss: Just go for it Chandler.ScenesMonica: Yeah, you should.ScenesRachel: Yeah, you should, really.ScenesMonica: Go on.ScenesChandler: All right, all right, I’ll go sleep with my girlfriend. But I’m just doing it for you guys.

rows.Scenes: The museum, Joey is giving a tour to a bunch of school kids.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay, now the Mastodon is from the semi-late Jurassic period.ScenesSmart Kid: Isn’t the Mastodon from the Pliocene Epic?ScenesJoey: Shhh! This is a museum, no talking. Right down here, (Motions to a fossilised dinosaur foot.) we have a large foot. (Sees Ross working in one of the display cases.) Uhh, and over here we have Ross Geller. (Knocks on the glass) Everyone wave ‘Hi’ to Ross. Ross is one of our most important scientists, look at him, hard at work. (Ross does the old "Putting a cigarette in your ear and pulling it out of your mouth trick.") Okay, moving right along. Come on.

rows.Scenes: Phoebe Sr.’s house, there’s a knock on the door.]
rows.Content: Phoebe Sr: It’s open! Come in!ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesPhoebe Sr: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: I’m sorry, I’m late.ScenesPhoebe Sr: Oh, that’s okay, it gave me time to finish glazing my nipples.ScenesPhoebe: Wow! You really go all out when you’re expecting company.ScenesPhoebe Sr: No, I was working on my pottery.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Ooh! Oh, I didn’t know that you did…pot.ScenesPhoebe Sr: Well, yeah, mostly nudes. It combines my two passions, pottery and erotica.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, erotiery!ScenesPhoebe Sr: Hey! Okay! Well thanks for coming out to see me. I just-I just thought it would be a very good idea to talk about this baby stuff in person. Y’know…ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesPhoebe Sr: I really don’t think it’s a very good idea, Phoebe.ScenesPhoebe: Why not?ScenesPhoebe Sr: Well, because you’d be giving up a baby, and I-I really don’t—I don’t know if there’s anything I can say that could make you understand the pain of giving up a baby. So, umm, (Picks up a puppy in the box next to the couch.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh no! No-no! I understand the pain! Don’t-don’t hurt the puppy.ScenesPhoebe Sr: No-no-no, the-the puppy’s yours.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I get a puppy!!ScenesPhoebe Sr: Well, yeah! I mean yeah, but only for three days.ScenesPhoebe: Why?ScenesPhoebe Sr: I realise I don’t have any right to start get all parenty on you and everything now, but umm, (Sees that Phoebe isn’t paying attention and is busy mimicking the puppy.) uhh… Phoebe, would you please look at me and not the puppy, it’s very important.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesPhoebe Sr: I mean, I know what I’m talking about. I gave up two babies, and I only wish I had someone there that had given up babies, that could tell me how terrible it is to give up babies. I just think that, it would be something you will regret every single day for the rest of your life. So, how ever hard it is to give up this puppy, it would be like a million times harder to give up a child. (Phoebe is playing with the puppy again, and not listening) I really shouldn’t have given you the puppy first.ScenesPhoebe: All right, I’m sorry.

rows.Scenes: The museum’s worker cafeteria, Joey is eating lunch with the rest of the tour guides. Another tour guide tries to sit down in a seat Joey saved for Ross.]
rows.Content: Joey: Uhh, do you mind sitting there. I’m-I’m saving this for my friend Ross.ScenesTour Guide: You mean Dr. Geller?ScenesJoey: Doctor? Wow! I didn’t know he had a nickname.ScenesTour Guide: Oh, he won’t sit here. Only the people in the white coats sit over there, (Points to there table) and only the people in the blue blazers sit here.ScenesJoey: Well, how-how come?ScenesTour Guide: That’s just the way it is.ScenesJoey: That’s crazy.ScenesTour Guide: Maybe it’s crazy in a perfect world, a world without lab coats and blazers, but you not in a perfect world, you in a museum now. See that scientist in the classes, he and I used to play together all the time in grade school, but now…(Turns around) Peter! Hey, Peter! It’s me Rhonda! From PS-129! I shared my puddin’ which you man! I gave you my Snack Pack! (to Joey) See, he pretend he don’t even here me!ScenesJoey: I-I think everybody’s pretending they don’t hear you. Anyway, look, I don’t know about you and your jackets and your separate tables, but Ross is one of my best friends, and if I save him a seat, I’m telling you, he will sit in it! (Ross enters and goes over to the white table) Ross! Ross! Over here, man! I-I saved you seat.ScenesRoss: That’s okay, I’m cool over here. I’ll catch up with you later, Joey. (Joey is shocked.)Scenes(Another woman enters without a coat or blazer and tries to sit at the ‘blue’ table.)ScenesTour Guide: Op, this is saved. (Joey wonders why) Gift shop.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is eating dinner, Monica and Rachel are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Ross: (entering) Hey, uh, I’m really, really sorry about what happened in the cafeteria today.ScenesJoey: It’s no big deal. Hey, y’know, you do what you gotta do. Right?ScenesRoss: But hey, it’s not just me, I mean the scientists and the tour guides never sit together.ScenesJoey: Whatever.ScenesRoss: It’s like that everywhere, Joey! Okay, Mon, back me up here. Where you work the uh, waiters eat with the waiters, right? And the chefs eat with the other chefs, right?ScenesMonica: I eat by myself in the alley because everybody hates me.ScenesJoey: Look, Ross, really it’s-it’s no big deal. Y’know you wear a white coat, I wear a blue blazer, if that means we can’t be friends at work, then so be it. Y’know, hey I understand. Y’know? Hey, when I’m in a play and you’re in the audience, I don’t talk to you, right? So it’s y’know, it’s uh, it’s cool. I’ll see you tomorrow. (Leaves)ScenesRachel: Yeah, when we’re in the audience he doesn’t talk to us, but he does wave.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, Phoebe is there with her puppy and is trying to sing it to sleep as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hi.ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesChandler: Why is Phoebe singing to Carl Mulden?ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, y’know what, I think it’s time for puppy to go out again. Come on, let’s go to the balcony.ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesPhoebe: Umm, the street. Come on, let’s go to the street. Ooh, listen, don’t go onto the balcony until after I get back. (Leaves)ScenesMonica: (to Chandler) So, did you do it?ScenesChandler: Yes, yes, we had the sex.ScenesMonica: Uh-oh, it was bad?ScenesChandler: It was fine, y’know? But she didn’t agree with me as strongly as she agreed with Joey. She was more like, "I see you point, I’m all right with it.ScenesMonica: Well, it was the first time. Y’know, there’s not always a lot of agreement the first time.ScenesRachel: Yeah, not girls anyway, guys agree (snaps her fingers) like that.ScenesChandler: Look, you have to help me! Okay? I mean, I know what to do with a woman, y’know, I know where everything goes, it’s always nice. But I need to know what makes it go from nice to, "My God! Somebody’s killing her in there!ScenesMonica: All right, I’m gonna show you something a lot of guys don’t know. Rach, give me that pad, please? (She does so and Monica starts drawing on it) All right. Now…ScenesChandler: Look, you don’t have to draw an actual wo—whoa! She’s hot!ScenesMonica: Now everybody knows the basic erogenous zones. (She starts labelling them) You got one, two three, four (Chandler is shocked to find out there’s more than three), five, six, and seven!ScenesChandler: (shocked) There are seven?!ScenesRachel: Let me see that. (Monica shows her) Oh, yeah.ScenesChandler: (Points to one) That’s one?ScenesMonica: It’s kind of an important one!ScenesChandler: Oh, y’know-y’know what, I was looking at it upside down.ScenesRachel: Well, y’know, sometimes that helps. (She realises what that could’ve meant.)ScenesMonica: (continuing) Now, most guys will hit uh, 1-2-3 and then go to 7 and set up camp.ScenesChandler: That-that’s bad?ScenesRachel: Well if you go to Disneyland, you don’t spend the whole day on the Materhorn.ScenesChandler: Well you might if it were anything like 7!ScenesMonica: All right uh, the important thing is to take your time, you want to hit ‘em all, and you mix ‘em up. You gotta keep them on their toes.ScenesRachel: Oo, toes!! Well, for some people. (Chandler eyes her and her toes.)ScenesMonica: All right. Umm, you could uh start out with a little 1, a 2, a 1-2-3, 3, 5, a 4, a 3-2, 2, a 2-4-6, 2-4-6, 4, (Rachel starts getting worked up) 2, 2, 4-7, 5-7, 6-7, 7, …7..…7…7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7-7…(mouths 7)! (They both lean back on the couch satisfied.)

rows.Scenes: The museum cafeteria, Joey is eating with the tour guides as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Older Scientist: Dr. Geller, there’s a seat over here. (Motions to an empty chair at the ‘white’ table.)ScenesRoss: Thank you, Dr. Phillips, but I’m having my lunch at this table, here in the middle. I’m having lunch right here, with my good friend Joey, if he’ll sit with me.ScenesJoey: (standing up) I will sit with you Dr. Geller. (He goes over to his table and they shake hands.)ScenesRoss: Y'know, we work in a museum of natural history, and yet there is something unnatural about the way we eat lunch. Now, I look around this cafeteria, and y’know what I see, I see-I see division. Division, between people in white coats and people in blue blazers, and I ask myself, "My God why?!" Now, I say we shed these-these coats that separate us, and we get to know the people underneath. (He takes off his coat and throws it down.) I’m Ross! I’m divorced, and I have a kid!ScenesJoey: (stands up, and throws his coat on the floor) I’m Joey! I’m an actor! I don’t know squat about dinosaurs!ScenesAnother Tour Guide: (standing up and removing his coat) I’m Ted, and I just moved here a month ago, and New York really scares me.ScenesRoss: All right, there you go!ScenesJoey: Yeah, you hang in there Teddy!ScenesOlder Scientist: I’m Andrew, and I didn’t pay for this pear.ScenesRoss: Okay, good-good for you.ScenesTour Guide: I’m Rhonda, (motions to her breasts) and these aren’t real! (Joey and Ross look at each other, shocked)ScenesRoss: Wow, Rhonda.ScenesAnother Scientist: I’m Scott.ScenesRoss: Yeah, okay, Scott!ScenesAnother Scientist: And I need to flip the light switch on and off 17 times before I leave a room or my family will die.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe, with the puppy, Monica, and Rachel are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: My mom’s gonna be here any minute. I can’t do this, I can’t give him up. Yes—no, I can. I don’t want to. But I can. No.ScenesRachel: Oo, I can’t watch this, it’s like Sophie’s Choice.ScenesMonica: Y’know, I never saw that.ScenesRachel: Ooh, it was only okay.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, I can’t do this. My mom was right. If I can’t-if I can’t give him up, then there’s no way I can give up a baby. Ohh, God, Frank and Alice are gonna be so crushed. What-what else, what else can I give ‘em—a kidney!ScenesAlice: (entering with Frank) Hi!ScenesFrank: Hi!ScenesAlice: Uhh, we were just in the neighbourhood, so…ScenesFrank: Yeah, so we just thought we’d stop by and let you know there’s still no pressure.ScenesAlice: None. But if there was something you wanted to tell us, we’re just gonna be right over there (points to the counter) having coffee.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesFrank: (noticing the puppy) Oh, who’s this little guy?! (Grabs the puppy)ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Ooh! Umm!ScenesFrank: Oh, he’s so cute, he reminds me of my old dog, Tumour.ScenesAlice: You are so precious, I could just take you home.ScenesPhoebe: Hey, why don’t you?ScenesFrank: Are you serious?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh, yeah!ScenesFrank: Oh, thanks.ScenesMonica: What are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: No, I’m really okay with this. Y’know why? ‘Cause look at them, and I made that, so… I know it’s gonna be like a million times harder to give up a baby but, oh my God, it’s gonna feel like a million times better, right? I wanna do this. (To Frank and Alice) I wanna carry your baby.ScenesAlice: (shocked) Oh! Oh! Oh! Thank you so much! You don’t know what this means to us! Oh!ScenesFrank: Oh my God, I think I’m gonna cry!ScenesMonica: It’s gonna be so great.ScenesPhoebe Sr: (entering) Hi! What’s going on?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I-I gave them the puppy and it made them so happy that I decided I’m gonna carry their baby.ScenesPhoebe Sr: But Phoebe…ScenesPhoebe: No-no-no, I know, but you and I are different people though, and this is a totally different situation, and I know that I am not gonna regret this.ScenesPhoebe Sr: Oh, I-I-I understand all that, but it’s just—that was my puppy.ScenesPhoebe: Oh!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are sitting at the table.]
rows.Content: Monica: Would you ever be a surrogate for anyone?ScenesRachel: It depends on who asked.ScenesMonica: What if I asked?ScenesRachel: Oh, Mon, sure.ScenesMonica: Really?ScenesRachel: Yes. (Pause) You’re not asking are you?ScenesMonica: No.ScenesRachel: Yes! Totally!Scenes(Kathy runs in, hair all out of place, and hugs Monica.)ScenesKathy: Oh! Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! Yes! Thank you! (Runs back to Chandler)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The EmbryosScenesWritten by: Jill Condon & Amy ToominScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, it’s 0-Dark:30, in other words it’s really, really early. Everyone’s asleep, and all through the apartments not a creature was stirring, not even a mouse. That is except for the chick, who turns out to be a rooster and is crowing in the sun. Needless to say, this awakens Monica and Rachel who rush into their living room, searching for the cause of the sound.]
rows.Content: Rachel: What the hell is that?!! (to Monica) What the hell is that? Is that you? (Monica nods her head no, and Rachel realizes what is making that sound.) Ohhhhhhh! (storms over to Chandler and Joey’s with Monica in trail.)ScenesMonica: Boy, you are really not a morning person.ScenesRachel: (angrily) BACK OFF!!! (She starts banging on their door.) Get up! Get up! Get up! God damn it! Get up, get up, get up, get up, get up!!Scenes(Chandler opens the door, finally.)ScenesRachel: What is that noise?ScenesChandler: You!ScenesJoey: It’s the chick! She’s…going through some changes.ScenesMonica: What kind of changes?ScenesChandler: Well the vet seems to think that’s she’s becoming a rooster. (The rooster crows.) We’re getting a second opinion.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, it’s later that morning, everybody has gotten up and Ross and Phoebe has joined them for breakfast. Rachel is returning from shopping.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey, what are you doing shopping at eight in the morning?ScenesRachel: Well, I’ve been up since six. Thanks to somebody’s dumb-ass rooster.ScenesPhoebe: You guys you really should get rid of those animals. They shouldn’t be living in an apartment.ScenesRachel: Yeah! Especially not with all of these knives and cookbooks around…ScenesPhoebe: All right. I’m gonna go to the fertility doctor and um, see if I’m ready to have Frank and Alice’s embryo transferred into my uterus.ScenesRoss: Now, how will they know if you’re ready?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, they’re just gonna umm, look to see if my endometria layer is thick.ScenesChandler: Oh, I can uh, check that for ya.ScenesPhoebe: Okay everyone, think thick.ScenesAll: Good-bye! Good luck! (She opens the door to reveal Monica and Joey.)ScenesPhoebe: Hi! Wish me luck!ScenesMonica: Oh, good luck.ScenesJoey: Good luck. (to Monica) And I’m still right!ScenesMonica: That is sooo not true!ScenesRachel: What?ScenesJoey: She’s mad because I know today’s her laundry day and that means she’s wearing her old lady underpants.ScenesChandler: I can check that for ya.ScenesMonica: I just—I can’t believe that you think that you and Chandler know me and Rachel better than we know you.ScenesChandler: Well… we-we do. You can only eat Tic Tacks in even numbers.ScenesJoey: Yeah, what’s that about?ScenesChandler: (to Rachel) And you… Ross, I believe, if you check Rachel’s bag you will find a half-eaten box of cookies in there.ScenesRoss: (He does so, and finds a half-eaten box of cookies.) You’re good. (Tries a cookie.) These are not.ScenesRachel: I’m so not impressed. Everybody snacks when they shop.ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Oh yeah? Ross, how many items left in that bag?ScenesRoss: Five.ScenesChandler: Okay, ten bucks says that we can name every item in that bag.ScenesRachel: How many guesses do you get?ScenesJoey: Six.ScenesRoss: Challenge extended.ScenesMonica: Deal!ScenesRoss: Challenge excepted.ScenesJoey: All right, we’ll start with…apples.ScenesRoss: We’ll be starting with apples.ScenesChandler: (to Ross) Stop that now!Scenes(Ross reveals a bag of apples.)ScenesChandler: Yes!ScenesJoey: Okay. Uhh, tortilla chips, yogurt.ScenesChandler: Diet soda.ScenesRoss: Yes. Yes. Yes. (They’re perfect so far.)ScenesChandler: Orange juice.ScenesRachel: No! There’s no orange juice in there! We win!!ScenesMonica: Ha-ha!ScenesRoss: They have another guess.ScenesRachel: Okay, well, we won that one.ScenesJoey: Okay, the last thing…ScenesChandler: Oh-oh, oh, oh-oh! (Whispers something in Joey’s ear.)ScenesJoey: No-no, not for like another two weeks.ScenesChandler: I got it! Scotch… tape. (They’re right.)ScenesRoss: How did you know she would buy scotch tape?ScenesChandler: Well, we used there’s up last night making scary faces.ScenesMonica: Aww, man!ScenesChandler: All right! Ten buck! Fork it over! Cough it up! Pay the piper! Gimme it.ScenesMonica: That does not mean you know us better, I-I want a rematch.ScenesRachel: Yeah, and none of these stupid grocery questions, real personal questions.ScenesMonica: Yeah! And the winner gets a hundred bucks.ScenesJoey: Serious?ScenesMonica: Are you scared?ScenesJoey: No! All right, who-who makes up the questions?ScenesMonica: Ross will do it.ScenesRoss: Oh sure, "Ross will do it!" It’s not like he has a job, or a child, or a life of his own.ScenesRachel: Fine! We’ll ask Phoebe.ScenesRoss: No-no-no, I-I wanna play.

rows.Scenes: The Doctor’s office, Dr. Zane is examining Phoebe as Frank and Alice watch.]
rows.Content: Dr. Zane: It looks like your uterus is ready for implantation.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! I knew it! I knew it! I felt really thick this morning.ScenesFrank: Well, okay, so what’s now—go get, go get the eggs, put ‘em in there.ScenesDr. Zane: Okay, it’ll take just a little while to prepare the embryos.ScenesPhoebe: Embryossss? As in, "More than one?ScenesDr. Zane: Um-hmm, five actually.ScenesPhoebe: Five? Okay, where am I giving birth, a hospital or a big box under the stairs?ScenesDr. Zane: We do five because that gives you a 25% chance that at least one will attach.ScenesPhoebe: That’s it! 25 percent? That means that’s it’s like 75 percent chance of no baby at all!ScenesFrank: Hey, y’know I was thinking, what are the odds like if-if, if you stuff like 200 of them in there?ScenesAlice: Sweety, now, she’s a woman, not a gumball machine.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, well y’know what, don’t worry you guys, ‘cause I’m-I’m gonna do this as many times as it takes to get it right.ScenesFrank: Well, you see, the-the thing is, we-we only got, we kinda have one shot to make it right.ScenesAlice: Umm, it costs $16,000 each time you do this. So, umm, we’re kinda using all the money we have to do it just this one time.ScenesPhoebe: Whoa!! That—okay, that’s a lot of pressure on me and my uterus. (to Dr. Zane) So, well okay, so is there—is maybe is there something that I can do y’know just to like help make sure I get pregnant?ScenesDr. Zane: No, I’m sorry.ScenesPhoebe: Wow! You guys really don’t know anything!ScenesFrank: I know! Why don’t you get drunk! That worked for a lot of girls in my high school.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the game is about to begin.]
rows.Content: Monica: You guys! Do you realize that any minute now, Phoebe can be pregnant?ScenesJoey: Huh.ScenesRachel: I know! I know, it’s such a huge, life-altering thing.ScenesJoey: I know.Scenes(They all pause and think about it.)ScenesRoss: The test is ready.ScenesAll: Yeah! Yes! (They all right into the living room, all excited.)ScenesRoss: Okay, each team will answer ten questions. The first team that answers the most questions wins. Okay, the categories are, Fears and Pet Peeves, Ancient History, Literature, and It’s All Relative. Now, the coin toss to see who goes first. (He flips the coin and they all watch it hit the table and stop. Then they all look up at him, to see who goes first.) Okay, somebody call it this time.ScenesAll: Oh yeah!Scenes(Ross flips the coin again.)ScenesRachel: Tails!ScenesRoss: It’s heads. (The guys celebrate.) Gentlemen, pick your category.ScenesChandler: Fears and Pet Peeves.ScenesRoss: What is Monica’s biggest pet peeve?ScenesJoey: Animals dressed as humans.ScenesRoss: That’s correct. Ladies?ScenesMonica: Same category?ScenesRoss: According to Chandler, what phenomenon scares the bejeezus out of him?ScenesMonica: Michael Flatley, Lord of the Dance!ScenesRoss: That is correct.ScenesJoey: (to Chandler) The Irish gig guy?!ScenesChandler: His legs flail about as if independent of his body!ScenesRoss: Gentlemen, you’re pick.ScenesJoey: It’s All Relative.ScenesRoss: Monica and I have a grandmother who died, you both went to her funeral, name that grandmother!ScenesJoey: (to Chandler) Nana?ScenesChandler: She has a real name.ScenesJoey: (answering the question) Althea!ScenesChandler: Althea?! What are you doing?!ScenesJoey: I took a shot.ScenesChandler: You're shooting with Althea?!ScenesRoss: Althea is correct.ScenesChandler: Nice shooting!Scenes(Ross motions for the girls to pick.)ScenesRachel: We’ll take Literature!!ScenesRoss: Every week, the TV Guide comes to Chandler and Joey’s apartment. What name appears on the address label?ScenesRachel: Chandler gets it! It’s Chandler Bing!ScenesMonica: No!!ScenesRoss: I’m afraid the TV Guide comes to Chinandolor Bong.ScenesMonica: I knew that! Rachel! Use you’re head!ScenesChandler: Actually, it’s Miss Chinandolor Bong.

rows.Scenes: The Doctor’s office, Phoebe is giving a pep talk to the petrie dish containing the embryos.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hello, tiny embryos. Well, I’m-I’m Phoebe Buffay, hi! I’m-I’m-I’m hoping to be your uterus for the next nine months. You should know, that we’re doing this for Frank and Alice, who you know, you’ve been there! Umm, y’know they want you so much, so when you guys get in there, really grab on. Okay, and-and I promise that I’ll keep you safe and warm until you’re ready to have them take you home, so… Oh! And also, umm next time you see me, I’m screaming, don’t worry, that’s what’s supposed to happen.ScenesDr. Zane: Ready?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh. (To the embryos) Good luck.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the game is coming to a close.]
rows.Content: Ross: All right, the score is nine to eight in favor of the guys. Ladies if you miss this the game is theirs, pick your category.ScenesRachel: (shouting) It’s All Relative!!ScenesRoss: You don’t have to shout everything.ScenesRachel: (shouting) I’m sorry!ScenesRoss: Ooh. What is the name of Chandler’s father’s Las Vegas all-male burlesque?ScenesMonica: Viva Las Gaygas!ScenesChandler: Unfortunately that is correct.ScenesThe Girls: Yes!!ScenesRoss: All right, we have a tie. Luckily, I have prepared for such an event. (He opens up an envelope and holds up some note cards.) The Lightning Round!ScenesAll: Ohhhh.ScenesRoss: Thirty seconds, all the questions you can answer.ScenesMonica: You guys are dead, I am so good at lighting rounds.ScenesChandler: I majored in lightning rounds. All right, we’re gonna destroy you.ScenesMonica: Huh, wanna bet?ScenesChandler: Well, I’m so confused as to what we’ve been doing so far…ScenesMonica: How about we play for more money, say 150?ScenesRoss: 150 dollars.ScenesChandler: Say 200?ScenesRoss: 200 dollars.ScenesMonica: You’re doing it again.ScenesRoss: Excuse me.ScenesRachel: Monica, I don’t want to lose 200 dollars.ScenesMonica: We won’t. (to Chandler) 300?ScenesRachel: Monica?!ScenesMonica: I’m just trying to spice it up!ScenesRachel: Okay, so let’s play for some pepper! Stop spending my money!ScenesMonica: I got it! How about, if we win, they have to get rid of the rooster?ScenesRachel: Oooohh that’s interesting.ScenesJoey: Hey, no way, that rooster’s family!ScenesRachel: Throw in the duck too!ScenesJoey: What do you have against the duck?! He doesn’t make any noise!ScenesRachel: Well, he gets the other one all riled up.ScenesJoey: Look, we are not gonna…ScenesChandler: (interrupting) All right, hold on! If you win, we give up the birds.ScenesJoey: (shocked) Dah!! (Chandler motions for him to calm down.)ScenesChandler: But if we win, we get your apartment.ScenesJoey: Oooooh!ScenesMonica: Deal!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier, only slightly later.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Monica, betting the apartment, I don’t know about this.ScenesMonica: Rachel, I have not missed one question the whole game. I own this game! Look at my hand. (Holds up her hand.)ScenesRachel: Why? Do you have the answers written on there?ScenesMonica: No! Steady as a rock! Now, are you with me.ScenesRachel: All right, let’s do it.ScenesMonica: Come on!ScenesRachel: Okay. (They go into the living room.)ScenesRoss: All right, gentlemen, you’re up first.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesChandler: Okay. (Starts jumping around.)ScenesRoss: You have 30 seconds. And the lightning round begins—stop it (Chandler stops jumping)—now. What was Monica’s nickname when she was a field hockey goalie?ScenesJoey: Big fat goalie.ScenesRoss: Correct. Rachel claims this is her favorite movie…ScenesChandler: Dangerous Liaisons.ScenesRoss: Correct. Her actual favorite movie is...ScenesJoey: Weekend at Bernie’s.ScenesRoss: Correct. In what part of her body did Monica get a pencil stuck at age 14?ScenesChandler: Oh! (Whispers something in Joey’s ear and then in Ross’s ear.)ScenesRoss: Eww! No!! Her ear! All right, Monica categorizes her towels. How many categories are there?Scenes(They both confer.)ScenesJoey: Everyday use.ScenesChandler: Fancy.ScenesJoey: Guest.ScenesChandler: Fancy guest.ScenesRoss: Two seconds…ScenesJoey: Uhh, 11!ScenesRoss: 11, unbelievable 11 is correct. (The guys celebrate.) All right, that’s 4 for the guys. Ladies, you’re up.ScenesRachel: All right!ScenesMonica: Come on!Scenes(As they change places, they give each other the now patented Ross maneuver. If you don’t know what that means, click here to find out The One With Joey's New Girlfriend.)ScenesRoss: 30 seconds on the clock. 5 questions wins the game. The lightning round begins…now! What is Joey’s favorite food?ScenesMonica: Sandwiches!ScenesRoss: Correct. Chandler was how old when he first touched a girl’s breast?ScenesRachel: 14?ScenesRoss: No, 19.ScenesChandler: Thanks man.ScenesRoss: Joey, had an imaginary childhood friend. His name was?ScenesMonica: Maurice.ScenesRoss: Correct, his profession was?ScenesRachel: Space cowboy!ScenesRoss: Correct! What is Chandler Bing’s job?Scenes(The girls are stumped)ScenesRachel: Oh gosh, it has something to do with numbers.ScenesMonica: And processing.ScenesRachel: He carries a briefcase.ScenesRoss: 10 seconds, you need this or you lose the game.ScenesMonica: It’s umm, it has something to do with transponding.ScenesRachel: Oh-oh-oh, he’s a transponce—transpondster!ScenesMonica: That’s not even a word! I can get this! I can get this!Scenes(Ross stops the clock, signifying the end of the lightning round.)ScenesMonica: NOOOOOOOOO!!!!!ScenesRachel: Oh my God.ScenesChandler and Joey: YEAH!!! YES!!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, Chandler and Joey are carrying in the foosball table.]
rows.Content: Joey: I call Monica’s room!ScenesChandler: You can’t just call Monica’s room.ScenesJoey: Sure I can, standard shotgun rules, I’m sight of the room and I called it.Scenes(Chandler grunts and turns around, sees that he’s in sight of the room, and mouths damn!)ScenesMonica: Man, I feel like I’m coming down with something.ScenesJoey: What?ScenesMonica: Yeah. (to Chandler) I bet you can’t guess what color my tonsils are? I’ll bet the apartment!ScenesChandler: Oh, I would never bet this apartment. It’s too nice.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey—ooh Pheebs, are they in there?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, yeah, uh-huh, they’re implanted.ScenesMonica: How do you feel?ScenesPhoebe: Well, freaked. ‘Cause it turns out that the odds are really sucky. And! This is Frank and Alice’s like only shot. Like, they are literally putting all of their eggs in my basket.ScenesChandler: Yeah, but I bet it works.ScenesMonica: Really?! How much?!ScenesPhoebe: All right, I’m gonna go take a pregnancy test, right now.ScenesJoey: Oh wow! You can tell this soon.ScenesPhoebe: Well the doctor says it takes a couple days, but my body’s always been a little faster than Western medicine.ScenesRachel: (entering from Chandler’s bedroom, I guess, and sees the foosball table.) Oh my God! I can’t believe you guys are actually think you’re moving in here!ScenesChandler: Well believe it baby!ScenesRachel: Well I-I-I’m not moving.ScenesJoey: What?!ScenesRachel: No, it was a stupid bet! We were just playing a game!ScenesJoey: You can’t just ignore the bet! It’s a bet! You bet and you bet and if you lose, you lose the bet!ScenesMonica: Look Rach, we have to move. I mean if they had lost, we would’ve made them get rid of the birds. Right?ScenesRachel: Noooo.ScenesMonica: All right, look, I hate this as much as you, but if it makes you feel better, it’s all your fault.ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesMonica: Chinadolor Bong, come on, we steal that TV Guide every week!ScenesChandler: I knew it!ScenesRachel: I don’t care, I’m not going anywhere.ScenesChandler: Cool, girl roommate.Scenes(Phoebe comes in from the bathroom as Rachel sits down in disgust.)ScenesMonica: Well?ScenesPhoebe: Nope, not knocked up yet.ScenesMonica: It’s only been a couple of hours, so just give it some time.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, all right. Meanwhile, I’m gonna do whatever I can to help this so, I’m just gonna y’know, lie it your chair, (She climbs into the chair and drapes her feet over the back of the chair.) Y'know? Yeah, good, I’m let gravity y’know, do its jobs.Scenes[Cut too later, the moving process is progressing steadily. Monica is trying to lift a heavy box, as Rachel comes in from Chandler’s bedroom.]ScenesMonica: Hey, Rach, can you give me a hand with this box?ScenesRachel: No! Put that box down! We are not going anywhere! This is my apartment and I like it! This is a girl’s apartment! That is a boy’s apartment, it’s dirty and it smells. This is pretty. It’s-it’s so pretty! And look, and it’s-it’s purple! And I’m telling you, you with the steady hand, I am not moving, and now I have got the steady hand. (She holds out her hand, which is shaking uncontrollably.)ScenesMonica: I’ll take care of it.ScenesRachel: That’s right! You do what the hand says!Scenes[Cut to later, Phoebe is still in the chair and Rachel is laying down as Monica enters.]ScenesRachel: How did it go?ScenesMonica: I lost our mattresses.Scenes[Cut to still later, Rachel has now resigned herself to move and is now helping Monica. Phoebe is still on the chair.]ScenesPhoebe: (singing) "Are you in there little fetus? Scenes                             In nine will you come great us? Scenes                             I will buy you some Adidas.Scenes(There’s a knock on the door and Monica answers it.)ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesFrank and Alice: (entering) Hi!ScenesAlice: Hi, Phoebe! We were just at the drugstore and we got you a little present.ScenesPhoebe: Oh. Oh.ScenesFrank: Umm, it’s a lollipop and a uh, a home pregnancy test.ScenesMonica: Hey, don’t mix those up, you could really ruin that lollipop.ScenesAlice: So umm, you feel like taking a test? There’s only one question.ScenesPhoebe: All right, I will. No, I will. But umm, y’know just remember that it’s still really early, okay so, if it says that I’m not pregnant, that doesn’t mean that I’m not gonna get pregnant, okay and, and just please, just so I don’t go completely nuts, just try not put all your hopes on this.ScenesAlice: Okay.ScenesFrank: Okay. (They both squeal in expectation.)ScenesPhoebe: Great. (Goes to take the test.)Scenes(The door opens and Joey and Chandler ride in on the big, fake dog in triumph)ScenesRachel: Y’know what, you are mean boys, who are just being mean!ScenesJoey: Hey, don’t get mad at us! No one forced you to raise the stakes!ScenesRachel: That is not true. She did! She forced me!ScenesMonica: Hey, we would still be living here if hadn’t gotten the question wrong!ScenesRachel: Well it stupid, unfair question!ScenesRoss: Don’t blame the questions!ScenesChandler: Would you all stop yelling in our apartment! You are ruining moving day for us!ScenesRachel: Will you stop calling it your apartment!ScenesJoey: But it is our apartment!ScenesRachel: No it’s not!Scenes(They all decay into massive bickering as Phoebe returns from the bathroom.)ScenesPhoebe: You guys! You guys! You’re gonna have a baby! They’re gonna have a baby!ScenesFrank: MY SISTER’S GONNA HAVE MY BABY!!!!!!!Scenes(They all go over and hug Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, but this can’t be good for the baby.ScenesAll: Oh! (They stop hugging her to let her out and resume the hug without her.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, erm, Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are busy unpacking.]
rows.Content: Monica: I can’t find garbage bags!ScenesRachel: Oh, I think I saw some in here.Scenes(She opens a door and they both scream at horror at what’s inside of it.)ScenesMonica: What is it?!ScenesRachel: I don’t know! But maybe if we keep that drawer shut, it’ll die.ScenesMonica: I can’t believe we’re living here!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, they’re both unpacked. The big ceramic dog has found a new home in front of the window. Joey screams and runs into the living room.]
rows.Content: Chandler: What?! What-what is it?!ScenesJoey: Did you see the size of the closets?!ScenesChandler: I can’t believe we live here!Scenes(They both sit down on the chairs and put up the foot rest.)ScenesChandler and Joey: Awwwww!! (They lean back all the way.) Awwwwwww!!!ScenesEndScenesThe One With Rachel’s CrushScenesWritten by: Shana Goldberg-MeehanScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: A Theatre, Chandler and Ross are there to watch the premiere of Kathy’s play.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay, she is the star of the play. And she is my girlfriend! I get to have sex with the star of the play!ScenesRoss: People can hear you.ScenesChandler: I know!!Scenes(The play starts.)ScenesChandler: Wow! She looks great. Doesn’t she?ScenesRoss: Yeah.Scenes(Onstage there’s a knock on the door and Kathy opens it. We don’t see what’s going on, only hear it.)ScenesKathy's Co-Star: Hi!ScenesKathy: Hi!ScenesRoss: That is one good looking man!ScenesChandler: Is it just me, or can you actually see his abs through his overcoat?!ScenesKathy's Co-Star: Sooo, you’ve been doing this long?ScenesKathy: No, you’re my first. Put the money on the table.Scenes(Ross and Chandler have stunned looks on their faces as Kathy and her co-star start making out.)ScenesKathy's Co-Star: Oh, yeah! Ooh, that’s nice. (They start making out harder.)ScenesRoss: Dude!ScenesKathy's Co-Star: Is that an expensive blouse?ScenesKathy: If you want it to be.Scenes(Kathy’s co-star rips her blouse off and buttons go flying into the audience, and one hits Ross. Chandler’s mouth is on the floor.)ScenesRoss: Here’s your girlfriend’s button. (Holding the button.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, erm, Monica and Rachel's, Monica is still unpacking after the move, and Phoebe is their also.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh, hey, Mon, do you still have your like old blouses and dresses from high school?ScenesMonica: Yeah, I think I have some around here somewhere. Why?ScenesPhoebe: Well, it’s just that maternity clothes are so expensive.Scenes(Rachel enters)ScenesMonica: Hey, Rach! I made a pile of your stuff over on this side of the room. If you could just…(Rachel grunts and throws her purse at it)…throw your purses at it.ScenesRachel: Bloomingdale’s eliminated my department. (Phoebe gasps)ScenesMonica: Oh my God, are you out of a job?ScenesRachel: No, but they stuck me in personal shopping. Which is just a huge step down!ScenesPhoebe: Personal shopping? What is that? Like where you walk around with snooty rich people and tell them what to buy?ScenesRachel: Uh-huh.ScenesPhoebe: That sounds great!ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey! (Goes to the fridge.)ScenesMonica: Umm, excuse me, we switched apartments. You can’t eat are food anymore, that-that gravy train had ended.ScenesJoey: (Holding a turkey leg) There’s gravy?ScenesMonica: If you have the big apartment you have to deal with people coming over all the time. That fridge has got to be stocked, okay, that’s your department now. (She takes back the turkey leg)Scenes(Joey climbs up on the counter and starts looking at the top of the cabinets.)ScenesMonica: What are you doing?ScenesJoey: I think I left a donut up here.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross and Chandler are entering after the play. Phoebe and Joey are already there.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Ooh! How was Kathy’s play?ScenesRoss: Well, Kathy gets half-naked and simulates sex with a real good lookin’ guy.ScenesChandler: Yeah, it’s like someone literally wrote down my worst nightmare and then charged me $32 to see it!ScenesPhoebe: That’s a good idea for a business!ScenesChandler: I’m totally screwed. Okay, they are gonna be hot and heavy on stage every night, and then they’re gonna go to their cast parties and he’s gonna try to undermine me. Y'know it’ll be like, "So where’s your boyfriend, what’s-his-name, Chester?" And she’ll go, "No-no-no, it’s Chandler." And he’ll go, "Whatever. Ha-ha-ha-ha!ScenesJoey: (to Ross) That-that is a good trick.ScenesChandler: All right, look, look, what am I gonna do?ScenesJoey: Chandler, look they’re actors. They’re there to do a job, just ‘cause they work together, doesn’t mean they’re gonna get together. I mean just ‘cause it happened with Susan Sarandon and Tim Robbins, it doesn’t mean it’s gonna happen with them.ScenesRoss: Oh-oh, Alec Baldwin and Kim Basinger.ScenesJoey: Tom Cruise and Nicole Kidman.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Hey, Mel Gibson and Clint Eastwood.ScenesRoss: They’re not a couple!ScenesPhoebe: Oh-okay, I get the game now.ScenesJoey: Okay look, look, let me ask you a question, when they were doing it on stage, was it like really hot?ScenesRoss: Oh yeah!ScenesJoey: Well okay, so then you’re fine. The rule is when two actors are actually doing it off-stage all the sexual tension between them is gone. Okay? So as long as it’s hot onstage you got nothing to worry about. It’s when the heat goes away, that’s when you’re in trouble.ScenesChandler: Really?ScenesJoey: Look, you guys have been to every play I’ve ever been in, have I ever had chemistry on stage?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesJoey: Noooo!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, the gang minus Monica and Rachel are eating breakfast. Ross and Chandler are sitting at the foosball table and eating.]
rows.Content: Chandler: So uh, man, are you gonna go to the play with me tonight?ScenesRoss: Y’know what, I don’t know how comfortable I am going to see how hot the sex is between some guy and your girlfriend.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I know but…ScenesRoss: Oh no-no-no, I’m there.ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey Mon! Want some pancakes?ScenesMonica: You made pancakes?ScenesJoey: Yep! Grab a plate.ScenesMonica: Okay. (She does so and starts to walk towards Joey to receive her pancakes.)ScenesJoey: No-no, stay right there. (Monica stops and Joey flips her a pancake, which flies over her head and lands in the living room.) Gettin’ closer.ScenesChandler: Okay, okay, but don’t worry, because we also have cereals, muffins, waffles, and, jams, jellies, and marmalades. Which I’m fairly certain are the same thing.ScenesJoey: Listen also we’re uh, we’re watching the game here Saturday night, if people want to come over.ScenesRoss: Oh yeah!ScenesMonica: Oh, I was thinking about having people over for the game.ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, who’s playing?ScenesMonica: The players.ScenesRoss: Somebody seems to be missing being the hostess.ScenesMonica: (laughs) Please, it’s a relief is what it is, is what it is.ScenesJoey: All right Pheebs, stick out your plate!ScenesPhoebe: Oh. (Joey flips the pancake and Phoebe catches it and throws it on her plate.)

rows.Scenes: Bloomingdale’s, Rachel’s new job.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (on the phone) Monica, I’m quitting! I just helped an 81 year old woman put on a thong and she didn’t even buy it! (Pause) I’m telling you I’m quitting! That’s it! I’m talking to my boss right now! (Pause) Yes I am! (Pause) Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Yes I am! Okay bye, call me when you get this message. (Hangs up as her boss, Mr. Waltham, walks in.) Oh! Mr. Waltham, I ah really need to talk to you.ScenesMr. Waltham: In a moment, please, I’m in the middle of a task. And you have a customer.Scenes(It’s a really good-looking man, Joshua, that Rachel has an instant crush on. Well actually it’s Tate Donovan, so it’s not like she’s really testing her acting skills.)ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesJoshua: Hi, I’m Joshua.ScenesRachel: Hi, I’m Rachel Green. What can I do for you Joshua?ScenesJoshua: Well, I need a whole new wardrobe. My wife, well my ex-wife…ScenesRachel: Oh, I’m so sorry.Scenes(He walks over to look and some clothes and Rachel quickly turns around and adjusts her bra, trying to show off her assets.)ScenesJoshua: Anyway, she burned all of my clothes. I got away with two things. This suit and what turned out to be a skirt.ScenesRachel: Well, at least that’s a great suit.ScenesJoshua: Yeah, but it wasn’t much fun dropping it off at the dry cleaners in the skirt. (Rachel laughs) So I need everything down to underwear, so if you’re willing, I’m all yours.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesMr. Waltham: Rachel, you needed to speak to me?ScenesRachel: No-no, that wasn’t me! (To Joshua) Well, we should get started. Let me show you my underwear. (Joshua turns at that) The selection of underwear we carry.Scenes(He walks out and Rachel stares at his butt as he leaves. He makes a wrong turn.)ScenesRachel: Oh-oh, sorry, it’s this way, it’s this way. (Motions to the correct way.)ScenesJoshua: It’s this way? Sorry. (He walks past her and she again admires his butt.)

rows.Scenes: Kathy’s play, Ross and Chandler are waiting for her in the lobby after the play.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I’m right! Right? There was like no chemistry between them. Before they had heat, and now there’s no heat! Now you know what this means, Joey told us what this means!ScenesRoss: All right, let’s not jump to any conclusions. All right? There was some sexual chemistry between them.ScenesChandler: Come on, it was like cousins having sex up there!ScenesRoss: Here she comes. Don’t say a word, okay? Just be cool, don’t be…y'know you.ScenesKathy: Hey you guys!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesKathy: Hi! (Kisses Chandler) Thank you so much for coming again. Did you like it tonight?ScenesRoss: Oh, absolutely! (Chandler mumbles something.)ScenesKathy: Wasn’t Nick funny when he couldn’t get his match lit?Scenes(Chandler laughs without opening his mouth.)ScenesKathy: It’s a good play, isn’t it?Scenes(Chandler mumbles something, and Ross tells him to "Come on.")ScenesChandler: Oh, I loved the play. You were great, and Nick ditto. Clearly you’re having sex with him.ScenesRoss: Okay, I… (Walks away.)ScenesKathy: Clearly, I’m having sex with him?ScenesChandler: Oh come on, it was so obvious! There was no chemistry between you two!ScenesKathy: Okay, so let me just get this straight. You’re accusing me of cheating on you, and insulting my performance?ScenesChandler: Y’know, I-I could see how this could happen, y'know you’re up there every night, you’re naked, touching, kissing.ScenesKathy: Acting! Chandler, this is my job! I’m-I’m playing a part in a play! How can you not trust me?!ScenesChandler: Well, you can understand, given how we started.ScenesKathy: Oh, wow. I can’t believe you’re throwing that in my face.ScenesChandler: Well, that is what happened, and I don’t even see you denying this!ScenesKathy: I’ll tell you what, Chandler, why don’t you call me when you grow up!ScenesChandler: Yeah, well, don’t expect that to happen anytime soon!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Phoebe, and Ross are there eating pizza as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I have the best job in the entire world! The most adorable guy came over today, and I got to dress him up all day!ScenesPhoebe: Rachel has a new doll.ScenesRachel: Oh, I wish he was a doll, then I could get a Rachel doll and bump them together and make kissy noises. Oh! And he has the most beautiful name, I never realised it, Joshua! Josh-u-a! Joshua! Josh.ScenesRoss: Uh, hello!ScenesRachel: Hi-e!!ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, what do I smell?ScenesJoey: I don’t know, it smells good.Scenes(He goes over and opens the door to reveal Monica holding a plate of cookies and a fan to blow the smell across the hall.)ScenesMonica: Fresh cookies! Hot from the oven!ScenesPhoebe: Ooh! (They all go over to her apartment)ScenesMonica: Please, have some!ScenesRoss: Oh, yumm!ScenesMonica: Yeah, I’ve just been fiddling around in here making delicious treats for everyone.ScenesJoey: (Holding a magazine) Wow! The new Playboy!ScenesMonica: Yeah, it’s just something I picked up.ScenesRoss: Cookies and porn, you’re the best mom ever!!Scenes(Rachel laughs hysterically for no reason.)ScenesPhoebe: What? What?ScenesRachel: Well, it was just something Josh said about v-necks, but you had to be there.ScenesRoss: Yeah, how does Jason look in a v-neck?ScenesRachel: It’s Joshua.ScenesRoss: Oh, whatever. (Laughs and gives Joey the thumbs up heading back to his apartment. Joey follows him)ScenesMonica: Wait! Wait! This isn’t take-out!ScenesPhoebe: (getting up) Well, I hate to eat and run, but…ScenesMonica: No, wait, please don’t go! I’ve got porn for you too!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I don’t need it.ScenesMonica: People are supposed to wanna hang out here!ScenesRachel: Why? Honey, what is the big deal?ScenesMonica: I’m the hostess! Not those guys! I’m always the hostess! I mean, I was always the hostess, I mean even when I was little, I mean the girls brought their dollies to my tea party, I-I served the best air.ScenesPhoebe: Well, why did you make like a whole big thing out of y'know, everyone has to hang out in the big apartment?ScenesMonica: ‘Cause they took our apartment, I wanted to punish them. But I’m-I’m done now. They’ve suffered enough.ScenesPhoebe: If you wanted to punish them, you should’ve just made them hang out here!ScenesRachel: Yeah, that’s true.ScenesMonica: All right then, when I’m done with this place, it’s gonna be ten times better than that place!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, are we gonna trash that place?Scenes(Chandler comes back, obviously drunk, and trips over the steps.)ScenesChandler: Steps! (He opens the door to his apartment to Ross and Joey looking at the new Playboy) Slut! (Ross and Joey quickly hide the Playboy behind their backs. Chandler wonders into the girl’s apartment.) You will all be very happy to hear that Kathy is sleeping with that guy!ScenesAll: What?!ScenesRoss: So you were right?ScenesChandler: I confronted her, and she didn’t deny it! (Pause) I don’t live here! (Goes back into his apartment and they all follow him.)ScenesRoss: Chandler!ScenesRachel: Chandler, what did she say?ScenesPhoebe: Wait a minute.ScenesJoey: Come here.ScenesMonica: Are you sure?ScenesChandler: Well, I may be drunk, but I know what she said! Then I went over to Beefsteak Julie’s…ScenesRachel: Beefsteak Charlie’s?ScenesChandler: Yes! See you and I have always been like—(motions that they think the same.)

rows.Scenes: The hallway between the apartments, Monica is lugging one of those floor polishing machines through the hallway. Rachel comes up the steps and stops when she sees Monica.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Whoops. (Starts to go into Chandler and Joey’s.) Oh, hey, do you need help with that?ScenesMonica: Nah, I got it.ScenesRachel: Ooh, I just feel bad, I never vacuum. (She goes into Chandler and Joey’s.)Scenes[Cut to inside the apartment.]ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesRachel: So I was with Joshua for an hour today, and he has not asked me out. It’s just so frustrating!ScenesPhoebe: Why don’t you ask him out?ScenesJoey: Oh, yeah, totally! That’s such a turn-on!ScenesRachel: Really? It doesn’t seem desperate?ScenesJoey: Oh-ooh, that’s the turn-on.ScenesPhoebe: He just got a divorce right?ScenesRachel: Hmm-mmm.ScenesPhoebe: So he’s probably really nervous around women, y'know? Maybe, you just have to make the first move.ScenesRachel: Yeah but, I’ve never asked a guy out before.ScenesPhoebe: (shocked) You’ve never asked a guy out?!!ScenesRachel: No. Have you?ScenesPhoebe: Thousands of times!! That doesn’t make me sound too good does it?ScenesRachel: I don’t even know how I would go about it.ScenesJoey: Oh-oh-oh-oh, how I do it is, I look a woman up and down and say, "Hey, how you doin’?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, please!ScenesJoey: (to Phoebe) Hey, how you doin’?Scenes(Phoebe looks at him, and then giggles and looks away.)ScenesRachel: You know what, I’m gonna do that, I’m gonna call him up, and I’m gonna ask him out. I can do that. Ask him out. (Practising) How you doin’? (Calls him) Hi! Joshua? It’s Rachel Green from Bloomingdale’s. (Listens) Yeah, umm, I was wondering if you umm, if you umm, left your wallet at the store today? Well, we found a wallet, and we—(Listens) the license? Well, that is a good idea! Uh, well, let’s see here this says this license belongs to a uh, uh, belongs to a mister uh, Pheebs, and umm, yeah, so sorry to bother you at home. I’ll see you tomorrow. Bye. (Hangs up) (to Phoebe) You’ve done that a thousand times?ScenesPhoebe: I’ve never done that.ScenesRachel: Ohh, God, I just got so nervous that he would say no.ScenesJoey: Well, you gotta give him something that he can’t say no too. Like uh, Knicks tickets! Invite the guy to a Knicks game, you’re guaranteed he’ll say yes!ScenesRachel: Really?! You think that will work?ScenesJoey: Absolutely! And if it doesn’t, can I get the extra ticket?Scenes(We hear a noise coming from Monica and Rachel’s apartment.)ScenesJoey: What the heck is that?Scenes(They go open the door and reveal Monica being spun around on the floor polisher and getting the cord wrapped around her legs.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, Ross, Joey, and Phoebe are watching a movie as Chandler comes in from his bedroom.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Did she call?ScenesPhoebe: No, sorry.ScenesChandler: All right, maybe I should call her.ScenesJoey: No! Forget her, man! You don’t need her, you don’t need that!ScenesRoss: He’s right, what she did was unforgivable.ScenesChandler: Well, yeah, but y'know, what-what if I was wrong?ScenesRoss: How might you be wrong?ScenesChandler: Well y'know, what if she didn’t actually sleep with the guy?ScenesJoey: Dude, tell me she actually told you this.ScenesChandler: She did not have to tell me, I saw the play, and there was no heat. Back me up here, Ross!ScenesRoss: That’s all you’re basing this on?ScenesChandler: That’s not backing me up! Look, you said with the off-stage and the heat, and the onstage and the oy heat.ScenesJoey: Whoa-whoa, that-that was just a theory! There’s a lot of theories that didn’t pan out. The lone gunman. Communism. Geometry.ScenesChandler: Oh my God!!

rows.Scenes: Bloomingdale’s, Rachel’s new job, she is waiting for Joshua and practising how to ask him out.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Would you like to go to a basketball game with me? (Tries again.) You know, its funny, basketball, because I happen to have tickets too… (Tries again.) Umm, who likes the Knicks—(Joshua comes in from the dressing room.)ScenesJoshua: What do you think?ScenesRachel: Oh! Well, as a single woman, who is available, I think you look great!ScenesJoshua: Huh. (She starts brushing the lint off and checking him out in the mirror.) Yeah?ScenesRachel: Yep. Oh, yeah, look you great. (She puts her arm in his and checks how they would look as a couple.) Oh yeah. Yeah, this looks great. (Pause) Umm, so you like it?ScenesJoshua: I do. I do. I love it. In fact, I think I’m gonna wear it home.ScenesRachel: Great.ScenesJoshua: All right, thank you so much for all your help.ScenesRachel: Sure.ScenesJoshua: Well, I guess this is uh, I guess this is it.ScenesRachel: Yeah-eah-ha!ScenesJoshua: Thanks. (He starts to leave) Maybe I’ll see in the spring, with the uh, y’know, for the uh, bathing suits.ScenesRachel: Oh well, you don’t want to do that now?!ScenesJoshua: Ah, that’s okay, thanks.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesJoshua: Anyway, hopefully, I’ll see you around sometime. (He goes out the door.)ScenesRachel: Basketball!ScenesJoshua: (coming back in) I’m sorry.ScenesRachel: I uh, I have two tickets to the Knicks game tonight if you’re interested, just as a thank you for this week.ScenesJoshua: Wow! That would be great.ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesJoshua: Yeah, that would be fantastic! My-my nephew is crazy about the Knicks! This is fantastic, thank you so much Rachel. (He takes the tickets and leaves as Mr. Waltham returns.)ScenesMr. Waltham: Good morning.ScenesJoshua: Hi!Scenes(Mr. Waltham admires Joshua’s butt as he leaves.)

rows.Scenes: Kathy’s apartment, Chandler is knocking on the door.]
rows.Content: Kathy: (opening the door) Hey.ScenesChandler: Hey. I just, I just wanted to come over to-to say that I’m sorry. Y’know? I know I acted like the biggest idiot in the world, and I can completely understand why you were so upset.ScenesKathy: Oh wow. I really wish you’d call me.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I know, I-I wish I had too, but y’know I-I think this is a good thing. Y'know? ‘Cause we’ve had our first fight, and now we can move on. Y’know, I know for me—(Notices a pair of men’s pants on the chair.) Nick’s pants?ScenesKathy: Yeah.ScenesChandler: Yeah. Well, I think our second fight is going to be a big one!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey is debriefing Rachel on her rejection earlier that day and telling her what she should’ve done. Ross and Phoebe are watching.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay, for next time, what do you say?ScenesRachel: I have an extra ticket. An extra ticket. Not, two tickets, I have an extra ticket.ScenesRoss: So the first time you ask a guy out, he-he turns you down?ScenesRachel: He didn’t turn me down! He’s at the game isn’t he? I got the date, I’m just not on it!ScenesMonica: (entering) Okay, it’s ready. Come on.ScenesJoey: What’s ready?ScenesMonica: Just come.Scenes(They all go over to her apartment.)ScenesRoss: Oh my God!ScenesRachel: Wow! Monica!ScenesPhoebe: Great!ScenesRoss: This is beautiful!Scenes(She has cleaned it, completely redecorated it, removed the carpet, and polished the floor.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh did you—what did you—did you work for two days straight?ScenesMonica: Pretty much. (to Joey) So, what do you, what do you think of the floor?ScenesJoey: I don’t know, it looks the same.ScenesMonica: You used to have carpet.ScenesJoey: Oh yeah!ScenesMonica: So I made snacks. Please, just hang out okay? I’m just gonna rest my eyes just a little bit.ScenesRoss: Look, Mon, do you want us to uh, come back later?ScenesMonica: Oh no-no-no, stay, stay, stay, just keep talking. I’m always the hostess.Scenes(Chandler returns.)ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesJoey: How’d it go?ScenesChandler: Well, she wasn’t sleeping with him.ScenesPhoebe: Oh good!ScenesChandler: She is now.ScenesRoss: What are you saying?ScenesChandler: I’m saying that she… is a devil woman! Y’know I mean you think you know someone and then they turn around and they sleep with Nick! Nick, with his rock hard pecs, and his giant man-nipples! I hate him, I hate her! Well, I don’t hate her, I love her. This is all my fault really.ScenesPhoebe: How? How is your fault?ScenesChandler: Because, I-I should’ve called! Y’know if I had just called her after our big, stupid fight, she never would’ve gone out with Nick, and they would’ve ended up in bed together. I threw her at his man nipples!ScenesRachel: Honey, this is not your fault, just because you guys had a fight, it does not justify her sleeping with someone.ScenesRoss: Well, if-if she thought they were on a break…Scenes(They all turn and glare at him.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Bloomingdale’s, Rachel is sitting at her desk as Mr. Waltham comes in.]
rows.Content: Mr. Waltham: Rachel, one of your customers seems to have left his billfold. A Joshua Bergen.ScenesRachel: Really?ScenesMr. Waltham: Will you call him?ScenesRachel: Yes! I will! Absolutely! (She takes out his license and her license and holds them face to face with each other. She then proceeds to act like Dark Helmut in Spaceballs, and mimic a conversation between the two of them.) Hello, Rachel. Hi, Joshua. I left my wallet here on purpose. Really? Yes, I just wanted to see you again. Oh, I’m glad. Rachel, I’d like to say something to you. Yes? How you doin’?ScenesEndScenesThe One With Joey’s Dirty DayScenesWritten by: Wil CalhounScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey is getting ready for a fishing trip and Phoebe is asking him about the fishing lures. Ross is playing with the rod, and Monica is pretty much just watching the on goings.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (holding a lure) So now, what is this now?ScenesJoey: Guggly worm.ScenesPhoebe: (laughs and picks up another lure) And this?ScenesJoey: Glow-pop giggly jammer.ScenesPhoebe: (laughs harder) You make it so funny.ScenesMonica: (not wanting to be left out, picks up something) Hey umm, what’s this?ScenesJoey: (examining it) Ohh, a hunk of sandwich from last year. (Monica drops the sandwich)ScenesRoss: (pretend fishing in the living room) Ohh, Geller’s got one hooked! Ohh! Looks like a big one! Yeah, ohh! Ohh! (Swinging the rod back and forth) It’s the classic struggle between man and—(swings the rod and knocks over a lamp.) Someone knocked over a lamp.ScenesJoey: (going over and picking up the rod) That’s all right. Hey you guys, you know what’s going to be great about the fishing trip this year? When my dad gets me out in the middle of the lake and gives me that, "Joey, what are you doing with your life?" stuff. I can say, "Well, I’m doing a movie with Charlton Heston dad. What are you doing with your life?ScenesAll: Great!Scenes(Chandler enters from his bedroom, all depressed and wearing sweat pants, with the chick and duck in tow.)ScenesChandler: You don’t have to stop having fun just because I’m here. Kathy didn’t cheat on all of you. (To Joey) Well, except you. (They hug and Chandler goes into the bathroom with the chick and duck following him.)ScenesMonica: Hey, Joey, I don’t think that you should leave Chandler alone. I mean it’s only been two days since he broke up with Kathy. Maybe you can go fishing next week?ScenesJoey: Look, there’s nothing I can do for him right now, he’s still in his sweat pants, that’s still Phase One. Y'know? I’ll be back for Phase Two, I would never miss Phase Two.ScenesMonica: What’s Phase Two?ScenesJoey: Gettin’ drunk and going to a strip club.ScenesRachel: How does going to a strip club help him better?ScenesRoss: Because there are naked ladies there.ScenesJoey: Which helps him get to Phase Three, picturing yourself with other women.ScenesRoss: There are naked ladies there too.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesChandler: (opening the bathroom door and kicking out the chick and duck) Would you give me one minute!! Please.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Bloomingdale’s, Rachel is still dressing Joshua. He is trying on a pair of pants.]
rows.Content: Joshua: So, these will match the jacket you picked out for me last week?ScenesRachel: Um-hmm. (Joshua turns to look in the mirror and leaves Rachel staring at his ass.) There we go. There it is.ScenesJoshua: (turning around) Oh! You know what I need?ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesJoshua: Gloves. Brown, leather dress gloves.ScenesRachel: Oh, okay. Uhh, well let’s see. (Grabs his hand.) You’re about—well uh, this one is large. And this one—(Grabs the other hand.)ScenesJoshua: Also large?ScenesRachel: Yeah! Okay, two larges coming right up!ScenesJoshua: Okay.ScenesMr. Waltham: (entering) Rachel! Could I have a moment?ScenesRachel: Yes.ScenesMr. Waltham: I-I was wondering, my niece you see is in from London—well Shropshire really but y’know—well she’s about your age I say. Anyway I have tickets for the opera, Die Fledermaus, and I was wondering if you’d like to keep her company this evening?ScenesRachel: Sure. You got it. Great!ScenesMr. Waltham: Oh, good.ScenesRachel: Me, Fledermaus, great. I really—(motions to Joshua.)ScenesMr. Waltham: Ohh! Yes of course, thank you, thank you, thank you so very much.ScenesJoshua: So…(Holds out his hands as to say, "Where are my gloves?")ScenesRachel: So? (She puts her hands in his, totally forgetting about the gloves, and hoping for something more intimate.)ScenesJoshua: Gloves?ScenesRachel: Ohh! Right! Right, sorry, I’ll be right back!ScenesJoshua: Uhh, actually y’know what, I kinda—I have to take off.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesJoshua: But, I was curious; do you have any plans for tonight?ScenesRachel: No! Nothing!ScenesJoshua: I invested in this night-club and it’s opening tonight, would you like to come?ScenesRachel: Yeah! That would be great!ScenesJoshua: You’re into hardcore S&M right?ScenesRachel: (shocked) Well, I-I guess—I…ScenesJoshua: Kidding! (Rachel is relived) I’m gonna get there early, but I’m going to put you on the V.I.P list, okay? Look for me.ScenesRachel: Yeah, great, you betcha!ScenesMr. Waltham: (entering) I almost forget the tickets, didn’t I?ScenesRachel: What?ScenesMr. Waltham: For you and Emily, tonight, Die Fledermaus.ScenesRachel: Oh. Oh, right.ScenesMr. Waltham: I think you’ll like it, it has two out of the three tenors.ScenesRachel: Oh yay!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is in his sweats flinging playing cards into a pot.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Y’know, I can’t believe Kathy did this too me. I really, thought that she was the one. I tell you what, from now on I’m never getting out of this chair, ever! Okay? From now on, this chair is the one! You wanna what else is the one? My sweat pants!ScenesRoss: Come on, man! Just-just take the sweats off. Okay? Just take ‘em off and we’ll have some fun.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey-hey!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesRoss: Catch any big fish? (Phoebe, Ross, and Monica all go over to him.)ScenesJoey: Oh my God, you guys have no idea.ScenesAll: (they all recoil from the smell emanating from him) Oh! God! Wow!ScenesMonica: You stink!ScenesRoss: Are you kidding?!ScenesJoey: Yeah, three days on the lake without a shower. Plus! I fell in that big tub of worms at the bait stand! Hey, how-how’s he doing?ScenesRoss: He hasn’t gotten out of that chair in two days.ScenesJoey: (goes over to Chandler) Hey buddy! How’s it going?Scenes(Chandler imitates retching and gets out of the chair.)ScenesJoey: (To the rest of the gang) Hey, see that? He just needed his pal to come home. All right, uh, I’ve got to go memorise my lines. (Starts to go his bedroom) Me and Charlton Heston bright and early tomorrow morning! Yeah-yeah!ScenesRachel: (entering) Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey, Monica!ScenesMonica: Uh-oh, what’s the matter?ScenesRachel: Ohh, it’s Joshua invited me to this fancy club opening tonight. But, I already told Mr. Waltham that I would take his niece to this dumb old opera. So… What are you gonna do?ScenesMonica: I don’t know sweetie.ScenesRachel: No! Help me!ScenesMonica: I can’t! I have to work!ScenesRachel: Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: I would, but I get my morning sickness in the evening.ScenesRachel: Ugh!ScenesPhoebe: Unless! She wants to spend the night holding my hair back for me.ScenesRachel: Ohh, gosh. You guys, come on, this is—I have to meet Joshua! This is my one chance for him to see the fun Rachel. Y’know the "Wouldn’t it be great if she was my wife" Rachel. Ohh, all right! Are Joey and Chandler back?ScenesMonica: No, Chandler’s still in Phase One, and Joey’s that thing you smell.ScenesRachel: Ohh! (Realises that Ross is in the room.) Hi!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesRachel: So….ScenesRoss: No.ScenesRachel: Ohhhh, come on!!!Scenes(There’s a knock on the door.)ScenesMonica: I think she’s here.ScenesRachel: No! Wait! Wait-wait! Ross, please!ScenesRoss: You want me to take some girl I’ve never met to the opera so you can go to a club and flirt with some guy, hmm, that-that is a toughie.ScenesMonica: (looking out the peephole) Ohh, she’s looking down the hall. Oh! She looked right at me! Oh wait, you can’t see people through that little hole, can you? (Goes back to the door.) Hello!ScenesWoman: Hello! (Monica screams)ScenesRachel: I’ll be right there! (to Ross) Okay, Ross, please come on! I thought we have moved on! I thought we’ve gotten to a place where we could be happy for each other! I mean was that just me?ScenesRoss: All right, I’ll do it.ScenesRachel: Oh thank you! Thank you, thank you, thank you! (Monica opens the door.) Emily?ScenesEmily: Yes.ScenesRachel: I’m Rachel Green.ScenesEmily: Thank goodness.ScenesRachel: There’s been a teeny-teeny change in plans. It turns out that I’m not free tonight. So…ScenesEmily: Really?! Well, that’s just lovely, isn’t it? I must’ve missed your call, even though I didn’t leave the flat all day.ScenesRachel: Oh well, no I…ScenesEmily: Oh, no-no-no, that’s not rude! It’s perfectly in keeping with a trip that I’ve already been run down by one of your wiener carts, and been strip-searched at John F. Kennedy Airport, apparently to you people, I look like someone who’s got a balloon full of cocaine stuffed up their bum.ScenesMonica: I-I-I think you look great.ScenesEmily: Good night, it was very nice to meet you all. (Storms out.)Scenes(Pause)ScenesRachel: I’ll get her.ScenesRoss: Please hurry.ScenesPhoebe: Don’t you just love the way they talk?!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, erm, Chandler and Joey's, the next morning, Monica and Phoebe are eating breakfast.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Ohh!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: It kicked! I think the baby kicked!ScenesMonica: Oh my God!ScenesPhoebe: Oh no wait, oh no, the elastic on my underwear busted.ScenesJoey: (running from his bedroom) Oh my God! I overslept! I was supposed to be on the set a half an hour ago! I gotta get out of here!ScenesMonica: Oh wait, Joey, you can’t go like that! You stink!ScenesJoey: Look, I know I feel asleep before I could shower and now I don’t have time! They’re just ten blocks away, if I run, I can make it.ScenesMonica: Yeah. Run ten blocks, that’ll help the smell.Scenes(He opens the door to reveal Rachel.)ScenesRachel: Hey—whoa, slow down. (Gets a whiff of him) No, keep moving. (Joey runs off.) Wow!ScenesMonica: So? How did it go with Joshua last night?ScenesRachel: Well, I didn’t see Joshua last night, but I did punch a girl in the face.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: Why?ScenesRachel: The whole night was horrible, it was pouring down rain, and when I got there, there was no Rachel Green on the list, but there was a Rachel Greep.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh! So, did you get to meet her?ScenesRachel: No, there is no Rachel Greep, but then this other girl overheard us and she was all, "I’m Rachel Greep! I’m Rachel Greep!" and he let her right in.ScenesMonica: So you hit her in the face?ScenesRachel: No, she was already in, but then this big bitch behind me tried to steal my umbrella, so I clocked her. Ohhh! I can’t believe this, all I wanted was a few hours outside of work to see Joshua, so he can go ahead and start falling in love with me.ScenesPhoebe: (going over to comfort her) Aww, Pheebs.ScenesRachel: Honey, that’s you’re name.ScenesPhoebe: That’s short for Phoebe?! I thought that was just what we called each other!Scenes(Chandler enters from his bedroom.)ScenesMonica: Hey! You’re wearing pants!ScenesChandler: That’s right! Where are the guys? I’m ready to get drunk and see some strippers.ScenesMonica: It’s 9:30 in the morning!ScenesChandler: They got a breakfast buffet.Scenes(The phone rings and Monica answers it.)ScenesMonica: Hello. (Listens) Oh, hey Ross!ScenesChandler: Ooh, let me talk to him!ScenesMonica: Oh-oh, my God!ScenesChandler: Well, can I just…ScenesMonica: (to Chandler) Shh!! (On phone) Wait, what?ScenesChandler: She’s shhing me! It’s my phone and she’s shhing me!ScenesPhoebe: Shhh!! Please! What’s he saying?ScenesMonica: He’s with Emily at a Bed and Breakfast in Vermont!ScenesPhoebe: What? Oh my God!ScenesRachel: What? Who the hell is Emily—(realises) noooo!!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, erm, Monica and Rachel's, scene continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Rachel: They’re in Vermont!! How could this happen?! (She waves her arms franticly and hits Chandler.)ScenesChandler: Ow!ScenesRachel: How—how did end up in Vermont with that awful witch?! (She hits Chandler again.)ScenesChandler: Maybe, she doesn’t hit him all the time.Scenes[cut to Ross in Vermont, talking on the phone.]ScenesRoss: When we first met her, she was soaking, her feet were wet! Who wouldn’t be miserable? I’m telling you when I got her into a dry pair of shoes, she was a totally different person.ScenesEmily: (rushing in) Ross! Come quickly! There’s a deer just outside eating fruit from the orchard!ScenesRoss: I’ve gotta go, there’s a deer just outside eating fruit from the orchard! (He hangs up and runs out.)Scenes[cut back to Chandler and Joey’s.]ScenesMonica: He had to go, there’s a deer just outside eating fruit from the orchard.ScenesRachel: I don’t get this! She was horrible! (She hits Chandler, yet again.)ScenesChandler: Okay, I’m going to go stand over there. (Points and moves into the living room.)ScenesMonica: Why do you care so much anyway?ScenesRachel: I don’t care! All right, y’know what I’m just upset that I’m getting nowhere with Joshua that—y’know what still, you do not meet someone and go flitting off to Vermont!ScenesMonica: Well, when you first met Barry, you flitted off to Vail.ScenesRachel: Oh, y’know, would you just for once, not remember every…little…thing!! (Storms out.)ScenesChandler: So y’know, uh, when’s he getting back?ScenesMonica: A couple of days.ScenesChandler: Y’know, I knew something like this was going to happen. (He starts to take off his pants, revealing that he is still wearing his sweat pants.)ScenesMonica: What are you doing?! Chandler! You can’t just go back a phase!ScenesChandler: Yes you can. You’re thinking about time, you can’t go back in time.ScenesPhoebe: Well, look, why don’t you just, why don’t you do your Phase Two strip club thing with us.ScenesMonica: Yeah, come on, we can be guys!ScenesChandler: (laughs) No you can’t.ScenesPhoebe: Come on! Let us be guys! Maybe we want to be guys!ScenesChandler: You don’t want to be guys, you’d be all hairy and wouldn’t live as long. (Starts to go to his bedroom)ScenesPhoebe: Y’know you, you just stop being such a wuss and get those off and you come with us and watch naked girls dance around!!ScenesChandler: Okay. (Starts to cry)ScenesPhoebe: I’m sorry. (Goes and hugs him)

rows.Scenes: Silvercup Studios, Joey is just arriving for his scene.]
rows.Content: Joey: (rushing in) Hey! Joey Tribbiani! I’m here! I’m here!ScenesThe A.D: Calm down, we got time, we’re running a little late.Scenes(Just then, Charlton Heston walks out of his dressing room and starts eating a liquorice whip.)ScenesJoey: Look at that, Charlton Heston eating a liquorice whip!ScenesThe A.D: Yeah, we loves ‘em. I’ve never seen him with—(He gets a whiff of Joey and starts smelling around.)ScenesJoey: (trying to act like he’s not the one that stinks.) Whoa! Yeah, what the hell is that? What smells so bad?ScenesThe A.D: You.ScenesJoey: Y’know, I can see why you think that, but ah, actually, you know who I think it is?ScenesThe A.D: You?ScenesJoey: No-no, it’s uh, it’s Heston.ScenesThe A.D: What?ScenesJoey: Yeah, the man wreaks! Smells like he went on a three day fishing trip and then ate some liquorice.ScenesThe A.D: There’s no way he smells, he’s the only one around here with a shower in his dressing room.ScenesJoey: Really, a shower huh? And uh, which-which room might that be?ScenesThe A.D: The one with "Heston" on it.ScenesJoey: Interesting.

rows.Scenes: A strip club, the girls are there with Chandler, who isn’t enjoying himself.]
rows.Content: Monica: (coming back to the stage and sitting next to Chandler) Okay, I’ve got some Ones, you wanna put them in her panties?ScenesChandler: No thanks, Mom!Scenes(A man sits down next to Phoebe and lights up a cigarette.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, no umm, hi, that-that, you have to put that out, ‘cause I’m pregnant.ScenesThe Cigarette Smoking Guy: (No, not the Cigarette Smoking Man from The X-Files.) Well, maybe you and your baby should go to another strip club.ScenesPhoebe: Ha-ha, it’s not my baby, ha-ha-ha! (He leaves.)Scenes(The dancer finishes and everyone claps.)ScenesMonica: Very good, (getting up and sliding a One into the dancer’s hot pants) so good.ScenesPhoebe: (doing the same) I really, really enjoyed it. Very exotic.ScenesRachel: (joining them) Well, I just checked our messages and Joshua didn’t call. I mean you’d think he’d be worried about me not showing up at his club. Ugh, you know what makes it so much worse, Ross is all happy in Vermont!ScenesPhoebe: Come on! Look where you are!!ScenesMonica: (to the waitress) When you get a sec, another round of daiquiris.ScenesPhoebe: Remember, a virgin for me please.ScenesMonica: Oh! And don’t let me leave without getting the name of that carpet guy.ScenesChandler: Ahh, come on! Y’know what—y’know what, I think I’m just gonna go home and call Kathy.ScenesPhoebe: Well, if you think it will help.ScenesChandler: No! That was a test! In a couple of hours I’m gonna get really drunk and wanna call Kathy and you guys are gonna have to stop me! And then after that, I’m gonna get so drunk, I’m gonna wanna call JaniceScenesPhoebe: You should! How is she?ScenesChandler: Ohhh!!ScenesMonica: I think somebody needs another lap dance. (Motions for one.)

rows.Scenes: Silvercup studios, Joey is taking a shower in Charlton Heston’s dressing room. Heston enters the room, Joey panics, and walks over to the shower and confronts Joey about the use of his shower.]
