rows.Content: Charlton Heston: Hello! Who’s in there? (He opens to curtain to reveal a naked and wet Joey.)ScenesJoey: How ya doin’?ScenesCharlton Heston: Who in the hell are you?ScenesJoey: I guess you wouldn’t believe me if I said I was Kurt Douglas, huh?ScenesCharlton Heston: Put some pants on kid so I can kick your butt.ScenesJoey: No-no-no, no, no, wait. You see, I’m an actor, Joey Tribbiani, I’m doing a scene with you today, and well, I stink.ScenesCharlton Heston: (shocked) You’re in this picture?ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah, I’m one of the cops that won’t work with you ‘cause you a lose cannon. Anyway, look, I’m really sorry, but I stink!ScenesCharlton Heston: Joey, right?ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesCharlton Heston: (tosses him a towel, motions for him to get out of the shower and sits down on the couch) Every actor at one time or another—opp! (Joey tries to sit down next to him and Heston makes him sit somewhere else.) Every actor thinks he stinks, even Lawrence Oliver at sometimes thought he stank, Bob Redford won’t even watch himself.ScenesJoey: Oh no-no-no, you don’t understand…ScenesCharlton Heston: Listen to me!ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, yeah.ScenesCharlton Heston: I don’t know one actor worth his salt that didn’t say at one time or another, "God, I stink!" Hell, I just did a scene out there, first take, I stunk the place up. But, the important thing you must remember, no matter how badly you think you might stink, you must never, ever bust into my dressing room and use my shower! Do you understand me?!ScenesJoey: Yes sir! Yes sir, I’m-I’m—(he starts to leave)ScenesCharlton Heston: Wait a minute! Take your pants.ScenesJoey: Yeah. Oh, yeah.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, erm, Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are returning from the strip club.]
rows.Content: Monica: So, we did okay at the strip club, right?ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, that was great. Thanks to you, the hottest cocktail waitress there is quitting to teach the third grade!ScenesRachel: (entering) I can’t believe it! He still hasn’t called.ScenesPhoebe: Who, Josh?ScenesRachel: It’s Joshua.ScenesMonica: What, he doesn’t like Josh?ScenesRachel: No, I don’t.ScenesChandler: All right, well I’m gonna put my sweats back on.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no! Wait! Wait! Okay, y’know what, you were right, you were right. We really weren’t great at being guys, but you know why? Because we’re girls.ScenesChandler: Yeah?ScenesPhoebe: And do you know what girls are really good at?ScenesChandler: Stripping!ScenesPhoebe: No, listening! Sit! Y’know, maybe it would just really, really help if you would just talk.ScenesRachel: Yeah, come on! What’s going in on in there? (Pats his chest.)ScenesMonica: Yeah. And y’know, if you wanna cry, that’s okay too.ScenesChandler: Okay, look, I’m gonna have to ask you all to leave.ScenesMonica: Come on! Chandler!ScenesChandler: Look, forget it. We tried, but Phase Three is a lost cause, Okay? Those strippers were insanely hot, and I couldn’t picture myself with any of them. (Sits back in disgust.)ScenesMonica: They really were pretty, weren’t they? (Rachel and Phoebe both agree)ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I really liked that fighter pilot one.ScenesMonica: Oh, Candy! She was so spunky!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesMonica: Y’know, I think if I were going to be with a woman. (Chandler is intrigued.) It’d, it’d be with someone like Michelle, she was so oh, she was so petite.ScenesRachel: See, I don’t know, for me it would have to Chantal.ScenesMonica: Oh, Chantal!ScenesRachel: Oh my goodness, she had the smoothest skin! I mean when I stuck that dollar bill in her g-string and grazed her thigh…ScenesChandler: (jumping up) Phase Three! I just achieved Phase Three!ScenesMonica: Really?!ScenesChandler: I am totally picturing you with all those women!ScenesMonica: That’s-that’s not Phase Three.ScenesChandler: Well, I’m there too!ScenesRachel: Well, are we all together? Like in a group?ScenesChandler: Stop it! You’re killing me! I think I just moved on to Phase Four!ScenesPhoebe: Oh! What is that? What is that?ScenesChandler: Where I don’t want to have a relationship ever! I just want to have sex with strippers and my friends!!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the gang is there, minus Ross. Chandler is trying to cheer Joey up about missing Phase Two.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Come on, let me see that smile.ScenesJoey: I don’t wanna.ScenesChandler: Please?ScenesJoey: I wanted to go to the strip club!ScenesChandler: I know, I know, but you’re gonna have plenty of chances. There are literally thousands of women out there just waiting to screw me over.ScenesJoey: Yeah, all right. (Ross enters.)ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey—ooh so, how was Vermont?ScenesRoss: Emily is…incredible. I mean there-there are no words to describe it, I mean the whole weekend was like a dream. (Sees Rachel coming back from the bathroom.) Oh! And you! Rach!ScenesRachel: Oh, hey!ScenesRoss: Hey! You were so right!ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: Uh, what you said, about us being in a place where we could finally be happy for each other.ScenesRachel: Oh, hmm.ScenesRoss: I mean, I, I-I admit I-I wasn’t quite there. Y’know, I mean the thought of you and that-that Josh guy…ScenesRachel: Joshua.ScenesRoss: Joshua…guy at that club, dancing and having a good time, the thought of it kinda…y’know.ScenesRachel: Yeah, I…ScenesRoss: But now! I’m there! I’m totally there! I’m-I’m finally where you are!ScenesRachel: Oh, thank goodness!ScenesRoss: Yeah, and-and thank you for Emily.ScenesRachel: Oh, no problem. I’m so glad I could help. Happy for you. (She playfully punches him.)ScenesRoss: Happy for you. (He punches her back.)ScenesRachel: No, happy for you! (Hits him harder.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, erm, Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is there and is getting ready to direct a bunch of strippers, Monica, Rachel, and Phoebe on what to do in the upcoming orgy of lesbian lust. Yes, it’s a dream sequence, this isn’t cable.]
rows.Content: Chandler: All right ladies, here’s what we’re gonna do. (Points to a stripper.) You are gonna take off my clothes. (To another two strippers) You two, go get the oils. (To another stripper) And you just constantly scream at the top of your voice, "Chandler’s the king! Chandler’s the king!ScenesPhoebe: I-I wanna be with her, (points to the stripper next to her) I like her.ScenesChandler: Oh, that’s fine! Go with your instincts, go with your instincts.ScenesMonica: Wait, now, what am I doing again?ScenesChandler: Come on! Would you please pay attention, I could wake up at any moment!ScenesThe Cigarette Guy: Hi, I’m Joshua, I’m here to pick up Rachel.ScenesRachel: No-no-no, that’ not Joshua.ScenesChandler: What do you want from me, I’ve never met the guy. So anyway, Rachel, I’m sorry you can’t stay, (Rachel is upset about leaving the orgy with the cigarette guy.) but the rest of us have a lot of work to do. (The cigarette guy starts rubbing Chandler’s back.) What are you doing? (The guy just nods) All right, listen, I’ve got to wake up!ScenesEndScenesThe One With All The RugbyScenesTeleplay by: Wil CalhounScenesStory by: Andrew Reich and Ted CohenScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: A beauty parlour, Rachel is getting a manicure while Chandler, yes Chandler, is getting a petticure (Does that scare you that I know those terms?  Well, it scares me.).]
rows.Content: Chandler: Y'know, I can't believe I'm getting my nails done!  And you said it was gonna be fun! (pause) Which it kinda is.  Also, you said there would be other guys here. There are no other guys here!ScenesRachel: Chandler, there’s a guy right over there. (Points to the counter)ScenesChandler: That’s a mailman! That’s our mailman! (Waves to the mailman) (Sarcastic) Hi. How are ya?ScenesRachel: Chandler, don’t worry! This doesn’t make you any less of a guy! (Chandler starts blowing on his fingernails like women do.) That does! (Chandler stops blowing.) What am I sitting on? (She looks and finds a huge nail.) I hate to think what this woman was scratching when this broke off.ScenesChandler: Hey, you know who used to have nails like that?ScenesRachel: Hmm.ScenesWoman: OH…MY…GAWD!! (Yep, you guessed it. It’s Janice.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Joey are standing at the counter. Monica is flipping a light switch on and off next to the door.]
rows.Content: Monica: Joey let me ask you a question. What does this light switch do?ScenesJoey: Ohh, Nothing.ScenesMonica: Didn’t it drive you crazy to have a switch and not know what it did?ScenesJoey: I know what it did! Nothing.ScenesMonica: They wouldn’t have put it there if it didn’t do something! How can you not care?ScenesJoey: Like this. (Shrugs)ScenesRachel: Well, here’s another question for ya. Uhh, do you know what that silver knob on the toilet does?ScenesJoey: Sure! It flushes it.ScenesRachel: Okay, good. Now that since you know, when you come over would you mind actually using it?ScenesChandler: (entering, with Janice in tow) Hello!ScenesJoey: Hey! (Sees Janice.) Ah!! (Janice screams in surprise.)ScenesRachel: Guess who we ran into today?!ScenesMonica: Janice?!ScenesChandler: Isn’t this amazing?ScenesMonica: How have you been?ScenesJanice: Oh well, I’m divorced.ScenesPhoebe: Ohhh, wow.ScenesJanice: Yeah, I’m riding the alimony pony. (Does the now famous laugh.)ScenesJoey: And there it is.ScenesJanice: I just came up to say, "Hi!" Hi! (to Chandler) And you, sweetie, I’ll see you tonight.ScenesChandler: Okay. Bye.ScenesJanice: Bye.ScenesChandler: Bye.ScenesJanice: Bye.ScenesChandler: Bye.ScenesJanice: Bye.ScenesChandler: B-bye!ScenesJanice: Bye-bye.ScenesChandler: Bye. (Finally closes the door on her.) (After it’s closed) I can’t stand the woman! (Phoebe is shocked, Joey is relieved.)ScenesPhoebe: What?! I thought you were crazy about her!ScenesChandler: Yeah, I know, but all of those little annoying things she did before we fell in love? Like her voice, her laugh, her personality—Well, they’re all back! Y’know? And she’s picked up like nine new ones!ScenesJoey: So what are you doing bringing her here?! There’s people here!ScenesChandler: Don’t worry about it. I’m taking care of it tonight. (Chandler opens the fridge and grabs something to drink.)ScenesRachel: You are not. You have never been able to break up with her.ScenesChandler: (standing in the door of the fridge) Well, I don’t have to break up with her this time. We’re not involved! I’m going to do a pre-emptive strike! I’m going to end it with her before it starts. My ass is like frozen! (Closes the fridge.)ScenesJoey: Yeah, try sticking it in the freezer for 20 minutes. (They all look around and then back at Joey.) I’m tellin’ ya!

rows.Scenes: A street, Ross and Emily are walking home from a date.]
rows.Content: Emily: I can’t believe you really walk alone here! I mean, you hear such stories about New York.ScenesRoss: No, it’s really not that bad. I mean, I-I for one, feel perfectly safe.Scenes(At that moment two very large men start screaming and running towards Emily and picking her up.)ScenesRoss: Help! Help!! Help! Help!!ScenesEmily: No, no, no Ross! Ross, these are friends of mine from home. (Introducing them) Liam, Devon, this is Ross.ScenesDevon: Hey, mate.ScenesLiam: How are ya man?ScenesRoss: Oh hey, that was a good one, huh? (Imitating himself) Help! Help!ScenesEmily: So how are you? I’ve been meaning to ring you ever since I arrived but umm, well, I’ve been rather busy.ScenesDevon: Do you realise that we have not seen each other since the night of that U2 concert?ScenesEmily: Oh my God. I think you’re right.ScenesLiam: (puts his arm around her) Well, actually the last time you and I saw each other was that morning.ScenesEmily: Oh, Liam. (Ross laughs and takes her back.)ScenesRoss: Oh, Liam. So uh, what, were you guys playing soccer or something—or should I call it (In an English accent) football?ScenesDevon: We were playing rugby.ScenesLiam: In fact we’re playing a game at the park tomorrow. You’re welcome to play too if you want.ScenesEmily: (laughs) Ross play rugby? I don’t think so.ScenesRoss: What’s ah, what’s so funny about that?ScenesEmily: Well I mean, you’re American to start with. You don’t even have rugby here.ScenesRoss: Well, we didn’t have freedom here until 1776, either so…ScenesDevon: So good then! We’ll see you at Riverside Park at 2:00! Cheers!ScenesLiam: Cheers!ScenesRoss: Cheers!Scenes(Liam and Devon both take a swig of their beers, while Ross takes a swig of his coffee. The Brits both crush their cans, and not to be out done, Ross crushes his coffee cup, spilling its contents.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is attempting his pre-emptive strike.]
rows.Content: Janice: Oh boy, I just love to sing!ScenesChandler: Yes, I-I know that you do, but I think one of the reasons people were complaining though, was that they paid to hear the actor sing Old Man River.ScenesJanice: Oh, look at us! Who would’ve thought that Cupid had a station at 14th Street Nails. (Does the laugh)ScenesChandler: (laughs) Okay, we have to talk. I’m just getting out of a very serious relationship…ScenesJanice: I know! And I’m just getting out of a marriage, I mean talk about meant to be!ScenesChandler: Right! I just think that this is happening too soon.ScenesJanice: Oh, too soon, too schmoon. Face it honey, I am not letting you get away this time.ScenesChandler: I hear ya. (Pause) But! Unfortunately, my company is transferring me overseas!ScenesJanice: Oh no! Where to? (Gasps) Too Paris?ScenesChandler: No! No! Not, Paris.ScenesJanice:Too London? No-no, Rome? Vienna? Ooh-ooh, Barcelona?ScenesChandler: Okay, could you just stop talking for a second? (Thinks) Yemen. That’s right, yes, I’m being transferred to Yemen!ScenesJanice: When?ScenesChandler: I don’t know exactly.ScenesJanice: Ugh, well I will just have to soak up every once of Chandler Bing until that moment comes.ScenesChandler: But I do know that it’s some time tomorrow.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe and Monica are plugging in a bunch of electronics.]
rows.Content: Monica: Done?ScenesPhoebe: Yep!ScenesRachel: (entering, with Joey) Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey! What’s up?ScenesMonica: This switch thing has been driving me crazy. So I turned it off and checked every outlet. Now, four of them don’t work. Which means, one of them has to be controlled by the switch. So, I plugged in things in all four of the outlets that-that make noise, so that way, when I turn it on I just follow the noise and find out which one it is.ScenesJoey: (to Rachel) I bet I stopped listening before you did.ScenesRachel: Y’know, you-you also could’ve used uh, lamps and then followed the light.ScenesMonica: Yeah, well, I’m using noise. Okay. All right! So, is everybody ready? Here we go. (She flips on the switch and a hum starts.) I hear something! I hear something! Where is it? (They all start looking until Rachel realises it’s Joey.)ScenesRachel: It’s coming from Joey!ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God, that’s so freaky! Turn him off!!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Ross, Joey, and Rachel are watching rugby on TV as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Ooh, hey, could we put on the news? I think it might be raining.ScenesRoss: Oh, just hold on a second. I’m watching this rugby thing on ESPN. I don’t know what the big deal is. I’m man enough to play this sport.ScenesJoey: Dude, you’re not even man enough to order the channel that carries the sport.ScenesJanice: (entering) Hey there Ross!ScenesRoss: (shocked) Hey!ScenesPhoebe: (whispering to Ross) Janice.ScenesChandler: Y’know uh, you didn’t really have to help me pack.ScenesJanice: Ohh, well when you said all you were going to be doing between now and the time you leave is packing, you didn’t really leave me much choice. Did you?ScenesChandler: Well, I-I thought I did but, I-I guess I did not!ScenesJoey: Hey-hey, what’s going on?ScenesChandler: Oh, I’m packing. Y’know I’m-I’m packing ‘cause I’m moving to Yemen tomorrow.ScenesJoey: Thanks for telling me!Scenes(Janice runs into the bedroom.)ScenesChandler: I’m only going to pretend I’m moving to Yemen, it’s the only way I can get rid off her.ScenesJoey: Ohhhh, good one! And Yemen that actually sounds like a real country.ScenesJanice: (leaning in from the bedroom) Chandler! Come on, I’m gonna show how to roll up your underwear and stuff it in your shoes. It’s a real space saver.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I know, I do that ‘cause it makes me look taller.ScenesJanice: Okay, Chandler, come on!ScenesChandler: (to Janice) Okay. (to Joey) Joey, trade lives with me!ScenesJoey: Nope. (To Ross) Man look at this! Ross, I can’t believe you said you’d play rugby. I mean look how brutal this is!ScenesRoss: Hey, I can handle it! All right?ScenesRachel: Please, Ross, you-you got hurt playing badminton with my dad.ScenesRoss: That’s ‘cause-‘cause you’re mom’s dog kept-kept looking at me.ScenesJoey: (pointing to the TV) Okay, Ross, look-look-look-look, look right here. That’s called a scrum, okay? It’s kinda like a huddle.ScenesRoss: And is a hum, kinda like a scruddle?ScenesJoey: Ross! (Laughs) They’re gonna kill you!ScenesPhoebe: Well, why are you doing this anyway?ScenesRoss: Well, you should’ve seen the guy that she used to go out with. I mean, he’s like Joe Rugby.ScenesPhoebe: You’re kidding! And he plays rugby?! That’s so funny. (Realises) Ohh! I see how you did that. All right.ScenesRoss: Anyway, she thought the very idea of me playing rugby with him was like hilarious. So I’m gonna show her how tough I really am!ScenesRachel: (starts laughing, Ross stares at her) I’m sorry. I’m sorry. You’re right, you are a tough guy. You’re the toughest palaeontologist I know.ScenesJoey: All right, come on look, Ross can take care of himself! It’s not like he’s…Chandler!ScenesChandler: (from his bedroom) Thanks!ScenesRoss: Look, don’t worry about me. Okay? I’ll just stay real energetic and stay away from the ball. I’ll uh, I’ll be that guy right out of the circle. (He points to a player who starts running and then gets viscously tackled from behind.)ScenesAll: Oh!ScenesRachel: Oh, well maybe there was a dog lookin’ at him.Scenes(Ross turns and wants to attack Rachel, but Joey stops him.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The park, everyone is warming up for the rugby game. Only Joey and Phoebe came to support Ross.]
rows.Content: Joey: Ross-Ross-Ross-Ross! Stay away from that guy (Points), and that guy (Points). And that one—Dude! They’re all huge!ScenesRoss: They don’t look any bigger than me!ScenesJoey: Well, maybe that’s because you’re closer to you. So you look bigger to you from where you are.ScenesEmily: I’m just going to say hi to the lads. All right?ScenesRoss: All right.ScenesEmily: Okay. (Goes to say hi to the lads.)Scenes(A player comes over and picks up a ball in front of Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: (to the player) Hi.Scenes(The player stands up and smiles. Showing that he has no front teeth.)ScenesPhoebe: Whoa! (The player leaves and to Joey) I kinda liked it.Scenes(The referee blows the whistle and the players gather to start the game.)ScenesRoss: Okay, I know what I have to do. I’ve got to go Red Ross. (Joey and Phoebe don’t know what he’s talking about.) Y’know, Red Ross!ScenesJoey: I totally don’t know what you’re talking about.ScenesRoss: Come on! The time we were all waiting in line for Dances With Wolves and that one guy cut in line in front of us and I just lost it?! Screamed at him! Turned all red! Red Ross!!ScenesJoey: No.ScenesRoss: You’ll see.Scenes[Cut to Emily, Devon, and Liam]ScenesEmily: Liam, do me a favour. Tell the lads to go easy on Ross, it’s his first time.ScenesLiam: You don’t say! (We see Ross who is hopping about with the ball and spikes it in his face.)ScenesEmily: (to Ross) Good luck, babe.Scenes(The scrum forms and the game is underway.)ScenesLiam: Ross! Ross! Come on! Get in here! (Ross gets pumped up.) Ross! Come on!Scenes(Ross walks over to the scrum, walks around a bit looking for a way to get into the scrum.)ScenesLiam: Ross, come on! Get in the bloody scrum! Ross, get in!Scenes(Ross, urged on by his team-mates, jumps on top of the scrum and falls headfirst into the middle, leaving his feet sticking straight up.)ScenesRoss: JOEY!!!!!!

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is going over some plans as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: You…are…not going to believe it! Joshua came into work today, and guess what happened?ScenesMonica: He asked you out?!ScenesRachel: No. But I was showing him some cufflinks and I felt his pulse.ScenesMonica: Saucy!ScenesRachel: (refers to the table) What are these?ScenesMonica: Electrical plans for the building.ScenesRachel: Okay, okay, okay should I be scared?ScenesMonica: I know that switch does something, okay? So-so I went down to city hall and got these. All I had to do was pay $25 and wait in line for three hours.ScenesRachel: Wow! If only more people knew.

rows.Scenes: The airport, the Yemen Express counter, Chandler is still trying to get rid of Janice.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Y’know you, really didn’t have to take me to the airport.ScenesJanice: Oh please. Every moment is precious. Y’know? Besides, somebody had to ride in that other taxi with the rest of your luggage, and your friends don’t really seem to care too much that you’re leaving.ScenesChandler: Well, we’re really not that close. (Pause) Okay, so I guess this is uh, good-bye then.ScenesJanice: On no! No! It’s not good-bye, I’m not leaving until you get on that plane.ScenesChandler: Okay. Then I guess it’s just, wait here then. (Hands her the sign that says, Wait Here.") (To the ticket agent) Hi. I need one fake ticket to Yemen.ScenesTicket Counter Attendant: One ticket to Yemen?ScenesChandler: Oh no-no-no, no. No, no, no, I just, I just need a pretend ticket.ScenesTicket Counter Attendant: I’m sorry sir, I don’t understand.ScenesChandler: What would you give to a kid if he wanted a ticket to play with?ScenesTicket Counter Attendant: Are you travelling with a child?ScenesChandler: No. All right, y’know what, she’s (Points to Janice) gonna think that I’m handing you a credit card, but what I’m really gonna do is hand you a library card.ScenesTicket Counter Attendant: Ah, sir a ticket to Yemen is $2,100 and we don’t take library cards.ScenesJanice: What’s the matter? Is something wrong? Do you have to stay?ScenesChandler: (to the ticket agent) American Express?

rows.Scenes: The rugby game, Ross is getting killed.]
rows.Content: Emily: I can’t believe they’re doing that to him! I told them to go easy on him!ScenesPhoebe: No offence but, y’know sometimes it’s hard to understand you, y’know with the accent, so…Scenes(The whistle blows.)ScenesEmily: That’s just halftime, there’s more of this.Scenes(Ross limps over all covered in mud.)ScenesRoss: Did you see me? I was pretty good, huh? That is one fun game!ScenesEmily: Right.ScenesRoss: (to Emily) Hey, could you do me a favour? Could you just grab me a bottle of water?ScenesEmily: Okay.ScenesRoss: Thanks. (When she’s gone he collapses into Joey.) I-I think I’m dying. I really do.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, poor baby.ScenesRoss: (to Phoebe) Tell my son that I love him. (Emily returns with the water.) Excellent! Well, okay, I gotta have some more fun!ScenesEmily: Ross, they are killing you out there!ScenesRoss: (whines "No.") That’s not true!ScenesPhoebe: She’s right! You have to stop!ScenesRoss: What? No! No, I’m not stopping. I’m Red Ross!ScenesJoey: Dude, if you go back out there, you’re gonna be Dead Ross!ScenesRoss: I don’t care! I am not quitting! I insist on finishing this game!ScenesEmily: All right, all right, if you insist on doing this, at least let me help you.ScenesRoss: No, God no! That is no place for a woman. Those guys will grab anything.ScenesEmily: No. That’s not what I’m saying. I just may know a few things that might help you inflict some pain.ScenesRoss: I like that.ScenesEmily: Yeah? Listen closely, Devon has got a weak ankle.ScenesRoss: Huh?ScenesEmily: One swift kick and he’ll back off.ScenesRoss: All right, bad ankle, got it!ScenesEmily: And that big bloke with the beard, he has got a trick hip. Yeah. And uh, and David over there, I heard he doesn’t wear a cup.ScenesRoss: Yeah? I can use that, trick hip, no cup, okay! Okay!ScenesEmily: And uh, Liam, Liam’s got bad knees. You hit him right and he’ll go down like a lamp.ScenesRoss: But-but, Liam’s on my team.ScenesEmily: I don’t care! You just get him!ScenesRoss: I’m gonna go get him! Okay, I am going back in! (Squeals like a madman.)ScenesJoey: The Red Ross! Okay.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is reading a book as Rachel returns.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesRachel: (noticing a bunch of pictures around the door that weren’t there originally.) What-what are-what are these?ScenesMonica: Oh, just some pictures I made and hung up. I thought they’d brighten up the place. They do don’t you think?Scenes(Rachel rips one of the wall and finds a huge hole underneath.)ScenesMonica: No-no-no, no!Scenes(Rachel rips off another one, revealing another hole. Rachel then moves onto a third one, but this one doesn’t have a hole underneath it.)ScenesMonica: I know that there’s no hole there, I just really liked that picture.Scenes(Rachel looks at it and then throws it away. She then removes a fourth one, revealing a third hole.)ScenesRachel: Oh my God! Look at this!ScenesMonica: Okay, but there is a wire back there! I mean that switch is connected to something!ScenesRachel: I don’t care! The wires have come loose in your head!ScenesMonica: I just thought that if I could follow the wire I could find out what it did.ScenesRachel: And did you?!ScenesMonica: No. It disappears back there behind that baseboard. For a minute there, I thought it went downstairs.Scenes(Rachel removes a paper on the floor which is covering a hole and gasps.)ScenesMonica: But it didn’t. Say hello to Mrs. Chatracus.ScenesRachel: Oh my God.ScenesMrs. Chatracus: Hello darling.ScenesRachel: Hello, Mrs. Chatracus.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, They are returning from the rugby game, Joey and Emily are carrying Ross.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Now, are you sure you don’t want to go see a doctor?ScenesRoss: Oh no! That-that’ll just bring me down! This was great! I mean I-I-I was great! This is a great day! Y’know what? I’m buying everyone coffee. All right? If someone would just grab my wallet, it’s in my pocket.ScenesJoey: Yeah, sure.ScenesRoss: No, not you. (Emily gets it.)ScenesJoey: Uhh, look, your eye’s still popping out a little, I’m gonna go get some ice.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, ice! I am so in the mood for ice! (They go and get the coffee and the ice leaving Ross and Emily alone.)ScenesEmily: You were amazing out there.ScenesRoss: Oh, I kinda was, wasn’t I?ScenesEmily: Oh my God!ScenesRoss: I made a man twice my size cry. I mean, I haven’t done that since I was four and I washed my dad’s Porsche with rocks.ScenesEmily: You really enjoyed yourself didn’t you?ScenesRoss: Please! Are you kidding? I-I hurt three huge men, I gave a guy a bloody nose—I mean I-I’m not proud of it but, I really am. And it’s all because of you, wonderful, amazing you.ScenesEmily: I think you’ve got concussion.ScenesRoss: No, no, I’m serious. Thank you.ScenesEmily: You’re welcome. (She hugs him tightly and he winces.) I’m sorry. Did I hurt you?ScenesRoss: It’s worth the pain. (She goes to hug him again.) Y’know what, you know what? It’s not.

rows.Scenes: The airport, the flight to Yemen is being called.]
rows.Content: Ticket Counter Attendant: (on the P.A.) This is the final boarding call for Flight 664 to Yemen.ScenesChandler: Well, I-I guess I gotta go.ScenesJanice: Oh, my Bing-a-ling. I’ll wait for you. Do you even know how long you’re going to be gone?ScenesChandler: Well, just until we find an energy source to replace fuel.ScenesJanice: Oh. Well, I’ll right you everyday. (Reading the address) 15 Yemen Road, Yemen.ScenesChandler: Okay, good-bye. Good-bye.Scenes(He gives the agent his ticket and walks onto the jetway. Janice walks over and looks out the window. Chandler walks back into the terminal and tries to walk right past Janice, but she sees him.)ScenesJanice: Chandler?ScenesChandler: No!ScenesJanice: Chandler!ScenesChandler: Janice! There you are! There you are! I had to have one last kiss, and also-also you said that you were going to leave right after I got on the plane!ScenesJanice: No! No! I wanna see you take-off.ScenesChandler: Well, I then guess I’m going to Yemen! I’m going to Yemen! (To this old woman also going to Yemen.) When we get to Yemen, can I stay with you?ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel’s, Monica has finally given up on her search to find what the light switch does and is now flicking it on and off aimlessly.]
rows.Content: Monica: All right. The super couldn’t figure out what it did. A $200 an hour electrician couldn’t figure out what it did. I’ve had seven pretty serious shocks. I officially give up.ScenesRachel: Thank God.ScenesMonica: I guess Joey was right, it does nothing.Scenes[Cut to Chandler and Joey’s, Joey and Phoebe are watching TV. The TV is turning off and on, and each time Phoebe is blinking her eyes like the Genie did. The switch obviously controls the outlet which the TV is plugged into.]ScenesPhoebe: See? I’m doing it. I am totally doing it. (Suddenly it stops working.) I lost it.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Fake PartyScenesTeleplay by Shana Goldberg-Meehan & Scott Silveri ScenesStory by Alicia Sky VarinaitisScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are there. Phoebe is stressing out about something.]
rows.Content: Monica: What is it hon?ScenesPhoebe: I-I can’t find anything that I want to eat! Everything I eat makes me nauseous! I’m telling you, being pregnant is no piece of cake—ooh! Cake! (Chandler shrugs, and Phoebe grimaces.) No.ScenesMonica: Aww, honey I’m sorry.ScenesPhoebe: God! Ooh! What is that smell? It’s coming from the bathroom. Ooh! (She goes to the bathroom.)ScenesChandler: Wow! Pregnancy does give you some weird cravings.Scenes[Cut to the bathroom, Joey is taking a shower and Phoebe knocks on the door.]ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesPhoebe: It’s me. It’s Phoebe. Listen there’s something in here I want to eat, what-what smells so good?Scenes(Joey sticks his head out of the shower curtain.)ScenesJoey: Is it the shampoo? It’s guava.ScenesPhoebe: (she smells his head) No!ScenesJoey: Oh! Wait-wait! (Reaches inside the shower.) Is it my bologna sandwich?ScenesPhoebe: Yes. Yes. Yes. I can’t believe it! The baby wants bologna! Maybe he wants me to eat meat? I can’t eat meat!ScenesJoey: Oh, wait-wait! (Reaches into the shower again.) Maybe it’s a pickle?!Scenes(Phoebe grimaces at the smell.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, Joey and Rachel are there. Rachel is writing something on a pad, and then crumples it up and throws it on the floor.]
rows.Content: Chandler: What are you writing?ScenesRachel: Well, Joshua’s coming in tomorrow and since I don’t have the guts to ask him out, I’m going to sell him a coat and put this note in the pocket.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah? (He grabs the pad and starts reading it.) Joshua, give me a call sometime, guys like you (Pause) never go out of style—what did you throw away?Scenes(Ross and Emily enter.)ScenesChandler: Hi guys!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey, what have you guys been up too?ScenesRoss: Oh, we went to see a collection of Victorian doorknobs and the Cupert-Hewitt museum.ScenesChandler: Without me?!ScenesEmily: My uncle dragged us there. But, it actually it turned out to be really interesting.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesEmily: They were so ornate and beautiful, I mean look at that! (Shows them a doorknob she has.)ScenesMonica: I don’t know how museums work in England but, here, you’re not supposed to take stuff.ScenesEmily: I uh, I got it from the gift shop. They have really lax security there. (Chandler is shocked.) It’s a joke. (They all laugh.)ScenesRoss: Bye. (They kiss.)ScenesEmily: Right, I’ve got to be off, I’ll see ya. Buh-bye then. (She leaves.)ScenesJoey: Wow! You guys seem to be having a good time.ScenesRoss: Oh yeah, she’s-she’s amazing. And-and she’s so much fun. And! Y’know what? When I’m with her, I’m fun! I even signed up for helicopter classes. (Chandler is shocked.) She’s leaving in two days, I don’t have to do it.ScenesMonica: Oh no, two days, you must be bummed.ScenesRoss: Yeah, she’s got to go back to London. But you know what? I’ve been prepared for this from the start. We both knew we had two weeks together, and that’s it. Y’know.ScenesJoey: Hey that’s what all my relationships are like.ScenesChandler: Yes, but in Ross’s case, they both know in two weeks that’s it.Scenes(Phoebe enters.)ScenesRoss: Pheebs!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesRoss: (starts rubbing her belly) Hello! Hello!ScenesPhoebe: (angered by the rubbing) Yes! I know! I know! Yeah! So the baby is totally craving meat. This afternoon I tried tricking it, I made it a soy-burger to make it think it was getting meat, y’know? And I got nauseous.ScenesChandler: Maybe that’s because soy-burgers suck!ScenesPhoebe: Being pregnant is tough on your tummy.ScenesJoey: Hey, but at least you got that cool, pregnant lady glow.ScenesPhoebe: That’s sweat. You throw up all morning, you’ll have that glow too.

rows.Scenes: Bloomingdale’s, Rachel is preparing to slip Joshua the note.]
rows.Content: Joshua: (coming in from a changing room) Okay!ScenesRachel: Oh, here’s that trench-coat that you wanted.ScenesJoshua: Oh great! (He tries on the coat.) Wow! Yeah, it’s comfortable.ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesJoshua: Man, I could really flash somebody in this thing. (He goes to put his hands in his pockets.)ScenesRachel: (stopping him) Oh no-no, no-no, they don’t want you to put your hands in the pockets until you are out of the store.ScenesJoshua: Why not?!ScenesRachel: Well, that’s because of a lot of…(She imitates someone picking their nose and placing the treasure found in the pockets.)ScenesJoshua: Y’know, they ruin it for everybody.ScenesRachel: I know!ScenesJoshua: Y’know, I wore that cashmere sweater on a date last night.ScenesRachel: Oh?ScenesJoshua: Yeah, it was my first date since the uh, since the divorce.ScenesRachel: Well, congratulations, so do you love her?ScenesJoshua: No, no, no, she’s nice but, y’know, it just it made me realize that I’m just not, I’m just not ready to be dating, y’know?ScenesRachel: Huh. Well, uh, that’s uh, that’s interesting. (She goes over and retrieves her note.)ScenesJoshua: (noticing her) Hey-whoa-hey-hey, what was that?ScenesRachel: Oh, it’s just an anti-theft device.ScenesJoshua: Then uh, what’s-what’s this? (Shows her the real anti-theft device.)ScenesRachel: You need that, you need that too ‘cause obviously, a thief could just tear this up. (Rips up the note.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Ross is writing on the Magna-Doodle as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oops, sorry. Listen, we-we have to have a party tonight! Actually, we have to have one in five minutes, so everybody cancel your plans.ScenesChandler: What are you talking about?ScenesJoey: Yeah, what’ going on?ScenesRachel: We have to have a surprise Bon Voyage party for Emily. But it’s actually for Joshua. (Starts handing out party hats.) Look, he said he’s not ready to date, so I had to invite him to a party if I wanted to see him outside of work, and now I have the perfect opportunity to seduce him! (Hands Ross a party hat.)ScenesRoss: Well, as much as I’d like to meet Josh and warn him, Emily and I aren’t going to be here. All right? I mean, she’s going to come by first to say good-bye, and then I’ve got a whole special evening planned. So I’m sorry, no party.ScenesJoey: Awwww!ScenesEmily: (entering) Hello?ScenesRachel: Surprise!!!ScenesChandler and Joey: Surprise!!ScenesEmily: No one’s ever thrown me a surprise party before!ScenesRachel: Well, it was all Ross’s idea.ScenesEmily: You’re so sweet! And I’m so surprised!ScenesRoss: You really didn’t know?Scenes[Cut to later, the party is in full swing. Rachel is in the kitchen and Chandler goes over to talk to her.]ScenesChandler: Why are you in here if Joshua is all the way over there? (Points to the living room.)ScenesRachel: Uhh, because I’m trying to play hard to get. Oh, quick he’s looking over here, say something funny.ScenesChandler: Like what?Scenes(Rachel laughs hysterically.)ScenesJoey: What-what-what is so funny?ScenesChandler: I said, "Like what?ScenesJoey: Now that’s a thinker.ScenesRachel: Okay, y’know what, y’know what? This playing hard to get thing is not working. Umm, hand-hand me those cherries. (Chandler does so.) Okay. Okay. (She does a little sexy walk over to where Joshua is standing.) Hi!ScenesJoshua: Hi!ScenesRachel: Care for a cherry?ScenesJoshua: Oh, no thanks.ScenesRachel: No? Y’know, I can tie one of these into a knot using just my tongue.Scenes(She tries to demonstrate this unique ability, but only succeeds in choking on it.)ScenesJoshua: You okay? (Rachel swallowed it whole and is not hacking like a heavy smoker in the morning.) You all right? (Rachel walks away, coughing.)ScenesRoss: (interrupting Monica and Emily) So we should probably get going soon.ScenesEmily: Oh, but the party’s only just getting started!ScenesRoss: Yeah, but we-we have to be at the Four Seasons for drinks in 15 minutes and then y’know, then The Plaza for dinner.ScenesEmily: So why did you plan a party at the same time?ScenesRoss: No-no-no, no, umm, actually American surprise parties are-are-are very short. It’s usually, "Surprise!" And then, "Oh my God, I’m so surprised—good-bye!ScenesEmily: But Ross, I’m such having a great time! Your sister has just been telling me that you used to dress up like little, old ladies and hold make-believe tea parties.ScenesRoss: Monica said that did she? (He squeezes Monica’s knee really hardly and Monica winces in pain.)Scenes[Cut to Joey and Phoebe in the kitchen. Phoebe is watching Joey make a sandwich.]ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, yeah. Then what are you going to put on top of that?ScenesJoey: A little salami.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh yeah! Then umm, what goes on top of the salami?ScenesJoey: Pastrami.ScenesPhoebe: Oooh, yeah. You’re a genius.Scenes(Rachel enters, she has changed clothes.)ScenesRachel: Oh, could somebody give me a hand with this zipper?ScenesJoey: Yeah. (He goes over to her.)ScenesRachel: Up!ScenesMonica: You changed?ScenesRachel: Yeah, I did. I needed my lucky dress.ScenesMonica: And lucky means, more cleavage?ScenesChandler: Does for me.Scenes(Joey starts wiping lint off of her back, but goes at little too far and Rachel just glares at him. He stops, gives her the ‘okay’ symbol and walks away.)ScenesRachel: Ohh, God! Look at him, he’s so cute. I wanna go over there, grab him, and kiss him! How can I kiss him and not letting him know that I like him?ScenesJoey: Oh! I know how you can get him, take off your bra.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesJoey: There was a seen in Footloose...ScenesChandler: Flashdance.ScenesJoey: Yeah-yeah, yeah, with that-that uh, plumber girl…ScenesChandler: She was a welder.ScenesJoey: What? Were you like in the movie, or… Anyway, she takes off her bra under her shirt and pulls it out the sleeve. Very sexy, and classy.ScenesMonica: Or if you want to kiss him, umm, you could use mistletoe.ScenesRachel: It’s not Christmas!ScenesMonica: Or Spin the Bottle?ScenesRachel: He’s not 11!ScenesEmily: (with her coat on, she’s leaving with Ross) Thank you so much for this. It was really so thoughtful of you.ScenesRachel: What? You’re leaving?!ScenesRoss: Yes, we have something we have to get to.ScenesJoshua: Uhh, yeah, I think I’m going to take-off too.ScenesRachel: No! You guys can’t leave yet! You have to stay, we-we got the whole big thing planned!ScenesRoss: What big thing?Scenes[Cut to later, the whole group is seated on the floor and Rachel is explaining the rules of Spin the Bottle.]ScenesRachel: (spinning the bottle) So, Spin the Bottle works like this: I spin the bottle, it lands on Gunther, so I would have to kiss Gunther. (She crawls over to where Gunther is sitting and sees the look of anticipation on Gunther’s face and decides not to kiss him.) All right. Who wants to go first?ScenesEmily: I’ll go.ScenesAll: Yay!Scenes(Emily spins the bottle and it lands on Joey.)ScenesJoey: Welcome to America. (They both kiss.)Scenes(Joey spins the bottle and it lands on Emily.)ScenesMonica: Two in a row! You’ve got to use your tongues now! (They kiss again.)ScenesRachel: Yay! Emily!Scenes(Emily spins the bottle and once again, it lands on Joey.)ScenesChandler: What are the odds? What are the odds?Scenes(They both move to kiss again.)ScenesRoss: (stopping them) Okay, that-that’s enough! Y’know, let’s, let’s let someone else play.ScenesJoey: If you didn’t want to play, why did you come to the party?ScenesRachel: Okay, my turn!!Scenes(Rachel spins the bottle and it lands on….wait for it….Joshua. (You thought I was going to say Ross, didn’t you?) Rachel squeals in delight and starts a slow sexy crawl over to Joshua, making sure he and everyone else watching gets a good look at her cleavage.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!! The baby just kicked!ScenesAll: Ohh!ScenesRachel: It’s okay! It’s okay! It kicked once, it’ll kick again!ScenesAll: Oh my God!Scenes(They all stand up and go over to Phoebe to feel the baby, preventing Rachel from kissing Joshua.)ScenesRachel: All right, well, everybody just remember where they were sitting.Scenes(She crawls over to Joshua and kisses the back of his knee. He feels it and looks down, Rachel pretends she’s knocking a bug off his leg.)ScenesRachel: Just a bug.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, it is later in the party. The Spin the Bottle game is over and Chandler is making a sandwich as Phoebe watches.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Y’know it doesn’t matter how much I’m craving it. Y’know why I’m never gonna eat meat? Because it’s murder, cold blooded murder.ScenesChandler: Okay.Scenes(He takes a bite out of the sandwich and as he does so, Phoebe attacks the other end and starts devouring the sandwich.)ScenesChandler: There’s a Phoebe on my sandwich! (He walks away, giving the sandwich to Phoebe.)ScenesJoey: Phoebe, what-what are you doing?!ScenesPhoebe: I can’t help it. I need the meat. The baby needs the meat.ScenesJoey: All right look, y’know how-y’know how when you’re dating someone and you don’t want to cheat on them, unless it’s with someone really hot?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, totally!ScenesJoey: All right. Okay. Well this is the same kind of deal. If you’re going to do something wrong, (He grabs two steaks from the freezer) do it right!Scenes[Cut to later, Phoebe is finishing off her steak.]ScenesJoey: Feel better now?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but at what cost? Six more months, three meals a day, I’m gonna eat like, y’know millions of cows.ScenesJoey: Hey, what if I said, I could even things out for ya, meatwise.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesJoey: Well, I eat a lot of meat right?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Well, suppose until the baby’s born I laid off it. No extra animals would die, you-you’d just be eating my animals.ScenesPhoebe: Joey, I can’t believe you would do that for me.ScenesJoey: Absolutely! I could be a vegetarian. There’s no meat in beer, right?Scenes[Cut to Ross and Emily standing by the foosball table.]ScenesRoss: Okay, we could still make dinner if we skipped the appetisers and asked for our check right away.Scenes(Rachel enters, she has changed once again. This time into her high school cheerleading uniform.)ScenesEmily: But, we can’t go now. It looks like Rachel’s gonna put on a skit.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! Have you lost your mind?ScenesRachel: No-n-n-n-no! I am finally thinking clearly. My lucky dress wasn’t working out to well for me, but for four years, this baby never missed.ScenesMonica: Rachel-Rachel-Rachel I-I cannot, I can’t let—(pause), actually I kinda want to see what happens.ScenesJoshua: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesJoshua: Nice uh, costume.ScenesRachel: Ohh, yeah, well I wanted to give Emily a big American good-bye cheer. So okay! (Runs into the living room) Ready! Okay! Gimme an ‘E!’ScenesAll: E!ScenesRachel: Gimme an ‘M!’ScenesAll: M!ScenesRachel: Gimme an ‘I!’ScenesAll: I!ScenesRachel: Gimme an ‘L!’ScenesAll: L!ScenesRachel: Gimme a ‘Y!’ScenesAll: Y!ScenesRachel: What do you get? (She throws her pom-poms to Joey and Phoebe and performs a cartwheel.) Emily!! (Tries to do another one.) Emil—Whoa!! (She falls in Chandler’s room.) Okay! So that’s me as a cheerleader! Ta-dum! (Gunther’s the only one that claps.)Scenes(Joey and Monica rush over to her.)ScenesJoey and Monica: Are you all right?ScenesRachel: I’m fine! I’m fine! I’m just losing a tooth, it’s no big deal. I have a dentist! Y’know. I’m gonna go put some ice on it. Excuse me. (She goes over to the ice and Joey and Monica follow her.) What do I do now? What do I do now?ScenesMonica: I think you’re done.ScenesJoey: Okay, time to take off the bra. (She glares at him.)ScenesJoshua: Umm, that was really great, but I-I gotta take-off actually.ScenesJoey: (trying not to be obvious) Take the bra off.ScenesRachel: All right, come on, let’s go get your coat.ScenesJoshua: Okay.Scenes(They both go to Chandler’s bedroom to get his coat.)Scenes[Cut to Gunther and Emily.]ScenesGunther: Rachel is my girlfriend.Scenes[Cut to Chandler’s bedroom.]ScenesJoshua: So, this was uh, really fun.ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah! Real fun. (She makes a decision.) Y’know, this bra… Really, bothers me. (She starts taking off her bra.) Y’know, this used to be my bedroom. Yeah. A lot of memories in here, a lot of memories. If these walls could talk, y’know what they’d say? Wanna hear some memories? (She is now violently pulling on her bra in order to remove it, but it isn’t co-operating.)ScenesJoshua: Need uh, need a little hand there.ScenesRachel: Oh no-no-no! No, I got this all under control.ScenesJoshua: You really don’t seem like you do. That’s…Scenes(She is still yanking on the bra, but it is stuck in her sleeve. Finally, she gives up.)ScenesRachel: Ughhhh!! Forget it! (Sits down heavily on the bed.) This is, this is not how this is supposed to happen.ScenesJoshua: Well, what was supposed to happen?ScenesRachel: Can you not look at me when I say this? (He turns around) I thought that if I could get you here, I could seduce you.ScenesJoshua: Huh. Oh, boy! (Sits down next to her.) Uhh, I-I don’t wear suits to work, and I bought six of them from you.ScenesRachel: Well, I’m sorry, I thought you needed them!ScenesJoshua: No, no-no, no-no, my point is that I kept coming back because, I wanted to see you.ScenesRachel: Why?!ScenesJoshua: Because I-I like you.ScenesRachel: You like me?ScenesJoshua: Yeah! I mean you’re-you’re beautiful and smart and sophisticated—a lot of this isn’t based on tonight.ScenesRachel: Yeah but-but-but you liked me! Oh my God, I can’t believe this, all this time, I liked you and you liked me!ScenesJoshua: But…ScenesRachel: Oh no-no-no don’t say but! No-no, but’s never good! Let’s just leave it at, you like me and I like you.ScenesJoshua: Okay uh, however…ScenesRachel: Oh, now see that’s a fancy but.ScenesJoshua: My marriage like just ended, and I’m really not ready to get into anything yet.ScenesRachel: But….ScenesJoshua: I’m sorry, I, I just need a little time.ScenesRachel: Okay.

rows.Scenes: The hallway, Ross is sitting on the step drinking a beer as Rachel comes out of the guys apartment.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Ohh, here you are. I was looking for you before. Joshua’s gone so you and Emily are free to go.ScenesRoss: That’s okay. She’s still in there enjoying her fake party and uh, it’s too late to do any of the things I had planned, so…ScenesRachel: Oh, Ross, I’m sorry. I completely ruined your evening.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Well, if it makes you feel any better, I made a fool out of myself.ScenesRoss: Helps a little.ScenesRachel: Is there room on that step for a pathetic loser?ScenesRoss: Yeah, have a seat.ScenesRachel: I’m so sorry.ScenesRoss: That’s okay, I mean it was just two-week thing anyway, I just didn’t want it to end this way, y’know?ScenesRachel: Well, maybe you didn’t want it to end?ScenesRoss: What do you mean?ScenesRachel: You seem to really like her.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I really do. Yeah, but what am I gonna do, I mean we-we both agreed that it was gonna be a two-week thing, y’know no commitment.ScenesRachel: Ross, that girl just spent the entire evening talking to your friends, asking to hear stories about you, looking through Monica’s photo albums, I mean you don’t do that if you’re just in it for two weeks.ScenesRoss: You think?ScenesRachel: Yeah, you got like 14 hours until she has to be at the airport, and you’re sitting here in the hallway with a 28-year-old cheerleader with a fat lip.ScenesRoss: Hey, you’re right.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Thanks. (He starts to go inside and stops.) What photo album was it?ScenesRachel: I don’t know, it was you and a bunch of albino kids.ScenesRoss: Oh my God! Those weren’t albino kids, that was computer camp! Rach! (He hurries inside and Chandler is taking out the garbage.)ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesRachel: You’re a pathetic loser, right?ScenesChandler: Oh-ho, yeah!ScenesRachel: Sit!Scenes(He does so, and immediately starts looking pathetic.)ScenesJoshua: Hi. (He has just returned.)ScenesRachel: Oh my gosh, Joshua!ScenesJoshua: All those things I said about not being ready…ScenesRachel: They’re not true?ScenesJoshua: No, they’re-they’re all true.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesJoshua: But…ScenesRachel: Oh! Oh, I love that but.Scenes(They move to kiss, but realise that Chandler is staring at them. Chandler urges them on.)ScenesRachel: You wanna go inside and have some coffee?ScenesJoshua: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Okay. (Joshua goes inside and to Chandler.) Every time.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, the next day. Phoebe is busy making a sandwich.]
rows.Content: Joey: Oooh, what you got there?ScenesPhoebe: Pastrami.ScenesJoey: Oh-ho-ho, yeah! Hey! Y’know what goes good with that?ScenesPhoebe: Hm-mm, corn beef.ScenesJoey: Ooh, I was gonna say bologna, but that’s much better. How about a little of that smoked turkey?ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesJoey: (He starts looking longingly at the sandwich.) Oh mama! Uh when-when is the baby due?ScenesPhoebe: Six months.ScenesJoey: Ugh. Now if a cow should die of natural causes, I can have one of those right?ScenesPhoebe: Not if I get there first.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Free PornScenesStory by Mark J. Kunerth ScenesTeleplay by Richard Goodman ScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching TV, and we hear Mr. Treeger in the bathroom.]
rows.Content: Mr. Treeger: Ohhh, man!!ScenesJoey: (coming in from his bedroom) What is that?ScenesChandler: Treeger’s snaking the shower drain.ScenesMr. Treeger: What in the name of hell?ScenesJoey: Maybe he found you flip-flop.Scenes(Joey sits down and changes the channel, and we see two people making out.)ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Whoa! Is this porn? What did I do? I must’ve hit something on the remote.ScenesChandler: Do we pay for this?ScenesJoey: No, we didn’t even pay our cable bill—maybe this is how they punish us.ScenesChandler: Maybe we shouldn’t pay our phone bill—free phone sex.ScenesJoey: Maybe we shouldn’t pay our gas bill? (Stops and thinks about what he just said.)ScenesMr. Treeger: (coming in from the bathroom) Whoa, hey, that lady’s all kinds of naked.ScenesChandler: Yeah, Joey just pressed something on the remote and it just, came on!ScenesMr. Treeger: Yeah, it happened to me once. I was just flipping through the channels and bam! It was like finding money.ScenesChandler: Like finding money with naked people on it!ScenesMr. Treeger: Then I made the mistake of turning off the TV, I never got it back again. And I’m sad. (Exits.)ScenesJoey: (to Chandler) Why would he turn off the TV? (Chandler shrugs.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, later that morning. The porn is still on, there are three women getting ready to shave the chest of some guy. Joey and Chandler are wondering why that guy is letting them shave his chest, and Monica and Rachel are eating breakfast at the foosball table.]
rows.Content: Rachel: All right, y’know what, come on, do we really have to watch this while we eat? (She makes a move for the remote.)ScenesJoey and Chandler: (stopping her) Oh no-no-no-no!ScenesChandler: We don’t know what could make this go away.ScenesJoey: Yeah, so no one touches the remote. And no one touches the TV!ScenesChandler: And no one touches the air around the TV!ScenesJoey: Imagine a protective porn bubble if you will, okay?ScenesMonica: Well at least, I’m going to mute it.ScenesJoey and Chandler: Oh no-no-no! (Monica mutes the TV and they tentatively look behind them)ScenesChandler: We still have porn.ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: (entering, carrying her massage table) Hi!ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesRachel: Honey, what are you doing? That’s too heavy.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Give it here. (She takes the table.) Oh, God. (And gives it to Monica right away.)ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, I’m getting too pregnant for this, lugging around a stupid massage table. Y’know, I have to find a job where I carrying a smaller table. (She goes over and stands in front of the TV.)ScenesChandler: Or a job where you don’t have to carry a table.ScenesPhoebe: You mean like a doctor?ScenesJoey: Pheebs! You’re blocking the porn! Look out!ScenesPhoebe: Ohh! (She moves.) Oh my. Oh, that reminds me, I have to see my OB-GYN today.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Ross is entering.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hi.ScenesMonica: Hi.ScenesRoss: So uh, Emily just went to the airport.ScenesMonica: Oh. Why didn’t you take her?ScenesRoss: Eh, her-her uncle already had planned on doing it. And y’know, we-we said our good-byes this morning, so…ScenesMonica: You must feel horrible. Hey! The guys have free porn!ScenesRoss: (Thinks about it.) Nah.ScenesMonica: Hey, cheer up! You’re gonna see her again, right?ScenesRoss: Well I, that’s the thing, I don’t know! I mean, whenever I brought it up with her she said, (In a British accent.) "This is so fantastic! Why do we have to talk about the future? Let’s just enjoy…ScenesMonica: (interrupting him) No-no-no, don’t-don’t do the accent. You’ve got to see her again.ScenesRoss: And why do you care so much?ScenesMonica: Because! You could get to live out my fantasy!ScenesRoss: You had fantasies about Emily?ScenesMonica: No! Y’know, the fantasy! Meet someone from a strange land, fall in madly love, and spend the rest of your lives together.ScenesRoss: Is that why in junior high you were the only one that hung out with that Ukrainian kid?ScenesMonica: Yeah that, plus his mom used to put sour cream on everything!ScenesRoss: Ahh.ScenesMonica: Do you love her?ScenesRoss: We said it was only going to be two weeks, y’know?ScenesMonica: You love her!ScenesRoss: What-what is love really?ScenesMonica: Ohhh, I knew you loved her! Then you need to go to the airport and tell her. You’re probably just gonna catch her just as she’s about to go to the gate. You’re gonna call out her name and say, "I love you!" And she’s gonna say, "I love you, too!" And you guys are going to have the most amazing kiss, everyone at the gate will applaud.ScenesRoss: I am a good kisser.ScenesMonica: Then you two can, can sneak into the cockpit, and things will start to heat up, and then a stewardess comes in… (Ross looks at her.) I’ve been watching too much porn.

rows.Scenes: Beth Israel Medical Center, Phoebe is at her OB-GYN doing an ultrasound, Rachel is with her. We here the baby’s heartbeat.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Is that the heartbeat?ScenesThe Doctor: That’s it.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!ScenesRachel: Oh wow! This is so cool.Scenes(The heartbeat changes, and we hear a different one.)ScenesThe Doctor: Have we talked about the possibility of multiple births?ScenesPhoebe: Why don’t take care of this one, and should I get pregnant again, I’ll hold onto your card, okay?ScenesThe Doctor: No, I’m getting three separate heartbeats.ScenesPhoebe: Three? You guys were worried I wouldn’t even have one!ScenesThe Doctor: Doctors are wrong all the time.ScenesPhoebe: Well, yeah.ScenesRachel: Well, so, are-are you sure that there are three?!ScenesThe Doctor: Definitely. (Points out each head on the ultrasound.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! Oh my God! Oh my God!! So I-I mean so in a few months I’m going to have three full grown babies just walkin’ around inside me?! Oh! Oh! And it’s gonna be one of those log rides where they just come shooting out!ScenesThe Doctor: Actually, giving birth to three babies isn’t that different from giving birth to one.ScenesPhoebe: What do you know?!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is there, waiting to tell Frank and Alice the news.]
rows.Content: Alice: (entering) Oh-oh, Phoebe!ScenesPhoebe: Ooh! Hi!ScenesAlice: Hi! (She runs over and hugs Phoebe’s stomach.) So, how did it go at the doctors?ScenesPhoebe: Oh well, okay, hey, y’know how when you’re umm, you’re walking down the street and you see three people in a row, and you say, "Oh, that’s nice?ScenesFrank: Yes.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, yeah well, good news, you’re going to have three babies.ScenesAlice: Three babies?ScenesFrank: I finally got my band!ScenesAlice: We’re gonna have a big family, I’ve always wanted a big family!ScenesPhoebe: Oh God, I’m so glad you guys are happy, I was so afraid you were going to be all freaked.ScenesFrank: Why would we be freaked?ScenesPhoebe: No, no maybe ‘cause it’s harder to raise them, and the added expense, and…ScenesFrank: (They’re less than happy now) Oh.ScenesAlice: Right.ScenesPhoebe: No, back to happy. Back to happy!ScenesAlice: No-no-no, no, it’s going to be fine. Because umm, because I teach Home Ec, and uh, I can have 30 kids making baby clothes all year long. Y’know it’ll-it’ll be like my very own little sweatshop.ScenesFrank: Yeah, I’ve been thinking ever since you said we were having triplets, the best thing for me to do is to drop out of college and get a job.ScenesAlice: No, Frank.ScenesPhoebe: No you can’t quit college! No! You’re in college? Really?ScenesFrank: Yeah, refrigerator college.ScenesAlice: Yeah.ScenesFrank: Yeah, y’know when we found out we were going to have a baby, y’know I figured y’know like I should y’know have like a career—and I love refrigerators!ScenesPhoebe: You can’t give up on your dream.ScenesFrank: No, it’s okay. We’re-we’re gonna have three kids! And that’s-that’s a different kind of dream. Three kids and no money.

rows.Scenes: The airport, Emily is getting ready to board her flight to London.]
rows.Content: Ticket Agent: (On the P.A.) This is the boarding call for Flight 009.ScenesRoss: Emily! (Runs up.)ScenesEmily: Oh my God! What are you doing here? (They hug)ScenesRoss: I just, I had to see you one more time before you took-off.ScenesEmily: You are so sweet. (They kiss.)ScenesRoss: That’s, that’s, that’s a big candy bar. (She’s holding one of those huge Toblerone bars.) I had the most amazing time with you.ScenesEmily: Me too.ScenesTicket Agent: This is the final boarding call for Flight 009.ScenesEmily: Well, that’ me. (They kiss again.) Here, have this. (She gives him the candy bar.) I’m only allowed one piece of carryon anyway. (She starts towards the jetway.)ScenesRoss: (stops her) Wait uh, listen. I-I, I have to tell you something. Umm, I’ve been thinking, I’m just gonna come out and say it. Okay? I-I-I ah, I-I think I love you.ScenesEmily: Oh. (She’s shocked and hugs him.) Thank you. (She boards the plane.)ScenesRoss: That’s no problem.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Rachel is singing some kind of song.]
rows.Content: Rachel: What’s that song? It has been in my head all day long.ScenesChandler: It’s the theme from Good Will Humping.ScenesRachel: Y’know who doesn’t even like dirty movies? My new boyfriend Joshua.ScenesJoey: Yeah right.ScenesRachel: No, he told me. He prefers to leave certain things to the imagination.ScenesChandler: Oh-oh, yeah, and did he also say that ah, some of the dialogue was corny and that he actually found it was funny and not sexy?ScenesRachel: Yes!ScenesJoey: Yeah, he likes porn.Scenes(Rachel starts to leave.)ScenesMonica: Where ya going?ScenesRachel: I’m going to find out if he really thinks supermodels are too skinny. (As she exits, Phoebe enters.) Hey, Pheebs!ScenesPhoebe: Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesMonica: How did it go with Frank and Alice?ScenesPhoebe: Well, Frank has to quit college because his super fertile sister is having three babies! I need to make a lot of money really fast, and I had an idea that I want to talk to you (Points to Chandler) about, ‘cause you work for a big company. Okay, insider trading, what information is there that you can give me.ScenesChandler: They don’t really talk to us about that kind of stuff. I can get you some free white out though.Scenes(Ross enters.)ScenesMonica: Ohh! Did you do what I said? Did-did-did you tell her?ScenesRoss: I did.ScenesMonica: And well, what did she say?ScenesRoss: Thank you.ScenesMonica: Oh, you’re totally welcome! What’d she say?ScenesRoss: She said, "Thank you." I said, "I love you." And she said, "Thank you.ScenesChandler: Whoa-whoa, wait a minute, did you say, you love her?ScenesJoey: Yeah, what were you trying to get her to do?!ScenesRoss: What do I do now?ScenesJoey: You play hard to get.ScenesRoss: She already lives in London.ScenesJoey: Then you go to Tokyo.ScenesChandler: All right look, forget it, forget it. You told her you love her, it’s over.ScenesMonica: It is not over! You’re over!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesMonica: You know!ScenesChandler: Okay. (Pause) Good one.ScenesMonica: It is not over because she is going to call you and tell you she loves you. And the reason why she couldn’t, is because her feelings were so strong, it scared her. Now you go home and wait for her call, she could be calling you from the plane! Come on now go! Go! (Tries to push Ross out the door.)ScenesRoss: Okay! Okay! But if she doesn’t call, it is definitely over! No, wait. Wait. Unless, eventually, I call her, y’know just to she what’s going on, and, and she says she’ll call me back, but then she doesn’t. Then it’s over.Scenes(Joey holds his fist up, and Chandler gives him two thumbs up.)ScenesJoey: Way to be strong, man!Scenes(Ross leaves, and after the door closes, Joey gives him the loser sign.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Joey enter having just woken up.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hi! Listen, can we watch cartoons on your television? We need a porn break. We spent the last two hours watching In & Out & In, Again.ScenesRachel: Well, so, why don’t you just turn it off?ScenesChandler: Because then we would be the guys who turned off free porn.ScenesPhoebe: (entering carrying a case) Ooh, good, you’re hear! Okay.ScenesMonica: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesRachel: Well, what-what ‘cha got there?ScenesPhoebe: Oh this, well I’m glad you asked. (She opens the case and removes a knife and an soda can.) Now, don’t you hate it when you have to cut a tin can with an ordinary steak knife? (She efficiently cuts it in half.) Ahh! Now, I know what you’re thinking…ScenesChandler: Pregnant Woman Slays Four?ScenesMonica: Phoebe, they didn’t make you pay for those knives, did they?ScenesPhoebe: No!ScenesMonica: Are you sure?ScenesPhoebe: No!ScenesRachel: Honey, you’re not gonna make enough money to help Frank and Alice just by selling knives.ScenesPhoebe: No-no, I know that, but I just have to make enough money for the second part of my plan.ScenesChandler: What’s the second part of your plan?ScenesPhoebe: My Saturn dealership.

rows.Scenes: Ross’s bedroom, he has fallen asleep waiting for Emily to call. He is awaken by the phone.]
rows.Content: Ross: (Answers the phone.) Hello?ScenesEmily: Ross.ScenesRoss: Emily, hi! Uh, how-how was you flight?ScenesEmily: It was dreadful. I felt terrible about how I acted when you said those wonderful things.ScenesRoss: No, no, that-that, that’s all right. Umm, I’m just glad you called.ScenesEmily: Ross umm, there’s something that I’ve got to tell you, there’s-there’s someone else.ScenesRoss: Does that mean the same thing in England as it does in America?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Ross is relating his recent conversation with Emily to the gang.]
rows.Content: Ross: She doesn’t know which one of us she wants, me or this Colin guy.ScenesMonica: This isn’t how it’s supposed to go, there can’t be another guy.ScenesRoss: Well…ScenesMonica: Of course there’s another guy!! This is even more perfect! Now you have to prove your love!ScenesRoss: I’m not proving anything. Okay, I’m done listening to you. If I hadn’t let you talk me into going to the airport in the first place, I never would’ve put my fist through the wall!ScenesChandler: You put your fist through the wall?ScenesRoss: No, I missed and hit the door. But, it opened really hard!ScenesMonica: You have to go to London!ScenesRoss: What?ScenesMonica: Yeah, you have to go fight for her!ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, sure, that makes sense. Yeah. ‘Cause you already told her you love her and she didn’t say it back, then she called you and told you that there’s another guy, so yeah, go to London that’ll scare her!ScenesMonica: When Rachel was with Paulo, what did you do?ScenesRoss: I made fun of his accent.ScenesMonica: You sat back and let him have her, you didn’t fight at all. Am I right? Do you want the same thing to happen with Emily?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesMonica: All right then, go fight for her! Go to London! I mean, that could be you and Emily! (Points to the TV.) That, but-but nicer. Just, go to London!ScenesRoss: Really?ScenesMonica: Come on! Surprise her! Show up at her doorstep! Don’t let her go without a fight!ScenesRoss: All right. All right, I’m gonna do it!ScenesMonica: All right.ScenesRoss: I’m gonna, I’m gonna go to London and I’m going to fight for her.ScenesMonica: Okay, good luck!Scenes(Ross starts to leave.)ScenesJoey: Ross! Ross! If you’re going to the airport, could you pick me up another one of those Toblerone bars? (Chandler nods his head no.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Joey, and Chandler are sitting and talking as Phoebe and Rachel enter.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Ooh-Ooh! I did it! I did it! I figured out a way to make money! I’m gonna open up my own massage place and Frank’s gonna help me! And! We can work it around his schedule so he doesn’t have to quit school!ScenesMonica: That’s sounds great, but how are you going to afford it?ScenesRachel: Well, we were walking down the street and we saw that van that you guys used for catering and we realised…ScenesPhoebe: I’m telling it! I’m telling it!ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. You know how people need transportation, but they also need massages to help them relax so I just figured we could combine the two, okay, I give the massages and Frank drives! I can fix up the van, bolt the table in the back, and you know what I’ve got?ScenesChandler: A place where no one will ever get out alive?ScenesPhoebe: No! Think about it, it’s a taxi that people take when they need to relax, it’s…ScenesRachel: (interrupting) Relaxi-Taxi!ScenesPhoebe: The name was my favourite part!ScenesRachel: Well, well I can up with it!ScenesPhoebe: YOU DID NOT!!!! Oh! No! You came up with Relaxi Cab! That’s not good.ScenesRachel: Well, I…Scenes(The phone rings and Monica answers it.)ScenesMonica: Hello.ScenesRoss: (on phone) Hey.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! Ross, are you in England? Was Emily surprised?Scenes[Cut to Ross in one of those British phone booths.]ScenesRoss: No, because she hasn’t come home yet. And she hasn’t been home all night! She’s obviously staying with that other guy, and I’m the stupid moron who spent the whole night outside her apartment!ScenesMonica: All right. When is, when is the next flight out?ScenesRoss: About four hours.ScenesMonica: Okay, just stay there a couple more hours and if she doesn’t show up by then, then just come on home.ScenesPhoebe: Hey, tell him about Relaxi-Taxi, and-and ask him if he thinks that’s better than Relaxi Cab.ScenesRachel: Okay, it’s not Relaxi Cab. It’s Relaxicab, like taxicab.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, that is better.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, later that same night. There is a knock on the door and Chandler answers it to reveal Emily standing behind it.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Are we in London?ScenesMonica: What are you doing here? You can’t be here!ScenesEmily: I’ve uh, I’ve come to talk to Ross.Scenes(She sets her bag down on the foosball table and Joey sees the Toblerone bar sticking out of it and gazes longingly at it.)ScenesEmily: What?ScenesJoey: (pause) Nothing. No, nothing.ScenesEmily: I was going to call him, but…ScenesMonica: Oh, you came to tell him you love him! I knew it! (Points at Chandler) I was right! (Points to Emily) I’m right, right?ScenesEmily: I’d really rather talk to him.ScenesMonica: Oh.ScenesEmily: I uh, I’ve been to his apartment and he wasn’t there, and uh. I need to talk to him, so do you have any idea where he is?Scenes[Cut to London, we sit Ross sitting outside Emily’s apartment. We hear Emily’s phone ring with amazing clarity. Apparently, sound travels quite easily through the walls of British buildings. Anyhoo, Ross looks around for the ringing phone and in the meantime Emily’s answering machine picks up and once again with amazing clarity we hear Emily say…]ScenesEmily: Ross, are you there? Ross, I don’t know if you can hear this but… (Ross has moved to the window, apparently so that he can hear better.) I’m gonna talk anyway, uh, I’m in the States with you sister and your friends and it’s all over with Colin. I came here to tell you that, and to tell you—Yes, Joey you can have all the chocolate you want, just take it! Uh, I came here to tell you that I love you.ScenesRoss: (yelling, thinking Emily can hear him through the answering machine all the way to New York.) I love you too! I’m, I’m gonna call you right now from the phone booth! (Realises) You can’t hear me. (Goes to make his call.)ScenesEmily: I wish I could know if you’d heard any of that. I suppose I’ve either just told you I love you or given my neighbours a good laugh. Mrs. Newman if you’re listening, bugger off this in none of your business. I suppose there’s not much chance you did heard that, and there’s the call waiting so, I should go. Oh well. (Answers the call waiting.) Hello.ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesEmily: Ross, I love you!ScenesRoss: Ohh! Thank you.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey is still watching the porn as Chandler enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesChandler: I was just at the bank, and there was this really hot teller, and she didn’t ask me to go do it with her in the vault.ScenesJoey: Same kind of thing happened to me! Woman pizza delivery guy come over, gives me the pizza, takes the money, and leaves!ScenesChandler: What, no, "Nice apartment, I bet the bedrooms are huge?ScenesJoey: Noo! Nothing!ScenesChandler: Y’know what, we have to turn off the porn.ScenesJoey: I think you’re right.Scenes(Goes over and picks up the remote.)ScenesChandler: All right, ready?ScenesJoey: One.ScenesChandler: Two.ScenesBoth: Three.Scenes(Chandler turns off the porn and sets the remote down.)ScenesJoey: That’s kinda nice.ScenesChandler: Yeah, that’s kinda a relief.ScenesJoey: Yeah.Scenes(Pause.)ScenesChandler: You wanna see if we still have it?ScenesJoey: Yeah.Scenes(Chandler turns on the TV and…)ScenesChandler: FREE PORN!!!ScenesJoey: Yeah!!ScenesChandler: We have free porn here!!!ScenesEndScenesThe One With Rachel’s New DressScenesTeleplay by: Jill Condon & Amy ToominScenesStory by: Andrew Reich & Ted CohenScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Joey and Chandler are there as Phoebe enters carrying a drum.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey! Wow, it is true what they say, pregnant bellies look like a drum.ScenesPhoebe: (not amused) Ha-ha. (She sits down on the couch.) No, it’s just I’m so pregnant that I—my guitar doesn’t fit anymore. So I thought ‘til I’m not, I’m just gonna play all my songs on this drum. It sounds really cool!ScenesChandler: All right.ScenesPhoebe: Listen. Listen. (She starts to play and sing.) Smelly cat, smelly cat, what are they feeding you?ScenesJoey: Wow, Pheebs! That sounds great!ScenesPhoebe: I know! I know, and I’ve only been playing for like an hour!ScenesAlice: (entering) Phoebe! Phoebe! Hi! Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! What are you doing here?ScenesAlice: Umm, actually, I came down to ask you a big favour.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, well, don’t tell me you want to keep more of your stuff in my uterus.ScenesAlice: (laughs) No. No. No. (Sits down.) Okay, now, see, I wanna name the girl baby Leslie, and Frank wants to name one of the boy babies Frank JR. JR.ScenesChandler: Wouldn’t that be Frank the III?ScenesAlice: Don’t get me started. (To Phoebe) Anyway, umm, since there are three babies and umm, we both got to put our names in, we would be truly honoured if you named the other boy baby.ScenesPhoebe: Wow! That’s so great! Oh! Oh! Cougar.ScenesAlice: You think about it. (Leaves)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Ross’s apartment, he and Emily are getting ready to go to the airport.]
rows.Content: Emily: I left a bra drying on the shower rod, you don’t think your son will think it’s yours and be horribly traumatised?ScenesRoss: Hey, if mommy can have a wife, daddy can have a bra.ScenesEmily: (checks the clock) Ohh, it’s time to go.ScenesRoss: Oh, no-no-no, see, that-that clock’s a little fast, uh, we have 17 minutes. Huh, what can we do in 17 minutes? Twice?ScenesEmily: Well that’s ambitious.Scenes(They kiss but are interrupted by a knock on the door.)ScenesRoss: Hey, uh, you can ignore that.ScenesEmily: That’s Carol with your son!ScenesRoss: Uhh, believe me when he’s older, he’ll understand.ScenesCarol: (knocking on the door) Ross!ScenesRoss: I’ll be right there. (He goes over and opens the door to Carol, Susan, and Ben.) (To Ben.) Hello! (To Carol.) Hello! (To Susan.) Hey. Uhh, Emily, this is Carol and Susan.ScenesSusan: Hey, it’s so nice to finally meet you!ScenesEmily: Me too!ScenesCarol: Ohh, y’know, Susan’s gonna be shooting a commercial in London next week.ScenesSusan: Oh yeah, I’m so excited, I’ve never been there.ScenesEmily: Oh, well, I’ll show you around.ScenesSusan: That would be great! Also, uh, I was hoping to catch a show so if you can make any suggestions…ScenesEmily: Oh, there’s tonnes of terrific stuff—I’ll go with you!ScenesSusan: Ahh!Scenes(Ross accidentally, on purpose, bumps into Susan.)ScenesRoss: Look at you two, bonding, making us late for the airport so…ScenesEmily: Are you all right?ScenesSusan: Oh, he’s fine. He’s fine. It’s just that us getting along is difficult for him, because he doesn’t like me.ScenesRoss: Oh come on! That’s-that’s… true.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey and Chandler are playing foosball as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hi!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey! Do we have a baby name yet?ScenesPhoebe: Ugh! No! This is so hard! I went through this whole book (Holds up a book) and found nothing! I want a name that’s really like, y’know strong and confident, y’know? Like-like Exxon.ScenesChandler: Well, it certainly worked for that Valdez kid.ScenesJoey: Ooh-ooh, Pheebs, you want a strong name? How about, The Hulk?ScenesPhoebe: No, I’m-I’m not sure about Hulk, but I like the idea of a name starting with "The.ScenesJoey: Oh, want a good name, go with Joey. Joey’s your pal. Joey’s your buddy. "Where is everybody?" "Well, they’re hanging out with Joey.ScenesChandler: Hey, y’know what, if you’re gonna do that, if you’re gonna name him Joey, you should name him Chandler. (Phoebe doesn’t think so.) Oh, come on! Chandler’s funny, sophisticated, and he’s very loveable, once you get to know him.ScenesJoey: Oh well, hey, Joey’s loveable too! But the thing about Joey is, if you need him, he’ll be there.ScenesChandler: Well, Chandler will be there for you too. I mean, well, he might be a little late, but-but, he’ll be there. And he’ll bring you some cold soda, if want you need him for is that you’re really hot.ScenesJoey: What do ya say? What do ya say?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I, I like the idea of naming him after someone I love, and Joey and Chandler are great names. (They both stare at her.) But, all right, I don’t—maybe I’ll just name him The Hulk.ScenesJoey: I knew I shouldn’t have mentioned it! That’s what I wanted to name my kid!

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's erm, Monica and Rachel's, Monica is cooking and Rachel is getting ready for a date with Joshua.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hey, Mon, if you were hoping to sleep with Joshua the first time tonight, which one of these would you want to be wearing. (She’s holding two frilly, lace nighties.)ScenesMonica: Y’know what? It really creeps me out choosing other people’s sex clothes.ScenesRachel: Sorry. I’m so exited! I’ve been waiting for this for months! I got my hair coloured! I got new sheets! I’m making him a very fancy meal.ScenesMonica: Um-hmm.ScenesRachel: What am I making him by the way?ScenesMonica: Well, you’re making him a frieze salad with goat cheese and pine nuts, wild nuts, wild rice, roast asparagus, and salmon au croup.ScenesRachel: I thought I was making him filet mignon?ScenesMonica: Yeah, you were, but you decided to make salmon because you had some left over at the restaurant. And then you realised if you (Points at Rachel) bitched about it, then you (Points to herself) would stop cooking, and you (Points at Rachel) would have to make your famous baked potato and Diet Coke.ScenesRachel: Wow, I really get crabby when I cook.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's erm, Chandler and Joey's, Joey, Chandler, and Phoebe are there as Ross enters.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRoss: So uh, Emily called last night…ScenesChandler: And now you’re giving me the message!ScenesRoss: Turns out them Emily is just crazy about Susan. Yeah, they’re going to the theatre together! They’re going to dinner! They’re going horseback riding!ScenesPhoebe: God, Susan is so fun!ScenesRoss: Look, this is just a little too familiar, okay? For like, for like six months before Carol and I spilt up, all I heard was: "My friend Susan is so smart. My friend Susan is so funny. My friend Susan is so great.ScenesChandler: You actually think that something can happen between Emily and Susan?ScenesRoss: Hey, they’re going to the gym together! Two women! Stretching! Y’know they-they take a steam together! Things get a little playful—didn’t you see Personal Best?ScenesJoey: No, but I’m gonna!ScenesChandler: Hi! Hi! You’re crazy! Okay? This is Emily. Emily is straight.ScenesRoss: How do you know? I mean we thought Carol was straight before I married her!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I definitely. I don’t like the name Ross.ScenesRoss: What a weird way to kick me when I’m down.ScenesPhoebe: No! No! I-I meant for the baby!ScenesRoss: Oh.
